前言

PREFACE

巴拉克·奥巴马总统在2009年的就职演说中指出，“我们的力量源于审慎运用；我们的安全源于我们事业的正义性、我们榜样的力量以及谦逊和克制的品质。”同样，国务卿希拉里·克林顿也表示，“美国无法独自解决最紧迫的问题，而没有美国，世界也无法解决这些问题。我们必须运用所谓的‘巧实力’，即我们所掌握的一切手段。”1早在2007年，国防部长罗伯特·盖茨就呼吁美国政府加大对软实力工具（包括外交、经济援助和沟通）的投入，因为仅靠军事力量无法捍卫美国在全球的利益。他指出，当时的军费开支每年超过5000亿美元，而国务院的预算仅为360亿美元。他表示：“我今天来到这里，是为了阐明加强我们运用软实力的能力，并将其与硬实力更好地结合起来的必要性。”2这意味着什么？权力是如何运作的，它在二十一世纪又发生了怎样的变化？

In his inaugural address in 2009, President Barack Obama stated that “our power grows through its prudent use; our security emanates from the justness of our cause, the force of our example, the tempering qualities of humility and restraint.” Similarly, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said, “America cannot solve the most pressing problems on our own, and the world cannot solve them without America. We must use what has been called ‘smart power,’ the full range of tools at our disposal.”1 Earlier, in 2007, Secretary of Defense Robert Gates had called for the U.S. government to commit more money and effort to soft power tools including diplomacy, economic assistance, and communications because the military alone could not defend America’s interests around the world. He pointed out that military spending then totaled more than half a trillion dollars annually compared with a State Department budget of $36 billion. In his words, “I am here to make the case for strengthening our capacity to use soft power and for better integrating it with hard power.”2 What does this mean? How will power work, and how is it changing in the twenty-first century?

要回答这类问题，我们需要对权力有比当前大多数讨论中更深刻的理解。让我举两个例子，一个是个人例子，一个是公共例子。

To answer such questions, we need to have a better understanding of power than is typical in most current discussions. Let me give two examples, one personal and one public.

20世纪70年代中期，法国同意向巴基斯坦出售一座核燃料后处理厂，该厂可以提取钚——一种既可用于民用用途也可用于制造核弹的材料。福特政府担心核武器扩散，试图用高性能飞机收买巴基斯坦来阻止该厂的建设，但巴基斯坦拒绝了。福特政府和卡特政府都曾试图说服法国取消这笔交易，但法国以该交易仅用于民用为由拒绝了。一切努力似乎都无济于事，直到1977年6月，我负责吉米·卡特的核不扩散政策，并获准向法国官员出示巴基斯坦正在研制核武器的新证据。一位法国高级官员直视着我的眼睛告诉我，如果情况属实，法国就必须想办法阻止该厂的建设。随后，他信守了承诺，该厂最终没有建成。美国是如何实现这一重大目标的呢？没有发出任何威胁，没有支付任何款项，也没有软硬兼施。法国人的行为因说服和信任而改变。我当时就在现场，亲眼目睹了这一切。这与大多数社论或近期外交政策书籍中盛行的权力模式截然不同，这些书籍不认为说服是一种权力形式，因为它“本质上是一个智力或情感过程”。3

In the mid-1970s, France agreed to sell Pakistan a nuclear reprocessing plant that could extract plutonium, a material that could be used either for civilian purposes or for bombs. Concerned about the spread of nuclear weapons, the Ford administration tried to stop the plant by buying off Pakistan with high-performance aircraft, but Pakistan refused the deal. Both the Ford and Carter administrations tried to prevail upon France to cancel the sale, but the French refused on the grounds that it was a legitimate sale for civilian purposes only. Nothing seemed to work until June 1977, when I was in charge of Jimmy Carter’s nonproliferation policy and was allowed to present French officials with new evidence that Pakistan was preparing a nuclear weapon. A top French official looked me in the eye and told me that if this were true, France would have to find a way to cancel the completion of the plant. Subsequently, he was as good as his word, and the plant was not completed. How did the United States accomplish this major objective? No threats were issued. No payments were made. No carrots were dangled or sticks brandished. French behavior changed because of persuasion and trust. I was there and saw it happen. This hardly fits the usual model of power that is prevalent in most editorials or in recent foreign policy books that do not consider persuasion a form of power because it “is essentially an intellectual or emotional process.”3

最近，在2008年8月，中俄两国在运用实力方面形成了鲜明对比。正如法国分析家多米尼克·莫伊西当时所写：“中国试图通过奥运奖牌数量来吸引和震撼世界，而俄罗斯则希望通过展示其军事优势来震慑世界——这是中国软实力与俄罗斯硬实力的较量。”一些分析人士由此得出结论：俄罗斯入侵格鲁吉亚证明了软实力的“无关紧要”和硬实力军事力量的主导地位。4实际上，从长远来看，这对两国来说都是一个更为复杂的问题。

More recently, in August 2008, China and Russia provided sharp contrasts in the use of power. As French analyst Dominique Moisi wrote at the time, “Whereas China intends to seduce and impress the world by the number of its Olympic medals, Russia wants to impress the world by demonstrating its military superiority— China’s soft power versus Russia’s hard power.” Some analysts concluded that the Russian invasion of Georgia proved the “irrelevance” of soft power and the dominance of hard military power.4 In reality, the story turned out to be more complicated for both countries in the long run.

俄罗斯动用硬实力削弱了其合法性主张，并在世界大部分地区播下了恐惧和不信任的种子。欧洲邻国俄罗斯变得更加谨慎。立竿见影的代价是波兰改变了对美国反弹道导弹系统的抵制立场。当俄罗斯就其对格鲁吉亚的政策向上海合作组织其他成员国寻求支持时，中国和其他一些国家拒绝支持。一年后的一项分析得出结论：俄罗斯对邻国的呼吁听起来并不那么诱人。“理想情况下，俄罗斯应该在政治和经济上为邻国树立一个有吸引力的榜样。年轻一代会因为自愿学习俄语而学习，后苏联时代的联盟将成为邻国争相加入的俱乐部。”正如俄罗斯分析家阿列克谢·穆欣所总结的那样，“用金钱买来的爱情不会长久。那是金钱买来的爱情，并不可靠。”5

Russia’s use of hard power undercut its claims to legitimacy and sowed fear and mistrust in much of the world. European neighbors became more wary. An immediate cost was Poland’s reversal of its resistance to an American antiballistic missile system. When Russia appealed for support on its Georgian policy to other members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, China and others withheld their support. An analysis one year later concluded that Russia’s appeal to its neighbors did not sound very seductive. “Ideally, it would present an attractive model for its neighbors, politically and economically. Young generations would learn Russian because they wanted to, and the post-Soviet alliances would be clubs its neighbors are lining up to join.” As Russian analyst Alexei Mukhin summed the matter up, “Love bought with money will not last long. That is purchased love. It is not very reliable.”5

相比之下，中国在8月底凭借成功举办奥运会提升了软实力。2007年10月，胡锦涛主席宣布中国将提升软实力，而奥运会正是这一战略的重要组成部分。中国通过建立数百所孔子学院向世界推广中华文化、加强国际广播、吸引外国留学生以及对东南亚邻国采取更为温和的外交策略，大力投资软实力建设。民意调查显示，中国的国际声誉有所提升。中国在提升硬实力的同时，也构建了引人入胜的软实力叙事，试图运用巧实​​力来传达其“和平崛起”的理念，从而避免形成制衡力量。

In contrast, China ended August with its soft power enhanced by its successful staging of the Olympic Games. In October 2007, President Hu Jintao declared China’s intent to increase its soft power, and the Olympics were an important part of that strategy. With the establishment of several hundred Confucius Institutes to promote Chinese culture around the world, increased international broadcasting, attraction of foreign students to its universities, and softer diplomacy toward its neighbors in Southeast Asia, China made major investments in soft power. Opinion polls showed an increase in its international reputation. By accompanying its growth in hard power with an attractive soft power narrative, China was trying to use smart power to convey the idea of its “peaceful rise” and thus head off a countervailing balance of power.

二十一世纪的美国实力

AMERICAN POWER IN THE TWENTY-FIRST CENTURY

更普遍地说，在2008-2009年美国经济大衰退期间，随着美国经济步履蹒跚而中国经济持续增长，中国学者掀起了一股“关于美国衰落的浪潮”。一位专家声称，美国实力投射的顶峰是2000年。6发表此类言论的并非只有中国人。2009年皮尤研究中心的民意调查显示，在25个国家中，有13个国家的多数或相对多数人认为中国将取代美国成为世界领先的超级大国。7甚至美国政府的国家情报委员会也预测，到 2025 年，美国的统治地位将“大大减弱”。俄罗斯总统德米特里·梅德韦杰夫称 2008 年金融危机是美国全球领导地位即将结束的标志，就连一位同情美国的观察家，加拿大反对党领袖迈克尔·伊格纳季耶夫也建议，既然“美国及其全球统治的鼎盛时期已经结束”，加拿大现在应该将目光投向北美以外。8

More generally, as the U.S. economy floundered and China continued to grow in the great recession of 2008–2009, Chinese authors launched “a flood of declinist commentary about the US.” One expert claimed that the high point of U.S. power projection had been 2000.6 The Chinese were not alone in such statements. In a 2009 Pew Research Center poll, majorities or pluralities in thirteen of twenty-five countries believed that China would replace the United States as the world’s leading superpower.7 Even the U.S. government’s National Intelligence Council projected that American dominance would be “much diminished” by 2025. Russian president Dmitri Medvedev called the 2008 financial crisis a sign that America’s global leadership was coming to an end, and even a sympathetic observer, Canadian opposition leader Michael Ignatieff, suggested that Canada should look beyond North America now that the “the noon hour of the United States and its global dominance are over.”8

我们如何才能知道他们的观点是否正确？这个问题困扰了我二十年，而这本书正是我探索美国权力来源和发展轨迹的集大成之作。要回答这个问题，我们需要更深入地理解“权力”一词的含义，以及在21世纪信息技术和全球化蓬勃发展的背景下，权力是如何演变的。此外，我们还需要避免一些常见的误区。

How can we know if they are correct or not? That question has fascinated me for two decades, and this book is the culmination of my exploring the sources and trajectory of American power. To answer the question, we need to understand better what we mean when we speak of power and how it is changing under the conditions of a burgeoning revolution in information technology and globalization in the twenty-first century. We also need to avoid certain pitfalls.

首先，我们必须警惕关于有机衰落的误导性比喻。国家不像人类那样拥有可预测的寿命。例如，18世纪末英国失去美洲殖民地后，霍勒斯·沃波尔曾感叹英国沦为“像丹麦或撒丁岛一样微不足道的国家”。9他未能预见到工业革命将使英国在第二个世纪里更加崛起。罗马在鼎盛时期之后仍保持了三个多世纪的统治地位。即便如此，罗马也并非屈服于其他国家的崛起，而是被各个蛮族部落蚕食殆尽。的确，尽管各种时髦的预测认为中国、印度或巴西将在未来几十年超越美国，但更大的威胁可能来自现代蛮族和非国家行为体。此外，正如我们将看到的，大国之间传统的权力更迭可能远不如非国家行为体的崛起构成威胁。在一个基于信息的时代在网络安全形势严峻的今天，权力扩散可能比权力转移构成更大的威胁。

First, we must beware of misleading metaphors of organic decline. Nations are not like humans with predictable life spans. For example, after Britain lost its American colonies at the end of the eighteenth century, Horace Walpole lamented Britain’s reduction to “as insignificant a country as Denmark or Sardinia.”9 He failed to foresee that the Industrial Revolution would give Britain a second century of even greater ascendency. Rome remained dominant for more than three centuries after the apogee of Roman power. Even then, Rome did not succumb to the rise of another state, but died a death of a thousand cuts inflicted by various barbarian tribes. Indeed, for all the fashionable predictions of China, India, or Brazil surpassing the United States in the next decades, the greater threats may come from modern barbarians and nonstate actors. Moreover, as we shall see, the classical transition of power among great states may be less of a problem than the rise of nonstate actors. In an information-based world of cyberinsecurity, power diffusion may be a greater threat than power transition.

从更根本的层面来说，在21世纪的全球信息时代，运用权力意味着什么？第二个误区是将权力与国家拥有的资源混淆，并将我们的关注点局限于国家本身。究竟哪些资源能够产生权力？16世纪，西班牙凭借对殖民地和黄金的控制而占据优势；17世纪，荷兰从贸易和金融中获利；18世纪，法国凭借其庞大的人口和军队而受益；19世纪，英国的权力建立在其在工业革命中的领先地位和强大的海军之上。传统观点一直认为，拥有最强大军事力量的国家最终获胜，但在信息时代，或许是那些能够讲述最精彩故事的国家（或非国家行为体）才能最终胜出。10正如我们将在第五章中看到的，信息革命和全球化正在为非国家行为体提供新的权力资源。2001年9月11日，一个非国家行为体在纽约造成的死亡人数超过了日本在1941年珍珠港事件中的死亡人数。这可以被称为战争的私有化。如今，我们如何衡量权力平衡远未可知，更遑论如何制定在这个新世界中生存的成功战略。目前大多数关于全球权力平衡变化的预测主要基于一个因素——各国国民生产总值增长的预测。这些预测忽略了本书讨论的其他权力维度，更不用说将这些不同维度整合为成功战略的难度了。

At an even more basic level, what will it mean to wield power in the global information age of the twenty-first century? A second pitfall is to confuse power with the resources that states possess and to limit our focus solely to states. What resources will produce power? In the sixteenth century, control of colonies and gold bullion gave Spain the edge; in the seventeenth, the Netherlands profited from trade and finance; in the eighteenth, France gained from its larger population and armies; and in the nineteenth, Britain’s power rested on the nation’s primacy in the Industrial Revolution and on its navy. Conventional wisdom has always held that the state with the largest military prevails, but in an information age it may be the state (or nonstates) with the best story that wins.10 As we shall see in Chapter 5, the Information Revolution and globalization are providing new power resources for nonstate actors. On September 11, 2001, a nonstate actor killed more people in New York than the state of Japan did at Pearl Harbor in 1941. This can be called the privatization of war. Today, it is far from clear how we measure a balance of power, much less how we develop successful strategies to survive in this new world. Most current projections of a shift in the global balance of power are based primarily on one factor— projections of growth in the gross national product of different countries. These projections ignore the other dimensions of power discussed in this book, not to mention the difficulties of combining the different dimensions into successful strategies.

智能电源

SMART POWER

巧实力是将胁迫和支付等硬实力与说服和吸引力等软实力相结合。软实力并非解决所有问题的灵丹妙药。即使朝鲜独裁者金正日观看好莱坞电影，这对朝鲜的核武器计划也几乎没有影响。上世纪90年代，武力未能使塔利班政府放弃对基地组织的支持。2001年，最终依靠强硬的军事力量才结束了这一局面。为了阐明这一点，我在2004年出版的《软实力：世界政治中的成功之道》一书中引入了“巧实力”一词，指的是将硬实力和软实力结合起来，形成成功的战略。几年后，我和理查德·阿米蒂奇共同主持了战略与国际研究中心的一个两党巧实力委员会。该委员会的结论是，近年来美国的形象和影响力有所下降，美国必须从输出恐惧转向激发乐观和希望。11智能电力委员会并非唯一得出此结论的机构，其他机构也加入了呼吁制定智能电力战略的行列。

Smart power is the combination of the hard power of coercion and payment with the soft power of persuasion and attraction. Soft power is not the solution to all problems. Even though North Korean dictator Kim Jong-Il watched Hollywood movies, that had little effect on North Korea’s nuclear weapons program. And soft power got nowhere in attracting the Taliban government away from its support for Al Qaeda in the 1990s. It took hard military power in 2001 to end that. To clarify that point, in my 2004 book Soft Power: The Means to Success in World Politics I introduced the term “smart power” to refer to the combining of hard and soft power into successful strategies. A few years later, Richard Armitage and I cochaired a bipartisan Smart Power Commission at the Center for Strategic and International Studies. It concluded that America’s image and influence had declined in recent years, and that the United States had to move from exporting fear to inspiring optimism and hope.11 The Smart Power Commission was not alone in this conclusion, and others have joined the call for smart power strategies.

五角大楼是美国政府训练有素、资源最丰富的机构，但单凭军事力量所能取得的成就终究有限。促进民主、人权和公民社会发展并非武力所能及。诚然，美军拥有令人瞩目的作战能力，但仅仅因为五角大楼能够办事就依赖它，这种做法会给人留下过度军事化外交政策的印象。高级军官们对此心知肚明。正如参谋长联席会议主席迈克·穆伦海军上将所言：“克林顿部长和盖茨部长都呼吁增加对软实力的投入和重视，我完全赞同他们的观点。如果我们选择仅仅依靠军队来施加美国的影响力，那么随着时间的推移，这种影响力必然会逐渐减弱。”12巧实力并非简单的“软实力 2.0”。它指的是在不同情况下将硬实力和软实力结合起来，形成有效战略的能力。

The Pentagon is the best-trained and best-resourced arm of the American government, but there are limits to what military power can achieve on its own. Promoting democracy, human rights, and development of civil society are not best handled with the barrel of a gun. It is true that the American military has an impressive operational capacity, but the practice of turning to the Pentagon because it can get things done leads to an image of an overmilitarized foreign policy. Top military officials understand this. In the words of Admiral Mike Mullen, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, “Secretaries Clinton and Gates have called for more funding and more emphasis on our soft power, and I could not agree with them more. Should we choose to exert American influence solely through our troops, we should expect to see that influence diminish in time.”12 Smart power is not simply “soft power 2.0.” It refers to the ability to combine hard and soft power into effective strategies in varying contexts.

二十一世纪的背景

TWENTY-FIRST-CENTURY CONTEXTS

权力总是取决于情境。在操场上称霸的孩子，一旦下课铃响，就可能变成落后者。场景切换到一间秩序井然的教室。二十世纪中叶，约瑟夫·斯大林曾轻蔑地问教皇有多少个教区，但五十年后，在思想的语境下，教皇制度得以延续，而斯大林的帝国却土崩瓦解。

Power always depends on context. The child who dominates on the playground may become a laggard when the recess bell rings and the context changes to a well-ordered classroom. In the middle of the twentieth century, Josef Stalin scornfully asked how many divisions the pope had, but in the context of ideas five decades later the Papacy survived, whereas Stalin’s empire had collapsed.

如今，世界权力格局宛如一盘复杂的三维国际象棋。在最上层的棋盘上，军事力量基本呈单极格局，美国很可能在未来一段时间内保持霸主地位。但在中间的棋盘上，经济力量已呈现多极格局十余年，美国、欧洲、日本和中国是主要参与者，其他国家的重要性也在不断提升。欧洲的经济规模已超过美国。最下层的棋盘则代表着不受政府控制的跨国关系领域，其中包括形形色色的非国家行为体，例如，一端是银行家通过电子方式转移超过大多数国家预算的巨额资金，另一端是恐怖分子转移武器或黑客威胁网络安全。此外，这盘棋盘还囊括了诸如流行病和气候变化等新的跨国挑战。在这个底层，权力广泛分散，在这里谈论单极、多极、霸权或政治领导人和评论员在演讲中经常提及的任何其他陈词滥调都是没有意义的。

Today, power in the world is distributed in a pattern that resembles a complex three-dimensional chess game. On the top chessboard, military power is largely unipolar and the United States is likely to remain supreme for some time. But on the middle chessboard, economic power has been multipolar for more than a decade, with the United States, Europe, Japan, and China as the major players, and with others gaining in importance. Europe’s economy is larger than America’s. The bottom chessboard is the realm of transnational relations that cross borders outside of government control, and it includes nonstate actors as diverse as bankers electronically transferring sums larger than most national budgets at one extreme and terrorists transferring weapons or hackers threatening cybersecurity at the other. This chessboard also includes new transnational challenges such as pandemics and climate change. On this bottom board, power is widely diffused, and it makes no sense to speak here of unipolarity, multipolarity, hegemony, or any other such clichés that political leaders and pundits put in their speeches.

本世纪正在发生两大权力转移：一是国家间的权力转移，二是权力从所有国家向非国家行为体扩散。即使在金融危机之后，技术变革的迅猛步伐仍在推动全球化，但其对民族国家和非国家行为体的政治影响将截然不同。在国家间政治中，最重要的因素将是亚洲的持续“回归”。1750年，亚洲拥有世界一半以上的人口和产出。到1900年，随着欧美工业革命的到来，亚洲的份额缩减至世界产出的五分之一。到2050年，亚洲将逐步恢复到其历史水平。中国和印度的崛起可能会造成不稳定，但这并非史无前例，我们可以从历史中吸取教训。关于我们的政策如何影响结果。一个世纪前，英国成功地避免了美国崛起带来的冲突，但世界各国未能有效应对德国的崛起，最终导致了两次毁灭性的世界大战。

Two great power shifts are occurring in this century: a power transition among states and a power diffusion away from all states to nonstate actors. Even in the aftermath of the financial crisis, the giddy pace of technological change continues to drive globalization, but the political effects will be quite different for the world of nation-states and the world of nonstate actors. In interstate politics, the most important factor will be the continuing “return of Asia.” In 1750, Asia had more than half of the world population and product. By 1900, after the Industrial Revolution in Europe and America, Asia’s share shrank to one-fifth of the world product. By 2050, Asia will be well on its way back to its historical share. The “rise” in the power of China and India may create instability, but it is a problem with precedents, and we can learn from history about how our policies can affect the outcome. A century ago, Britain managed the rise of American power without conflict, but the world’s failure to manage the rise of German power led to two devastating world wars.

在跨国政治——也就是最底层的棋盘——中，信息革命正在大幅降低计算和通信成本。四十年前，即时全球通信虽然可行，但成本高昂，而且仅限于政府和企业。如今，只要有条件进入网吧，几乎任何人都能免费进行这种通信。参与世界政治的门槛降低了，非国家行为体也开始活跃起来。黑客和网络犯罪分子给政府和企业造成了数十亿美元的损失。一场由鸟类或乘坐喷气式飞机的旅客传播的流行病，其造成的死亡人数可能超过第一次或第二次世界大战的死亡人数，而气候变化也可能带来巨大的代价。这是一个我们尚不熟悉的新型世界政治格局。

In transnational politics—the bottom chessboard—the Information Revolution is dramatically reducing the costs of computing and communication. Forty years ago, instantaneous global communication was possible but costly, and it was restricted to governments and corporations. Today, this communication is virtually free to anyone with the means to enter an Internet café. The barriers to entry into world politics have been lowered, and nonstate actors now crowd the stage. Hackers and cybercriminals cause billions of dollars of damage to governments and businesses. A pandemic spread by birds or travelers on jet aircraft could kill more people than perished in World War I or II, and climate change could impose enormous costs. This is a new world politics with which we have less experience.

21世纪所有国家面临的问题是，由于权力从国家向非国家行为体扩散，越来越多的事物超出了即使是最强大的国家的控制范围。尽管美国在军事方面表现出色，但世界上正在发生的事情越来越多，这些军事手段已无法应对。在信息革命和全球化的影响下，世界政治格局正在发生变化，这意味着美国无法单枪匹马地实现所有国际目标。例如，国际金融稳定对美国人民的繁荣至关重要，但美国需要其他国家的合作才能确保这一点。全球气候变化也会影响生活质量，但美国无法独自应对这一问题。在一个国界比以往任何时候都更加开放，毒品、传染病、恐怖主义等各种威胁和挑战层出不穷的世界里，各国必须动员国际联盟并建立相关机构来应对共同的威胁和挑战。从这个意义上讲，权力变成了一场双赢博弈。仅仅依靠权力是不够的。要从支配他人的角度思考问题。我们也必须从与他人合作的角度思考如何运用权力来实现目标。13在许多跨国问题上，赋能他人有助于我们实现自身目标。在当今世界，人脉网络和相互联系成为重要的力量来源。

The problem for all states in the twenty-first century is that there are more and more things outside the control of even the most powerful states, because of the diffusion of power from states to nonstate actors. Although the United States does well on military measures, there is increasingly more going on in the world that those measures fail to capture. Under the influence of the Information Revolution and globalization, world politics is changing in a way that means Americans cannot achieve all their international goals acting alone. For example, international financial stability is vital to the prosperity of Americans, but the United States needs the cooperation of others to ensure it. Global climate change too will affect the quality of life, but the United States cannot manage the problem alone. And in a world where borders are becoming more porous than ever to everything from drugs to infectious diseases to terrorism, nations must mobilize international coalitions and build institutions to address shared threats and challenges. In this sense, power becomes a positive-sum game. It is not enough to think in terms of power over others. We must also think in terms of power to accomplish goals that involves power with others.13 On many transnational issues, empowering others can help us to accomplish our own goals. In this world, networks and connectedness become an important source of relevant power.

情境智能，即理解不断变化的环境并利用趋势的能力，将成为领导者将权力资源转化为成功战略的关键技能。14.我们需要具备情境智能才能理解，21世纪美国实力的问题并非衰落，而是未能意识到即使是最大的国家也无法在没有他国帮助的情况下实现其目标。这需要对权力、权力的演变以及如何构建巧实力战略有更深刻的理解。这需要比传统的大国兴衰故事更为复杂的叙事。美国很可能仍将是21世纪最强大的国家，但这并不意味着它将主宰世界。能否实现我们想要的结果，取决于一种关于巧实力的新叙事。美国人需要停止追问谁是第一，停止沉迷于关于霸权的叙事，而应该开始思考如何将各种权力工具结合起来，制定与其他国家合作而非仅仅凌驾于其他国家之上的巧实力战略。本书的目的就在于更清晰地思考权力，并激发这种更广阔的叙事。

Contextual intelligence, the ability to understand an evolving environment and capitalize on trends, will become a crucial skill in enabling leaders to convert power resources into successful strategies.14 We will need contextual intelligence if we are to understand that the problem of American power in the twenty-first century is not one of decline, but of a failure to realize that even the largest country cannot achieve its aims without the help of others. That will require a deeper understanding of power, how it is changing, and how to construct smart power strategies. That will require a more sophisticated narrative than the classical stories of the rise and fall of great powers. America is likely to remain the strongest country of the twenty-first century, but that will not mean domination. The ability to get the outcomes we want will rest upon a new narrative of smart power. Americans will need to stop asking questions about who is number one, and entertaining narratives about dominance, and start asking questions about how the various tools of power can be combined into smart strategies for power with rather than merely over other nations. Thinking more clearly about power and stimulating that broader narrative are the purposes of this book.

我尝试撰写一本篇幅不长的书，风格力求通俗易懂，面向有见识的读者，而非学术界，但脚注中会阐明其严谨的分析结构。在继续探索美国未来力量的同时，我也力求阐述一些概念，使其同样适用于其他国家。将权力资源转化为能够产生预期结果的战略存在哪些问题？在国际目标方面，“帝国扩张过度”和在国内资源调动方面“力度不足”分别存在哪些问题？如何才能平衡这两者？权力的各个维度之间又存在怎样的关联？本世纪正在发生改变，而这种改变对战略成功的定义意味着什么？在网络时代，美国、中国乃至非国家行为体的实力将何去何从？对于充满争议的“实力”概念，没有人能给出最终答案，但既然我们无法回避这个问题，我希望能够为讨论带来更清晰的思路，并为战略愿景提供更广阔的视角。这便是“巧实力”。

I have tried to write a short book in a style that is accessible to the intelligent reader rather than aimed at an academic audience, but with a careful analytical structure disclosed in the footnotes. While I continue my exploration of the future of American power, I have tried to elaborate concepts in a way that are applicable to other countries as well. What are the problems of converting power resources into strategies that produce desired outcomes? What are the problems of “imperial overstretch” in international goals and “domestic underreach” in mobilizing resources? How can the two be brought into balance? How are the various dimensions of power changing in this century, and what does that change mean for the definition of strategic success? What will happen to American power or Chinese power or the power of nonstate actors in a cyberage? No one has the final word on the contested concept of power, but because we cannot avoid talking about it, I hope to introduce more clarity into the discussion and a larger perspective into strategic visions. That would be smart power.

第一部分

PART I

电力类型

TYPES OF POWER

第一章

CHAPTER 1

全球事务中的权力是什么？

What Is Power in Global Affairs?

“权力”作为一个被广泛使用的概念，却出人意料地难以捉摸，难以衡量。但这些问题并不意味着权力的概念毫无意义。即使我们无法说出“我爱你比爱其他事物多3.6倍”，也很少有人会否认爱的重要性。如同爱一样，我们在日常生活中体验着权力，尽管我们无法精确衡量它，但它仍然会产生真实的影响。有时，分析人士会因为权力过于模糊不清而想要放弃它，但事实证明，权力很难被取代。1

For a concept that is so widely used, “power” is surprisingly elusive and difficult to measure. But such problems do not make a concept meaningless. Few of us deny the importance of love even if we cannot say, “I love you 3.6 times more than I love something else.” Like love, we experience power in our everyday lives, and it has real effects despite our inability to measure it precisely. Sometimes, analysts have been tempted to discard the concept as hopelessly vague and imprecise, but it has proven hard to replace.1

英国伟大的哲学家伯特兰·罗素曾将权力在社会科学中的作用比作物理学中“能量”概念的核心地位，但这种比较具有误导性。物理学家可以相当精确地测量无生命物体之间的能量和力的关系，而权力则指的是更为微妙、会随环境变化而改变的人际关系。另一些人则认为，权力之于政治，正如金钱之于经济。然而，这种比喻同样具有误导性。金钱是一种流动性或可替代性的资源，可以用来购买各种各样的商品，但产生权力的资源在某种关系或情境下可能并非如此。在其他领域，你可以运用金钱。金钱可以在房地产市场、蔬菜市场或网络拍卖中使用，而军事力量——最重要的国际力量资源之一——或许能在坦克大战中产生你想要的结果，但在互联网上却未必如此。

The great British philosopher Bertrand Russell once compared the role of power in social science to the centrality of the concept of “energy” in physics, but the comparison is misleading. Physicists can measure relations of energy and force among inanimate objects quite precisely, whereas power refers to more ephemeral human relationships that change shape under different circumstances.2 Others have argued that power is to politics as money is to economics. Again, the metaphor misleads us. Money is a liquid or fungible resource. It can be used to buy a wide variety of goods, but the resources that produce power in one relationship or context may not produce it in another. You can use money in a housing market, at a vegetable market, or in an Internet auction, whereas military capacity, one of the most important international power resources, may produce the outcomes you want in a tank battle, but not on the Internet.

多年来，众多分析人士试图提供能够量化国际事务中权力的公式。例如，雷·克莱恩曾是中央情报局的高级官员，他的职责是向政治领导人汇报冷战期间美苏两国的权力平衡。他的观点影响着涉及高风险和数十亿美元的政治决策。1977年，他发表了他用于估算权力的公式的精简版：

Over the years, various analysts have tried to provide formulas that can quantify power in international affairs. For example, Ray Cline was a high-ranking official in the CIA whose job was to tell political leaders about the balance of American and Soviet power during the Cold War. His views affected political decisions that involved high risks and billions of dollars. In 1977, he published a distillation of the formula he used for estimating power:

感知权力 =

PERCEIVED POWER =

（人口 + 领土 + 经济 + 军事）×（战略 + 意志）

(POPULATION + TERRITORY + ECONOMY + MILITARY) × (STRATEGY + WILL)

在将数字代入公式后，他得出结论：苏联的实力是美国的两倍。3当然，正如我们现在所知，这个公式并不能很好地预测结果。仅仅十几年后，苏联解体，专家们就宣称美国是单极世界中唯一的超级大国。

After inserting numbers into his formula, he concluded that the Soviet Union was twice as powerful as the United States.3 Of course, as we now know, this formula was not a very good predictor of outcomes. In a little more than a decade, the Soviet Union collapsed and pundits were proclaiming that the United States was the sole superpower in a unipolar world.

最近一项创建实力指数的尝试，将一个国家的资源（技术、企业、人力、资本、物质）和国家绩效（外部制约因素、基础设施、理念）纳入考量，并以此来决定军事能力和作战熟练程度。4这种表述告诉我们的是相对军事实力，而不是所有相关的实力类型。虽然有效的军事力量仍然是国际事务中的关键实力资源之一，但正如我们将在下一章中看到的，世界已不再像19世纪的欧洲那样不受约束，当时的历史学家可以将“大国”定义为能够在战争中获胜的国家。5

A more recent effort to create a power index included a country’s resources (technology, enterprise, human, capital, physical) and national performance (external constraints, infrastructure, ideas) and how they determined military capability and combat proficiency.4 This formulation tells us about relative military power, but not about all relevant types of power. Although effective military force remains one of the key power resources in international affairs, as we shall see in the next chapter, the world is no longer as unconstrained as in nineteenth-century Europe when historians could define a “great power” as one capable of prevailing in war.5

例如，在金融领域或气候变化领域，军事力量和作战能力并不能告诉我们太多结果。它们也无法充分展现非国家行为体的力量。从军事角度来看，基地组织与美国这个庞然大物相比简直是小巫见大巫，但恐怖分子的影响与其说是取决于兵力规模，不如说是取决于其行动和叙事所造成的戏剧性效果以及由此引发的过度反应。从这个意义上讲，恐怖主义就像柔术这项运动，弱者利用强者的力量反制自己。这种动态是典型的军事力量指标无法捕捉到的。

Military force and combat proficiency do not tell us much about outcomes, for example, in the world of finance or climate change. Nor do they tell us much about the power of nonstate actors. In military terms, Al Qaeda is a midget compared to the American giant, but the impact of terrorists relies less on the size of their forces than on the theatrical effects of their actions and narratives and the overreactions they can produce. In that sense, terrorism is like the sport of jujitsu in which the weak player uses the strength of the larger against himself. This dynamic is not caught by typical indices of military power.

正如托马斯·谢林所证明的那样，在某些谈判情境中，弱点以及合作伙伴崩溃的威胁可以成为谈判力量的来源。6.一个负债1000美元的破产债务人几乎没有任何权力，但如果负债10亿美元，那么这个债务人就可能拥有相当大的谈判筹码——2008年金融危机中那些被判定为“大到不能倒”的机构的命运就是最好的证明。朝鲜的金正日“可能是唯一一个能让北京显得无能为力的世界领导人……外交官们说，金正日肆无忌惮地利用中国的恐惧心理。他辩称，如果中国不向其摇摇欲坠的经济注入援助，他们将面临难民涌入和可能的动乱。”7

In certain bargaining situations, as Thomas Schelling demonstrates, weakness and the threat that a partner will collapse can be a source of bargaining power.6 A bankrupt debtor who owes $1,000 has little power, but if it owes $1 billion, that debtor may have considerable bargaining power—witness the fate of institutions judged “too big to fail” in the 2008 financial crisis. North Korea’s Kim Jong-Il “is probably the only world leader who can make Beijing look powerless. . . . Diplomats say Mr. Kim brazenly plays on Chinese fears. If the Chinese do not pump aid into his crumbling economy, he argues, they will face refugees pouring across the border and possible unrest.”7

任何试图建立单一权力指标的尝试都注定会失败，因为权力取决于人际关系，而人际关系在不同的背景下会有所不同。8虽然可以用金钱来衡量不同市场的购买力，但没有一个价值标准可以概括所有关系和背景，从而得出公认的总体权力总和。9

Any attempt to develop a single index of power is doomed to fail because power depends upon human relationships that vary in different contexts.8 Whereas money can be used to measure purchasing power across different markets, there is no standard of value that can summarize all relationships and contexts to produce an agreed overall power total.9

定义权力

DEFINING POWER

如同许多基本概念一样，“权力”也是一个充满争议的概念。没有一个定义能被所有使用这个词的人所接受，人们对权力的定义选择反映了他们自身的利益和价值观。有些人将权力定义为促成或抵制变革的能力，而另一些人则认为权力是获得我们想要的东西的能力。10这个宽泛的定义包括对自然以及对其他人的权力。我对行动和要了解政策，一个合乎常理的起点是字典，字典告诉我们，权力是做事的能力，也是在社会情境中影响他人以获得我们想要的结果的能力。11有些人称之为影响力，并将权力与影响力区分开来，但这令人困惑，因为字典将这两个术语定义为可以互换的。

Like many basic ideas, power is a contested concept. No one definition is accepted by all who use the word, and people’s choice of definition reflects their interests and values. Some define power as the ability to make or resist change. Others say it is the ability to get what we want.10 This broad definition includes power over nature as well as over other people. For my interest in actions and policies, a commonsense place to start is the dictionary, which tells us that power is the capacity to do things and in social situations to affect others to get the outcomes we want.11 Some people call this influence, and distinguish power from influence, but that is confusing because the dictionary defines the two terms as interchangeable.

影响我们实现愿望的因素有很多。我们生活在一个由既有社会力量交织而成的网络中，其中一些力量显而易见，另一些则较为间接，有时被称为“结构性”力量。我们往往会根据自身利益，识别并关注某些制约因素和力量，而非其他因素。例如，政治学家彼得·卡岑斯坦在其关于文明的研究中指出，文明的力量与文明内部的力量有所不同。文明内部的行动者拥有硬实力和软实力。而社会力量则在行为层面之下运作，它塑造着潜在的社会结构、知识体系和整体环境。12虽然这种结构性的社会力量很重要，但出于政策目的，我们也想了解行动者或代理人在特定情况下可以做什么。13.文明和社会并非一成不变，有效的领导者可以尝试塑造更大的社会力量，但成功程度各不相同。正如德国著名理论家马克斯·韦伯所说，我们想知道社会关系中的个体能够实现自身意志的概率。14

There are many factors that affect our ability to get what we want. We live in a web of inherited social forces, some of which are visible and others of which are indirect and sometimes called “structural.” We tend to identify and focus on some of these constraints and forces rather than others depending on our interests. For example, in his work on civilizations, political scientist Peter Katzenstein argues that the power of civilizations is different from power in civilizations. Actors in civilizations command hard and soft power. Social power operates beneath the behavioral level by shaping underlying social structures, knowledge systems and general environment.12 Even though such structural social forces are important, for policy purposes we also want to understand what actors or agents can do within given situations.13 Civilizations and societies are not immutable, and effective leaders can try to shape larger social forces with varying degrees of success. As the famous German theorist Max Weber puts it, we want to know the probability that an actor in a social relationship can carry out his own will.14

即使我们主要关注特定的代理人或行动者，我们也不能说一个行动者“拥有权力”，而不具体说明“做什么的权力”。15我们必须明确权力关系中的参与者（权力范围）以及涉及的议题（权力领域）。例如，教皇对某些基督徒拥有权力，但对另一些基督徒（例如新教徒）则没有。即使在天主教徒中，教皇也可能希望掌控他们所有的道德抉择，但一些信徒可能会拒绝接受他在某些问题上的权力（例如节育或教会外婚姻）。因此，要说教皇拥有权力，就必须明确教皇与任何个人之间关系的具体背景（范围和领域）。

Even when we focus primarily on particular agents or actors, we cannot say that an actor “has power” without specifying power “to do what.”15 We must specify who is involved in the power relationship (the scope of power) as well as what topics are involved (the domain of power). For example, the pope has power over some Christians, but not over others (such as Protestants). And even among Catholics, he may wish to have power over all their moral decisions, but some adherents may reject his power on some issues (such as birth control or marriage outside the church). Thus, to say that the pope has power requires us to specify the context (scope and domain) of the relationship between the pope and any individual.

精神病患者或许有能力随意杀害和摧毁陌生人，但却无力说服他们。有些影响他人并达到预期结果的行为可能纯粹是破坏性的，与受害者的想法无关。例如，波尔布特屠杀了数百万柬埔寨公民。有人认为这种武力使用并非权力，因为其中不存在双向关系，但这取决于具体情况和动机。如果行为者的动机纯粹是虐待或恐怖，那么使用武力就符合权力的定义，即通过影响他人来达到自身目的。然而，大多数权力关系都很大程度上取决于受害者的想法。如果异见人士真的寻求殉道以推进其事业，那么独裁者在惩罚异见人士时可能会误以为自己行使了权力。但如果独裁者只是想消灭异见人士，那么异见人士的意图对他的权力而言无关紧要。

A psychopath may have the power to kill and destroy random strangers, but not the power to persuade them. Some actions that affect others and obtain preferred outcomes can be purely destructive and not dependent on what the victim thinks. For example, Pol Pot killed millions of Cambodian citizens. Some say such use of force is not power because there was no two-way relationship involved, but that depends on context and motive. If the actor’s motive is pure sadism or terror, the use of force fits within the definition of power as affecting others to get what the actor wants. Most power relationships, however, depend very much on what the victim thinks. A dictator who wishes to punish a dissident may be misled in thinking he exercised power if the dissident really sought martyrdom to advance her cause. But if the dictator simply wanted to destroy the dissident, her intentions did not matter to his power.

行动往往会产生强大的意外后果，但从政策角度来看，我们关注的是能否实现预期结果。如果一名北约士兵在阿富汗被流弹击中身亡，他虽然有能力造成破坏，但却无法实现其预期结果。一次空袭造成一名叛乱分子和多名平民死亡，展现了强大的破坏能力，但对反叛乱政策而言，这可能适得其反。一个经济大国的行动可能会产生意想不到的后果，给一个小国带来意外的伤害（或财富）。16.再次强调，如果后果并非预期，那么就存在造成伤害（或带来益处）的能力，但这种能力并不能实现预期结果。加拿大人经常抱怨，与美国为邻就像与大象同眠。从加拿大人的角度来看，意图并不重要；如果大象翻身，他们也会感到疼痛。但从政策角度来看，意图对于实现预期结果至关重要。17以政策为导向的权力概念依赖于特定的背景来告诉我们谁在何时何地获得什么。18

Actions often have powerful unintended consequences, but from a policy point of view we are interested in the ability to produce preferred outcomes. If a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) soldier in Afghanistan kills a child by a stray bullet, he had the power to destroy but not to achieve his preferred outcome. An air strike that kills one insurgent and many civilians demonstrates a general power to destroy, but it may prove counterproductive for a counterinsurgency policy. The actions of a country with a large economy may have unintended effects that cause accidental harm (or wealth) in a small country.16 Again, if the effects are unintended, then there is power to harm (or benefit), but it is not power to achieve preferred outcomes. Canadians often complain that living next to the United States is like sleeping with an elephant. From the Canadian point of view, intentions do not matter; it hurts if the beast rolls over. But from a policy-oriented perspective, intentions matter in terms of getting preferred outcomes.17 A policy-oriented concept of power depends upon a specified context to tell us who gets what, how, where, and when.18

务实的政治家和普通民众常常觉得行为和动机等问题过于复杂和难以预测。行为定义以行动后的结果（经济学家称之为“事后”）而非行动前的结果（“事前”）来评判权力。但政策制定者希望对未来进行预测以指导其行动。因此，他们常常简单地将权力定义为能够产生结果的资源。按照这种将权力视为资源的定义，一个国家如果拥有相对庞大的人口、领土、自然资源、经济实力、军事力量和社会稳定性，就被认为是强大的。这种定义的优点在于，它使权力看起来具体、可衡量且可预测——成为行动的指南。在这种意义上，权力就像在纸牌游戏中手握大牌一样。但这种定义存在重大问题。当人们将权力等同于（可能）产生结果的资源时，他们常常会遇到一个悖论：那些拥有最多权力的人并不总是能得到他们想要的结果。

Practical politicians and ordinary people often find these questions of behavior and motivation too complicated and unpredictable. Behavioral definitions judge power by outcomes that are determined after the action (what economists call “ex post”) rather than before the action (“ex ante”). But policymakers want predictions about the future to help guide their actions. Thus, they frequently define power simply in terms of the resources that can produce outcomes. By this second definition of power as resources, a country is powerful if it has a relatively large population, territory, natural resources, economic strength, military force, and social stability. The virtue of this second definition is that it makes power appear to be concrete, measurable, and predictable—a guide to action. Power in this sense is like holding the high cards in a card game. But this definition has major problems. When people define power as synonymous with the resources that (may) produce outcomes, they often encounter the paradox that those best endowed with power do not always get the outcomes they want.

这并非否认权力资源的重要性。权力是通过资源传递的，无论这些资源是有形的还是无形的。人们会注意到资源。如果你在扑克牌游戏中亮出最大的牌，其他人可能会选择弃牌而不是挑战你。但是，在一种游戏中制胜的权力资源，在另一种游戏中可能毫无用处。即使你手握一手强牌，如果玩的是桥牌，你也赢不了。即使是扑克，如果你打得不好，或者被虚张声势和欺骗所蒙蔽，你仍然会输。权力转化——即从资源到行为结果的转化——是一个至关重要的中间变量。拥有权力资源并不能保证你总能得到想要的结果。例如，就资源而言，美国比越南强大得多，但最终却输掉了战争。将资源转化为实际权力，即获得预期结果，需要精心设计的策略和高超的领导力——我称之为“巧权力”。然而，策略往往不够完善，领导者也常常判断失误。

This is not to deny the importance of power resources. Power is conveyed through resources, whether tangible or intangible. People notice resources. If you show the highest cards in a poker game, others may fold their hands rather than challenge you. But power resources that win in one game may not help at all in another. Holding a strong poker hand does not win if the game is bridge. Even if the game is poker, if you play your high hand poorly, or fall victim to bluff and deception, you can still lose. Power conversion—getting from resources to behavioral outcomes—is a crucial intervening variable. Having the resources of power does not guarantee that you will always get the outcome you want. For example, in terms of resources, the United States was far more powerful than Vietnam, yet lost the war. Converting resources into realized power in the sense of obtaining desired outcomes requires well-designed strategies and skillful leadership—what I call smart power. Yet strategies are often inadequate and leaders frequently misjudge.

然而，用资源来定义权力是政策制定者认为有用的一种简便方法。一般来说，一个拥有丰富权力资源的国家更有可能影响一个较弱的国家。与反之相比，小国对最优战略的依赖程度可能较低。小国有时可能因为选择较小的冲突或有选择地关注少数几个问题而获得更有利的结果。平均而言，在直接冲突中，我们并不认为芬兰能够战胜俄罗斯。19

Nonetheless, defining power in terms of resources is a shortcut that policymakers find useful. In general, a country that is well endowed with power resources is more likely to affect a weaker country and be less dependent upon an optimal strategy than vice versa. Smaller countries may sometimes obtain preferred outcomes because they pick smaller fights or focus selectively on a few issues. On average, and in direct conflicts, we would not expect Finland to prevail over Russia.19

在任何博弈中，第一步都是要弄清楚谁手握大牌，以及他们拥有多少筹码。然而，同样重要的是，政策制定者必须具备足够的背景知识，才能理解他们所处的博弈环境。在特定背景下，哪些资源能为权力行为提供最佳基础？工业时代之前，石油并非重要的能源；核时代之前，铀也并非举足轻重。在传统的现实主义国际事务观中，战争是国际政治博弈的终极手段。当所有牌都摆在桌面上时，相对实力的评估便会得到验证或证伪。但几个世纪以来，随着技术的进步，战争的力量来源往往发生了变化。此外，在21世纪越来越多的问题上，战争不再是最终的仲裁者。

As a first step in any game, it helps to start by figuring out who is holding the high cards and how many chips that player has. Equally important, however, is that policymakers have the contextual intelligence to understand what game they are playing. Which resources provide the best basis for power behavior in a particular context? Oil was not an impressive power resource before the industrial age, nor was uranium significant before the nuclear age. In traditional realist views of international affairs, war was the ultimate game in which the cards of international politics were played. When all the cards were on the table, estimates of relative power were proven and disproven. But over the centuries, as technologies evolved, the sources of strength for war often changed. Moreover, on an increasing number of issues in the twenty-first century, war is not the ultimate arbiter.

因此，许多分析人士认为“国家权力要素”方法具有误导性，且不如20世纪后半叶在社会科学分析中占据主导地位的行为或关系方法。严格来说，这些怀疑者的观点是正确的。权力资源仅仅是构成权力关系的有形和无形原材料或载体，而特定资源组合能否产生预期结果取决于具体情境下的行为。载体本身并非权力关系。20知道车辆的马力和里程数并不能告诉我们它是否能到达目的地。

As a result, many analysts reject the “elements of national power” approach as misleading and inferior to the behavioral or relational approach that became dominant among social science analysis in the latter half of the twentieth century. Strictly speaking, the skeptics are correct. Power resources are simply the tangible and intangible raw materials or vehicles that underlie power relationships, and whether a given set of resources produces preferred outcomes or not depends upon behavior in context. The vehicle is not the power relationship.20 Knowing the horsepower and mileage of a vehicle does not tell us whether it will get to the preferred destination.

实际上，在全球事务中，关于权力的讨论往往涉及这两种定义。21我们日常使用的许多术语，例如“军事实力”和“经济实力”，都是资源和行为相结合的混合概念。既然如此，我们就必须明确我们指的是基于行为的定义还是基于资源的定义。权力，我们必须意识到它们之间并不完美。例如，当人们谈到中国或印度的崛起时，他们往往会提到这些国家庞大的人口和不断增长的经济或军事资源。但是，这些资源所蕴含的能力能否真正转化为预期的结果，取决于具体情况以及该国将资源转化为能够产生预期结果的战略的能力。图 1.1总结了这些不同的定义。该图还展示了一种更为严谨的关系性定义，即权力是改变他人行为以产生预期结果的能力。

In practice, discussions of power in global affairs involve both definitions.21 Many of the terms that we use daily, such as “military power” and “economic power,” are hybrids that combine both resources and behaviors. So long as that is the case, we must make clear whether we are speaking of behavioral- or resource-based definitions of power, and we must be aware of the imperfect relation between them. For example, when people speak of the rising power of China or India, they tend to point to the large populations and increased economic or military resources of those countries. But whether the capacity that those resources imply can actually be converted into preferred outcomes will depend upon the contexts and the country’s skill in converting resources into strategies that will produce preferred outcomes. These different definitions are summarized in Figure 1.1. The figure also illustrates the more careful relational definition in which power is the ability to alter others’ behavior to produce preferred outcomes.

图 1.1权力作为资源和权力作为行为结果

FIGURE 1.1 Power as Resources and Power as Behavioral Outcomes

这就是人们常说的“权力不一定会带来影响力”的意思（尽管出于前面已经解释过的原因，这种说法令人困惑）。

This is what people are getting at when they say things like “Power doesn’t necessarily lead to influence” (though for reasons already explained, that formulation is confusing).

归根结底，因为我们关注的是结果而非资源，所以我们必须更加重视情境和策略。权力转换策略是一个至关重要却往往被忽视的变量。策略将手段与目标联系起来，而那些能够在不同情境下成功结合硬实力和软实力资源的策略，才是巧实力的关键所在。

In the end, because it is outcomes, not resources, that we care about, we must pay more attention to contexts and strategies. Power-conversion strategies turn out to be a critical variable that does not receive enough attention. Strategies relate means to ends, and those that combine hard and soft power resources successfully in different contexts are the key to smart power.

关系权力的三个方面

THREE ASPECTS OF RELATIONAL POWER

除了区分权力的资源定义和关系定义之外，区分权力的三个不同方面也很有帮助。关系权力包括：主导变革、掌控议程和确立偏好。这些概念常常被混淆。例如，最近一本关于外交政策的书将权力定义为“让人们或群体去做他们不想做的事情”。22但这种狭隘的方法可能会导致错误。

In addition to the distinction between resource and relational definitions of power, it is useful to distinguish three different aspects of relational power: commanding change, controlling agendas, and establishing preferences. All too often these are conflated. For example, a recent book on foreign policy defines power as “getting people or groups to do something they don’t want to do.”22 But such a narrow approach can lead to mistakes.

能够命令他人违背其最初意愿改变行为，是关系权力的一个重要维度，但并非唯一维度。另一个维度是影响他人偏好的能力，使他们想要你想要的东西，而无需你命令他们改变。前总统（兼将军）德怀特·艾森豪威尔曾将此描述为让人们做某事“不仅是因为你命令他们这样做，而是因为他们本能地想为你这样做”。23这种合作性权力与命令性权力形成对比，又与之互补。认为权力仅仅是命令他人改变是错误的。与其在“关键时刻”才依靠胡萝卜加大棒来改变他们的行为，不如通过塑造他们的偏好来影响他们的行为，从而达到你想要的结果。有时，无需强迫或胁迫也能获得你想要的结果。如果对权力的定义过于狭隘而忽略这一维度，就可能导致外交政策制定不当。

The ability to command others to change their behavior against their initial preferences is one important dimension of relational power, but not the only one. Another dimension is the ability to affect others’ preferences so that they want what you want and you need not command them to change. Former president (and general) Dwight Eisenhower referred to this as getting people to do something “not only because you tell them to do so, but because they instinctively want to do it for you.”23 This co-optive power contrasts with and complements command power. It is a mistake to think that power consists of just ordering others to change. You can affect their behavior by shaping their preferences in ways that produce what you want rather than relying on carrots and sticks to change their behavior “when push comes to shove.” Sometimes you can get the outcomes you want without pushing or shoving. Ignoring this dimension by using a too narrow definition of power can lead to a poorly shaped foreign policy.

权力的第一个方面，或者说“面貌”，是由耶鲁大学政治学家罗伯特·达尔在 20 世纪 50 年代对纽黑文的研究中定义的，尽管它只涵盖了权力行为的一部分，但今天仍然被广泛使用。24这种权力体现在能够使他人采取与其最初意愿和策略相悖的行动。要衡量或判断权力，你必须了解他人或国家的最初意愿有多强烈，以及你的努力在多大程度上改变了这些意愿。在看似存在一定选择余地的情况下，胁迫可能非常明显。如果一个持枪歹徒说：“要么给钱，要么要命”，你虽然有一定的选择余地，但这种选择余地很小，而且与你最初的意愿并不一致（除非你的意愿包括自杀或殉道）。25当捷克斯洛伐克沦陷于德苏联军之手时1938 年和 1968 年的布拉格之行，并非是那个国家想要这样做。

The first aspect, or “face,” of power was defined by Yale political scientist Robert Dahl in studies of New Haven in the 1950s, and it is widely used today even though it covers only part of power behavior.24 This face of power focuses on the ability to get others to act in ways that are contrary to their initial preferences and strategies. To measure or judge power, you have to know how strong another person’s or nation’s initial preferences were and how much they were changed by your efforts. Coercion can be quite clear in a situation in which there appears to be some degree of choice. If a man holding a gun on you says, “Your money or your life,” you have some choice, but it is small and not consistent with your initial preferences (unless they included suicide or martyrdom).25 When Czechoslovakia succumbed to German and Soviet troops entering Prague in 1938 and again in 1968, it was not because that country wanted to.

经济措施则更为复杂。负面制裁（剥夺经济利益）显然会被视为一种强制手段。对当事人而言，用金钱或经济激励来促使其去做原本不愿做的事情，或许更具吸引力，但任何形式的报酬都可能因为被暗示或明确威胁取消而轻易转化为负面制裁。年终奖金是一种奖励，但取消奖金则会被视为一种惩罚。此外，在不平等的谈判关系中，例如在百万富翁地主和饥饿的农民之间，微薄的“要么接受，要么放弃”的报酬可能让农民几乎没有选择余地。关键在于，有人有能力迫使他人违背其最初的意愿和策略行事，而双方都能感受到这种力量。

Economic measures are somewhat more complex. Negative sanctions (taking away economic benefit) are clearly felt as coercive. Payment or economic inducement to do what you initially did not want to may seem more attractive to the subject, but any payment can easily be turned into a negative sanction by the implicit or explicit threat of its removal. A year-end bonus is a reward, but its removal is felt as a penalty. Moreover, in unequal bargaining relationships, say, between a millionaire landowner and a starving peasant, a paltry “take it or leave it” payment may give the peasant little sense of choice. The important point is that someone has the capacity to make others act against their initial preferences and strategies, and both sides feel that power.

20 世纪 60 年代，在达尔提出他广为接受的定义后不久，政治学家彼得·巴赫拉赫和莫顿·巴拉茨指出，达尔的定义忽略了他们所谓的“权力的第二面”。达尔忽略了框架和议程设置的维度。26如果能够利用某些理念和制度来构建行动议程，使他人的偏好显得无关紧要或超出范畴，那么或许就无需强迫或干预他们。换言之，或许可以通过影响他人对合法性和可行性的预期来塑造他们的偏好。议程构建的核心在于将某些问题排除在讨论之外，或者正如夏洛克·福尔摩斯所说，就是让那些不会吠叫的狗保持沉默。

In the 1960s, shortly after Dahl developed his widely accepted definition, political scientists Peter Bachrach and Morton Baratz pointed out that Dahl’s definition missed what they called the “second face of power.” Dahl ignored the dimension of framing and agenda-setting.26 If ideas and institutions can be used to frame the agenda for action in a way that make others’ preferences seem irrelevant or out of bounds, then it may never be necessary to push or shove them. In other words, it may be possible to shape others’ preferences by affecting their expectations of what is legitimate or feasible. Agenda-framing focuses on the ability to keep issues off the table, or as Sherlock Holmes might put it, dogs that fail to bark.

强势国家可以确保弱势国家永远无法参与谈判，即便参与，游戏规则也早已被先行者制定。国际金融政策就具有这种特点，至少在2008年危机爆发之前是如此。危机爆发后，八国集团（G8）被二十国集团（G20）补充，情况才有所改善。那些受制于这种权力第二面的人可能意识到了这一点，也可能没有意识到。如果他们接受相关机构或构建议程的社会话语的合法性，他们可能不会感到受到过多的约束。权力的第二面。但如果行动议程受到胁迫威胁或金钱承诺的制约，那么它仅仅是权力的第一面。目标对象对该议程合法性的默许，使得这种权力具有收买性，并部分构成软实力——即通过收买手段构建议程、说服和激发积极情绪来达到目的的能力。

Powerful actors can make sure that the less powerful are never invited to the table, or if they get there, the rules of the game have already been set by those who arrived first. International financial policy had this characteristic, at least before the crisis of 2008 opened things up somewhat when the Group of 8 (G-8) was supplemented by the Group of 20 (G-20). Those who are subject to this second face of power may or may not be aware of it. If they accept the legitimacy of the institutions or the social discourse that framed the agenda, they may not feel unduly constrained by the second face of power. But if the agenda of action is constrained by threats of coercion or promises of payments, then it is just an instance of the first face of power. The target’s acquiescence in the legitimacy of the agenda is what makes this face of power co-optive and partly constitutive of soft power—the ability to get what you want by the co-optive means of framing the agenda, persuading, and eliciting positive attraction.

后来，到了 20 世纪 70 年代，社会学家史蒂文·卢克斯指出，思想和信仰也会影响他人的最初偏好。27在达尔的理论中，我可以通过让你去做你原本不想做的事情来对你施加影响；换句话说，通过改变你的处境，我可以让你改变你偏好的策略。但我也可以通过决定你的欲望本身来对你施加影响。我可以塑造你的基本或初始偏好，而不仅仅是改变处境，让你改变实现偏好的策略。

Still later, in the 1970s, sociologist Steven Lukes pointed out that ideas and beliefs also help shape others’ initial preferences.27 In Dahl’s approach, I can exercise power over you by getting you to do what you would otherwise not want to do; in other words, by changing your situation, I can make you change your preferred strategy. But I can also exercise power over you by determining your very wants. I can shape your basic or initial preferences, not merely change the situation in a way that makes you change your strategy for achieving your preferences.

达尔的定义忽略了权力的这一维度。一个十几岁的男孩可能会精心挑选一件时髦的衬衫去学校，以吸引女孩的注意，但他可能并不知道这件衬衫之所以如此时髦，是因为一家全国性零售商最近发起了一场大型广告宣传活动。他和其他青少年的偏好都受到一个看不见的“行动者”的影响，这个“行动者”塑造了偏好的结构。如果你能让别人想要和你想要的结果一样，你就无需去违背他们最初的意愿。卢克斯称之为权力的“第三张面孔”。28

This dimension of power is missed by Dahl’s definition. A teenage boy may carefully choose a fashionable shirt to wear to school to attract a girl, but the teenager may not be aware that the reason the shirt is so fashionable is that a national retailer recently launched a major advertising campaign. Both his preference and that of the other teenagers have been formed by an unseen actor who has shaped the structure of preferences. If you can get others to want the same outcomes that you want, it will not be necessary to override their initial desires. Lukes called this the “third face of power.”28

在决定人们在多大程度上自由地选择自己的偏好时，存在着关于自愿性的关键问题。29并非所有软实力在外部批评者眼中都显得那么温和。在某些极端情况下，很难确定何为自愿形成的偏好。例如，在“斯德哥尔摩综合症”中，遭受创伤性应激的绑架受害者开始认同绑架者。绑架者有时试图“洗脑”人质，有时则试图用善意赢得他们的心。30但在某些情况下，要确定他人的利益则更加困难。阿富汗妇女她们选择穿罩袍就受到压迫吗？那么在民主的法国，选择戴面纱的女性又该如何看待呢？31有时，仅凭外表很难判断自愿程度。像阿道夫·希特勒和斯大林这样的独裁者试图营造一种不可战胜的氛围来吸引追随者，而一些东南欧国家的领导人也屈服于这种影响。如果武力能够营造出一种令人敬畏的氛围，从而吸引他人，那么它就可以成为一种间接的收买力量；但如果武力是直接的强制力，那么它就仅仅是权力的第一副面孔。

There are critical questions of voluntarism in determining how freely people chose their preferences.29 Not all soft power looks so soft to outside critics. In some extreme cases, it is difficult to ascertain what constitutes voluntary formation of preferences. For instance, in the “Stockholm syndrome,” victims of kidnapping who suffered traumatic stress began to identify with their abductors. Captors sometimes try to “brainwash” their captives and sometimes try to win them over with kindnesses.30 But in some situations, it is more difficult to be certain of others’ interests. Are Afghan women oppressed when they choose to wear a burka? What about women who choose to wear a veil in democratic France?31 Sometimes it is difficult to know the extent of voluntarism from mere outward appearances. Dictators such as Adolf Hitler and Stalin tried to create an aura of invincibility to attract followers, and some leaders in southeastern European countries succumbed to this effect. To the extent that force creates a sense of awe that attracts others, it can be an indirect source of co-optive power, but if the force is directly coercive, then it is simply an instance of the first face of power.

表1.1关系权力的三个方面

TABLE 1.1 Three Aspects of Relational Power

第一种策略： A利用威胁或奖励来改变B的行为，使其违背B最初的偏好和策略。B明白这一点，并感受到A的影响力。

FIRST FACE: A uses threats or rewards to change B’s behavior against B’s initial preferences and strategies. B knows this and feels the effect of A’s power.

第二层面： A 控制着行动议程，从而限制了 B 的策略选择。B 可能知道也可能不知道这一点，也可能意识到 A 的权力。

SECOND FACE: A controls the agenda of actions in a way that limits B’s choices of strategy. B may or may not know this and be aware of A’s power.

第三层面： A帮助塑造和形成B的基本信念、认知和偏好。B不太可能意识到这一点，也不太可能意识到A的力量所产生的影响。

THIRD FACE: A helps to create and shape B’s basic beliefs, perceptions, and preferences. B is unlikely to be aware of this or to realize the effect of A’s power.

一些理论家将这些称为权力的公开面孔、隐藏面孔和不可见面孔，反映了目标对象在发现权力来源时所面临的不同程度的困难。32第二和第三个方面体现了结构性权力的各个方面。结构仅仅是整体所有部分的安排。人类嵌入在复杂的文化、社会关系和权力结构中，这些结构影响并制约着他们。一个人的行动领域“由那些与他没有互动或沟通的行动者所界定，由在时间和空间上遥远的行动所界定，由那些他并非明确意义上的目标的行动所界定。”33有些权力的行使反映了特定行为者的有意决定，而另一些则是无意后果和更大的社会力量的产物。

Some theorists have called these the public, hidden, and invisible faces of power, reflecting the degrees of difficulty that the target has in discovering the source of power.32 The second and third faces embody aspects of structural power. A structure is simply an arrangement of all the parts of a whole. Humans are embedded in complex structures of culture, social relations, and power that affect and constrain them. A person’s field of action is “delimited by actors with whom he has no interaction or communication, by actions distant in time and space, by actions of which he is, in no explicit sense the target.”33 Some exercises of power reflect the intentional decisions of particular actors, whereas others are the product of unintended consequences and larger social forces.

例如，为什么大型汽车占据了我们城市的街道？部分原因在于个人消费者的选择，但这些消费者的偏好本身又受到广告、制造商决策、税收优惠、公共交通政策、道路建设补贴和城市规划等社会历史因素的影响。34过去许多有形和无形的行动者就这些问题做出了不同的选择，这使得今天的城市居民在这些问题上的选择变得有限。

For example, why do large automobiles dominate our city streets? In part the answer reflects individual consumer choices, but these consumer preferences are themselves shaped by a social history of advertising, manufacturers’ decisions, tax incentives, public transport policy, road-building subsidies, and urban planning.34 Different choices on these issues by many visible as well as unseen past actors confront an urban resident today with a limited set of choices.

据称，比尔·克林顿的政治顾问詹姆斯·卡维尔在 1993 年曾开玩笑说，他希望自己能转世成为债券市场，因为那样他就能拥有真正的权力。35当我们谈到市场的力量时，我们指的是一种结构性力量。一位小麦种植户为了支付女儿的大学学费，可能会决定种植更多的小麦。但如果其他种植户也增加种植量（而需求不变），市场力量可能会减少他的收入，从而影响女儿的教育前景。在完全市场中，个体没有定价权。数百万其他不可见的个体做出独立选择，从而形成供求关系，最终决定价格。这就是为什么生产大宗商品的贫穷国家往往面临贸易条件差异巨大的问题。但是，如果个体能够通过引入垄断（单一卖方）或买方垄断（单一买方）等因素来改变市场结构，她就能获得一定的定价权。她可以通过广告差异化产品、建立品牌忠诚度、选择特殊地点等方式来实现这一点。或者，在石油生产国，个体可以尝试组建像石油输出国组织（欧佩克）这样的卡特尔。

In 1993, Bill Clinton’s political adviser James Carville is alleged to have joked that he wished he could be reborn as the bond market because then he would have real power.35 When we speak of the power of markets, we are referring to a form of structural power. A wheat farmer who wants to earn more income to pay for his daughter’s college tuition may decide to plant more wheat. But if other farmers plant more as well (and demand does not change), market forces may reduce his income and affect her educational prospects. In a perfect market, the agent has no pricing power. Millions of other unseen agents making independent choices create the supply and demand that determine the price. This is why poor countries that produce commodities are often subject to wide variations in their terms of trade. But if an agent can find a way to change the structure of a market by introducing an element of monopoly (a single seller) or monopsony (a single buyer), she can gain some power over price. She can do this by differentiating her product through advertising, creating brand loyalty, picking a special location, and so forth. Or in the case of oil-producing countries, agents can try to form a cartel like the Organization of Petroleum-Exporting Countries (OPEC).

不同的分析者从不同的角度剖析复杂的因果关系，并在不同的层面上界定个体选择与更大结构之间的关系。例如，社会学家往往比政治学家更少关注具体的行为和结果。36那些只关注个体行为者的分析家（正如权力的第一面往往那样）显然未能全面理解和描述权力关系。但那些只关注广泛的社会力量和更长远的分析家则不然。历史视角，如同权力的第二和第三面一样，往往忽视了政策制定中至关重要的个人选择和意图。一些批评者称我的方法过于“以行动者为中心”，但它仍然允许对结构性力量进行一定程度的考量，即便它并未涵盖结构的所有方面。37

Different analysts cut into the complex pattern of causation and draw the line between individual choice and larger structures at different places. For example, sociologists tend to focus less on specific actions and outcomes than political scientists do.36 Analysts who focus only on individual agents, as the first face of power tends to do, are clearly failing to understand and describe power relationships fully. But those who focus only on broad social forces and longer historical perspective, as the second and third faces of power tend to do, pay too little attention to the individual choices and intentions that are crucial in policy. Some critics have called my approach too “agent centered,” but it still allows some consideration of structural forces even if it does not include all aspects of structure.37

一些分析人士认为这些区别是无用的抽象概念，都可以归结为权力的第一面。38然而，如果我们屈服于这种诱惑，我们很可能就会限制我们对行为的观察，这往往会限制政策制定者为实现其目标而设计的策略。命令权力（第一层面）非常明显且易于理解。它是硬实力的基础——通过胁迫和收买来获得预期结果的能力。第二层面和第三层面的收买权力则更为微妙，因此也更难被察觉。它有助于软实力的形成，即通过议程设置、说服和吸引等收买手段来获得理想结果的能力。政策制定者常常过于关注硬命令权力，以此迫使他人违背自身意愿行事，而忽略了通过形成偏好而产生的软实力。但是，当收买成为可能时，政策制定者就可以省去胡萝卜加大棒的手段。39

Some analysts regard these distinctions as useless abstractions that can all be collapsed into the first face of power.38 If we succumb to this temptation, however, we are likely to limit what we see in terms of behavior, which tends to limit the strategies that policymakers design to achieve their goals. Command power (the first face) is very visible and readily grasped. It is the basis for hard power—the ability to get desired outcomes through coercion and payment. The co-optive power of faces two and three is more subtle and therefore less visible. It contributes to soft power, the ability to get preferred outcomes through the co-optive means of agenda-setting, persuasion, and attraction. All too often policymakers have focused solely on hard command power to compel others to act against their preferences and have ignored the soft power that comes from preference formation. But when co-opting is possible, policymakers can save on carrots and sticks.39

在全球政治中，一些国家追求的目标更容易受到权力第二面和第三面的影响，而非第一面的影响。阿诺德·沃尔弗斯曾区分过他所谓的“占有目标”（具体且通常有形的目标）和“环境目标”（通常是结构性的且无形的）。40例如，获取资源、获得基地使用权或达成贸易协定属于占有目标，而促进开放的贸易体系、自由市场、民主或人权则属于环境目标。沿用之前的术语，我们可以将国家视为具有具体目标和一般目标或结构性目标。仅仅关注指挥权力和权力的第一层面可能会误导我们对如何促进这些目标的理解。例如，在促进民主方面，仅靠军事手段远不如军事手段与软实力相结合来得有效——正如美国在伊拉克所发现的那样。而软实力……吸引力和说服力既包含能动性维度，也包含结构性维度。例如，一个国家可以通过公共外交等行动来吸引其他国家，但它也可以通过自身榜样的结构性影响，或者所谓的“山巅之城”效应来吸引其他国家。

In global politics, some goals that states seek are more susceptible to the second and third than to the first face of power. Arnold Wolfers once distinguished between what he called possession goals—specific and often tangible objectives—and milieu goals, which are often structural and intangible.40 For example, access to resources or basing rights or a trade agreement is a possession goal, whereas promoting an open trade system, free markets, democracy, or human rights is a milieu goal. In the terminology used previously, we can think of states having specific goals and general or structural goals. Focusing solely on command power and the first face of power may mislead us about how to promote such goals. For example, in the promotion of democracy, military means alone are less successful than military means combined with soft power approaches—as the United States discovered in Iraq. And the soft power of attraction and persuasion can have both agentic and structural dimensions. For example, a country can try to attract others through actions such as public diplomacy, but it may also attract others through the structural effects of its example or what can be called the “shining city on the hill” effect.

另一个不应将权力的三种面向全部归为第一面的原因在于，这样做会削弱人们对网络的关注，而网络是21世纪一种重要的结构性权力。在信息时代，网络的重要性日益凸显，在社交网络中占据有利位置可以成为重要的权力资源。例如，在中心辐射型网络中，权力可以来源于成为通信枢纽。如果你通过我与其他朋友沟通，我就获得了权力。如果边缘节点之间没有直接连接，它们对通过中心节点进行沟通的依赖性会影响它们的议程。例如，即使在独立之后，许多前法国非洲殖民地之间的通信仍然要经过巴黎，这增强了法国塑造其议程的权力。

Another reason not to collapse all three faces of power into the first is that doing so diminishes attention to networks, which are an important type of structural power in the twenty-first century. Networks are becoming increasingly important in an information age, and positioning in social networks can be an important power resource. For example, in a hub-and-spokes network, power can derive from being the hub of communications. If you communicate with your other friends through me, that gives me power. If the points on the rim are not directly connected to each other, their dependence on communication through the hub can shape their agenda. For example, even after independence, many communications among former French African colonies ran through Paris, and that increased French power to shape their agenda.

在其他更复杂的网络结构中，理论家指出结构洞的重要性，结构洞会阻止网络某些部分之间的直接通信。41那些能够弥合或利用结构性漏洞的人，可以通过控制他人之间的沟通，将自身地位转化为权力来源。与权力相关的网络的另一个方面是其广泛性。即使是弱的广泛联系，也能在获取和传播新颖创新信息方面发挥作用。弱联系能够以合作且成功的方式将不同的群体联系起来。42这增强了一个国家与他国合作而非凌驾于他国之上的能力。经济学家肯尼斯·博尔丁将这种建立信任网络、使各方能够携手实现共同目标的能力称为“整合能力”。43心理学家表示：“多年的研究表明，同理心和社会智慧对于获取和行使权力而言，远比武力、欺骗或恐怖重要得多。”44

In other more complex network arrangements, theorists point to the importance of structural holes that prevent direct communication between certain parts of the network.41 Those who can bridge or exploit structural holes can use their position as a source of power by controlling communication between others. Another aspect of networks that is relevant to power is their extensiveness. Even weak extensive ties can be useful in acquiring and disseminating novel and innovative information. Weak ties provide the ability to link diverse groups together in a cooperative, successful manner.42 This increases a country’s ability to gain power with, rather than over, others. The ability to create networks of trust that enable groups to work together toward common goals is what economist Kenneth Boulding calls “integrative power.”43 According to psychologists, “Years of research suggest that empathy and social intelligence are vastly more important to acquiring and exercising power than are force, deception, or terror.”44

政治理论家汉娜·阿伦特曾说过：“当人们团结起来行动时，权力就会在他们中间产生。”45同样，一个国家可以通过与其他国家合作并共同行动来运用全球力量，而不仅仅是对抗它们。普林斯顿大学政治学家约翰·伊肯伯里认为，二战后美国的实力建立在一个制度网络之上，该网络既约束了美国，又对其他国家开放，从而增强了美国与其他国家合作的能力。46这是评估当前国际体系中各国实力的重要一点，也是评估21世纪美国和中国未来实力的重要维度。47例如，如果美国参与更多的通信网络，它就有更大的机会在权力的第三面塑造偏好。

Political theorist Hannah Arendt once said that “power springs up among men when they act together.”45 Similarly, a state can wield global power by engaging and acting together with other states, not merely acting against them. Princeton political scientist John Ikenberry argues that American power after World War II rested on a network of institutions that constrained the United States but were open to others and thus increased America’s power to act with others.46 This is an important point in assessing the power of nations in the current international system and an important dimension for assessing the future of American and Chinese power in the twenty-first century.47 For example, if the United States is involved in more communication networks, it has a greater opportunity to shape preferences in terms of the third face of power.

从政策制定的角度来看，将权力的三种表现形式按照社会科学家提出它们的先后顺序颠倒过来思考会更有帮助。政策制定者在转向权力的第一种表现形式，即支配性权力之前，应该先考虑通过偏好形成和议程设置来塑造环境。48总之，那些坚持将权力的第二和第三维度合并为第一维度的人，将会错过本世纪权力中一个日益重要的方面。

For policy purposes, it can be useful to think of the three faces of power in a reverse sequence from the order in which they were invented by social scientists. A policymaker should consider preference formation and agenda-framing as means of shaping the environment before turning to the first, or command, face of power.48 In short, those who insist on collapsing the second and third dimensions of power into the first will miss an increasingly important aspect of power in this century.

现实主义与权力行为的全谱

REALISM AND THE FULL SPECTRUM OF POWER BEHAVIOR

在美国，人们倾向于关注权力的第一面，这在一定程度上反映了美国的政治文化和制度。没有哪个政治家愿意显得“软弱”，国会也更容易增加五角大楼的预算，而不是国务院的预算。这种偏见又被主流的国际政治理论所强化。几个世纪以来，占主导地位的古典国际事务研究方法被称为“现实主义”，其渊源可以追溯到修昔底德和尼科洛等伟大的思想家。马基雅维利认为，在无政府状态的世界政治中，由于没有凌驾于国家之上的国际政府权威，各国必须依靠自身手段来维护独立，而当事态发展到白热化阶段时，武力便是最终手段。现实主义将世界描绘成主权国家为维护自身安全而战，并将军事力量视为其最终手段。因此，战争在几个世纪以来一直是国际事务中一个持续存在的问题。现实主义者形形色色，但他们都倾向于认为全球政治就是权力政治。在这一点上，他们的观点是正确的，但有些人对权力的理解过于狭隘，从而限制了他们对权力的理解。务实或具有常识的现实主义者会考虑权力资源的全部范围，包括思想、说服和吸引力。许多古典现实主义者对软实力的作用的理解甚至比一些现代的后辈更为深刻。

In the United States, the tendency to focus on the first face of power is partly a reflection of American political culture and institutions. No politician wants to appear “soft,” and Congress finds it easier to boost the budget of the Pentagon than that of the State Department. That bias has been reinforced by prevailing theories of international politics. For centuries, the dominant classical approach to international affairs has been called “realism,” and its lineage stretches back to such great thinkers as Thucydides and Niccolò Machiavelli. Realism assumes that in the anarchic conditions of world politics, where there is no higher international government authority above states, they must rely on their own devices to preserve their independence, and that when push comes to shove, the ultima ratio is the use of force. Realism portrays the world in terms of sovereign states aiming to preserve their security, with military force as their ultimate instrument. Thus, war has been a constant aspect of international affairs over the centuries. Realists come in many sizes and shapes, but all tend to argue that global politics is power politics. In this they are right, but some limit their understanding by conceiving of power too narrowly. A pragmatic or commonsense realist takes into account the full spectrum of power resources, including ideas, persuasion, and attraction. Many classical realists of the past understood the role of soft power better than some of their modern progeny.

现实主义理论在描绘国际关系的某些方面提供了一个良好的初步框架。但正如我们所见，国家不再是全球事务中唯一的重要行为体；安全不再是它们追求的唯一主要目标，武力也并非实现这些目标的唯一或最佳手段。事实上，这种复杂的相互依存关系是美国、加拿大、欧洲、澳大利亚和日本等发达后工业化国家之间关系的典型特征。相互民主、自由文化以及深厚的跨国联系网络意味着，无政府状态的影响与现实主义理论的预测截然不同。在这种情况下，巧实力战略更多地融合了权力的第二面和第三面。

Realism represents a good first cut at portraying some aspects of international relations. But as we have seen, states are no longer the only important actors in global affairs; security is not the only major outcome that they seek, and force is not the only or always the best instrument available to achieve those outcomes. Indeed, these conditions of complex interdependence are typical of relations among advanced postindustrial countries such as the United States, Canada, Europe, Australia, and Japan. Mutual democracy, liberal culture, and a deep network of transnational ties mean that anarchy has very different effects than realism predicts. In such conditions, a smart power strategy has a much higher mixture of the second and third faces of power.

然而，软实力发挥重要作用并非仅限于发达国家之间的关系。在信息时代，传播策略变得愈发重要，而最终结果不仅取决于哪一方的军队获胜，也取决于哪一方的叙事方式能够赢得人心。例如，在反恐斗争中，至关重要的是要构建一种能够吸引主流民众并阻止其被极端分子招募的叙事。在打击叛乱的战斗中，动能军事力量必须与软实力手段相结合，以赢得大多数民众的民心（塑造他们的偏好）。

It is not solely in relations among advanced countries, however, that soft power plays an important role. In an information age, communications strategies become more important, and outcomes are shaped not merely by whose army wins but also by whose story wins. In the fight against terrorism, for example, it is essential to have a narrative that appeals to the mainstream and prevents its recruitment by radicals. In the battle against insurgencies, kinetic military force must be accompanied by soft power instruments that help to win over the hearts and minds (shape the preferences) of the majority of the population.

明智的战略必须包含信息和传播要素。各国争夺规范的制定权，而议题框架的重要性日益凸显。例如，1991年第一次海湾战争期间，CNN和BBC主导了舆论框架；而到了2003年，半岛电视台在伊拉克战争的叙事塑造中扮演了重要角色。这种框架构建远非简单的宣传。在描述2003年3月的事件时，我们可以说美军“进入伊拉克”，也可以说美军“入侵伊拉克”。两种说法都正确，但它们在塑造舆论偏好方面的影响却截然不同。同样，如果我们考虑国际机构，议程的制定方式也截然不同：一个由八国集团组成、邀请少数成员的会议，与一个由二十个平等成员组成的会议，其议程的制定方式截然不同。这些例子仅仅说明了在信息时代的全球政治中，权力的第二和第三维度是如何变得日益重要的。

Smart strategies must have an information and communications component. States struggle over the power to define norms, and framing of issues grows in importance. For instance, CNN and the BBC framed the issues of the First Gulf War in 1991, but by 2003 Al Jazeera was playing a large role in shaping the narrative in the Iraq War. Such framing is more than mere propaganda. In describing events in March 2003, we could say that American troops “entered Iraq” or that American troops “invaded Iraq.” Both statements are true, but they have very different effects in terms of the power to shape preferences. Similarly, if we think of international institutions, it makes a difference if agendas are set in a Group of 8 with a few invited guests or in a Group of 20 equal invitees. These are just some examples of how the dimensions of the second and third faces of power are becoming more important in the global politics of an information age.

软实力行为与资源

SOFT POWER BEHAVIOR AND RESOURCES

一些批评人士抱怨说，软实力的现行定义已经变得模糊不清，因为它不断扩大，“既包括经济外交——既可用作胡萝卜加大棒——也包括军事力量……软实力现在似乎包罗万象。”49但这些批评者犯了错误，因为他们混淆了国家为实现预期结果而采取的行动与实现这些结果所用的资源。许多类型的资源都能增强软实力，但这并不意味着软实力就是任何一种行为。我把使用武力、支付以及基于这些手段的议程设置称为硬实力。被目标对象视为合法的议程设置、积极的吸引力和说服力，是我所定义的软实力行为谱系的一部分。硬实力是推力；软实力是拉力。完整定义软实力是……通过协调一致的手段，例如设定议程、说服他人、激发积极兴趣等，来影响他人，从而获得理想的结果。50

Some critics complain that the prevailing definition of soft power has become fuzzy through its expansion “to include both economic statecraft—used as both a carrot and as a stick—and even military power. . . . Soft power now seems to mean everything.”49 But these critics are mistaken because they confuse the actions of a state seeking to achieve desired outcomes with the resources used to produce them. Many types of resources can contribute to soft power, but that does not mean that soft power is any type of behavior. The use of force, payment, and some agenda-setting based on them I call hard power. Agenda-setting that is regarded as legitimate by the target, positive attraction, and persuasion are the parts of the spectrum of behaviors I include in soft power. Hard power is push; soft power is pull. Fully defined, soft power is the ability to affect others through the co-optive means of framing the agenda, persuading, and eliciting positive attraction in order to obtain preferred outcomes.50

以下是权力行为谱系的示意图：51

Here is a representation of a spectrum of power behaviors:51

一般来说，与硬实力相关的资源类型包括武力、金钱等有形资产。与软实力相关的资源类型通常包括制度、理念、价值观、文化以及政策合法性等无形因素。但二者并非完全一致。爱国主义、士气和合法性等无形资源对军队的作战能力和取胜能力有着显著影响。而使用武力的威胁虽然属于硬实力的一个维度，但却是无形的。52

In general, the types of resources associated with hard power include tangibles such as force and money. The types of resources associated with soft power often include intangible factors such as institutions, ideas, values, culture, and the perceived legitimacy of policies. But the relationship is not perfect. Intangible resources such as patriotism, morale, and legitimacy strongly affect the military capacity to fight and win. And threats to use force are intangible, even though they are a dimension of hard power.52

如果我们回顾权力资源和权力行为之间的区别，就会意识到，通常与硬实力行为相关的资源，根据具体情况和使用方式，也能产生软实力行为。指挥权力可以创造资源，而这些资源反过来又可以在后期产生软实力——例如，未来能够提供软实力资源的机构。同样，合作行为可以用来获取硬实力资源，例如军事联盟或经济援助。像军事单位这样的有形硬实力资源，根据其使用方式的不同，既可以产生指挥行为（通过赢得战斗），也可以产生合作行为（通过吸引）。而且，由于吸引力取决于感知者的心理，因此，主体的感知在决定特定资源最终产生硬实力行为还是软实力行为方面起着至关重要的作用。

If we remember the distinction between power resources and power behavior, we realize that the resources often associated with hard power behavior can also produce soft power behavior depending on the context and how they are used. Command power can create resources that in turn can create soft power at a later phase— for example, institutions that will provide soft power resources in the future. Similarly, co-optive behavior can be used to generate hard power resources in the form of military alliance or economic aid. A tangible hard power resource such as a military unit can produce both command behavior (by winning a battle) and co-optive behavior (by attracting) depending on how it is used. And because attraction depends upon the mind of the perceiver, the subject’s perceptions play a significant role in whether given resources produce hard or soft power behavior.

例如，海军力量既可以用来赢得战争（硬实力），也可以用来赢得民心（软实力），这取决于目标和问题的具体情况。美国海军在提供救援方面发挥了重要作用。2004 年东亚海啸后，印度尼西亚的处境对印尼人对美国的吸引力产生了强烈的影响，美国海军 2007 年的《海上战略》不仅提到了战争，还提到了“用于在国家间建立信心和信任的海上力量”。53同样，像中国这样的成功经济表现既能产生制裁和限制市场准入的硬实力，也能产生吸引和效仿成功的软实力。

For example, naval forces can be used to win battles (hard power) or win hearts and minds (soft power) depending on what the target and what the issue are. The U.S. Navy’s help in providing relief to Indonesia after the 2004 East Asian tsunami had a strong effect on increasing Indonesians’ attraction to the United States, and the U.S. Navy’s 2007 Maritime Strategy referred not only to war-fighting but also to “maritime forces . . . employed to build confidence and trust among nations.”53 Similarly, successful economic performance such as that of China can produce both the hard power of sanctions and restricted market access and the soft power of attraction and emulation of success.

一些分析人士误解了软实力，将其等同于文化，进而贬低了其重要性。例如，历史学家尼尔·弗格森将软实力描述为“文化和商业产品等非传统力量”，然后又以“它太软了”为由将其否定。54当然，在麦当劳吃饭或穿迈克尔·杰克逊的T恤并不一定代表软实力。民兵组织穿着耐克鞋、喝着可口可乐，也可能犯下暴行或与美国人作战。但这种批评混淆了可能产生行为的资源和行为本身。拥有权力资源是否真的能产生有利的行为，取决于具体情境以及行动者将这些资源转化为行为结果的能力。吃寿司、交换宝可梦卡牌或聘请日本投手（就像波士顿红袜队那样）并不一定能向日本传递实力。但这并非软实力资源所独有。如果战斗发生在沙漠中，拥有更强大的坦克部队或许能带来胜利，但如果战斗发生在沼泽中，则未必如此。同样，一个友善的微笑可以是一种软实力资源，如果我每次见面都对你微笑，你可能更愿意为我做些事，但如果我在你母亲的葬礼上微笑，那可能反而会破坏软实力，而不是创造软实力。

Some analysts have misinterpreted soft power as a synonym for culture and then gone on to downgrade its importance. For example, the historian Niall Ferguson describes soft power as “nontraditional forces such as cultural and commercial goods” and then dismisses it on the grounds that “it’s, well, soft.”54 Of course, eating at McDonald’s or wearing a Michael Jackson shirt does not automatically indicate soft power. Militias can perpetrate atrocities or fight Americans while wearing Nikes and drinking Coca-Cola. But this criticism confuses the resources that may produce behavior with the behavior itself. Whether the possession of power resources actually produces favorable behavior depends upon the context and the skills of the agent in converting the resources into behavioral outcomes. Eating sushi, trading Pokemon cards, or hiring a Japanese pitcher (as the Boston Red Sox did) does not necessarily convey power to Japan. But this is not unique to soft power resources. Having a larger tank army may produce victory if a battle is fought in a desert, but not if it is fought in a swamp. Similarly, a nice smile can be a soft power resource, and you may be more inclined to do something for me if I smile whenever we meet, but if I smile at your mother’s funeral, it may destroy soft power rather than create it.

软实力和智能实力

SOFT POWER AND SMART POWER

正如前言所述，我于2004年提出了“巧实力”这一概念，旨在纠正人们认为仅靠软实力就能制定有效外交政策的错误观念。我将巧实力定义为：将硬实力和软实力资源结合起来，形成有效的战略。55与软实力不同，巧实力既是一个描述性概念，也是一个评价性概念。从规范的角度来看，软实力的好坏取决于其运用方式。巧实力的定义本身就包含了评价因素。那些认为“巧实力——可以称之为软实力2.0——已经在美国外交政策语境中取代了软实力1.0”的批评者显然是错误的。56更准确的批评是，因为这个概念（与软实力不同）具有规范性维度，所以它常常容易变成口号，尽管情况并非总是如此。

As mentioned in the Preface, I developed the term “smart power” in 2004 to counter the misperception that soft power alone can produce effective foreign policy. I defined smart power as the ability to combine hard and soft power resources into effective strategies.55 Unlike soft power, smart power is an evaluative as well as a descriptive concept. Soft power can be good or bad from a normative perspective, depending on how it is used. Smart power has the evaluation built into the definition. Critics who say “smart power— which can be dubbed Soft Power 2.0—has superseded Soft Power 1.0 in the U.S. foreign policy lexicon” are simply mistaken.56 A more accurate criticism is that because the concept (unlike that of soft power) has a normative dimension, it often lends itself to slogans, though that need not be the case.

巧实力并非美国独有，所有国家（以及非国家行为体）都可以运用。例如，正如我们将在第七章中看到的，小国往往也发展出了巧实力战略。挪威人口仅有500万，它通过在维和与发展援助方面推行合法化政策来提升自身吸引力，同时积极有效地参与北约事务。而人口规模与之形成鲜明对比的是，中国作为一个经济和军事资源日益强大的新兴力量，却有意投资软实力，以降低其硬实力对邻国的威胁，从而发展出一种巧实力战略。

Smart power is available to all states (and nonstate actors), not just the United States. For example, as we will see in Chapter 7, small states have often developed smart power strategies. Norway, with 5 million people, has enhanced its attractiveness with legitimizing policies in peacemaking and development assistance, while also being an active and effective participant in NATO. And at the other extreme in terms of population size, China, a rising power in economic and military resources, has deliberately decided to invest in soft power resources so as to make its hard power look less threatening to its neighbors and thus develop a smart strategy.

巧实力直指权力转换问题的核心。正如我们之前所见，一些国家和行为体可能拥有比其他国家和行为体更强大的权力资源，但却无法有效地将这些权力资源转化为能够产生预期结果的战略。有人认为，美国由于沿用了效率低下的十八世纪政府结构，在权力转换方面较为薄弱。也有人反驳说，美国的许多实力并非源于政府，而是来自其开放的经济和公民社会。或许，当一个国家拥有盈余资产并能够承担失误的代价时，权力转换会更容易一些。但要实现巧实力和有效的权力转换战略，首先要了解所有权力资源，并认识到在不同情况下有效整合这些资源所面临的挑战。

Smart power goes to the heart of the problem of power conversion. As we saw earlier, some countries and actors may be endowed with greater power resources than others, yet not be very effective in converting the full range of their power resources into strategies that produce the outcomes they seek. Some argue that with an inefficient eighteenth-century government structure, the United States is weak in power conversion. Others respond that much of American strength is generated outside of government by the nation’s open economy and civil society. And it may be that power conversion is easier when a country has a surplus of assets and can afford to absorb the costs of mistakes. But the first steps to smart power and effective power-conversion strategies are understanding the full range of power resources and recognizing the problems of combining them effectively in various contexts.
