The financial crisis there cut 0.5 percent off the U.S. growth rate, but with a booming economy the United States could afford it. Indonesia, in contrast, was both sensitive and vulnerable to changes in global trade and investment patterns. Its economy suffered severely, and that in turn led to internal political conflict. Vulnerability involves degree. In 2008, given the bubble conditions in the country’s subprime mortgage market and its growing deficits, the United States proved more vulnerable than it had been when its market was flourishing a decade earlier.

脆弱性不仅仅取决于总体指标，而这正是前文对经济实力的警示之处。它还取决于一个社会能否迅速应对变化。例如，私人行为者、大型企业和市场投机者都可能根据市场情况囤积物资，因为他们认为短缺情况会加剧。他们的行为会进一步推高价格，因为他们会加剧短缺，增加市场需求。政府往往难以控制这种市场行为。

Vulnerability depends on more than aggregate measures, and this is where the earlier cautionary remarks apply to economic power. It also depends on whether a society is capable of responding quickly to change. For example, private actors, large corporations, and speculators in the market may each look at a market situation and decide to hoard supplies because they think shortages are going to grow worse. Their actions will drive the price even higher because they will make the shortages greater and put more demand on the market. Governments often find it difficult to control such market behavior.

“对称性”指的是相对平衡的依赖关系与不平衡的依赖关系。依赖程度较低可能是一种权力来源。如果双方相互依赖，但一方的依赖程度低于另一方，那么只要双方都重视这种相互依赖关系，依赖程度较低的一方就拥有权力来源。操纵相互依赖关系中的不对称性是经济权力的一个重要维度。完全对称的情况非常罕见，因此大多数经济相互依赖的情况也都涉及潜在的权力关系。

“Symmetry” refers to situations of relatively balanced versus unbalanced dependence. Being less dependent can be a source of power. If two parties are interdependent but one is less so than the other, the less dependent party has a source of power as long as both value the interdependent relationship. Manipulating the asymmetries of interdependence is an important dimension of economic power. Perfect symmetry is quite rare, so most cases of economic interdependence also involve a potential power relationship.

上世纪80年代，罗纳德·里根总统削减税收、增加开支，使得美国不得不依赖日本的进口资本来平衡联邦政府预算。有人认为，这赋予了日本对美国巨大的影响力。但另一方面，如果日本停止对美贷款，不仅会损害美国，也会损害日本自身。此外，如果日本突然停止对美贷款，那些已经在美国持有大量股份的日本投资者也会发现，由于美国经济遭受重创，他们的投资价值将会缩水。日本的经济规模仅略高于美国的一半，这意味着日本对美国市场的依赖程度远高于美国对日本的依赖程度，尽管两国都相互依存，也都从这种相互依存中获益。

In the 1980s, when President Ronald Reagan cut taxes and raised expenditures, the United States became dependent on imported Japanese capital to balance its federal government budget. Some argued that this gave Japan tremendous power over the United States. But the other side of the coin was that Japan would hurt itself as well as the United States if it stopped lending to the Americans. In addition, Japanese investors who already had large stakes in the United States would have found their investments devalued by the damage done to the American economy if Japan suddenly stopped lending to the United States. Japan’s economy was little more than half the size of the American economy, and that meant the Japanese needed the American market for their exports more than vice versa, although both needed each other and both benefited from the interdependence.

如今，中美之间也发展出类似的关系。美国接受中国进口商品，并以美元支付货款；而中国则持有美元和美国国债，实际上是在向美国提供贷款。中国已积累了2.5万亿美元的外汇储备，其中大部分是美国国债。一些观察人士认为，这标志着全球力量平衡的重大转变，因为中国可以通过抛售美元来迫使美国屈服。但这样做，不仅会随着美元贬值而降低其外汇储备的价值，还会危及美国继续进口廉价中国商品的意愿，从而导致中国失业和经济动荡。如果中国抛售美元，虽然会迫使美国屈服，但也可能使自己陷入困境。正如一位中国经济学家所说：“我们生活在一个相互依存的世界，如果我们采取单方面行动损害另一方，最终很可能会损害自身。”13

A similar relationship has developed today between the United States and China. America accepts Chinese imports and pays China in dollars, and China holds American dollars and bonds, in effect making a loan to the United States. China has amassed $2.5 trillion of foreign exchange reserves, much of it held in U.S. Treasury securities. Some observers have described this as a great shift in the global balance of power because China could bring the United States to its knees by threatening to sell dollars. But in doing so, China would not only reduce the value of its reserves as the price of the dollar fell, but it also would jeopardize American willingness to continue to import cheap Chinese goods, which would mean job loss and instability in China. If it dumped its dollars, China would bring the United States to it knees, but might also bring itself to its ankles. As one Chinese economist puts it, “We live in an interdependent world, in which we will probably harm ourselves if we take unilateral action aimed at harming another side.”13

判断经济相互依存是否产生权力，需要考察不对称性的平衡，而不仅仅是等式的一侧。在这种情况下，不对称性的平衡类似于冷战时期军事相互依存的“金融恐怖平衡”。美国和苏联都曾有能力通过核战争摧毁对方，但最终并未发生战争。2010年2月，一群中国高级军官对美国向台湾出售武器感到愤怒，呼吁中国政府抛售美国国债以示报复，但他们的建议未被采纳。14相反，中国国家外汇管理局局长易刚解释说：“中国对美国国债的投资是市场投资行为，我们不希望将其政治化。”15如果他们这样做，痛苦将是相互的。

Judging whether economic interdependence produces power requires looking at the balance of asymmetries, not just at one side of the equation. In this case, the balance of asymmetries resembles a “balance of financial terror” analogous to the Cold War military interdependence in which the United States and the Soviet Union each had the potential to destroy the other in a nuclear exchange but never did. In February 2010, angered over American arms sales to Taiwan, a group of senior Chinese military officers called for the Chinese government to sell off U.S. government bonds in retaliation, but their suggestion was not heeded.14 Instead, Yi Gang, China’s director of state administration of foreign exchange, explained that “Chinese investments in US Treasuries are market investment behavior and we don’t wish to politicize them.”15 If they did, the pain would be mutual.

然而，这种平衡并不能保证稳定。不仅存在发生意外事故并造成意想不到的后果的风险，而且两国都在努力改变现有框架，降低自身的脆弱性。2008年金融危机后，美国敦促中国允许人民币自由浮动，以此来减少美国的贸易逆差和美元失衡。与此同时，中国央行官员开始发表声明，敦促美国增加储蓄、减少赤字，并朝着以国际货币基金组织（IMF）发行的特别提款权作为储备货币的长期未来发展方向迈进。但中国的强硬姿态远大于实际行动。尽管此前有关于债权国力量的悲观预测，但中国日益增强的金融实力或许增强了其抵制美国施压的能力，却并未显著提升其迫使美国改变政策的能力。16尽管中国采取了一些措施来减少美元持有量的增长，但由于国内政治原因，它不愿承担人民币完全可兑换的风险。因此，未来十年人民币不太可能挑战美元作为世界最大储备货币（超过60%）的地位。然而，随着中国逐步增加国内消费，而非依赖出口作为经济增长引擎，中国领导人可能会开始减少对美国市场作为就业来源的依赖。这对它们的内部政治稳定至关重要。政治博弈可能反映出人们对对称程度细微变化的感知。

Nonetheless, this balance does not guarantee stability. Not only is there the danger of accidents with unintended consequences, but also both countries maneuver to change the framework and reduce their vulnerabilities. After the 2008 financial crisis, the United States pressed China to let its currency float upward as a means of reducing the American trade deficit and the dollar imbalance. At the same time, officials of China’s Central Bank began making statements about America’s need to increase its savings, reduce its deficits, and move toward a long-term future in which the dollar would be supplemented by International Monetary Fund (IMF)–issued special drawing rights as a reserve currency. But China’s growl was louder than its bite. Despite dire predictions about the power of creditors, China’s increased financial power may have increased its ability to resist American entreaties but had little effect on its ability to compel the United States to change its policies.16 Even though China took minor measures to reduce the increase in its holdings of dollars, it was not willing to take the risks of making its currency fully convertible because of domestic political reasons. Thus, the yuan is unlikely to challenge the dollar’s role as the largest component of world reserves (more than 60 percent) in the next decade. Nonetheless, as China gradually increases domestic consumption rather than relying on exports as its engine of economic growth, Chinese leaders may begin to feel less dependent than they are now on access to the American market as the source of employment that is crucial for their internal political stability. Political bargaining may then reflect perceived marginal shifts in the degree of symmetry.

货币市场的不对称性是经济力量中一个尤为重要且有效的方面，因为它是庞大的贸易和金融市场体系的基础。货币力量可以来源于货币操纵、强化货币依赖以及扰乱现有体系的能力。17通过限制本币的可兑换性，中国避免了国际货币市场可能对国内经济决策带来的约束，同时创造了竞争性贸易优势。

Asymmetries in currency markets are a particularly important and efficient aspect of economic power because they underlie the vast systems of trade and financial markets. Monetary power can come from currency manipulation, a fostering of monetary dependence, and a capacity to disrupt the system.17 By limiting the convertibility of its currency, China avoids discipline over domestic economic decisions that could come from international currency markets, while creating a competitive trade advantage.

当一种货币被广泛用作交换媒介和价值储存手段时，它就被称为世界储备货币，这赋予了它一定的权力。例如，比较一下国际银行和国际货币基金组织在1998年对印尼和韩国施加的约束，与美国在2008年金融危机期间相对自由的调整能力，因为美国债务是以本国货币计价的。美元非但没有崩溃，反而升值，因为投资者将美国的潜在实力视为避险天堂。一个国家的货币在全球储备中占有相当大的比例，可以从这一地位中获得经济实力，这不仅体现在更容易进行调整，还体现在能够影响其他需要帮助的国家。例如，在1956年苏伊士运河危机中，英国和法国入侵埃及后，英镑在金融市场遭受重创，美国将支持英镑与英国从苏伊士运河撤军挂钩。18英国对此感到不满，但对此却无能为力。

When a currency is widely held as a means of exchange and a store of value, it becomes known as a world reserve currency, and this can convey a degree of power. Compare, for example, the discipline that international banks and the IMF were able to impose on Indonesia and South Korea in 1998 with the relative freedom that the United States had in adjusting during the 2008 financial crisis because American debts were denominated in the country’s own currency. Rather than collapse, the dollar appreciated as investors regarded the underlying strength of the United States as a safe haven. A country whose currency represents a significant portion of world reserves can gain economic power from that position, both in easier terms for adjustment and in the ability to influence others who are in need. For example, after the British and French invasion of Egypt in the Suez Canal crisis of 1956, sterling came under attack in financial markets, and the United States conditioned its support of the pound upon a British withdrawal from Suez.18 Britain was unhappy but could do little about it.

法国总统戴高乐抱怨道：“由于美元是全球通用的参考货币，其管理不善可能会给其他国家带来后果。这是不可接受的，这种情况不能持续下去。”19但事实的确如此。十年后，法国总统瓦莱里·吉斯卡尔·德斯坦抱怨说，美元的作用赋予了美国“过分的特权”。20正如一位经济史学家所言，“经济权力和政治权力往往密不可分”。在一个既不安全又高度重视安全和增长的世界里，这显得尤为重要。21美国的军事实力增强了人们对美元作为避险货币的信心。正如一位观察家所说，“发达的资本市场、强大的军事力量（用于捍卫该市场）以及其他安全措施（例如强大的产权保护传统和信守承诺的声誉）的共同作用，使得吸引资本变得轻而易举。”22

French president Charles de Gaulle complained that “since the dollar is the reference currency everywhere, it can cause others to suffer the effects of its poor management. This is not acceptable. This cannot last.”19 But it did. A decade later, French president Valéry Giscard d’Estaing complained that the role of the dollar gave the United States “an exorbitant privilege.”20 In the words of one economic historian, “Economic and political power tend to go hand in hand in a world that is insecure and at the same time places a high value on security and growth.”21 The military strength of the United States reinforces confidence in the dollar as a safe haven. As one observer puts it, “The combined effect of an advanced capital market and a strong military machine to defend that market, and other safety measures such as a strong tradition of property rights protection and a reputation for honoring dues, has made it possible to attract capital with great ease.”22

然而，我们不应高估一国货币被其他国家作为储备货币所获得的经济实力。铸币税（货币生产成本与其面值之间的差额）仅适用于国际上持有的3800亿美元纸币，而不适用于必须支付具有竞争力的利率的国债（尽管对美元的信心可能使财政部能够以低于正常水平的利率发行债券）。在2010年希腊和其他国家的财政问题导致欧洲信心丧失之前，“欧元仅仅通过增强金融市场的规模和流动性，就可能有助于降低整个欧洲的实际利率，而不仅仅是政府借款人的利率。”23

We should not overestimate, however, the economic power that a country gains from having its currency held as a reserve by other countries. Seignorage (the gap between the cost of producing money and its face value) applies only to the $380 billion of banknotes held internationally, not to Treasury obligations that must pay competitive interest rates (although confidence in the dollar can allow Treasury to issue bonds at lower interest rates than would otherwise be the case). Before fiscal problems in Greece and other countries caused a loss of confidence in Europe in 2010, “simply by enhancing the size and liquidity of financial markets the euro may have helped to lower real interest rates across Europe, and not just for government borrowers.”23

与前文所述的易于调整和融资赤字的便利性相比，也存在潜在的成本。例如，财政部在制定政策时会受到国际社会对美元看法的影响。此外，储备货币的国际地位越高，其需求就越大，货币价值也随之上升，储备货币所在国的生产商可能会发现，他们的产品在国际市场上的竞争力不如以往。许多美国生产商乐见美元的作用减弱。鉴于美国经济的规模及其金融市场的深度和广度，美元在未来十年或更长时间内仍可能保持其主要国际储备货币的地位，但作为外汇市场上的储备工具所带来的经济实力不容忽视，更不应像通常那样被夸大。24

Against the ease of adjustment and financing deficits described previously, there are potential costs. For example, Treasury is constrained by international opinion about the dollar when it formulates policies. In addition, to the extent that demand for the reserve currency is raised by its international role, the currency’s value rises and producers in the reserve currency country may find their products less competitive in world markets than would otherwise be the case. Many American producers would welcome a diminished role for the dollar. Because of the scale of the American economy and the comparative depth and breadth of its financial markets, the dollar is likely to remain a major international reserve currency for the next decade or longer, but the economic power that comes from being a reserve instrument in currency markets should not be ignored or, as is more often the case, exaggerated.24

尽管美国和中国都不愿打破维系两国关系的不对称平衡，但美国却允许中国在国际论坛上的影响力逐步增强（同时也允许其他新兴经济体的影响力不断扩大）。因此，八国集团（G8，其中四个成员国是欧洲国家）实际上已被涵盖全球80%经济总量的二十国集团（G20）峰会所取代。这些会议讨论了“重新平衡”金融流动的必要性，旨在改变以往美国赤字与中国盈余相匹配的局面。这种改变需要对国内消费和投资模式进行政治上难以实现的调整，例如美国增加储蓄，中国增加国内消费。这些改变不太可能迅速发生，但值得注意的是，二十国集团已经达成一致，欧洲应降低其在国际货币基金组织（IMF）的投票权重，而中国和其他新兴经济体则应逐步提高其投票权重。

Even though neither the United States nor China is willing to destroy the balance of asymmetries that locks them together, the United States has allowed a gradual increase in Chinese influence in international forums (as well as greater influence for other emerging economies). Thus, the G-8 forum (where four of the eight countries are European) has been effectively supplemented by a G-20 summit that includes economies representing 80 percent of world product. Such meetings have discussed the need to “rebalance” financial flows, altering the old pattern of U.S. deficits matching Chinese surpluses. Such changes would require politically difficult shifts in domestic patterns of consumption and investment, with America increasing its savings and China increasing domestic consumption. Such changes are not likely to occur quickly, but, interestingly, the G-20 has already agreed that Europe should reduce the weight of its votes in the IMF and that China and other emerging economies should gradually increase their weight.

这再次凸显了限制经济实力的重要性。尽管中国可以威胁抛售美元储备并损害美国经济，但美国经济疲软意味着中国出口市场萎缩，美国政府可能会以对中国商品加征关税作为回应。双方都不急于打破彼此脆弱性相互依存的对称关系，而是继续努力塑造其市场关系的结构和制度框架。此外，随着印度和巴西等其他新兴经济体发现其出口受到人民币低估的影响，它们可能会利用二十国集团等多边论坛来强化美国的立场。25

This again shows the importance of the limitations on economic power. Although China could threaten to sell its holdings of dollars and damage the American economy, a weakened American economy would mean a smaller market for Chinese exports, and the American government might respond with tariffs against Chinese goods. Neither side is in a hurry to break the symmetry of their vulnerability interdependence, but each continues to jockey to shape the structure and institutional framework of their market relationship. Moreover, as other emerging economies such as India and Brazil find their exports hurt by an undervalued Chinese currency, they may use a multilateral forum such as the G-20 in a way that reinforces the American position.25

当不同议题领域间的相互依存程度不对称时，一个国家可能会尝试将这些议题联系起来或分开。如果每个议题都是一场独立的博弈，并且所有博弈同时进行，那么一个国家可能在某个博弈中掌握大部分筹码，而另一个国家可能在另一个博弈中掌握大部分筹码。根据一个国家的利益和地位，它可能希望将这些博弈分开进行，或者……在经济体系中建立联系。因此，围绕经济相互依存的大部分政治冲突都涉及联系的建立或阻止。各国都希望在自身优势领域操控相互依存关系，并避免在自身相对薄弱的领域被他人操控。

When there is asymmetry of interdependence in different issue areas, a state may try to link or unlink issues. If each issue were a separate game and all games were played simultaneously, one state might have most of the chips at one table and another state might have most of the chips at another table. Depending on a state’s interests and position, it might want to keep the games separate or create linkages between the tables. Therefore, much of the political conflict over economic interdependence involves the creation or prevention of linkage. States want to manipulate interdependence in areas in which they are strong and avoid being manipulated in areas in which they are relatively weak.

通过设定议程和界定议题领域，国际机构往往为相互依存关系中的权衡取舍制定规则。各国试图利用国际机构来制定影响各方利益转移的规则。例如，加入世贸组织会限制各国可使用的某些政策工具，并将其他政策工具置于争端解决机制之下。具有讽刺意味的是，鉴于反全球化抗议者的言论，国际机构可以通过将一些较贫穷国家相对更有优势的冲突与强国主导的局面隔离开来，从而使较弱的国家受益。然而，仍然存在这样的危险：某些国家可能强大到足以推翻一项或多项规则。例如，1971年，随着美国国际收支状况恶化，尼克松总统突然宣布美国将不再将美元兑换成黄金，从而推翻了1944年通过多边协议建立的布雷顿森林货币体系。

By setting agendas and defining issue areas, international institutions often set the rules for the trade-offs in interdependent relationships. States try to use international institutions to set the rules that affect the transfer of chips among tables. Membership in the WTO, for example, restricts certain policy instruments that states might use and subjects others to a dispute resolution mechanism. Ironically, given the rhetoric of antiglobalization protesters, international institutions can benefit the weaker players by keeping some of the conflicts in which the poorer states are relatively better endowed separated from the tables where strong states dominate. The danger remains, however, that some players will be strong enough to overturn one or more of the tables. In 1971, for example, as the American balance of payments worsened, President Nixon abruptly announced that the United States would no longer convert dollars into gold, thus overturning the Bretton Woods monetary system that had been created by a multilateral agreement in 1944.

在经济相互依存关系的博弈中，最大的国家并非总能胜出。如果一个较小或较弱的国家对某个问题更为关注，它反而可能获益匪浅。例如，由于美国占加拿大对外贸易的近四分之三，而加拿大仅占美国对外贸易的约四分之一，因此加拿大对美国的依赖程度远高于美国对加拿大的依赖程度。尽管如此，加拿大在与美国的诸多争端中往往都能取得胜利，因为加拿大愿意采取报复性措施，例如加征关税和实施贸易限制，从而有效遏制了美国的行动。26如果加拿大人的行为导致全面争端，加拿大人遭受的损失将比美国人大得多，但加拿大认为，与其同意总是让加拿大吃亏的规则，不如冒着偶尔遭到报复的风险。通过操纵经济相互依存关系进行威慑，在某种程度上类似于核威慑，因为它依赖于有效破坏能力和可信的意图。小国往往可以利用其更强的实力、更高的专注度和更强的可信度来克服在不对称相互依存关系中的相对脆弱性。就第一章讨论的概念而言，它们可能会发展出更强的权力转换能力。资源上的不对称有时会被注意力和意志上的相反不对称所抵消。

The largest state does not always win in the manipulation of economic interdependence. If a smaller or weaker state has a greater concern about an issue, it may do quite well. For instance, because the United States accounts for nearly three-quarters of Canada’s foreign trade, whereas Canada accounts for about one-quarter of America’s foreign trade, Canada is more dependent on the United States than vice versa. Nonetheless, Canada has often prevailed in a number of disputes with the United States because Canada was willing to threaten retaliatory actions, such as tariffs and restrictions, that deterred the United States.26 The Canadians would have suffered much more than the Americans if their actions had led to a full dispute, but Canada felt it was better to risk occasional retaliation than to agree to rules that would always make Canada lose. Deterrence via manipulation of economic interdependence is somewhat like nuclear deterrence in that it rests on a capability for effective damage and credible intentions. Small states can often use their greater intensity, greater focus, and greater credibility to overcome their relative vulnerability in asymmetrical interdependence. In terms of the concepts discussed in Chapter 1, they may develop a greater power-conversion capability. The asymmetry in resources is sometimes balanced by an opposite asymmetry in attention and will.

自然资源

NATURAL RESOURCES

人们有时会将丰富的自然资源等同于经济实力，但这种关系其实很复杂。例如，日本在20世纪成为世界第二富裕的国家，而它本身并没有多少自然资源；一些自然资源丰富的国家也未能将自然资源转化为国家财富或实力。例如，一些产油国仍然经济疲软，而且由于石油有时会产生一些不良的社会和经济影响，观察人士称之为“石油诅咒”。石油财富如果导致制度腐败和经济失衡，从而抑制更广泛的创业精神和对人力资本的投资，那么它就可能阻碍国家实力的发展。27

Sometimes people equate a rich endowment in natural resources with economic power, but the relationship is complicated. Japan, for example, became the second richest country in the world in the twentieth century without significant natural resources, and some well-endowed countries have not been able to turn their natural resources into national wealth or power. For example, some oil-producing countries remain weak, and because of oil’s sometimes perverse social and economic effects, observers refer to an “oil curse.” To the extent that oil wealth leads to corrupt institutions and an unbalanced economy that discourages broader entrepreneurship and investment in human capital, it may inhibit the development of national power.27

各国努力通过操纵市场准入（例如关税、配额和许可证）、多元化供应链、获取公司股权以及利用援助换取特殊优惠等手段，来塑造有利于自身的市场结构。成功与否取决于特定市场的不对称性。例如，几十年来，大型铁矿石供应商和主要钢铁生产商之间的年度定价谈判一直乏味无趣，因为价格上涨缓慢。但自从中国成为全球一半以上的铁矿石出口买家后，2002年至2008年间铁矿石价格翻了四倍。中国政府对这种依赖感到担忧，因为当时只有三家公司（必和必拓、力拓和淡水河谷）垄断了铁矿石贸易。因此，中国政府通过国有企业采取行动，曾试图推翻寡头垄断，例如“鼓励中国客户统一谈判采购、寻找替代供应商，甚至购买力拓的股份，但这些努力收效甚微”。28在这种情况下，旺盛的需求和有限的供应限制了中国政府重组市场的权力，尽管中国后来对力拓集团的官员提出了受贿指控。29但在另一些依赖直接投资或进入中国国内市场的情况下，情况则恰恰相反，政府动用了其经济力量。2010年9月，在一次海上争端之后，中国限制了对日本的稀土矿物出口。

States struggle to shape the structure of markets to their advantage by manipulating market access with tariffs, quotas, and licenses; diversifying supply chains; pursuing equity shares in companies; and using aid to gain special concessions. Success varies with the asymmetries in particular markets. For example, for decades the annual price-setting negotiations between big suppliers of iron ore and leading steelmakers were dull as prices rose only gradually. But after China emerged as a buyer of more than half of all iron ore exports, prices quadrupled between 2002 and 2008. The Chinese government was nervous about its dependence because just three firms (BHP, Rio Tinto, and Vale) dominated trade in iron ore. So China’s government, acting through state-controlled companies, tried to overturn the oligopoly “by encouraging Chinese customers to negotiate purchases in unison, by hunting for alternate supplies and even by buying a stake in Rio, all to little effect.”28 In this case, buoyant demand and limited supply restricted Chinese government power to restructure the market, though China later brought bribery charges against officials of Rio Tinto.29 In other cases, which depend upon direct investment or access to the internal Chinese market, the situation is reversed, and the government has wielded its economic power. And in September 2010, after a maritime dispute, China curtailed its export of rare earth minerals to Japan.

即使一个国家境内自然资源匮乏，资源的缺乏也并非经济实力低下的标志。一个国家的脆弱性至关重要，而脆弱性又取决于是否存在替代品以及供应来源是否多样化。例如，20世纪70年代，一些分析人士对美国日益依赖进口原材料及其脆弱性表示担忧。在13种基本工业原材料中，美国近90%的铝、铬、锰和镍依赖进口。石油生产国组建卡特尔（欧佩克）的能力被视为其他大宗商品卡特尔的先兆。人们认为权力正在向自然资源生产者转移。然而，在接下来的十年里，原材料价格不升反降。之前的预测为何落空？分析人士在评估脆弱性时，忽略了原材料的替代来源以及供应来源的多样性，而正是这些因素阻止了生产者人为抬高价格。此外，技术也在不断进步。对美国易受原材料短缺影响的预测是不准确的，因为这些预测未能充分考虑技术和替代方案。

Even where natural resources are scarce within a nation’s borders, their absence is not an index of low economic power. Much depends on a country’s vulnerability, and that depends on whether substitutes are available and whether there are diverse sources of supply. For example, in the 1970s some analysts expressed alarm about the increasing dependence of the United States on imported raw materials and therefore its vulnerability. Of thirteen basic industrial raw materials, the United States was dependent on imports for nearly 90 percent of aluminum, chromium, manganese, and nickel. The ability of oil producers to form a cartel (OPEC) was taken as a harbinger for other commodities. Power was seen as shifting to the producers of natural resources. But over the next decade, raw materials prices went down, not up. What happened to the prediction? In judging vulnerability, the analysts failed to consider the alternative sources of raw materials and the diversity of sources of supply that prevented producers from jacking up prices artificially. Moreover, technology improves over time. Projections of U.S. vulnerability to shortages of raw materials were inaccurate because they failed to adequately consider technology and alternatives.

石油、天然气和经济动力

OIL, GAS, AND ECONOMIC POWER

毛泽东曾说过，权力来自枪杆子，但今天许多人认为权力来自……石油。事实证明，在衡量源于自然资源的经济实力时，石油并非普遍规律，而是例外，因此值得更深入的分析。无论从经济还是政治角度来看，石油都是世界上最重要的原材料，而且很可能在本世纪很长一段时间内仍将是关键的能源来源。美国消耗了全球20%的石油（相比之下，中国占8%，尽管中国的石油消费增长速度更快）。即使中国石油消费高速增长，世界石油也不会很快枯竭。已探明的石油储量超过1万亿桶，而且很可能还会发现更多。但已探明储量的66%以上位于波斯湾，因此极易受到政治动荡的影响，而政治动荡可能会对世界经济造成毁灭性打击。

Mao Zedong once said that power comes out of the barrel of a gun, but many people today believe that power comes out of a barrel of oil. It turns out that oil is the exception, not the rule, in judgments about economic power derived from natural resources, and thus it is worth a more detailed analysis. Oil is the most important raw material in the world, in both economic and political terms, and it is likely to remain a key source of energy well into this century. The United States consumes 20 percent of the world’s oil (compared to 8 percent for China, though Chinese consumption is growing more rapidly). Even with high Chinese growth, the world is not running out of oil anytime soon. More than 1 trillion barrels of reserves have been proven, and more is likely to be found. But more than 66 percent of the proven reserves are in the Persian Gulf and are therefore vulnerable to political disruption, which could have devastating effects on the world economy.

影响石油市场的规则、规范和制度框架在过去几十年里发生了巨大变化。1960年，石油体系是一个与主要消费国政府关系密切的私人寡头垄断体系。七家大型跨国石油公司，主要源自英国和美国，有时被称为“七姐妹”，决定着石油的产量。石油价格取决于这些大型公司的产量以及石油主要销往的富裕国家的需求。跨国公司设定产量，而价格则由富裕国家的状况决定。在传统的军事意义上，国际体系中最强大的国家偶尔会进行干预，以维护石油市场不平等的格局。例如，1953年，当一场民族主义运动试图推翻伊朗国王时，英国和美国秘密干预，帮助国王复位。

The framework of rules, norms, and institutions that affect oil markets has changed dramatically over the decades.30 In 1960, the oil regime was a private oligopoly with close ties to the governments of the major consuming countries. Seven large transnational oil companies, primarily British and American in origin and sometimes called the “seven sisters,” determined the amount of oil that would be produced. The price of oil depended on how much the large companies produced and on the demand in the rich countries where most of the oil was sold. Transnational companies set the rate of production, and prices were determined by conditions in rich countries. The strongest powers in the international system in traditional military terms occasionally intervened to maintain the unequal structure of oil markets. For example, in 1953 when a nationalist movement tried to overthrow the shah of Iran, Britain and the United States covertly intervened to return the shah to his throne.

1973年石油危机后，国际石油市场格局发生了重大变化。权力和财富从富裕国家向相对弱势的国家发生了巨大转移。产油国开始决定石油产量，因此对价格产生了强大的影响力，而不再仅仅由富裕国家的市场决定。一种常见的解释是：石油生产国联合起来组建了欧佩克，但欧佩克成立于1960年，而真正发生剧变的却是十多年后的1973年。1960年，欧佩克成员国中有一半是欧洲的殖民地；到1973年，它们全部都已独立。伴随民族主义的兴起，军事干预的成本也随之上升。对一个民族主义觉醒且摆脱殖民统治的人民使用武力，代价要高得多。1953年英国和美国干预伊朗时，短期内成本并不高，但如果美国在1979年面对伊朗革命试图维持沙阿的统治，那么代价将是难以承受的。

After the 1973 oil crisis, there was a major change in the international regime governing oil markets. There was an enormous shift of power and wealth from rich to relatively weak countries. The producing countries began to set the rate of production and therefore had a strong effect on price, rather than price being determined solely by the market in the rich countries. A frequently offered explanation is that the oil-producing countries banded together and formed OPEC, but OPEC was formed in 1960 and the dramatic change did not occur until more than a decade later in 1973. In 1960, half the OPEC countries were colonies of Europe; by 1973, they were all independent. Accompanying the rise in nationalism was a rise in the costs of military intervention. It is much more expensive to use force against a nationalistically awakened and decolonized people. When the British and Americans intervened in Iran in 1953, it was not very costly in the short term, but if the Americans had tried to keep the shah on his throne in 1979 in the face of the Iranian Revolution, the costs would have been prohibitive.

石油市场经济力量的相对对称性也发生了变化。在1956年和1967年的两次中东战争期间，阿拉伯国家试图实施石油禁运，但由于美国当时的石油产量足以供应被阿拉伯国家切断供应的欧洲，因此他们的努力很快就被挫败。1971年美国石油产量达到顶峰后，美国开始进口石油，平衡石油市场的权力转移到了沙特阿拉伯和伊朗等国手中。美国不再是能够弥补任何石油缺口的最后供应国。

The relative symmetry of economic power in oil markets also changed. During the two Middle East wars of 1956 and 1967, the Arab countries tried an oil embargo, but their efforts were easily defeated because the United States was producing enough oil to supply Europe when it was cut off by the Arab countries. Once American production peaked in 1971 and the United States began to import oil, the power to balance the oil market switched to such countries as Saudi Arabia and Iran. The United States was no longer the supplier of last resort that could make up any missing oil.

在此期间，“七姐妹”逐渐失去了影响力。其中一个原因是她们与生产国达成的“过时协议”。31当一家跨国公司带着新的投资进入一个资源丰富的国家时，它可以达成一项协议，使这家跨国公司获得大部分共同收益。从贫困国家的角度来看，跨国公司的进入开发其资源将使该国受益。在初期阶段，当跨国公司垄断资本、技术和国际市场准入时，它会与贫困国家达成协议，从中获得绝大部分利益。但随着时间的推移，跨国公司会在无意中将资源转移到贫困国家，并培训当地居民，这并非出于慈善，而是出于正常的商业运作过程。最终，贫困国家希望获得更合理的利润分配。跨国公司可能会威胁撤回投资。虽然过去跨国公司能够独立运营石油业务，但如今这个贫穷的国家却可以威胁要自行运营。因此，随着时间的推移，跨国公司在市场格局中，尤其是在原材料市场，其与东道国谈判的能力逐渐减弱。当新的跨国公司进入石油市场时，七大巨头又迎来了“小表亲”。尽管这些新公司规模不及七大巨头，但依然实力雄厚，并开始与产油国达成各自的交易。这种竞争进一步削弱了大型跨国公司在市场格局中的影响力。如今，六大跨国公司仅控制着全球5%的石油储量，其余部分则由国有企业控制。32

The “seven sisters” gradually lost power over this period. One reason was their “obsolescing bargains” with the producer countries.31 When a transnational corporation goes into a resource-rich country with a new investment, it can strike a bargain in which the multinational gets a large part of the joint gains. From the point of view of the poor country, having a multinational come in to develop its resources will make the country better off. At the early stages when the multinational has a monopoly on capital, technology, and access to international markets, it strikes a bargain with the poor country in which the multinational gets the lion’s share. But over time, the multinational inadvertently transfers resources to the poor country and trains locals, not out of charity but out of the normal process of doing business. Eventually, the poor country wants a better division of the profits. The multinational could threaten to pull out, but now the poor country can threaten to run the operation by itself. So over time, the power of the transnational company to structure a market, particularly in raw materials, diminishes in terms of its bargaining with the host country. The seven sisters were joined by “little cousins” when new transnational corporations entered the oil market. Although they were not as large as the seven sisters, they were still big, and they began to strike their own deals with the oil-producing countries. That competition further reduced the power of the largest transnational corporations to structure the market. Today, the six largest transnational corporations control only 5 percent of world oil reserves; state-owned companies control the rest.32

欧佩克作为卡特尔的效力也略有提升。限制供应的卡特尔在石油行业由来已久，但过去通常是七姐妹石油公司之间的私下协议。卡特尔普遍存在一个问题，那就是在市场疲软、油价下跌时，各产油国往往会违反生产配额。随着时间的推移，市场力量往往会削弱卡特尔。从1960年成立到20世纪70年代初，欧佩克一直未能有效执行价格纪律。但随着石油供应趋紧，欧佩克在协调产油国议价能力方面的作用日益增强。

There was also a modest increase in the effectiveness of OPEC as a cartel. Cartels restricting supply had long been typical in the oil industry, but in the past they had been private arrangements of the seven sisters. Cartels generally have a problem because there is a tendency to cheat on production quotas when markets are soft and the price drops. With time, market forces tend to erode cartels. OPEC was unable to enforce price discipline from the year it was founded, 1960, until the early 1970s. But after oil supplies tightened, OPEC’s role in coordinating the bargaining power of the producers increased.

1973年的中东战争极大地推动了欧佩克的发展，这标志着它现在可以运用自身的影响力。阿拉伯国家出于政治原因在1973年战争期间切断了石油供应，但这反而为欧佩克发挥效力创造了条件。伊朗并非阿拉伯国家，原本被认为是美国用来维护波斯湾秩序的工具，但伊朗国王却将油价提高了四倍，其他欧佩克成员国也纷纷效仿。从长远来看，由于市场力量的作用，欧佩克无法长期维持高油价，但欧佩克联盟的存在却造成了油价下行的滞后效应。

The Middle East war of 1973 gave OPEC a boost, a signal that now it could use its power. The Arab countries cut off access to oil during the 1973 war for political reasons, but that created a situation in which OPEC could become effective. Iran, which is not an Arab country, was supposed to be the American instrument for policing the Persian Gulf, but the shah moved to quadruple oil prices, and the other OPEC countries followed suit. Over the long term, OPEC could not maintain permanently high prices because of market forces, but there was a stickiness on the downside that was an effect of the OPEC coalition.

危机期间，国务卿亨利·基辛格一度表示，如果美国面临“窒息”，可能不得不动用武力。当时，石油贸易量已减少15%，而阿拉伯国家的禁运使美国石油出口减少了25%。然而，石油公司确保没有哪个国家遭受的损失远超其他国家。他们重新分配了全球石油贸易。当美国失去25%的阿拉伯石油进口时，这些公司就向其输送了更多委内瑞拉或印尼的石油。他们减轻了禁运带来的冲击，使得富裕国家石油进口的损失仅为7%至9%左右，远低于足以造成严重后果的临界点。这些公司主要出于维护自身稳定的利益，帮助阻止了经济冲突演变为军事冲突。33

At one point in the crisis, Secretary of State Henry Kissinger said that if the United States faced “strangulation,” military force might have to be used. Fifteen percent of traded oil had been cut, and the Arab embargo reduced oil exports to the United States by 25 percent. However, oil companies made sure that no one country suffered much more than any other. They redistributed the world’s traded oil. When the United States lost 25 percent of its Arab oil imports, the companies shipped it more Venezuelan or Indonesian oil. They smoothed the pain of the embargo so that the rich countries all lost about 7–9 percent of their oil, well below the strangulation point. The companies, acting primarily out of their own interest in maintaining stability, helped prevent the economic conflict from becoming a military conflict.33

1973年这个转折点，石油作为一种经济武器究竟有多强大？阿拉伯国家通过减产和对以色列友好国家的石油禁运，成功地将自身问题推到了美国议程的首位。石油武器促使美国在赎罪日战争后阿以冲突的调解中扮演了更为和解的角色。然而，石油武器并未改变美国在中东的基本政策。

How powerful was oil as an economic weapon at the turning point of 1973? By cutting production and embargoing sales to countries friendly to Israel, Arab states were able to bring their issues to the forefront of the U.S. agenda. The oil weapon encouraged the United States to play a more conciliatory role in arranging the settlement of the Arab-Israeli dispute in the aftermath of the Yom Kippur War. However, the oil weapon did not change the basic policy of the United States in the Middle East.

为什么石油武器未能发挥更大作用？这对当今有何启示？部分原因在于整体相互依存关系的对称性。沙特阿拉伯作为石油市场的关键国家，在美国拥有大量投资。如果沙特对美国经济造成过大的损害，也会损害自身的经济利益。此外，沙特阿拉伯在安全领域也依赖美国。从长远来看，美国是唯一能够在波斯湾地区维持稳定力量平衡的国家。沙特深知这一点，因此在运用石油武器时非常谨慎。他们甚至一度暗中确保了驻扎在该地区的美国第六舰队的石油供应。34沙特阿拉伯受益于美国提供的长期安全保障。安全相互依存与石油相互依存之间存在间接联系。公开使用武力成本过高，但它在幕后发挥着一种权力资源的作用。换言之，危机的结果涉及市场结构变化造成的不对称性，但结果并非仅仅由经济实力决定。如今，一系列复杂的因素依然影响着石油资源所有权所带来的权力的形成和限制。

Why was the oil weapon not more effective, and what are the lessons for today? Part of the answer is symmetry in overall interdependence. Saudi Arabia, which became the key country in oil markets, had large investments in the United States. If the Saudis damaged the U.S. economy too much, they would also hurt their own economic interests. In addition, Saudi Arabia depended on the United States in the security area. In the long run, the United States was the only country able to keep a stable balance of power in the Persian Gulf region. The Saudis knew this, and they were careful about how far they pushed the oil weapon. At one point, they quietly made sure that the American Sixth Fleet in the region was supplied with oil.34 The Saudis were benefiting from the long-run security guarantee provided by the United States. There was an indirect linkage between the security interdependence and the oil interdependence. Force was too costly to use overtly, but it played a role as a power resource in the background. In other words, the outcome of the crisis involved asymmetries caused by changes in the structure of the market, but the outcome was not determined by economic power alone. This complex set of factors persists today in creating and limiting the power that comes from possessing oil resources.

图 3.1实际国内原油价格 [1946-2008 年]

FIGURE 3.1 Real Domestic Crude Oil Prices [1946-20081*

* 已根据消费者物价指数调整至 2008 年 11 月价格

* Adjusted for CPI to November 2008 prices

数据来源：伊利诺伊州石油天然气协会和美国劳工统计局。

Source: Data from Illinois Oil and Gas Association and U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

到了20世纪90年代末，油价暴跌。高油价刺激了生产效率的提高，导致需求下降；而供应方面，非欧佩克产油国的出现意味着欧佩克在全球市场上面临更大的竞争。技术的进步使地质学家得以开采此前无法触及的石油。然而，2005年后，油价再次飙升，部分原因是战争、飓风和恐怖主义威胁造成的破坏，但主要原因是人们预期亚洲经济快速增长将带来需求上升。世界上人口最多的两个国家——中国和印度——在现代化和工业化进程中，能源需求正迅速增长。两国都在采取重商主义手段购买和控制外国石油供应，但20世纪70年代危机的教训表明，石油是一种可替代的商品，无论石油的所有者是谁，市场都倾向于分散供应并缓解价格波动带来的冲击。无论如何，这两个国家的快速经济增长将显著提升全球石油需求，这意味着全球最大的石油生产国将成为石油生产大国。波斯湾等地区仍将在世界政治中扮演重要角色。由于沙特阿拉伯是世界最大的石油生产国和储量来源国，其政治稳定性的任何重大变化都可能产生广泛的影响。

By the late 1990s, oil prices had plummeted. Efficiency gains stimulated by high prices cut demand, and on the supply side the emergence of new non-OPEC oil sources meant that OPEC faced more competition on the world market. Advances in technology led geologists to gain access to oil that had previously been impossible to reach. After 2005, however, oil prices spiked again, partly in response to disruptions from war, hurricanes, and terrorist threats, but largely because of projections of rising demand accompanying rapid economic growth in Asia. The two most populous nations on earth, China and India, are experiencing rapid increases in demand for energy as they modernize and industrialize. Both countries are making mercantilist efforts to buy and control foreign oil supplies, though the lessons of the 1970s crisis suggest that oil is a fungible commodity and markets tend to spread supplies and even out the pain no matter who owns the oil. In any event, the rapid economic growth of these two countries will contribute significantly to the global demand for oil, and this means that the biggest global oil-producing regions, such as the Persian Gulf, will still play an important role in world politics. Because Saudi Arabia is the world’s number one producer and source of reserves, any major changes in its political stability could have widespread consequences.

比较石油和天然气市场很有意思。俄罗斯是石油和天然气的主要生产国，但俄罗斯通过构建市场不对称来攫取权力的努力在天然气领域比在石油领域更为明显。正如我们所见，石油是一种相对可替代的商品，供应来源多样，运输也相对便捷；而天然气直到最近都被视为稀缺资源，且更依赖于固定管道供应。尽管液化天然气运输和页岩气田天然气开采新技术的发展可能会改变这一现状，但迄今为止，俄罗斯一直是欧洲主要的天然气供应国。俄罗斯政府已将天然气田和管道的所有权集中到一家公司——俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom）——手中，并利用该公司来构建有利于俄罗斯的市场格局。当俄罗斯与乌克兰等邻国就天然气价格发生争端时，它毫不犹豫地切断天然气供应，以此作为一种经济手段。后来，当一个对俄罗斯更友好的政府在乌克兰上台后，俄罗斯利用大幅折扣的天然气价格诱惑乌克兰延长了其在乌克兰的海军基地的租约，从而使乌克兰有一天加入北约的前景变得复杂。35

It is interesting to compare the markets in oil and natural gas. Russia is a major producer of both, but Russia’s efforts to gain power by structuring market asymmetries is more obvious in the area of natural gas than in oil. As we have seen, oil is a relatively fungible commodity with multiple sources of supply and relative ease of transport, whereas until recently gas has been regarded as scarce and more dependent upon fixed pipelines for supply. Although this may change in the future because of liquefied natural gas shipments and new technologies for producing gas from plentiful fields of shale rock, until now Russia has been a major supplier of natural gas to Europe. The Russian government has consolidated ownership of gas fields and pipelines in one company, Gazprom, and used it to structure markets in Russia’s favor. When Russia had disputes with neighbors such as Ukraine over gas prices, it did not hesitate to cut off gas supplies as a form of economic power. Later, when a more sympathetic government came to power in Ukraine, Russia used the lure of heavily discounted gas prices to obtain the extension of its lease of a naval base in Ukraine, thus complicating the prospect that Ukraine might one day join NATO.35

德国三分之一的天然气依赖俄罗斯，但德国政府声称并不太担心，因为它认为这种相互依存是对称的。36在德国人看来，德国客户群体如此庞大，以至于俄罗斯的收入与德国需求的稳定性息息相关，正如德国客户与俄罗斯供应的稳定性同样重要。因此，当欧盟试图推动修建一条绕过俄罗斯领土、将里海天然气输送至欧洲的管道时，德国表现出的兴趣并不高。相反，德国支持修建一条波罗的海海底管道，这将增加德国对俄罗斯天然气供应的依赖，并使俄罗斯能够绕过乌克兰和波兰。

Germany depends on Russia for a third of its natural gas, but the German government claims not to be overly concerned because it regards the interdependence as symmetrical.36 In German eyes, German customers are such a large group that Russian income depends on the security of German demand just as much as German customers depend on the security of Russian supply. Thus, when the European Union has tried to stimulate interest in a pipeline to route Caspian gas to Europe without crossing Russian territory, Germany has expressed less interest. Instead, Germany supported a pipeline under the Baltic Sea that will increase its dependence on Russian supply and allow Russia to bypass Ukraine and Poland.

这将加剧乌克兰和波兰的脆弱性。过去，这两个国家拥有谈判筹码，因为它们有能力阻止天然气通过穿越其领土的管道输送。德国因此遭受的损失，进一步增强了乌克兰和波兰与俄罗斯的谈判能力。简而言之，俄罗斯利用其管道外交来增强自身的经济实力。它有动机履行其作为德国等大客户的可靠供应商的承诺，但俄罗斯可以利用其在波罗的海三国、格鲁吉亚、白俄罗斯和乌克兰等较小客户面前的不对称优势，将其视为自身势力范围。同样，俄罗斯试图通过俄罗斯管道从中亚各国购买天然气并输送到欧洲，但这种市场结构正受到中国建设从中亚向东输送天然气管道的努力的制约。更重要的是，近期在美国和其他地区发现了能够释放页岩层中大量天然气的技术并加以利用。旨在将天然气液化并输送到美国的项目在美国市场已不再具有竞争力。由于这些天然气开始被运往欧洲市场，俄罗斯通过管道外交所能发展的力量就减弱了。37

This will increase the vulnerability of Ukraine and Poland. In the past, those states had bargaining power based on their ability to stop gas flowing through pipelines that crossed their territory. The pain this caused in Germany added to Ukraine and Poland’s bargaining power with Russia. In short, Russia has used its pipeline diplomacy to increase its economic power. It has an incentive to keep its promise to be a reliable supplier to large customers such as Germany, but Russia can wield its asymmetrical advantage over smaller customers such as the Baltics, Georgia, Belarus, and Ukraine in what Russia sees as its sphere of influence. Similarly, Russia has tried to contract for gas from the Central Asian republics to be routed to Europe through Russian pipelines, but this market structuring is being countered by Chinese efforts to construct pipelines eastward from Central Asia. Even more important were the recent discovery and exploitation of technologies to unlock the massive amounts of gas trapped in shale rock in the United States and elsewhere. Projects designed to liquefy natural gas and ship it to the United States were no longer competitive in American markets. As this gas began to be shipped instead to European markets, it reduced the power that Russia could develop through its pipeline diplomacy.37

这些石油和天然气的例子表明，尽管在信息时代所谓的轻量级经济中，原材料的重要性不如工业时代，但石油和天然气在创造经济实力方面仍然举足轻重。然而，即使是控制能源资源所带来的力量也会有起伏。经济实力高度依赖于特定的市场环境。

What these oil and gas examples show is that even though raw materials are less crucial in the so-called lightweight economies of the information age than they were in the industrial age, oil and gas still matter when it comes to generating economic power. But even the power that comes from the control of energy resources waxes and wanes. Economic power is highly contingent on the particular market context.

制裁：负面制裁和正面制裁

SANCTIONS: NEGATIVE AND POSITIVE

正如许多人认为战争是军事力量的核心一样，他们也常常认为制裁是经济力量最显而易见的手段。实施制裁比构建市场结构更直接、更易于理解。（尽管制裁有时涉及操纵市场准入控制权）。“制裁”被定义为旨在强化某项决定或使某项政策具有权威性的鼓励或惩罚措施。它们既可以是消极的，也可以是积极的。正如托马斯·谢林曾经指出的那样，“威胁与承诺、胁迫与补偿之间的区别，有时取决于基准线在哪里。我们最初给孩子每周零花钱的条件是他们自己铺床并做一些其他简单的家务……但一旦每周零花钱的发放成为惯例和预期，那么因未履行义务而扣发零花钱在孩子们眼中就变成了一种惩罚。”38.认知会影响人们对制裁的感受。

Just as many people think of fighting as the heart of military power, they often think of sanctions as the most visible instrument of economic power. Imposing sanctions is less subtle than structuring markets (though sanctions sometimes involve manipulating control over market access). “Sanctions” are defined as measures of encouragement or punishment designed to reinforce a decision or make a policy authoritative. They can be both negative and positive. As Thomas Schelling once pointed out, “The difference between a threat and a promise, between coercion and compensation, sometimes depends on where the baseline is located. We originally offered our children a weekly allowance on condition they make their own beds and do a few other simple chores. . . . But once it became standard practice and expectation that the weekly allowance would be paid, withholding it for nonperformance became in the children’s eyes a punishment.”38 Perceptions affect how sanctions are experienced.

戴维·鲍德温列举了11项负面贸易制裁措施，涵盖禁运和禁止购买等，以及7项资本制裁措施，包括冻结资产、征收不利税项和暂停援助。在12项正面制裁措施中，他列举了降低关税、提供优惠市场准入、提供援助和投资担保等。39近期其他制裁措施的例子包括旅行禁令和武器禁运。制裁既可以由国家行为体实施，也可以针对国家行为体实施。所有制裁的共同之处在于，它们都是为了政治目的而操纵经济交易。

David Baldwin lists eleven examples of negative trade sanctions ranging from embargos to preclusive buying and seven capital sanctions that include freezing of assets, unfavorable taxation, and suspension of aid. Among a dozen positive sanctions, he includes tariff reductions, favorable market access, provision of aid, and investment guarantees.39 Other recent examples of sanctions include travel bans and arms embargoes. Sanctions can be applied by and against both state and nonstate actors. What sanctions all have in common is the manipulation of economic transactions for political purposes.

各国出于保护主义目的限制市场准入，以期在贸易竞争中获取更大份额的利益，或扶持具有重要政治影响力的国内群体。但许多保护主义措施也旨在巩固自身权力。例如，欧盟给予其前殖民地优惠贸易准入，这既可以被视为纠正历史不公（从而寻求软实力），也可以被视为行使新殖民主义控制手段（硬实力），但其根本目的在于政治。

States restrict access to their markets for protectionist purposes in a competition to secure a greater share of the gains from trade or to favor a politically important domestic group, but many protectionist measures are also designed to generate power. For example, when the European Union granted preferential trade access to its market for its ex-colonies, it could be seen as righting a historical injustice (and thereby seeking to generate soft power) or as exercising a means of neocolonial control (hard power), but the purposes were political.

拥有庞大市场的国家经常以重组市场准入为威胁，将其监管权力扩展到本国领土之外。例如，在隐私监管领域，布鲁塞尔方面就采取了这样的措施。欧洲在制定全球标准方面发挥着主导作用，因为没有哪家公司愿意被排除在欧洲市场之外。同样，由于美国和欧洲市场的重要性，跨国公司也遵守最严格的反垄断法规。即使美国司法部批准了通用电气收购霍尼韦尔（两家均为美国公司），通用电气在欧盟提出反对后还是放弃了这笔交易。而想要进入中国市场的公司发现，它们必须接受少数股权规则、专有技术转让以及严格的沟通规则。随着市场规模的扩大，中国提出了越来越严格的要求，实际上迫使供应商共享技术并采用中国技术标准，“这是一种有意识的策略，旨在利用中国的经济实力来改变技术标准，使行业不采用这些标准的成本过高。”40位外国投资者曾警告中国，某些政策会削弱投资信心，但收效甚微。2009年访问布鲁塞尔期间，中国国务院副总理王岐山要求欧盟保持市场开放，解除武器禁运，并向中国公民发放更多签证。当欧盟方面表示反对时，“王岐山先生的回应是轻蔑的：你们说什么都无济于事。反正你们最终还是要来中国投资。”41不出所料，市场规模较大的国家更有能力控制市场准入和实施制裁。

States with large markets often use threats of restructuring market access to extend their regulatory power beyond their territory. In the area of privacy regulations, for example, Brussels has taken the lead in establishing global standards because no firm wishes to be excluded from the European market. Similarly, because of the importance of the American and European markets, transnational firms adhere to the strictest set of antitrust regulations. Even when the American Justice Department approved GE’s acquisition of Honeywell (both American companies), GE abandoned the deal after the European Union objected. And companies that want access to China’s market find they have to agree to minority ownership rules, transfer of proprietary technology, and restrictive rules on communication. As its market size increases, China has been making stricter demands that in effect force suppliers to share their technology and adopt Chinese technical standards “as a conscious strategy to use China’s economic girth to shift technology standards by making it too costly for the industry not to adapt.”40 Foreign investors have warned China about policies that undercut the climate of confidence of investment, but to little avail. During a visit to Brussels in 2009, Chinese vice premier Wang Qishan asked the European Union to keep its markets open, lift its arms embargo, and grant more visas to Chinese citizens. When the Europeans demurred, “Mr. Wang’s response was dismissive: whatever you tell me doesn’t really make a difference. You are going to invest in China anyway.”41 Not surprisingly, states with larger markets are better placed to control market access and to apply sanctions.

作为世界最大经济体，美国经常在实施制裁方面发挥带头作用。仅美国在1996年至2001年间就对外国实施了85项新的制裁。42人中有人抱怨说，美国对半个人类实施了制裁。然而，大多数专家的传统观点是“制裁无效”。一些著名案例也印证了这一观点，例如国际联盟的制裁未能阻止意大利侵略埃塞俄比亚，美国长达半个世纪的贸易禁运未能推翻菲德尔·卡斯特罗的政权，以及制裁未能使萨达姆·侯赛因下台。那么，为什么制裁如此频繁地被使用呢？

As the world’s largest economy, the United States has often taken the lead in applying sanctions. The United States alone applied eighty-five new sanctions on foreign states between 1996 and 2001,42 and some wags complained that the country had sanctions against half of humankind. Yet the conventional wisdom of most pundits is that “sanctions don’t work.” This judgment is reinforced by famous cases such as the failure of League of Nations sanctions to stop Italian aggression in Ethiopia, the failure of the American trade embargo to topple Fidel Castro for half a century, or the failure of sanctions to remove Saddam Hussein from power in Iraq. Why, then, are sanctions so often used?

部分原因可能在于，对失败的判断被夸大了。一项对1950年至1990年间主要国家115次经济制裁案例的深入研究得出结论：在约三分之一的案例中，制裁至少在一定程度上帮助实现了制裁者的目标。该研究发现，当目标明确且适度、目标国本身处于弱势、经济关系密切、制裁力度大且持续时间有限时，制裁最有可能取得成功。43其他人对这些结果提出了质疑，一位学者声称制裁在 115 个案例中只有 5 个案例有效，但成功的案例包括南非和利比亚等重大案例。44

The answer may be in part that the judgment of failure is overstated. A careful study of 115 uses of economic sanctions by major countries from 1950 to 1990 concluded that in about a third of the cases, sanctions made at least a modest contribution to obtaining the goals of those using them. The study found that sanctions were most likely to be successful when the objective was modest and clear, the target was in a weakened position to begin with, economic relations were great, sanctions were heavy, and the duration was limited.43 Others have challenged these results, with one scholar claiming that sanctions were effective in only 5 of the 115 cases, but the successes included significant instances such as South Africa and Libya.44

鲍德温指出，对有效性的判断仅与产出相关，而对效率或效用的判断则将工具和产出联系起来。在任何情况下，关键问题在于：制裁之外还有什么替代方案？即使通过经济制裁达到预期目标的概率很低，相关的问题是，这个概率是否高于其他政策选项。军事力量有时更有效，但其成本可能过高，以至于效率反而降低。以对古巴卡斯特罗政权的制裁为例。正如古巴导弹危机所表明的那样，动用军事手段推翻卡斯特罗的潜在成本巨大，包括核战争的风险。同时，考虑到两极冷战的局面，对美国而言，不采取任何行动都将付出沉重的代价，尤其是在与苏联的政治竞争中。尽管制裁未能成功推翻卡斯特罗，但它却是施加成本和遏制卡斯特罗的有效手段。军事行动或许能够（也或许不能——猪湾事件的失败就是一个例证）推翻卡斯特罗，但考虑到潜在的军事成本，制裁或许是当时最有效的政策选择。45

Baldwin points out that judgments about effectiveness relate only to outputs, unlike judgments about efficiency or utility, which relate instruments and outputs. The important question in any situation is, What is the alternative to sanctions? Even if the probability of reaching a desired end through economic sanctions is low, the relevant issue is whether it is higher than for alternative policy options. Military power is sometimes more effective, but its costs may be so high that it is less efficient. Take the case of sanctions against the Castro regime in Cuba. As the Cuban Missile Crisis showed, the costs of using military means to remove Castro were potentially enormous, including the risks of nuclear war. At the same time, given the bipolar Cold War, doing nothing would have been costly for America’s political competition with the Soviet Union. Although it is true that sanctions were not effective in removing Castro, they were an efficient means of imposing costs and containing Castro. Military action might (or might not—witness the Bay of Pigs failure) have removed Castro, but given the potential military costs, sanctions might have been the most efficient policy choice available.45

与其他所有形式的权力一样，运用经济制裁的努力取决于具体情况、目的以及将资源转化为预期行为的技巧。判断成功与否需要明确目标。行动者和观察者有时都会将这些目标混淆起来。制裁的主要目标包括改变他国的行为、遏制其扩张以及促成政权更迭。46或者，这些目标也可以描述为胁迫、约束和信号传递。胁迫是指试图让目标对象做某事，预防是指让目标对象做某事付出代价，而信号传递则表示承诺——对目标对象、国内受众或第三方的承诺。47一项研究得出结论，贸易制裁很少能迫使目标政府遵守或颠覆其政策，而且威慑作用有限，但它们往往能成功地作为国际和国内的象征。48

Like all forms of power, efforts to wield economic sanctions depend upon the context, purposes, and skill in converting resources into desired behavior. Judging success requires clarity about goals, and both actors and observers sometimes mix the goals together. The major goals of sanctions include behavioral change, containment, and regime change in another country.46 Alternatively, the goals can be described as coercing, constraining, and signaling. Coercion is an effort to make the target do something, prevention means making it costly for a target to do something, and signaling indicates commitment—to the target, to domestic audiences, or to third parties.47 One study concluded that trade sanctions rarely force compliance or subvert the target government and have limited deterrent value, but they often succeed as international and domestic symbols.48

回到著名的古巴“失败”案例，尽管制裁并未推翻卡斯特罗，也只是在一定程度上削弱了他的国际影响力（因为他得到了苏联的援助），但制裁确实让美国决策者得以向国内民众和其他国家发出信号：与苏联结盟的代价可能非常高昂。（至于随着冷战结束，制裁是否失去了其应有的作用，甚至适得其反，则是另一个问题。）同样，在1979年苏联入侵阿富汗后，吉米·卡特总统没有诉诸武力威胁，而是采取了限制粮食出口和抵制莫斯科奥运会的措施，因为武力威胁显得缺乏可信度。威胁虽然成本低廉，但一旦失败，就会损害美国的信誉。这些制裁给美国带来了沉重的代价，也正是美国对苏联入侵做出反应时，其立场显得更加可信的原因之一。

To go back to the famous Cuban “failure,” although sanctions did not remove Castro and only somewhat inhibited his international capabilities (because he received countervailing Soviet aid), they did allow American policymakers to signal to a domestic audience and to other countries that alliance with the Soviet Union could be costly. (Whether the sanctions outlived their purpose and became counterproductive when the end of the Cold War changed their context is a different question.) Similarly, after the Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan in 1979, President Jimmy Carter curtailed grain sales and boycotted the Moscow Olympics rather than use a threat of force, which would not have looked credible. Threats are cheap to make but costly to credibility when they fail. The fact that these sanctions were costly to the United States helped to establish some credibility in the American reaction to the Soviet invasion.

普遍制裁是一种粗暴的手段，其带来的苦难可能由穷人和弱势群体承担，而非专制国家中掌握决策权的精英阶层。此外，正如伊拉克的例子所示，萨达姆·侯赛因能够编造关于制裁残酷后果的耸人听闻的叙事，以此来否定联合国制裁的合法性，并寻求削弱制裁效果的让步。20世纪90年代制裁盛行但收效甚微，促使人们努力构建“精准制裁”，即针对精英阶层而非普通民众的制裁。特定的精英成员被禁止出境和……朝鲜的海外金融资产曾被冻结。2007年，美国财政部冻结朝鲜在澳门一家银行的资产，这一举措被认为有助于促使平壤重返谈判桌。此外，政策制定者开始意识到，制裁应被视为众多工具之一，而非非此即彼的条件，并应在谈判关系中灵活运用。例如，20世纪90年代，美国开始修复与越南的关系时，逐步放松制裁是这一进程的一部分，同时还辅以其他外交手段。最近，在缅甸问题上，国务卿希拉里·罗德姆·克林顿宣布，“接触与制裁并非二元对立……因此，今后我们将同时运用这两种工具。”49

General sanctions are a blunt instrument in which the suffering may be borne by the poor and powerless rather than the elites that make decisions in autocratic countries. Moreover, as in the case of Iraq, Hussein was able to construct dramatic narratives about their brutal effects as a way to delegitimize UN sanctions and seek concessions that undercut their effect. The prevalence of sanctions with limited results in the 1990s led to efforts to construct “smart sanctions” that would be targeted at elites rather than at the general public. Specific members of the elite were banned from travel and had overseas financial assets frozen. In 2007, the effectiveness of the American Treasury Department’s freezing of North Korean assets in a Macao bank is credited with helping to bring Pyongyang back to the bargaining table. In addition, policymakers began to realize that sanctions should be regarded as one tool among many, rather than an all-or-nothing condition, and used flexibly in a bargaining relationship. For example, as America began to repair its relations with Vietnam in the 1990s, a gradual relaxation of sanctions was part of the process, along with other diplomatic tools. More recently, in relation to Burma, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton announced that “engagement versus sanctions is a false choice . . . so going forward, we will be employing both these tools.”49

制裁的信号作用常常被轻描淡写地称为“仅仅象征性的”。但如果我们考虑合法性和软实力，就会清楚地看到，信号作用会给目标带来切实的代价。点名羞辱运动是非政府组织试图通过攻击跨国公司品牌所积累的声誉来影响其政策的重要途径。非政府组织也试图通过攻击国家声誉来迫使政府采取行动，而各国自身也在竞相构建能够提升自身软实力并削弱对手软实力的叙事。这些运动有时失败，有时成功，但合法性是一种权力现实，而围绕合法性的斗争会带来切实的代价。一些观察家认为，最终导致1994年南非实现多数人统治的反种族隔离制裁的主要影响并非在于经济影响，而在于统治的白人少数群体内部产生的孤立感和对自身合法性的怀疑。同样，联合国制裁在帮助利比亚扭转支持恐怖主义和发展核武器的政策方面取得的成功，与利比亚对合法性的担忧以及经济影响密切相关。50由于制裁在信号传递和软实力方面具有价值，而且往往是唯一相对廉价的政策选择，因此制裁很可能尽管政绩褒贬不一，但它们在二十一世纪仍将是重要的权力工具。

The signaling role of sanctions has often been dismissed as “merely symbolic.” But if we consider legitimacy and soft power, we see clearly that signaling can impose real costs upon a target. Naming and shaming campaigns are important ways in which nongovernmental actors try to affect the policies of transnational corporations by attacking the equity they have built up in their brands. NGOs also try to shame states into action by attack on national reputation, and states themselves compete to create narratives that increase their soft power and reduce that of their opponents. Sometimes the campaigns fail and sometimes they succeed, but legitimacy is a power reality, and struggles over legitimacy involve real costs. Some observers believe that the main effect of anti-apartheid sanctions that eventually led to majority rule in South Africa in 1994 lay not in the economic effects, but in the sense of isolation and doubts about legitimacy that developed in the ruling white minority. Similarly, the success of UN sanctions in helping to bring about a reversal in Libyan policies of support for terrorism and development of nuclear weapons were related to Libyan concerns about legitimacy as much as economic effects.50 Because of their value in signaling and soft power, and because they are often the only relatively inexpensive policy option, sanctions are likely to remain a major instrument of power in the twenty-first century despite their mixed record.

支付、援助和其他积极制裁措施都兼具硬实力和软实力两个层面。如前所述，支付和撤回支付是同一枚硬币的两面。提供援助和停止援助则是类似制裁措施的积极和消极两方面。通过支付款项来争取其他国家的支持在内阁外交中由来已久，并且在当今民主时代依然存在。事实上，许多仍然承认台北而非北京的中华民国政府的小国都从台湾获得了大量经济援助。同样，如果我们试图理解为什么一些非捕鲸国家在国际论坛上就捕鲸相关问题投票支持日本，就必须注意到它们也接受了日本的援助。

Payments, aid, and other positive sanctions also have both a hard and a soft power dimension. As noted earlier, providing a payment and removing a payment are two sides of the same coin. Providing aid and cutting off aid are the positive and negative aspects of a similar sanction. Providing payments to secure the support of other countries has a long history in cabinet diplomacy, and it persists in today’s democratic age. Indeed, the score of small countries that continue to recognize the Republic of China government in Taipei rather than Beijing receive significant economic aid from Taiwan. Similarly, if we try to understand why some nonwhaling countries vote with Japan in international forums on issues related to whaling, we must note that they receive aid from Japan.

2005年以后，石油和天然气价格上涨提升了俄罗斯、委内瑞拉和伊朗等能源生产国的政治影响力，这些国家在20世纪90年代曾饱受低油价之苦。尽管它们不具备沙特阿拉伯那样的经济实力来主导市场，但额外的资金为它们提供了支付和援助的渠道，以推进其外交政策目标。委内瑞拉总统乌戈·查韦斯利用该国的石油财富在拉丁美洲提升软实力，甚至向马萨诸塞州的消费者提供廉价石油，以此作为软实力宣传策略。伊朗利用其石油财富加强了在黎巴嫩和其他地区的影响力。俄罗斯则利用石油收入来收买影响力：据称，俄罗斯向太平洋岛国瑙鲁支付了5000万美元，以换取瑙鲁承认格鲁吉亚的阿布哈兹和南奥塞梯两个分离省份——而据称，非产油国中国每年仅向瑙鲁支付500万美元，以换取瑙鲁承认北京而非台北。51

After 2005, the rise in oil and gas prices boosted the political leverage of energy-producing countries such as Russia, Venezuela, and Iran that had suffered from the low oil prices of the 1990s. Although they did not have Saudi Arabia’s economic power to structure markets, their extra cash provided money for payments and aid to advance their foreign policy objectives. President Hugo Chávez of Venezuela used his country’s oil wealth to gain soft power in Latin America and even offered cheap oil to consumers in Massachusetts as a soft power propaganda ploy. Iran used its oil wealth to reinforce its influence in Lebanon and elsewhere. Russia used oil money to buy influence: It allegedly paid $50 million to the tiny Pacific island of Nauru to recognize Georgia’s breakaway provinces of Abkhazia and South Ossetia—although non-oil-producing China allegedly paid only $5 million a year to Nauru to recognize Beijing rather than Taipei.51

大国出于各种目的提供对外援助。除饱受战火蹂躏的阿富汗和巴基斯坦之外，美国援助的最大接受国是以色列和埃及，这些援助旨在影响两国在该地区的安全局势。中国的援助通常被用来获取原材料。中国在提供原材料的同时，往往会提出建造新体育场的条件。或者机场航站楼。一些专家认为，“中国并非经合组织（经济合作与发展组织）成员国，其运作遵循的规则已被西方国家基本摒弃。中国在秘密的政府间协议中将援助与商业活动混为一谈。”52中国模式回避了善治和人权条件，却往往受到专制国家的欢迎。卢旺达总统保罗·卡加梅就将其与西方模式进行了比较，并给予了积极评价。53中国并非孤例。印度和巴西也是新兴经济体，它们既是援助的接受国，也是援助的提供国。“所有新捐助国（除俄罗斯外，它们自身也仍在接受援助）都没有公布全面甚至易于理解的数据。”54

Large states give foreign aid for a variety of purposes. The largest recipients of American aid (after the war-torn states of Afghanistan and Pakistan) are Israel and Egypt, and the payments are designed to influence both states with regard to security in the area. Chinese aid is often used to gain access to raw materials. A raw material concession is often accompanied by a Chinese offer to build a new stadium or airport terminal. According to some experts, “China, which is not a member of the OECD [Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development], is operating under rules that the West has largely abandoned. It mixes aid and business in secret government-to-government agreements.”52 The Chinese approach, which avoids good governance or human rights conditions, is often welcomed by authoritarian states. Rwandan president Paul Kagame compares it favorably to the Western approach.53 Nor is China alone. India and Brazil are other emerging economies that both receive and give aid at the same time. “None of the new donors (all of which except Russia, still get aid themselves) publishes comprehensive, or even comprehensible, figures.”54

俄罗斯的援助旨在扩大其在俄罗斯所谓的“近邻”（即前苏联加盟共和国）的影响力。一些国家，例如英国，将大部分援助用于发展援助，并设立专门的机构负责管理——在英国，这个机构是国际发展部，而不是外交部。而美国的援助项目中，只有不到一半是由美国国际开发署（AID）管理并用于发展的。55作为超级大国，美国有很多援助目标并非直接与发展相关。美国四分之一的援助由五角大楼管理。

Russian aid is designed to increase Russian influence in what Russia calls “the near abroad” of former Soviet states. Some countries, such as Great Britain, devote a large portion of their aid to development and separate its administration in a special bureaucracy— in Britain, the Department for International Development rather than the Foreign Office. When we look at American assistance programs, less than half are administered by the Agency for International Development (AID) and devoted to development.55 As a superpower, the United States has many objectives for assistance that are not directly related to development. A quarter of American aid is administered by the Pentagon.

即使援助仅用于发展目的，它仍然可以被用来增强盟国的硬实力，例如，通过提升盟国的经济和行政能力。“国家建设”可以增强盟国的硬实力。马歇尔计划就是一个重要的例证。在该计划中，美国拿出其国内生产总值的2%来帮助重建二战后满目疮痍的欧洲经济。通过恢复西欧的增长和繁荣，美国成功地增强了对共产主义和苏联的抵抗力——这是一项重要的外交政策目标。马歇尔计划还有助于在欧洲培养感恩之心，并提升美国在受援国中的软实力。

Even when aid is designated for development only, it can still be used to create hard economic power, for example, by building up the economic and administrative capabilities of an allied country. “Nation-building” can develop the hard power of an ally. The Marshall Plan, in which the United States contributed 2 percent of its gross domestic product to restore the economies of Europe that had been devastated by World War II, is an important case in point. By restoring growth and prosperity to Western Europe, the United States succeeded in strengthening resistance to communism and the Soviet Union—a major foreign policy goal. The Marshall Plan also helped to develop a sense of gratitude in Europe and enhanced American soft power among the recipient countries.

表3.1美国援助项目构成（2008年）1

35.5

35.5

27.1

资料来源：美国国务院，《2009 财年国际事务第 150 项职能概要和要点》；众议院和参议院拨款委员会；以及国会研究服务处 (CRS) 的计算。

Source: U.S. Department of State, “Summary and Highlights, International Affairs, Function 150, FY2009”; House and Senate Appropriations Committees; and CRS calculations.

1. Curt Tarnoff 和 Marian Lawson，“对外援助：美国项目和政策简介”（华盛顿特区：国会研究服务报告，2009 年 4 月），www.fas.org/ sgp/crs/row/R40213.pdf 。

1. Curt Tarnoff and Marian Lawson, “Foreign Aid: An Introduction to U.S. Programs and Policy” (Washington, DC: Congressional Research Service Report, April 2009), www.fas.org/sgp/crs/row/R40213.pdf.

有时，人们会呼吁在许多欠发达地区推行类似的“马歇尔计划”式发展方案，但这类提议存在两个问题：一是原计划规模庞大，二是欧洲经济体本身已经发展成熟，只需进行重建即可。此外，欧洲当时有效地管理了大部分援助资金。如今，经济学家们对于是否存在明确的发展模式，或者即便存在，援助是否总能产生成效，尚无定论。事实上，一些人甚至认为援助会适得其反，滋生依赖和腐败的文化。例如，杰弗里·萨克斯认为，通过精心规划的发展援助，到2025年可以消除极端贫困；而前世界银行经济学家威廉·伊斯特利则对对外援助持怀疑态度，认为援助会产生不良激励。56萨克斯在肯尼亚的村庄开展了一些试点项目，这些项目取得了成功，但是“伊斯特利和其他人批评萨克斯先生没有足够关注治理和腐败等更宏观的问题，这些问题阻碍了一些初衷最好、资金最充足的援助项目。57即使我们不评判经济学家之间论点的优劣，我们也可以认识到：发展和国家建设方面的不确定性限制了援助通过巩固盟友关系来增强经济实力的方式。这并非意味着援助总是无效的，只是提醒我们，对于发展导向型援助作为硬实力来源的过于乐观的估计，应谨慎对待。事实上，当捐助方有战略目标时，他们可能会失去推动促进增长的改革的影响力。58

Occasionally, people have called for similar Marshall Plans for development in many less-developed regions, but two of the problems with such proposals are the scale of the original plan and the fact that the European economies were already developed and needed only to be restored. Moreover, they administered much of the aid effectively. Today, economists do not agree that there is a clear formula for development or if there is, that aid is always productive. Indeed, some go so far as to argue that aid can be counterproductive by creating a culture of dependency and corruption. For example, Jeffrey Sachs thinks that extreme poverty can be eliminated by 2025 through carefully planned development aid, whereas former World Bank economist William Easterly is very skeptical of foreign aid in general, and believes that it creates perverse incentives.56 Sachs has developed pilot projects in Kenya villages that work, but “Easterly and others have criticized Mr. Sachs as not paying enough attention to bigger-picure issues like governance and corruption, which have stymied some of the best-intentioned and best-fiananced aid projects.”57 Even if we do not determine the merits of the arguments among economists, we can recognize that the degree of uncertainty about development and nation-building sets limits on the way that aid can be used to generate economic power by building up allies. This does not mean that aid is always ineffective, only that we exercise caution in taking at face value overly optimistic estimates about development-oriented aid as a source of hard economic power. Indeed, when donors have strategic goals, they may lose the leverage to impose growth-promoting reforms.58

援助项目也可用于人道主义目的，如果管理得当，可以产生软实力。但这种软实力效应并非必然。援助虽然可能赢得精英阶层的青睐，但如果导致腐败和破坏社会群体间现有的权力平衡，则可能在普通民众中引发不满而非支持。此外，旨在限制地方精英的附加条件也可能适得其反。例如，2009年美国公布对巴基斯坦75亿美元的援助预算时，附加了一些限制条件，规定部分资金只能用于民用发展，但这些限制在巴基斯坦媒体中引发了民族主义的强烈抗议。59同样，一项针对阿富汗援助项目的研究发现，援助有时不仅无效，而且在软实力方面还会产生反作用。大型援助项目往往会扰乱当地的政治平衡，刺激腐败，从而引发当地群体之间的嫉妒、冲突和怨恨。正如一位观察家总结的那样：“如果说从这里尚属初步的成功中能汲取什么教训，那就是小型项目往往效果最佳，当地民众的同意和参与至关重要，而且即使是微小的进步也需要数年时间。”60与负面制裁一样，支付和援助等正面制裁在产生硬实力和软实力方面也有着褒贬不一的记录。

Aid programs may also be used for humanitarian purposes, and if properly administered, they can generate soft power. But such soft power effects are not guaranteed. Although assistance may curry favor among elites, if it leads to corruption and disruption of existing power balances among social groups, it can also engender resentment, rather than attraction, among the general populace. Moreover, conditionality designed to restrict local elites can backfire. For example, when the United States unveiled its $7.5 billion aid budget for Pakistan in 2009, it set conditions that restricted some parts for civilian development purposes, but the restrictions raised a nationalist furor in the Pakistan press.59 Similarly, a study of aid projects in Afghanistan found that sometimes aid was not merely ineffectual but was counterproductive in terms of soft power. By disturbing local political balances and stimulating corruption, large aid projects often generated jealousy, conflict, and resentment among local groups. As one observer concluded, “If there are lessons to be drawn from the still tentative successes here, they are that small projects often work best, that the consent and participation of local people are essential and that even baby steps take years.”60 Like negative sanctions, positive sanctions of payment and assistance have a mixed record as generators of both hard and soft power.

经济实力的未来

THE FUTURE OF ECONOMIC POWER

国家、私营企业以及二者的混合体之间都存在着讨价还价和权力斗争。“放眼望去，到处都能看到混合型组织的激增，它们模糊了两者之间的界限。”公共部门和私营部门。这些既不是旨在管理经济部分领域的老式国有企业，也不是依靠自身实力决定成败的传统私营企业。相反，它们是令人困惑的实体，似乎为了自身利益在两个世界之间游走。61 家俄罗斯公司（如俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司）、中国国有企业以及迪拜世界等主权财富基金，使市场行为变得复杂，并增加了政治操纵的机会。

Bargaining and power struggles occur among states, private corporations, and hybrids of the two. “Wherever you look you can see the proliferation of hybrid organizations that blur the line between the public and private sector. These are neither old-fashioned nationalized companies, designed to manage chunks of the economy, nor classic private-sector firms that sink or swim according to their own strength. Instead they are confusing entities that seem to flit between one world and another to suit their own purposes.”61 Russian firms like Gazprom, Chinese state-owned enterprises, and sovereign wealth funds like Dubai World complicate market behavior and increase the opportunities for political manipulation.

强劲且不断增长的经济是所有权力工具的基础。此外，制裁和援助等经济手段在本世纪至关重要，因为它们往往是相对成本最低的手段。但认为21世纪将是地缘经济学时代则是一种误解。权力向包括跨国公司在内的非国家行为体的扩散，限制了国家运用经济手段的战略。国家往往会发现，经济权力难以驾驭，这既是因为市场行为体难以控制，也是因为市场状况瞬息万变。尽管对21世纪经济权力凌驾于军事权力之上做出概括性的论断是错误的，但全面了解各种经济政策工具同样重要。构建市场结构比实施制裁和提供援助更为重要。很多时候，促进开放市场结构和供应来源多元化的政策，在限制供应商的经济权力方面，比通过所有权垄断供应的重商主义举措更为有效。经济实力将是智慧力量政策工具箱中最重要的工具之一，但政策应对措施往往取决于每个市场的具体情况及其脆弱性的不对称性。

A robust and growing economy provides the basis for all instruments of power. In addition, economic tools like sanctions and aid will be crucial in this century because they are often the most efficient instruments in terms of relative costs. But it is a mistake to argue that the twenty-first century will be the age of geoeconomics. The diffusion of power to nonstate actors, including transnational corporations, sets limits on state strategies to use economic instruments. States will often find economic power difficult to wield both because market actors are difficult to control and because market conditions are variable. But even as it is a mistake to make generalizations about the dominance of economic power over military power in the twenty-first century, it is equally important to understand the full range of economic policy instruments. Structuring markets is more important than imposing sanctions and providing aid. Very often, policies that promote open market structures and diversification of sources of supply will turn out to be more effective in denying economic power to suppliers than mercantilist efforts to lock up supplies through ownership. Economic power will be one of the most important implements in the toolbox of smart power policies, but policy answers will often depend on the context of each market and its asymmetries of vulnerability.

第四章

CHAPTER 4

软实力

Soft Power

软实力是一个学术概念，如今已频频出现在报纸头版，并被中国、印尼、欧洲及其他地区的领导人所使用。然而，其广泛应用有时也导致该概念被滥用，成为军事力量之外其他任何力量的代名词。此外，由于软实力被视为对抗赤裸裸的权力政治的一种替代方案，它常常受到具有伦理意识的学者和政策制定者的青睐。但软实力是一个描述性概念，而非规范性概念。如同任何形式的权力一样，它可以被用于行善，也可以被用于作恶。希特勒、斯大林和毛泽东在他们的追随者眼中都拥有强大的软实力，但这并不意味着这种软实力就是好的。蛊惑人心未必比强迫他人行动更好。2

Soft power is an academic concept that has migrated to the front pages of newspapers and been used by top leaders in China, Indonesia, Europe, and elsewhere. However, wide usage has sometimes meant misuse of the concept as a synonym for anything other than military force.1 Moreover, because soft power has appeared to be an alternative to raw power politics, it is often embraced by ethically minded scholars and policymakers. But soft power is a descriptive, rather than a normative, concept. Like any form of power, it can be wielded for good or bad purposes. Hitler, Stalin, and Mao all possessed a great deal of soft power in the eyes of their acolytes, but that did not make it good. It is not necessarily better to twist minds than to twist arms.2

怀疑论者对软实力不屑一顾，称其为“那些美好的学术理念之一，在很多外交政策考验中都失败了”，并认为“即使是最深厚的文化亲缘关系也无法阻止军队”。3虽然软实力概念出现时间不长，但它所代表的行为却与人类历史一样古老。老子曾说过，最好的领导者不是人民服从他的命令，而是人民几乎感觉不到他的存在。这其中就蕴含着这样的道理。在十八世纪的欧洲，法语和法国文化的传播增强了法国的实力。1762年，当普鲁士国王腓特烈大帝濒临战败时，他凭借个人软实力得以幸免。“沙皇伊丽莎白去世，她的儿子彼得继承王位，彼得崇拜这位军人国王……并下令俄罗斯军队回国。”4.在美国内战期间，一些英国政治家曾考虑支持南方，但尽管英国精英阶层显然有其商业和战略利益，他们还是受到民众对奴隶制的反对以及对北方事业的拥护所制约。第一次世界大战前，当美国在与德国或英国开战之间犹豫不决时，“德国在1914年的主要劣势并非其在美国民众心目中的战绩，而是缺乏战绩。几乎没有任何战绩可以抵消美国民众对英国的天然支持……而英国主导着跨大西洋的沟通渠道。”5与怀疑论者相反，软实力在历史上常常产生非常真实的影响，包括对军队调动的影响。

Skeptics have dismissed soft power as “one of those beautiful academic ideas that failed a lot of foreign policy tests” and argued that “armies weren’t stopped by even the deepest cultural affinity.”3 Though the concept of soft power is recent, the behavior it denotes is as old as human history. It is implicit in Lao-tzu’s comment that a leader is best not when people obey his commands, but when they barely know he exists. In eighteenth-century Europe, the spread of French language and culture enhanced French power. In 1762, when Frederick the Great of Prussia was on the brink of defeat, he was saved by his personal soft power when “Czarina Elizabeth died and was succeeded by her son Peter, who idolized the soldier-king . . . and ordered home the Russian armies.”4 During the American Civil War, some British statesmen considered supporting the South, but despite their obvious commercial and strategic interests, British elites were constrained by popular opposition to slavery and attraction to the cause of the North. Before World War I, when the United States wrestled with the choice of going to war with Germany or Britain, “Germany’s primary disadvantage in 1914 was not its record in American opinion, but the absence of a record. So little existed to counteract the natural pull toward Britain . . . which dominated the channels of transatlantic communication.”5 Contrary to the skeptics, soft power has often had very real effects in history, including on the movement of armies.

因为软实力是一种权力形式，只有片面且贫乏的现实主义才会忽视软实力。6.传统现实主义者并非如此。1939年，英国著名现实主义者E·H·卡尔将国际权力分为三类：军事权力、经济权力和舆论影响力。正如我们所见，当代新现实主义者为了便于其结构性判断，急于将权力量化，因而忽略了这种微妙之处。7他们犯了所谓的“具体谬误”。8.权力被简化为可衡量的、有形的资源。它变成了可以随意丢弃在你脚上或城市上的东西，而不是可能改变你最初想要丢弃任何东西的想法的东西。

Because it is a form of power, only a truncated and impoverished version of realism ignores soft power.6 Traditional realists did not. In 1939, noted British realist E. H. Carr described international power in three categories: military power, economic power, and power over opinion. As we have seen, much of this subtlety was lost by contemporary neorealists in their desire to make power measurable for their structural judgments.7 They committed what might be called “the concrete fallacy.”8 Power was reduced to measurable, tangible resources. It was something that could be dropped on your foot or on cities, rather than something that might change your mind about wanting to drop anything in the first place.

正如五百年前终极现实主义者马基雅维利所言，君主被人畏惧或许比被人爱戴更好，但被人憎恨才是他最大的危险。现实主义与软实力之间并不矛盾。软实力并非理想主义或自由主义，它仅仅是一种权力形式，是实现预期结果的一种途径。合法性本身就是一种权力现实。围绕合法性的竞争是增强或削弱各方软实力的手段之一，在二十一世纪的信息时代，这一点尤为突出。

As Machiavelli, the ultimate realist, described five centuries ago, it may be better for a prince to be feared than loved, but the prince is in greatest danger when he is hated. There is no contradiction between realism and soft power. Soft power is not a form of idealism or liberalism. It is simply a form of power, one way of getting desired outcomes. Legitimacy is a power reality. Competitive struggles over legitimacy are part of enhancing or depriving actors of soft power, and this is particularly true in the information age of the twenty-first century.

不仅国家参与其中，企业、机构、非政府组织和跨国恐怖网络也往往拥有自身的软实力。甚至一些名人也能运用软实力，“让某些理念变得易于接受、生动有趣。或者正如歌手波诺所说……他的职责是，当人们做对了，就为他们鼓掌；当他们做错了，就让他们痛苦不堪。”2007年北京奥运会前夕，史蒂文·斯皮尔伯格致信胡锦涛主席，请求中国利用自身影响力促使苏丹接受联合国在达尔富尔部署维和部队。“中国很快便派遣翟先生前往达尔富尔，这一转变堪称经典案例，展现了旨在打击北京脆弱时刻的施压行动，如何能够取得多年外交努力都无法企及的成果。”10

Not just states are involved. Corporations, institutions, NGOs, and transnational terrorist networks often have soft power of their own. Even individual celebrities are able to use their soft power “by making ideas, palatable, acceptable, colorful. Or as the singer Bono put it . . . his function is to bring applause when people get it right, and make their lives a misery when they don’t.”9 In 2007, in the run-up to the Beijing Olympics, Steven Spielberg sent an open letter to President Hu Jintao asking China to use its influence to push Sudan to accept a UN peacekeeping force in Darfur. “China soon dispatched Mr. Zhai to Darfur, a turnaround that served as a classic study of how a pressure campaign, aimed to strike Beijing in a vulnerable spot at a vulnerable time, could accomplish what years of diplomacy could not.”10

将软实力融入政府战略远比表面看起来要困难得多。首先，与硬实力相比，软实力的成效更多地掌握在目标方手中。其次，软实力的成效往往需要很长时间才能显现，而大多数政治家和公众都渴望看到投资的快速回报。第三，软实力的工具并非完全由政府掌控。尽管政府控制着政策，但文化和价值观却根植于公民社会之中。软实力或许看起来比经济或军事力量风险更小，但它往往难以运用，容易丧失，而且重建成本高昂。

Incorporating soft power into a government strategy is more difficult than may first appear. For one thing, success in terms of outcomes is more in the control of the target than is often the case with hard power. A second problem is that the results often take a long time, and most politicians and publics are impatient to see a prompt return on their investments. Third, the instruments of soft power are not fully under the control of governments. Although governments control policy, culture and values are embedded in civil societies. Soft power may appear less risky than economic or military power, but it is often hard to use, easy to lose, and costly to reestablish.

软实力依赖于信誉，当政府被视为操纵者，信息被视为宣传时，信誉就会丧失殆尽。一位批评家认为，如果政府避免强加或操纵，它们实际上并非在运用软实力，而仅仅是在进行对话。11尽管各国政府在维护信誉方面面临重重困难，但这种批评低估了软实力互动中“拉力”而非“推力”的重要性。最好的宣传并非宣传。

Soft power depends upon credibility, and when governments are perceived as manipulative and information is seen as propaganda, credibility is destroyed. One critic argues that if governments eschew imposition or manipulation, they are not really exercising soft power, but mere dialogue.11 Even though governments face a difficult task in maintaining credibility, this criticism underestimates the importance of pull, rather than push, in soft power interactions. The best propaganda is not propaganda.

当然，重要的是不要夸大软实力（或其他任何形式的实力）的影响。在某些情况下，软实力的作用微乎其微。例如，很难……看看软实力如何解决朝鲜核武器争端。一些批评者误以为，软实力往往不足以解决问题，因此它就不是一种权力形式。但这个问题适用于所有形式的权力。然而，当一个政府关注结构性环境目标或普遍价值目标，例如促进民主、人权和自由时，软实力往往比硬实力更为有效。在一个信息全球化、权力向非国家行为体扩散的世纪，软实力将成为巧实力战略中日益重要的组成部分。

Of course, it is important not to exaggerate the impact of soft (or any other form of) power. There are some situations where soft power provides very little leverage. It is difficult, for example, to see how soft power would solve the dispute over North Korea’s nuclear weapons. Some critics make the mistake of assuming that because soft power is often insufficient, it is not a form of power. But that problem is true of all forms of power. Nevertheless, when a government is concerned about structural milieu goals or general value objectives, such as promotion of democracy, human rights, and freedom, it is often the case that soft power turns out to be superior to hard power. And in a century marked by global information and a diffusion of power to nonstate actors, soft power will become an increasingly important part of smart power strategies.

软实力的来源

SOURCES OF SOFT POWER

一个国家的软实力主要依赖于三大基本资源：文化（在具有吸引力的地方）、政治价值观（在国内和国际上践行这些价值观时）以及外交政策（在其他国家认可其合法性和道德权威性时）。括号中的条件是决定潜在软实力资源能否转化为能够影响他人并促成有利结果的吸引力行为的关键。在软实力运作中，目标对象的想法至关重要，目标对象与行动者同样重要。吸引力和说服力都是社会建构的产物。软实力是一场需要伙伴配合的舞蹈。

The soft power of a country rests heavily on three basic resources: its culture (in places where it is attractive to others), its political values (when it lives up to them at home and abroad), and its foreign policies (when others see them as legitimate and having moral authority). The parenthetical conditions are the key in determining whether potential soft power resources translate into the behavior of attraction that can influence others toward favorable outcomes. With soft power, what the target thinks is particularly important, and the targets matter as much as the agents. Attraction and persuasion are socially constructed. Soft power is a dance that requires partners.

在某些情况下，文化可以成为重要的权力资源。“文化”是指群体传递知识和价值观的社会行为模式，它存在于多个层面。12人类文化的某些方面是普遍的，某些方面是民族性的，还有一些方面则特定于某个社会阶层或小群体。文化从来都不是一成不变的，不同的文化之间也以不同的方式相互作用。我们需要对文化与权力行为之间的联系进行更多研究。例如，西方文化的吸引力能否降低当今某些穆斯林社会中极端主义的吸引力？有些人认为文化鸿沟无法逾越。但请考虑一下伊斯兰世界。伊朗的情况是，西方音乐和视频为统治伊朗的毛拉们所憎恶，但却对许多年轻一代极具吸引力。
