In some contexts, culture can be an important power resource. “Culture” is the pattern of social behaviors by which groups transmit knowledge and values, and it exists at multiple levels.12 Some aspects of human culture are universal, some are national, and others are particular to social classes or small groups. Culture is never static, and different cultures interact in different ways. More research needs to be done on the connection between culture and power behavior. For example, can Western cultural attraction reduce current extremist appeals in some Muslim societies today? Some see an unbridgeable cultural divide. But consider the Islamic state of Iran. Western music and videos are anathema to the ruling mullahs, but attractive to many of the younger generation.

有时，第三方可以起到文化中介的作用。在中国，许多美国和日本的文化理念经由韩国传入后，更容易被接受。正如一位大学生在讨论电视剧时所说：“美剧也展现了类似的生活方式。我们知道韩国和美国的政治制度和经济体系很相似。但我们更容易接受韩国人的生活方式，因为他们的文化与我们更接近。我们觉得几年后我们也能过上和他们一样的生活。”13

Sometimes, a third party helps with cultural intermediation. In China, many American and Japanese cultural ideas are proving more attractive when they arrive via South Korea. As a university student puts it in discussing television shows, “American dramas also show the same kind of lifestyle. We know that South Korea and America have similar political systems and economies. But it is easier to accept the lifestyle from South Koreans because they are culturally closer to us. We feel we can live like them in a few years.”13

但直接的文化接触也很重要。正如中国外交部长的儿子描述在美中国留学生时所说：“我们的经历让我们看到，中国的发展道路和我们个人的生活方式都有其他选择。身处美国让我们意识到，中国的情况可能有所不同。”14.随着时间的推移，不同文化会相互影响。例如，贝鲁特美国大学最初提升了美国在黎巴嫩的软实力，但研究表明，它后来也提升了黎巴嫩在美国的软实力。15

But direct cultural contacts can also be important. As the son of China’s foreign minister described Chinese students in the United States: “Our experiences made us see that there are alternative ways for China to develop and for us to lead our personal lives. Being in the United States made us realize that things in China can be different.”14 Over time, cultures influence each other. For example, the American University in Beirut originally enhanced American soft power in Lebanon, but studies show that it later enhanced Lebanon’s soft power in America.15

文化、价值观和政策并非产生软实力的唯一资源。正如我们在上一章中所看到的，经济资源也能产生软实力和硬实力行为。它们既可以用来吸引，也可以用来胁迫。在现实生活中，有时很难区分经济关系中哪些部分属于硬实力，哪些部分属于软实力。欧洲领导人将其他国家加入欧盟的意愿视为欧洲软实力的体现。16例如，令人印象深刻的是，中欧一些前共产主义国家调整了预期，并修改了法律以符合布鲁塞尔的框架。土耳其也基于类似理由对其人权政策和法律进行了修改。但是，这些改变在多大程度上是市场准入带来的经济激励，又在多大程度上是出于对欧洲成功的经济和政治体系的向往？情况是多种动机交织在一起的。一个国家的不同参与者可能会以不同的方式看待这种混合局面。记者和历史学家必须详细追踪特定过程，才能厘清因果关系。

Culture, values, and policies are not the only resources that produce soft power. As we saw in the last chapter, economic resources can also produce soft as well as hard power behavior. They can be used to attract as well as coerce. Sometimes in real-world situations, it is difficult to distinguish what part of an economic relationship is composed of hard power and what is made up of soft power. European leaders describe the desire by other countries to accede to the European Union as a sign of Europe’s soft power.16 It is impressive, for example, that former communist countries in Central Europe oriented their expectations and revised their laws to comply with Brussels’s framework. Turkey has made changes in its human rights policies and laws on similar grounds. But how much are the changes the result of the economic inducement of market access, and how much is the result of attraction to Europe’s successful economic and political system? The situation is one of mixed motives, and different actors in a country may see the mix in different ways. Journalists and historians must trace particular processes in detail to disentangle causation.

许多观察人士认为，中国的软实力在亚洲和其他发展中国家正在增强，尤其是在始于美国的 2008 年全球金融危机之后。17据《人民日报》报道，“软实力已成为一个关键词……中国软实力发展潜力巨大。”18在一些发展中国家，所谓“北京共识”（即威权政府加市场经济）比此前占主导地位的“华盛顿共识”（即自由市场经济加民主政府）更受欢迎。但委内瑞拉人和津巴布韦人究竟在多大程度上被“北京共识”所吸引？他们究竟在多大程度上钦佩中国十年内国内生产总值翻番的成就？又或者，他们是否被进入一个庞大且不断增长的市场的前景所吸引？此外，即使威权增长模式在威权国家能为中国带来软实力，它在民主国家却未必具有吸引力。在加拉加斯具有吸引力的东西，在巴黎可能反而会令人反感。19

A number of observers see China’s soft power increasing in Asia and other parts of the developing world, particularly after the 2008 global financial crisis that started in the United States.17 According to the People’s Daily, “Soft power has become a key word. . . . There is great potential for the development of China’s soft power.”18 In parts of the developing world, the so-called Beijing Consensus on authoritarian government plus a successful market economy has become more popular than the previously dominant Washington Consensus of liberal market economics with democratic government. But to what extent are Venezuelans and Zimbabweans attracted to the Beijing Consensus, admire China’s doubling of its gross domestic product over a decade, or are induced by the prospect of access to a large and growing market? Moreover, even if the authoritarian growth model produces soft power for China in authoritarian countries, it does not produce attraction in democratic countries. What attracts in Caracas may repel in Paris.19

我们也看到，军事资源有时可以增强软实力。独裁者常常营造战无不胜的神话，以此来塑造公众预期，并吸引他人追随。有些人天生就向往强者。正如奥萨马·本·拉登所说，人们更喜欢强壮的马而不是弱小的马。一支运转良好的军队可以成为吸引力的来源，而军事合作和训练项目可以建立跨国网络，从而增强一个国家的软实力。与此同时，滥用军事资源也会削弱软实力。漠视正义战争中关于歧视和比例原则的行为会摧毁战争的合法性。2003年美国最初入侵伊拉克的效率或许赢得了部分伊拉克人和其他人的钦佩，但随后占领行动的低效以及虐待战俘的行径削弱了这种软实力。相比之下，美国、中国、巴西和其他国家都利用军事资源在2010年海地地震救援中发挥了作用，从而增强了自身的软实力。

We also saw that military resources can sometimes contribute to soft power. Dictators often cultivate myths of invincibility to structure expectations and attract others to join their bandwagon. Some people are generally attracted to strength. As Osama bin Laden has said, people are attracted to a strong horse rather than a weak horse. A well-run military can be a source of attraction, and military-to-military cooperation and training programs can establish transnational networks that enhance a country’s soft power. At the same time, misuse of military resources can undercut soft power. Indifference to just-war principles of discrimination and proportionality can destroy legitimacy. The efficiency of the initial American military invasion of Iraq in 2003 may have created admiration in the eyes of some Iraqis and others, but that soft power was undercut by the subsequent inefficiency of the occupation and the scenes of mistreatment of prisoners. In contrast, the United States, China, Brazil, and others all increased their soft power by using military resources for earthquake relief in Haiti in 2010.

软实力与美国霸权

SOFT POWER AND AMERICAN HEGEMONY

一些分析人士认为，21世纪的软实力是一种文化帝国主义形式，并认为美国文化创造了一种霸权式的自由主义对话。20全球政治涉及相互竞争的叙事之间的“口头斗争”，这些分析人士认为，美国在 9/11 事件后将全球政治定义为“全球反恐战争”，从而将争论和行动引导到美国框架内。21但将美国对当代通信的主导地位描述为强制性的，是对“强制”一词的奇怪用法。正如史蒂文·卢克斯所论证的，权力的第三面既有理性模式，也有非理性模式；行动者影响目标对象形成自身偏好和利益的方式，既有赋权方式，也有削弱方式。尽管并非总是易事，但在大多数情况下，我们都能区分灌输和自由选择。22

Some analysts see soft power in the twenty-first century as a form of cultural imperialism and argue that American culture has created a hegemonic liberal dialogue.20 Global politics involves “verbal fighting” among competing narratives, and these analysts argue that the ability of the United States to frame global politics after 9/11 as a “global war on terror” channeled arguments and actions into an American framework.21 But to describe American dominance over contemporary communications as coercive is an odd use of the word “coercion.” As Steven Lukes argues, there are rational and nonrational modes by which the third face of power operates and empowering and disempowering ways by which agents influence targets’ formulation of their preferences and self-interest. Although not always easy, we can distinguish indoctrination from free choice in most instances.22

美国价值观并非绝对意义上的普世价值，但在信息时代，随着越来越多的人渴望参与和言论自由，许多价值观与其他国家/地区的价值观相似。当价值观被广泛认同时，它们便能为软实力奠定基础，这种软实力可以双向发挥作用，既能影响美国，也能影响其他国家/地区。美国人或许会从中受益，但同时，如果美国希望保持其吸引力，就必须遵守其他国家/地区所共享的价值观。鉴于全球关系的政治多样性和制度碎片化，那些相信美国主导话语权的人很难站得住脚。许多国家和群体拥有不同的价值观。否则，全球事务中的观点将会比现在更加趋于一致。地方文化之所以能够持续获得忠诚，是因为“人们身处地位和等级网络之中，并追求宗教和社群的身份认同标志”。23

American values are not universal in some absolute sense, but many are similar to the values of others in an information age where more people want participation and freedom of expression. When values are widely shared, they can provide a basis for soft power that works in multiple directions, both to and from the United States. Americans may benefit but simultaneously find themselves constrained to live up to values shared by others if the United States wishes to remain attractive. Given the political diversity and institutional fragmentation of global relations, those who believe in an American hegemony over discourse have a difficult case to make. Many countries and groups have different values. Otherwise, there would be far more uniformity of views than now exists in global affairs. Local cultures continue to command loyalty because “people are involved in networks of status and caste, and they pursue religious and communal markers of identity.”23

要全面理解美国软实力霸权的问题，不妨看看中国。中国对“软实力”的概念非常重视。一位新加坡分析人士指出，“软实力是中国战略愿景的核心，也凸显了中国对外部舆论的敏感性。”24自20世纪90年代初以来，中华人民共和国已发表了数百篇关于软实力的论文和学术文章。该术语也已进入中国的官方语言。2007年10月15日，胡锦涛主席在中国共产党第十七次全国代表大会上发表主旨演讲时指出，中国共产党必须“加强文化建设，将其作为我国软实力的一部分……这在国家整体实力竞争中是一个日益重要的因素”。25

To put the question of American soft power hegemony in perspective, it helps to look at China. There is no lack of Chinese interest in the idea of “soft power.” A Singaporean analyst argues that “soft power is central to China’s strategic vision and underlines its sensitivity to external perceptions.”24 Since the early 1990s, hundreds of essays and scholarly articles have been published in the People’s Republic of China on soft power. The term has also entered China’s official language. In his keynote speech to the Seventeenth National Congress of the Communist Party of China (CPC) on October 15, 2007, President Hu Jintao stated that the CPC must “enhance culture as part of the soft power of our country . . . a factor of growing significance in the competition in overall national strength.”25

中国一直拥有极具吸引力的传统文化，如今也正迈入全球流行文化的领域。1978年至2008年间，共有140万中国学生出国留学；2009年，有22万外国留学生在中国高校就读。中国官方预计，到2020年，这一数字将增至50万。26中国在世界各地建立了数百所孔子学院，教授其语言和文化。与此同时，美国之音将中文广播从每天 19 小时减少到 14 小时，而中国国际广播电台则将英语广播增加到每天 24 小时。27 2009-2010年，中国投资89亿美元用于“对外宣传工作”，其中包括一个24小时播出的新华有线新闻频道，旨在模仿半岛电视台。28

China has always had an attractive traditional culture, but now it is entering the realm of global popular culture as well. A total of 1.4 million Chinese students studied abroad between 1978 and 2008, and in 2009, 220,000 foreign students enrolled in Chinese universities. Chinese officials expect the number to increase to 500,000 by 2020.26 China has created several hundred Confucius Institutes around the world to teach its language and culture, and while the Voice of America was cutting its Chinese broadcasts from nineteen to fourteen hours a day, China Radio International was increasing its broadcasts in English to twenty-four hours a day.27 In 2009–2010, China invested $8.9 billion in “external publicity work,” including a twenty-four-hour Xinhua cable news channel designed to imitate Al Jazeera.28

中国也调整了外交策略。上世纪90年代初，中国对多边安排持谨慎态度，与许多邻国关系不睦。此后，中国加入了世界贸易组织，向联合国维和行动派遣了3000多名维和人员，在防扩散外交方面发挥了更大作用（包括主办六国会谈以解决朝鲜问题），解决了与邻国的领土争端，并加入了包括东亚峰会在内的多个区域组织。最新例证。这种新的外交策略有助于缓解各方担忧，并降低其他国家结盟制衡新兴大国的可能性。29根据一项研究，“中国式的风格强调象征性关系和高调姿态，例如重建柬埔寨议会或莫桑比克外交部。”30但中国和美国的软实力都是有限的。

China has also adjusted its diplomacy. In the early 1990s, it was wary of multilateral arrangements and was at cross-purposes with many of its neighbors. Subsequently, it joined the World Trade Organization, contributed more than 3,000 troops to serve in UN peacekeeping operations, became more helpful on nonproliferation diplomacy (including hosting the six-power talks on North Korea), settled territorial disputes with neighbors, and joined a variety of regional organizations of which the East Asian summit is only the latest example. This new diplomacy helped to alleviate fears and reduce the likelihood of other countries allying to balance a rising power.29 According to one study, “The Chinese style emphasized symbolic relationships, high-profile gestures, such as rebuilding the Cambodian Parliament or Mozambique Foreign Affairs Ministry.”30 But there are limits to Chinese as well as American soft power.

2006 年，中国利用明朝伟大海军将领郑和远航周年纪念日，构建了一个为其现代海军向印度洋扩张辩护的叙事，但这并没有在印度产生软实力，反而导致印度对中国海军野心的怀疑，从而造成了不信任的氛围。31同样，中国曾试图通过成功举办2008年奥运会来提升其软实力，但此后不久，其在西藏、新疆以及对刘晓波（后来获得诺贝尔和平奖）等活动人士的镇压，削弱了中国软实力的提升。2009年，北京宣布计划投入数十亿美元发展全球媒体巨头，与彭博社、时代华纳和维亚康姆等公司竞争，“以软实力而非军事力量赢得国际友谊”。32但中国的努力受到国内政治审查的阻碍。尽管中国竭力将新华社和中央电视台打造成与CNN和BBC竞争的媒体，“但这种脆弱的宣传在国际上没有受众”。印度的宝莱坞电影比中国电影拥有更广泛的国际观众。“最近，当被问及为何他的电影总是以过去为背景时，著名导演张艺谋表示，以当代中国为背景的电影会被审查机构阉割。”33

In 2006, China used the anniversary of the naval explorations of its great Ming Dynasty admiral Zheng He to create a narrative that justified its modern naval expansion into the Indian Ocean, but that did not produce soft power in India, where suspicions of Chinese naval ambitions led to a climate of mistrust.31 Similarly, China tried to enhance its soft power by the successful staging of the 2008 Olympics, but shortly afterward its domestic crackdown in Tibet, in Xianjiang, and on activists like Liu Xiaobo (who later received the Nobel Peace Prize) undercut the country’s soft power gains. In 2009, Beijing announced plans to spend billions of dollars to develop global media giants to compete with Bloomberg, Time Warner, and Viacom “to use soft power rather than military might to win friends abroad.”32 But China’s efforts were hindered by its domestic political censorship. For all the efforts to turn Xinhua and China Central Television into competitors for CNN and the BBC, “there is no international audience for the brittle propaganda.” India’s Bollywood films command far greater international audiences than do Chinese films. “When Zhang Yimou, the acclaimed director, was asked recently why his films were always set in the past, he said that films about contemporary China would be neutered by the censors.”33

因此，2008 年末在亚洲进行的一项民意调查发现，中国的软实力不如美国，并得出结论：“迄今为止，中国的魅力攻势尚未奏效”，这并不令人惊讶。34 2010 年 BBC 对 28 个国家进行的民意调查证实了这一点，结果显示，只有巴基斯坦和非洲对中国的印象是积极的，而亚洲、美洲和欧洲的大多数意见是中立或负面的。35大国试图利用文化和叙事来打造软实力，以提升自身优势，但这并不能解决所有问题。如果文字和符号与国内实际情况不符，那么这种做法并不总是容易被接受。

Thus, it is not surprising that a poll taken in Asia late in 2008 found China’s soft power less than that of the United States, and concluded that “China’s charm offensive has thus far been ineffective.”34 This was confirmed by a 2010 BBC poll of twenty-eight countries that showed a net positive image of China only in Pakistan and Africa, whereas in Asia, the Americas, and Europe the modal opinion was neutral to poor.35 Great powers try to use culture and narrative to create soft power that promotes their advantage, but it is not always an easy sell if the words and symbols are inconsistent with domestic realities.

软实力既可用于零和博弈，也可用于正和博弈。正如我们所见，将权力——即影响他人以获得预期结果的能力——简单地理解为“凌驾于他人之上的权力”而非“与他人合作的权力”是错误的。一些观察人士对中国软实力的潜在增长表示担忧。这是否会对其他国家构成问题，取决于中国如何运用这种权力。如果中国利用软实力操纵亚洲政治以排挤美国，其策略必将引发摩擦；但如果中国在国际事务中采取日益增强的“负责任的利益攸关方”姿态，其软硬实力的结合便能做出积极贡献。

Soft power can be used for both zero-sum and positive-sum interactions. As we have seen, it is a mistake to think of power—the ability to affect others to obtain preferred outcomes—simply as “power over” rather than “power with” others. Some observers have expressed alarm over the potential increase in Chinese soft power. Whether this will be a problem for other countries or not will depend on the way the power is used. If China uses its soft power to manipulate the politics of Asia to exclude the United States, its strategy will cause friction, but to the extent that China adopts the attitude of a rising “responsible stakeholder” in international affairs, its combination of hard and soft power can make a positive contribution.

中国在软实力方面远不及美国或欧洲，但忽视中国正在取得的进步是愚蠢的。幸运的是，这些进步对中国自身以及世界其他国家都有益处。软实力并非零和博弈，并非一国的获益必然意味着另一国的损失。例如，如果中国和美国在彼此眼中都变得更具吸引力，那么发生破坏性冲突的可能性就会降低。如果中国软实力的提升降低了冲突的可能性，那么它就可以成为一种正和博弈关系的一部分。

China is far from America’s or Europe’s equal in soft power, but it would be foolish to ignore the gains China is making. Fortunately, these gains can be good for China and also good for the rest of the world. Soft power need not be a zero-sum game in which one country’s gain is necessarily another country’s loss. If China and the United States, for example, both become more attractive in each other’s eyes, the prospects of damaging conflicts will be reduced. If the rise of China’s soft power reduces the likelihood of conflict, it can be part of a positive-sum relationship.

软实力行为：议程设置、吸引和说服

SOFT POWER BEHAVIORS: AGENDA-SETTING, ATTRACTION, AND PERSUASION

到目前为止，我们一直关注软实力资源，但软实力与第 1 章讨论的权力行为的三个方面或所有三个方面都相符。

Thus far we have focused on soft power resources, but soft power fits with all three faces or aspects of power behavior discussed in Chapter 1.

例如，假设一位校长不希望某个青少年吸烟。在权力的第一层面上，校长可以威胁要罚款或开除这名学生，迫使她改变吸烟的念头（硬实力），或者花费数小时劝说她改变现有的吸烟习惯。在第二个维度上，校长可以禁止香烟自动售货机（这是议程设置的硬性手段），或者利用有关癌症和牙齿发黄的公益广告来营造一种吸烟不受欢迎甚至不可想象的氛围（软性手段）。在第三个维度上，校长可以召开全校集会，让学生讨论吸烟问题并承诺不吸烟（软性手段），或者更进一步，威胁要排斥少数吸烟的学生（硬性手段）。换句话说，校长既可以运用硬性手段阻止学生吸烟，也可以运用框架构建、说服和吸引力等软性手段。她运用软性手段能否成功，取决于她能否吸引学生并建立起信誉和信任。

For example, suppose a school principal does not want a teenager to smoke. Under the first face of power, the principal could threaten the student with fines or expulsion to change her desire to smoke (hard power) or spend hours persuading her to change her existing preference about smoking (soft power). Under the second dimension, the principal could ban cigarette vending machines (a hard aspect of agenda-setting) or use public service advertisements about cancer and yellow teeth to create a climate in which smoking becomes unpopular and unthinkable (soft power). Under the third dimension of power behavior, the principal could hold a school assembly in which students discuss smoking and vow not to smoke (soft power) or go further and threaten to ostracize the minority who smoke (hard power). In other words, the principal can use her hard power to stop students from smoking or use the soft power of framing, persuasion, and attraction. The success of her soft power efforts will depend upon her ability to attract and create credibility and trust.

表 4.1权力行为的三种面孔

TABLE 4.1 Three Faces of Power Behavior

第一张脸

FIRST FACE

（达尔：诱导他人去做

(DAHL: INDUCING OTHERS TO DO

他们通常不会做的事）

WHAT THEY OTHERWISE WOULD NOT DO)

困难：A 使用武力/金钱来改变 B 的现有策略。

Hard: A uses force/payment to change B’s existing strategies.

软性：A 利用吸引力/说服力来改变 B 现有的偏好。

Soft: A uses attraction/persuasion to change B’s existing preferences.

第二张脸

SECOND FACE

（巴赫拉赫和巴拉茨：框架构建与议程设置）

(BACHRACH AND BARATZ: FRAMING AND SETTING AGENDA)

困难：A 使用武力/金钱来阻止 B 的计划（无论 B 是否愿意）。

Hard: A uses force/pay to truncate B’s agenda (whether B likes it or not).

软性手段：A 利用吸引力或制度，使 B 认为其议程是合法的。

Soft: A uses attraction or institutions so that B sees the agenda as legitimate.

第三张脸

THIRD FACE

（卢克斯：塑造他人的偏好）

(LUKES: SHAPING OTHERS’ PREFERENCES)

困难：A 使用武力/金钱来影响 B 的偏好（“斯德哥尔摩综合症”）。

Hard: A uses force/pay to shape B’s preferences (“Stockholm syndrome”).

软性因素：A 利用吸引力和/或制度来塑造 B 的初始偏好。

Soft: A uses attraction and/or institutions to shape B’s initial preferences.

吸引力比乍看之下要复杂得多。它既可以指吸引注意力——无论是正面的还是负面的——也可以指创造。吸引力或积极的磁性效应。就像磁力或引力一样，关注可能是受欢迎的，也可能是不受欢迎的，这取决于具体情况。律师将某些事物称为“诱人的麻烦”。如果吸引力是不对称的，并导致强硬的回应，那么它带来的不是力量，而是脆弱性。例如，印度在19世纪对英国具有吸引力，但这最终导致印度遭受殖民统治，而不是获得软实力。36此外，关注度往往是不对称的。问题越大，就越容易吸引关注。与规模更大或实力更强的一方相比，规模较小或实力较弱的一方可以从获得更多关注中获得策略优势——例如美国和加拿大，或者中国和越南。但这种类型的关注并非软实力。软实力依赖于“吸引力”意义上的积极关注。

Attraction is more complex than it first appears. It can refer to drawing attention—whether positive or negative—as well as creating alluring or positive magnetic effects. Like magnetism or gravitational pull, attention may be welcome or unwelcome, depending on the context. Lawyers refer to some things as an “attractive nuisance.” If attraction is asymmetrical and leads to a hard power response, it produces vulnerability rather than power. For example, India was attractive to Britain in the nineteenth century, and that led to colonial subjugation, rather than soft power, for India.36 Moreover, attention is often asymmetrical. The bigger the problem is, the more attention it is likely to attract. A smaller or weaker party can gain tactically from its greater focus compared to the larger or stronger party—witness the United States and Canada or China and Vietnam. But this type of attraction is not soft power. Soft power relies on positive attraction in the sense of “alluring.”

什么会产生积极的吸引力？心理学家告诉我们，我们喜欢和我们相似的人，或者和我们属于同一群体的人，我们也会被外貌特征以及共同的态度所吸引。37在国家层面，亚历山大·武文（Alexander Vuving）提出了三个对吸引力至关重要的主体及其行为特质：仁慈、能力和魅力（或称风度）。“仁慈”是指主体与他人互动的方式。被认为仁慈往往会赢得同情、信任、信誉和顺从。“卓越”或“能力”指的是主体做事的方式，它能赢得钦佩、尊重和效仿。“魅力”或“风度”是指主体与理想、价值观和愿景之间的联系，它往往会激发灵感和拥护。38这些特质群对于将资源（如文化、价值观和政策）转化为权力行为至关重要。

What generates positive attraction? Psychologists tell us we like those who are similar to us or with whom we share group membership, and we are also attracted by physical characteristics as well as shared attitudes.37 At the level of states, Alexander Vuving usefully suggests three clusters of qualities of the agent and action that are central to attraction: benignity, competence, and beauty (charisma). “Benignity” is an aspect of how an agent relates to others. Being perceived as benign tends to generate sympathy, trust, credibility, and acquiescence. “Brilliance” or “competence” refers to how an agent does things, and it produces admiration, respect, and emulation. “Beauty” or “charisma” is an aspect of an agent’s relation to ideals, values, and vision, and it tends to produce inspiration and adherence.38 These clusters of qualities are crucial for converting resources (such as culture, values, and policies) into power behavior.

如果缺乏这些感知特质，某种资源可能会引起冷漠甚至反感——这与软实力截然相反。软实力的产生取决于行动者的特质以及目标群体如何感知这些特质。对一个目标群体具有吸引力的事物，对另一个目标群体则可能产生反感。当行动者或行为被视为恶意、操纵、无能或丑陋时，它很可能引起反感。因此，某种资源……一部描绘独立自主女性的好莱坞电影等文化产物，在里约热内卢可能引起积极的反感，但在利雅得却可能招致厌恶。一项被视为操纵性的援助项目可能会削弱软实力，而一部被视为纯粹宣传的精良电视节目则可能引发反感。

Without such perceived qualities, a given resource may produce indifference or even revulsion—the opposite of soft power. The production of soft power by attraction depends upon both the qualities of the agent and how they are perceived by the target. What produces attraction for one target may produce revulsion for another. When an actor or action is perceived as malign, manipulative, incompetent, or ugly, it is likely to produce revulsion. Thus, a given cultural artifact, such as a Hollywood movie that portrays liberated women acting independently, may produce positive attraction in Rio but revulsion in Riyadh. An aid program that is seen as manipulative may undercut soft power, and a slick television production that is perceived as pure propaganda may produce revulsion.

说服与吸引力密切相关。它是指运用论证来影响他人的信念和行为，而无需诉诸武力或金钱。说服几乎总是包含一定程度的操控，某些要点会被强调，而另一些则会被忽略。不诚实的说服甚至可能涉及欺诈。在说服过程中，理性论证（诉诸事实、因果关系信念和规范性前提）与以吸引人的方式构建问题框架以及运用情感诉求相结合。39这就是为什么吸引力、信任和说服力密切相关。有些理性论证本身就具有说服力。即使是敌人提出的，一个精妙的纯数学证明也能凭借其内在价值令人信服。但大多数论证都涉及对事实、价值观和框架的断言，而这些断言依赖于一定程度的吸引力以及对信息来源可信度的信任。例如，本书开头提到的法国向巴基斯坦出售核武器的轶事。美国的论点诉诸于法美两国在不扩散问题上的共同利益，但如果没有法美两国政府之间的某种吸引力，以及对美国人没有撒谎、情报准确度的信任，那么说服的努力就会失败。

Persuasion is closely related to attraction. It is the use of argument to influence the beliefs and actions of others without the threat of force or promise of payment. Persuasion almost always involves some degree of manipulation, with some points being emphasized and others neglected. Dishonest persuasion may go so far as to involve fraud. In persuasion, rational argument appealing to facts, beliefs about causality, and normative premises are mixed with the framing of issues in attractive ways and the use of emotional appeals.39 That is why attraction, trust, and persuasion are closely related. Some rational arguments are self-executing. An elegant proof in pure math can convince on its own internal merit even if propounded by an enemy. But most arguments involve assertions about facts, values, and framing that depend upon some degree of attraction and trust that the source is credible. Take, for instance, the anecdote about the French nuclear sale to Pakistan at the beginning of this book. The American argument appealed to common interests in nonproliferation shared by France and the United States, but without some attraction between the French and American governments and trust that the Americans were not lying and that the intelligence was accurate, the effort at persuasion would have failed.

反过来，议程的构建与说服密切相关。40.一个被目标受众视为合理且具有吸引力的论点更有可能具有说服力。此外，许多说服方式是间接的，通过大众而非精英阶层来实现。对合法性的认知也可能涉及第三方受众。间接说服往往需要运用情感诉求和叙事，而非纯粹的逻辑。叙事在以具有说服力的方式构建议题方面尤为重要。有些“事实”会变得重要，而另一些则会被忽略。然而，如果某种叙事过于明显地带有操纵性，并被认定为宣传，它就会失去说服力。再次强调，软实力的构建不仅取决于行动者施加的影响，也取决于目标对象的感知。

In turn, framing of an agenda is closely related to persuasion.40 An attractively framed argument seen as legitimate by the target is more likely to be persuasive. Moreover, much persuasion is indirect, mediated through mass audiences rather than elites. Perceptions of legitimacy can also involve third-party audiences. Indirect attempts at persuasion often involve efforts to persuade third parties with emotional appeals and narratives rather than pure logic. Narratives are particularly important in framing issues in persuasive ways so that some “facts” become important and others fall by the wayside. Yet if a narrative is too transparently manipulative and discounted as propaganda, it loses persuasive power. Again, it is not just the influence effort by the agent, but also the perceptions by the targets that are critical for the creation of soft power.

软实力如何运作

HOW SOFT POWER WORKS

有时，吸引力及其产生的软实力无需费力。正如我们之前所见，行为体的价值观的影响如同“山巅之城”的光芒。这种以身作则的吸引力是软实力的被动运用方式。而在其他情况下，行为体则会通过各种项目，例如公共外交、广播、交流和援助，积极主动地创造吸引力和软实力。因此，软实力影响目标的方式有两种：直接型和间接型。在直接型软实力中，领导人可能会被其他领导人的仁慈、能力或魅力所吸引和说服——例如之前提到的沙皇彼得和腓特烈大帝的例子，或者奥巴马总统在G20峰会上发表的演讲如何促成捐款增加。41精英关系和网络往往发挥着重要作用。然而，更常见的是一种两步模式：公众和第三方受到影响，进而影响其他国家的领导人。在这种情况下，软实力通过创造有利于决策的环境而产生重要的间接影响。反之，如果某个行为者或行为被视为令人反感，则会造成不利的环境。

Sometimes attraction and the resulting soft power it engenders require little effort. As we saw earlier, the effects of an actor’s values can be like the light shining from “a city on the hill.” This attraction by example is the passive approach to soft power. At other times, an actor makes active efforts to create attraction and soft power by a variety of programs, such as public diplomacy, broadcasting, exchanges, and assistance. There are, then, two models of how soft power affects its targets: direct and indirect. In the direct form, leaders may be attracted and persuaded by the benignity, competence, or charisma of other leaders—witness the example of Czar Peter and Frederick the Great cited previously or an account of the persuasive effect of President Obama’s arguments leading to an increase in donations at a G-20 meeting.41 Elite relations and networks often play an important role. More common, however, is a two-step model in which publics and third parties are influenced, and they in turn affect the leaders of other countries. In this case, soft power has an important indirect effect by creating an enabling environment for decisions. Alternatively, if an actor or action is perceived as repulsive, it creates a disabling environment.

判断软实力因模型而异。在第一种模型中，判断直接因果关系需要像优秀历史学家或记者那样进行细致的过程追踪，这其中也存在着厘清多种原因的诸多困难。在第二种模型中，判断间接因果关系同样需要细致的过程追踪，因为其中涉及多种因果因素，但民意调查和细致的内容分析可以帮助提供初步估计。是否存在有利或不利的环境，这本身就是一种问题。尽管民意调查可以衡量潜在软实力资源的存在及其趋势，但它们只能初步估算行为改变的结果。相关性，例如一项针对143对国家的研究发现，当民意调查显示一个国家的民众对另一个国家的领导人不满时，恐怖主义的发生率就会更高，这种相关性具有启发意义，但并不能证明因果关系。42当舆论在一段时间内保持强劲且稳定时，它会产生影响，但公众舆论相对于其他变量的影响程度，只能通过细致的过程追踪来确定。这在短期内往往难以察觉，有时最好由那些能够在事件发生后很久才去厘清原因的历史学家来判断。

Judging the causal effects of soft power varies with each model. In the first model, judging direct causation requires careful process-tracing of the sort that good historians or journalists do, with all the difficulties of sorting out multiple causes. In the second model, judging indirect causation also requires careful process-tracing because multiple causal factors are involved, but here public opinion polls and careful content analysis can help provide a first estimate of the existence of an enabling or a disabling environment. Even though polls can measure the existence and trends in potential soft power resources, they are only a first approximation for behavioral change in terms of outcomes. Correlations, such as a study of 143 pairs of countries that found a greater incidence of terrorism where polls showed people of one country disapproving of the leadership of another country, are suggestive but do not prove causation.42 Where opinion is strong and consistent over time, it can have an effect, but the impact of public opinion in comparison to other variables can be determined only by careful process-tracing. This is often difficult to catch in the short term and is sometimes best judged by historians able to sort causes well after the events.

图 4.1软实力：直接和间接因果模型

FIGURE 4.1 Soft Power: Direct and Indirect Causal Models

一些怀疑论者完全不相信民意调查。他们认为，“在外交政策领域，国家控制舆论而不是被舆论控制，这一事实削弱了软实力的逻辑。”43然而，这种论点是错误的，因为它忽略了直接影响、程度问题、目标类型以及与其他因素的相互作用。此外，公众舆论有时会对威权领导人起到约束作用，在许多内部异议被压制的威权国家，国际谴责会产生影响。即使在许多情况下，许多政府受公众舆论的约束力较弱，但这并不意味着软实力无关紧要。

Some skeptics discount polls completely. They argue that “the fact that the state controls public opinion rather than being controlled by it in the realm of foreign policy is a fact that undermines the logic of soft power.”43 This argument is wrong, however, because it ignores direct effects, matters of degree, types of goals, and interactions with other causes. Moreover, public opinion sometimes acts as a constraint on authoritarian leaders, and in many authoritarian states where internal dissent is muted, international opprobrium has an effect. Even if it is true that many governments in many contexts are only weakly constrained by public opinion, it does not follow that soft power is irrelevant.

就具体目标而言，有时存在一种直接影响政策制定者的单步模式，无需经过公众舆论。学生和领导人交流就是一个很好的例子。46位现任和165位前任政府首脑都毕业于美国高等教育机构。每年近75万名来美留学生并非全部都对美国感兴趣，但绝大多数确实如此。“研究始终表明，交换生回国后对他们留学的国家和接触过的人民持有更积极的看法”，而且，在民主国家接受教育的学生更有可能在自己的祖国推动民主。44此外，此类计划还可以对间接参与者产生有益的“涟漪效应”。45结果可能非常显著。例如，米哈伊尔·戈尔巴乔夫对改革和公开性的拥抱，受到了几十年前亚历山大·雅科夫列夫在美国学到的思想的影响。尽管冷战的结束是多种因素共同作用的结果，但前苏联精英们的大量证词表明，各种思想是如何与他们的经济衰退相互作用的。正如前苏联官员格奥尔基·沙克纳扎罗夫所说：“戈尔巴乔夫、我，我们所有人都是双重思想者。”46

Regarding specific goals, sometimes there is a one-step model with direct effects on policymakers that does not go through public opinion. Student and leadership exchanges are a good example. Forty-six current and 165 former heads of government are products of U.S. higher education. Not all of the nearly 750,000 foreign students who come to the United States annually are attracted to the country, but a large majority are. “Research has consistently shown that exchange students return home with a more positive view of the country in which they studied and the people with whom they interacted,” and foreign-educated students are more likely to promote democracy in their home country if they are educated in democratic countries.44 Moreover, such programs can have beneficial “ripple effects” on indirect participants.45 The results can be dramatic. For example, Mikhail Gorbachev’s embrace of perestroika and glasnost was influenced by ideas learned in the United States by Alexander Yakovlev decades earlier. And even though the end of the Cold War involved multiple causes, there is ample testimony by former Soviet elites about how ideas interacted with their economic decline. As former Soviet official Georgi Shaknazarov puts it, “Gorbachev, me, all of us were double thinkers.”46

即使采用两步模型，公众舆论也常常会影响精英阶层，为特定政策举措创造有利或不利的环境。例如，在2003年的伊拉克战争中，土耳其官员受到公众舆论和议会舆论的制约，无法允许美国第四步兵师穿越其领土。布什政府软实力的不足削弱了其硬实力。同样，墨西哥总统比森特·福克斯希望通过支持第二项授权入侵伊拉克的联合国决议来迎合乔治·W·布什，但他也受到公众舆论的制约。当亲美立场在政治上等同于自取灭亡时，公众舆论对政策的影响远非怀疑论者简单的论断所能涵盖。即使是亲密盟友英国，在对布什政府的情报标准做出反应时也认为，“我们仍然需要与他们合作，但我们的合作方式截然不同。”47

Even with the two-step model, public opinion often affects elites by creating an enabling or a disabling environment for specific policy initiatives. For example, in regard to Iraq in 2003, Turkish officials were constrained by public and parliamentary opinion and unable to allow the American Fourth Infantry Division to cross their country. The Bush administration’s lack of soft power hurt its hard power. Similarly, Mexican president Vicente Fox wished to accommodate George W. Bush by supporting a second UN resolution authorizing invasion, but he was constrained by public opinion. When being pro-American is a political kiss of death, public opinion has an effect on policy that the skeptics’ simple proposition does not capture. Even Britain, a close ally, when reacting to Bush administration intelligence standards decided that “we still have to work with them, but we work with them in a rather different fashion.”47

在这些负面案例中，由于“否决权”相对容易识别，因此因果关系通常更容易辨别。而在正面案例中，软实力在众多变量中的影响则更难分离和证实。一项研究提出了国家通过第二种公众舆论模型有效运用软实力的三个必要条件：在运转良好的思想市场中与目标受众沟通；说服目标受众改变其在某一政治问题上的态度；以及确保新的态度能够影响政治结果。48分析上述每个步骤有助于理解一国政府如何通过软实力改变另一国政府的政策。然而，这种分析不仅忽略了第一种直接影响模式，也忽略了第二种模式的另一个维度：通过长期吸引力营造有利环境。这种环境的形成可能更多地依赖于公民社会和非国家行为体，而非政府的直接努力，因为公民社会和非国家行为体通常被认为更具可信度。因此，我们不应仅仅关注政府机构和旨在改变特定政策的定向努力，还必须考虑“山巅之城”效应和榜样吸引力。一个社会对另一个社会的吸引力越大，它就能为整体环境目标以及精英阶层的特定决策创造有利条件。

It is often easier to see causation in these negative cases where a “veto” is relatively easy to identify. In positive cases, the impact of soft power among multiple variables is more difficult to isolate and prove. One study suggests three necessary conditions for effective state use of soft power via the second model of public opinion: communicating to an intended target in a functioning marketplace of ideas, persuading the target to change its attitude on a political issue, and ensuring the new attitude influences political outcomes.48 Analyzing each of these steps is helpful in addressing the efforts of a government to change another government’s policy through soft power. However, it misses not only the first model of direct effect but also another dimension of the second model: creating an enabling environment through long-term attraction. Such a climate may be the product of civil society and nonstate actors, often seen as more credible, rather than direct governmental efforts. Instead of focusing solely on government agents and targeted efforts to change specific policies, we must also consider the city on a hill effect and attraction by example. To the extent that one society is attractive to another, it can create an enabling environment for general milieu goals as well as specific elite decisions.

在此，软实力的目标是广泛的公众舆论和文化态度。研究过这一时期的多数历史学家都认为，除了军队和资金之外，美国在战后欧洲推行此类目标的能力也深受文化和思想的影响。尽管诸如马歇尔计划之类的政府项目至关重要，但这一时期的历史学家也强调了非国家行为体的影响。“美国企业和广告公司的高管，以及好莱坞制片厂的负责人，不仅向世界其他地区推销他们的产品，还推销美国的文化和价值观，即其成功的秘诀。”49正如一位挪威学者所言，“联邦制、民主和开放市场代表了美国的核心价值观。这就是美国输出的东西。”这使得维持他所谓的“邀请制帝国”变得更加容易。50

Here the target of soft power is broad public opinion and cultural attitudes. Most historians who have studied the period agree that in addition to troops and money, American power to promote such goals in postwar Europe was strongly affected by culture and ideas. Even though governmental programs such as the Marshall Plan were important, historians of the period stress the impact of nonstate actors as well. “American corporate and advertising executives, as well as the heads of Hollywood studios, were selling not only their products but also America’s culture and values, the secrets of its success, to the rest of the world.”49 As one Norwegian scholar argues, “Federalism, democracy, and open markets represented core American values. This is what America exported.” That made it much easier to maintain what he calls an “empire by invitation.”50

这些总体目标在今天仍然很重要。例如，许多恐怖主义行为并非旨在推翻某个特定政府。与其制造一种两极分化的氛围，让极端主义论调得以在更广泛的穆斯林世界传播，不如采取其他措施。一项针对贝鲁特美国大学和开罗美国大学（均为非政府机构）影响的有趣研究发现，尽管所在国局势动荡，这两所大学仍成功地推广了其自身（以及间接地推广了美国政府）所倡导的自由、世俗、私立教育的目标，但它们并未促成人们对不受欢迎的美国外交政策具体目标的接受。51

Such general goals remain important today. For example, many acts of terrorism are less designed to overthrow a particular government than to create a climate of polarization in which an extremist narrative can spread to wider parts of the Muslim world. An interesting study of the impact of the American University in Beirut and the American University in Cairo, both nongovernmental, found that they were successful in promoting their own (and indirectly American government) milieu goals of liberal, secular, private education despite perilous times in their host societies, but they did not contribute to acceptance of the specific goals of unpopular American foreign policies.51

然而，不应夸大软实力的“山巅之城”效应，尤其是在其对特定短期目标的影响方面。冷战后，欧洲软实力对实现中欧民主化的长期环境目标产生了重要影响，但当欧洲人参加2009年哥本哈根气候峰会时，他们在国内气候问题上树立的优越榜样所带来的软实力却未能奏效。“欧洲的策略是迫使其他国家在碳排放方面做出与其相同的让步。但欧盟在谈判中几乎形同虚设”，因为其远大的目标与其他国家达成的有限协议相去甚远。52

The passive city on the hill effect of soft power should not be exaggerated, however, particularly in its impact on specific short-term goals. European soft power had an important impact on achieving the long-term milieu goals of democratization of Central Europe after the Cold War, but when Europeans went to the 2009 Copenhagen climate summit, the soft power of their superior domestic example on climate was not effective. “Europe’s strategy was to press others to match its own concessions on carbon emissions. But the EU barely existed at the talks” because its lofty aspirations were too far from the limited bargains being struck by other countries.52

2008年巴拉克·奥巴马的当选就是一个有趣的“自然实验”，它有助于消除人们对美国政治体系封闭、完全由金钱和家族王朝把持的负面刻板印象。2009年的民调显示，美国在全球许多地区的形象出现了令人瞩目的“复苏”，这反映出人们对新总统的信心。53一项基于民意调查的品牌价值评估甚至表明，奥巴马效应的品牌资产价值高达 2 万亿美元。54到2010年，美国在欧洲、俄罗斯和中国的受欢迎程度有所上升，但在埃及的受欢迎程度有所下降。55在美国政策不受欢迎的巴基斯坦和巴勒斯坦地区，“奥巴马的支持率仅比布什的糟糕支持率略好一些”。56而对于奥巴马在其执政第一年提出的具体政策要求，例如向阿富汗增派盟军部队，或其他国家是否愿意接收从关塔那摩监狱释放的囚犯，结果比布什时期要好，但提升幅度不大。换句话说，奥巴马效应是积极的，但短期内影响有限。

An interesting “natural experiment” can be seen in the 2008 election of Barack Obama, which helped to dispel negative stereotypes of a closed American political system based solely on money and family dynasties. In 2009, polls showed an impressive “revival of America’s global image in many parts of the world reflecting confidence in the new president.”53 One poll-based assessment of brand values even suggested the Obama effect was worth $2 trillion in brand equity.54 By 2010, the popularity of the United States had risen in Europe, Russia, and China but had declined in Egypt,55 and in areas such as Pakistan and the Palestinian territories where American policies were unpopular, “ratings of Obama were only marginally better than the abysmal ratings accorded to Bush.”56 And on particular policy requests made by Obama in his first year, such as more allied troops for Afghanistan or the willingness of other countries to accept detainees released from the Guantánamo prison, the results were better, but only modestly so, than those that had been achieved by Bush. In other words, the Obama effect was positive, but of limited magnitude in the short term.

各方不仅试图通过软实力直接或间接地相互影响，而且还竞相削弱对方的吸引力和合法性，从而在对方国家的公众舆论中和/或相关第三方眼中营造一种不利的局面。例如，在美国参议院通过一项3000万美元的法案，用于记录和公布伊朗的人权侵犯行为后，伊朗议会设立了一个2000万美元的基金，用于揭露美国的人权侵犯行为。57有时，领导人准备忽略第三方的意见（被有些误导性地称为“世界舆论”），但有时，他们对外交孤立的担忧会阻碍他们的行动。

Not only do actors try to influence each other directly and indirectly through soft power; they also compete to deprive each other of attractiveness and legitimacy, thus creating a disabling environment either in public opinion in the other country and/or in the eyes of relevant third parties. For example, after the U.S. Senate passed a $30 million bill to document and publicize human rights violations in Iran, the Iranian parliament created a $20 million fund to expose human rights violations in the United States.57 Sometimes leaders are prepared to ignore the opinion of third parties (somewhat misleadingly labeled “world public opinion”), but at other times their concerns about diplomatic isolation can inhibit their actions.

2008年入侵格鲁吉亚后，俄罗斯严密控制国内媒体，但在国际上似乎准备不足，难以有效推进其立场。格鲁吉亚总统米哈伊尔·萨卡斯维利凭借流利的英语，在世界其他地区的媒体报道中占据主导地位。“克里姆林宫不愿像派遣坦克入侵格鲁吉亚那样，竭力争取国际社会对其立场的支持，这反映了其世界观。”58俄罗斯的军事力量占据主导地位，但俄罗斯不擅长运用软实力来巩固其军事胜利。

In 2008, after invading Georgia, Russia carefully controlled its domestic media, but seemed ill prepared to press its case internationally. Georgian president Mikhail Saakasvili used his fluency in English to dominate coverage in the rest of the world. “The Kremlin’s reluctance to muster support for its position with the same intensity that it sent tanks into Georgia offers an insight into its worldview.”58 Russian military power dominated, but Russia was not as adept in wielding soft power to consolidate its military victory.

正如我们所见，通过巧妙的转化策略，多种基础资源可以转化为软实力。这些基础资源包括文化、价值观、合法政策、积极的国内模式、成功的经济以及强大的军队。有时，这些资源会被专门用于软实力目的。此类经过改造的资源包括国家情报机构、信息机构、外交、公共外交、交流项目、援助项目、培训项目以及其他各种措施。经过改造的资源提供了多种政策工具，但它们在目标群体中产生的是积极还是消极反应（以及由此产生的预期结果）取决于具体情况。目标以及功率转换策略的特性。该转换过程如图4.2所示。

As we have seen, there are a wide variety of basic resources that can be converted into soft power by skillful conversion strategies. Basic resources include culture, values, legitimate policies, a positive domestic model, a successful economy, and a competent military. Sometimes these resources are specially shaped for soft power purposes. Such shaped resources include national intelligence services, information agencies, diplomacy, public diplomacy, exchange programs, assistance programs, training programs, and various other measures. Shaped resources provide a wide variety of policy tools, but whether they produce positive or negative responses in the targets (and thus preferred outcomes) depends upon the context, the target, and the qualities of the power-conversion strategies. This conversion process is illustrated in Figure 4.2.

图 4.2软实力资源向行为（结果）的转化

FIGURE 4.2 Conversion of Soft Power Resources to Behavior (outcomes)

要将软实力资源和工具转化为实际成果，关键在于能够在目标群体中树立对仁慈、能力和魅力等品质的认知。这种认知可能是虚假的（例如某些宣传的效果），但重要的是目标群体是否相信它，以及他们对此做出积极还是消极的反应。

To convert soft power resources and tools into outcomes requires the critical ability to create in the target perceptions of such qualities as benignity, competence, and charisma. The perception may be false (as in the effect of some propaganda), but what matters is whether the target believes it and responds positively or negatively.

通过公共外交运用软实力

WIELDING SOFT POWER THROUGH PUBLIC DIPLOMACY

正如我们所见，软实力对政府而言难以驾驭。持续的吸引力——如同山巅之城——需要实践与价值观的一致性。而进一步投射吸引力、构建议程并说服他人则更加困难。正如我们所见，因果路径往往是间接的，效果需要时间才能显现，软实力所指向的一些总体目标较为分散，而且政府很少能完全掌控所有工具。在第二章和第三章中，我们看到了利用军事和经济资源打造软实力的潜力和困难。通过公共外交工具打造软实力同样如此。大量信息的涌现以及信息的重要性，都加剧了政策制定的难度。网络以及民主社会中不断变化的领导风格都至关重要。但通过公共外交打造软实力往往困难重重，但这并不意味着它不重要。

As we have seen, soft power is difficult for governments to wield. Sustained attraction—being a city on a hill—requires consistency of practice with values. Going further to project attraction, frame agendas, and persuade others is even more difficult. As we have seen, the causal paths are often indirect, the effects often take time to ripen, some of the general goals to which soft power is directed are diffuse, and governments are rarely in full control of all the instruments. In Chapters 2 and 3, we saw some of the potential but also the difficulties of using military and economic resources to create soft power. That is equally true of efforts to create soft power through the instruments of public diplomacy. The policy difficulty is compounded by the plethora of available information, the importance of networks, and changing leadership styles in democratic societies. But the fact that creating soft power through public diplomacy is often difficult does not mean that it is unimportant.

在权力正从国家向非国家行为体扩散的世纪，政府若想保持公信力，就必须承认信息时代权力不再是等级分明的，社交网络的重要性日益凸显。要在网络化世界中取得成功，领导者需要转变思维方式，从命令式的指挥转向吸引和合作。领导者需要将自己视为置身于一个圈子之中，而非高高在上。这意味着双向沟通比命令式的指挥更为有效。正如一位参加萨尔茨堡研讨会的捷克青年所言：“这才是最好的宣传，因为它根本就不是宣传。”59

To be credible in a century where power is diffusing from states to nonstate actors, government efforts to project soft power will have to accept that power is less hierarchical in an information age and that social networks have become more important. To succeed in a networked world requires leaders to think in terms of attraction and co-option rather than command. Leaders need to think of themselves as being in a circle rather than atop a mountain. That means that two-way communications are more effective than commands. As a young Czech participant at a Salzburg seminar observed, “This is the best propaganda because it’s not propaganda.”59

软实力并非完全由政府通过政策和公共外交所创造。软实力的形成也受到国内外众多非国家行为体的积极（或消极）影响。这些行为体影响着其他国家的公众和执政精英，并为政府政策的实施创造有利或不利的环境。如前所述，在某些情况下，软实力会提高其他国家精英采纳有利于我们实现预期目标的政策的可能性。而在另一些情况下，如果被视为对美国政府友好就等同于政治上的“死亡之吻”，那么软实力的下降或缺失将阻碍美国人实现某些特定目标。但即便如此，公民社会和非国家行为体的互动仍然有助于推进民主、自由和发展等总体环境目标。

Soft power is generated only in part by what the government does through its policies and public diplomacy. The generation of soft power is also affected in positive (and negative) ways by a host of nonstate actors within and outside a country. Those actors affect both the general public and governing elites in other countries and create an enabling or a disabling environment for government policies. As mentioned earlier, in some cases, soft power will enhance the probability of other elites adopting policies that allow us to achieve our preferred outcomes. In other cases, where being seen as friendly to the U.S. administration is seen as a local political kiss of death, the decline or absence of soft power will prevent Americans from obtaining particular goals. But even in such instances, the interactions of civil societies and nonstate actors may help to further general milieu goals such as democracy, liberty, and development.

古典外交，有时被称为“内阁外交”，涉及统治者之间传递信息，通常是秘密通信。如图 4.3中的第一个模型所示，A 政府直接与 B 政府沟通。但各国政府也发现，通过图 4.3中的间接模型与他国公众沟通，以期影响他国政府，也十分有效。这种间接形式的……外交手段逐渐演变为公共外交。影响他国公众的努力由来已久。法国大革命后，新成立的法国政府派遣特工前往美国，试图直接影响美国舆论。19世纪末，法国在普法战争中战败后，法国政府成立了法兰西联盟，旨在推广法国文化，重塑国家形象。第一次世界大战期间，美国政府组织巡回展览，并游说好莱坞拍摄展现美国正面形象的电影。60

Classical diplomacy, sometimes called “cabinet diplomacy,” involved messages sent from one ruler to another, often in confidential communications. In terms of the first model in Figure 4.3, government A communicated directly with government B. But governments also found it useful to communicate with the publics of other countries in an effort to influence other governments through the indirect model in Figure 4.3. That indirect form of diplomacy became known as public diplomacy. Efforts to affect the publics of other countries have long roots. After the French Revolution, the new French government sent agents to America to try to directly affect public opinion. In the late nineteenth century, after France’s defeat in the Franco-Prussian War, the French government created the Alliance Française to popularize its culture and restore national prestige. During World War I, the American government organized tours and persuaded Hollywood to make films that portrayed the United States in a positive light.60

图 4.3两种外交模式

FIGURE 4.3 Two Models of Diplomacy

图例：G = 政府；S = 社会；10 = 国际组织。

Key: G = government; S = society; 10 = international organization.

随着无线电技术的出现，广播在20世纪20年代成为公共外交的主导模式。英国广播公司（BBC）成立于1922年，而极权政府在20世纪30年代完善了宣传广播和电影的形式。广播至今仍然重要，但在互联网和廉价航空旅行的时代，随着政府间组织和跨国组织的兴起，权力从国家层面向其他领域分散，使得公共外交变得更加复杂。沟通渠道不再是两国政府之间的一条直线，而更像是一个星形，其中包含了政府、公众、社会和非政府组织之间的各种联系。

With the new technology of radio, broadcasting became the dominant model of public diplomacy in the 1920s. The BBC was founded in 1922, and the totalitarian governments perfected the form of propaganda broadcasts and films in the 1930s. Broadcasting remains important to this day, but in the age of the Internet and inexpensive air travel, and with the development of intergovernmental and transnational organizations, the diffusion of power away from states has made public diplomacy more complex. The lines of communication are no longer a straight bar between two governments, but more like a star that includes lines among governments, publics, societies, and nongovernmental organizations.

在这样的世界里，除政府之外的其他行为体也完全有能力运用软实力。A政府会试图影响公众舆论。社会B中的跨国组织也会发起信息宣传活动，以影响A国政府以及B国政府。他们利用公开点名批评的方式影响其他政府，并向大型企业等其他非政府组织施压。有时，他们还会通过政府间组织开展工作。其结果是，政府、政府间组织和非政府组织之间形成新的混合联盟，各自利用公共外交来实现自身目标。例如，国际禁止地雷运动联合了加拿大和挪威等较小的政府，以及一位佛蒙特州活动家建立的网络，并借助戴安娜王妃的公众影响力，最终击败了世界唯一超级大国中最强大的官僚机构（五角大楼）。

In such a world, actors other than governments are well placed to use soft power. Government A will try to influence the public in society B, but transnational organizations in society B will also wage information campaigns to influence government A as well as government B. They use campaigns of naming and shaming to influence other governments as well as to put pressure on other nongovernmental actors such as large corporations. Sometimes they will also work through intergovernmental organizations. The result is a new set of mixed coalitions of governmental, intergovernmental, and nongovernmental actors each using public diplomacy for its own goals. For example, the International Campaign to Ban Landmines allied smaller governments, such as Canada and Norway, along with networks created by an activist in Vermont, and the public fame of Princess Diana to defeat the strongest bureaucracy (the Pentagon) in the world’s only superpower.

各国政府试图利用公共外交来发挥软实力，如今面临着新的挑战。塑造国家形象并非新鲜事，但近年来，构建软实力的条件发生了翻天覆地的变化。首先，世界上近一半的国家如今都是民主国家。在这种情况下，旨在影响公众舆论的外交手段，其重要性堪比领导人之间传统的机密外交沟通。信息创造力量，而如今，世界上更多的人都能获取这种力量。技术进步大幅降低了信息处理和传输的成本。其结果是信息爆炸式增长，并由此产生了“信息过载悖论”。61.信息过载导致注意力稀缺。当人们被海量信息淹没时，很难知道该关注什么。注意力而非信息本身成为稀缺资源，那些能够从背景杂乱信息中甄别出有价值信息的人便会获得权力。提供线索的人变得更加抢手，这为那些能够告诉我们应该将注意力集中在哪里的人带来了权力。

Governments trying to utilize public diplomacy to wield soft power face new problems. Promoting attractive images of one’s country is not new, but the conditions for trying to create soft power have changed dramatically in recent years. For one thing, nearly half the countries in the world are now democracies. In such circumstances, diplomacy aimed at public opinion can become as important to outcomes as the traditional classified diplomatic communications among leaders. Information creates power, and today a much larger part of the world’s population has access to that power. Technological advances have led to a dramatic reduction in the cost of processing and transmitting information. The result is an explosion of information, and that has produced a “paradox of plenty.”61 Plentiful information leads to scarcity of attention. When people are overwhelmed with the volume of information confronting them, they have difficulty knowing what to focus on. Attention, rather than information, becomes the scarce resource, and those who can distinguish valuable information from background clutter gain power. Cue-givers become more in demand, and this is a source of power for those who can tell us where to focus our attention.

在编辑和信息提供者中，信誉是至关重要的资源，也是软实力的重要来源。声誉变得至关重要。如今，信誉比以往任何时候都更加重要，政治斗争也围绕着信誉的建立和丧失而展开。各国政府不仅要与其他政府争夺信誉，还要与包括新闻媒体、企业、非政府组织、政府间组织和科学界网络在内的各种其他机构和个人争夺信誉。

Among editors and cue-givers, credibility is the crucial resource and an important source of soft power. Reputation becomes even more important than in the past, and political struggles occur over the creation and destruction of credibility. Governments compete for credibility not only with other governments, but also with a broad range of alternatives, including news media, corporations, NGOs, intergovernmental organizations, and networks of scientific communities.

政治已演变成一场争夺信誉的较量。传统强权政治通常关乎哪一方的军事或经济实力胜出。正如前文所述，信息时代的政治“最终可能取决于谁的故事能最终胜出”。62.叙事成为软实力的通行货币。各国政府之间以及与其它组织之间展开竞争，以提升自身信誉并削弱对手的信誉。例如，塞尔维亚与北约就2000年事件的解读展开争夺，广播和互联网在其中发挥了关键作用；又如，2009年伊朗大选后政府与抗议者之间的博弈，互联网和推特在跨国传播中扮演了重要角色。

Politics has become a contest of competitive credibility. The world of traditional power politics is typically about whose military or economy wins. As noted earlier, politics in an information age “may ultimately be about whose story wins.”62 Narratives become the currency of soft power. Governments compete with each other and with other organizations to enhance their own credibility and weaken that of their opponents. Witness the struggle between Serbia and NATO to frame the interpretation of events in 2000 in which broadcasts and the Internet played a key role, or consider the contest between the government and protesters after the Iranian elections in 2009 in which the Internet and Twitter played important roles in transnational communication.

那些看似宣传的信息不仅可能遭到鄙视，而且如果损害了国家的信誉，还可能适得其反。夸大萨达姆·侯赛因拥有大规模杀伤性武器以及与基地组织有联系的说法，或许有助于动员国内民众支持伊拉克战争，但随后这些夸大之词的揭露却给英国和美国的信誉造成了沉重打击。在新的形势下，温和的推销方式可能比以往任何时候都更加有效，而非强硬的推销。英国广播公司（BBC）相对独立的运作方式，有时令英国政府感到不安，但却为其信誉带来了回报。坦桑尼亚总统贾卡亚·基奎特的日常作息便印证了这一点：“他黎明即起，收听BBC世界广播，然后浏览坦桑尼亚的报纸。”63

Information that appears to be propaganda may not only be scorned, but it may also turn out to be counterproductive if it undermines a country’s reputation for credibility. Exaggerated claims about Saddam Hussein’s weapons of mass destruction and ties to Al Qaeda may have helped mobilize domestic support for the Iraq War, but the subsequent disclosure of the exaggeration dealt a costly blow to British and American credibility. Under the new conditions more than ever, a soft sell may prove more effective than a hard sell. The relative independence of the BBC, sometimes to the consternation of British governments, has paid dividends in credibility as indicated by an account of how President Jakaya Kikwete of Tanzania spends his day: “He rises at dawn, listens to the BBC World Service, than scans the Tanzanian press.”63

那些将“公共外交”一词视为宣传委婉说法的怀疑论者忽略了这一点。单纯的宣传作为公共外交手段，其效果适得其反。公共外交也并非仅仅如此。公共关系活动。传递信息和塑造正面形象固然是其中的一部分，但公共外交还包括建立长期关系，从而为政府政策创造有利环境。64

Skeptics who treat the term “public diplomacy” as a mere euphemism for propaganda miss this point. Simple propaganda is counterproductive as public diplomacy. Nor is public diplomacy merely public relations campaigns. Conveying information and selling a positive image are part of it, but public diplomacy also involves building long-term relationships that create an enabling environment for government policies.64

政府直接信息与长期文化关系的结合，随着公共外交的三个同心圆或阶段而变化，这三个阶段都很重要。65第一个也是最直接的环节是日常沟通，包括解释国内外政策决策的背景。第一阶段还必须包括危机应对准备。在当今信息时代，许多行为体都会争相填补事件发生后可能出现的任何信息空白。公共外交的快速反应能力意味着可以立即驳斥虚假指控或误导性信息。这个环节的周期以小时、天和周来衡量。

The mix of direct government information to long-term cultural relationships varies with three concentric circles or stages of public diplomacy, and all three are important.65 The first and most immediate circle is daily communications, which involves explaining the context of domestic and foreign policy decisions. The first stage must also involve preparation for dealing with crises. In today’s information age, many actors will rush in to fill any vacuum in information that might occur after an event. A rapid response capability in public diplomacy means that false charges or misleading information can be answered immediately. This circle is measured in terms of hours, days, and weeks.

第二阶段或同心圆是战略传播，它像政治或广告宣传活动一样，围绕一系列简单的主题展开。第一阶段以小时和天来衡量，而第二阶段则持续数周、数月甚至数年。2010年上海世博会或南非世界杯等特殊活动都符合这一描述。南非总统雅各布·祖马曾将世界杯的巨额支出辩解为“我们这个时代最大的营销机会”。66公共外交活动策划象征性事件和沟通活动，以强化核心主题或推进特定政府政策。专题活动则侧重于特定的政策举措。例如，当里根政府决定执行北约的双轨决策——即在与苏联谈判撤走现有中程导弹的同时部署导弹——时，苏联随即发起了一场协调一致的运动，旨在影响欧洲舆论，使部署计划无法实施。正如前国务卿乔治·舒尔茨后来总结的那样：“我认为，如果没有积极的公共外交计划，我们不可能成功。因为苏联在整个1983年都非常活跃……和平时期。”我们采取了各种行动和措施，试图劝阻我们在欧洲的朋友们不要部署军队。”67

The second stage or concentric circle is strategic communication, which develops a set of simple themes much as a political or advertising campaign does. Whereas the first dimension is measured in hours and days, the second occurs over weeks, months, and even years. Special events such as the Shanghai Exposition of 2010 or the World Cup in South Africa fit this description. President Jacob Zuma justified the expenditures on the World Cup as “the greatest marketing opportunity of our time.”66 A public diplomacy campaign plans symbolic events and communications to reinforce central themes or to advance a particular government policy. Special themes focus on particular policy initiatives. For example, when the Reagan administration decided to implement NATO’s two-track decision of deploying missiles while negotiating to remove existing Soviet intermediate range missiles, the Soviet Union responded with a concerted campaign to influence European opinion and make the deployment impossible. As former secretary of state George Schultz later concluded, “I don’t think we could have pulled it off if it hadn’t been for a very active program of public diplomacy. Because the Soviets were very active all through 1983 . . . with peace movements and all kinds of efforts to dissuade our friends in Europe from deploying.”67

公共外交的第三个也是范围最广的阶段，是通过奖学金、交流、培训、研讨会、会议以及媒体渠道等方式，与关键人物建立多年甚至数十年的持久关系。多年来，约有70万人参与了美国的文化和学术交流项目，这些交流培养了安瓦尔·萨达特、赫尔穆特·施密特和玛格丽特·撒切尔等世界领导人。其他国家也有类似的计划。例如，日本设立了一个交流项目，每年从40个国家引进6000名外国青年到日本学校教授他们的语言，并成立了校友会来维系彼此间建立的友谊。68这些项目发展了爱德华·R·默罗曾经称之为至关重要的“最后三英尺”——面对面的交流，这是一个双向过程，其特点是互惠互利带来的增强的可信度。

The third and broadest circle or stage of public diplomacy is the development of lasting relationships with key individuals over many years or even decades through scholarships, exchanges, training, seminars, conferences, and access to media channels. Over time, about 700,000 people have participated in American cultural and academic exchanges, and these exchanges helped to educate such world leaders as Anwar Sadat, Helmut Schmidt, and Margaret Thatcher. Other countries have similar programs. For example, Japan has developed an exchange program bringing 6,000 young foreigners each year from forty countries to teach their languages in Japanese schools, with an alumni association to maintain the bonds of friendship that are developed.68 These programs develop what Edward R. Murrow once called the crucial “last three feet”— face-to-face communications that are a two-way process characterized by the enhanced credibility that reciprocity creates.

公共外交的这三个阶段都发挥着重要作用，帮助政府塑造国家形象，从而提高实现预期目标的可能性。但即使是最好的广告也无法推销不受欢迎的产品。如果传播策略与政策背道而驰，就无法奏效。行动胜于雄辩，那些看似只是为了展现强权而粉饰太平的公共外交不太可能成功。阿布格莱布和关塔那摩监狱对待囚犯的方式与美国价值观不符，导致人们对美国虚伪的印象，即使播放穆斯林在美国生活美满的画面也无法扭转这种印象。事实上，美国卫星电视台“自由电视台”（Al Hurrah）精良的制作水平并没有使其在中东地区获得竞争力，反而被广泛视为政府宣传的工具。政策制定者常常把公共外交当作一种权宜之计，只有在其他手段造成损害之后才能使用。例如，当一位主张轰炸伊朗的人被问及……他表示，攻击伊朗是否会导致伊朗反对派团结在政权周围，这不会是个问题，因为要避免这种情况，只需要开展一场配套的公共外交活动即可。69

Each of these three stages of public diplomacy plays an important role in helping governments to create an attractive image of a country that can improve its prospects for obtaining its desired outcomes. But even the best advertising cannot sell an unpopular product. A communications strategy cannot work if it cuts against the grain of policy. Actions speak louder than words, and public diplomacy that appears to be mere window dressing for hard power projection is unlikely to succeed. The treatment of prisoners at Abu Ghraib and Guantánamo in a manner inconsistent with American values led to perceptions of hypocrisy that could not be reversed by broadcasting pictures of Muslims living well in America. In fact, the slick production values of the American satellite television station Al Hurrah did not make it competitive in the Middle East, where it was widely regarded as an instrument of government propaganda. All too often, policymakers treat public diplomacy as a bandage that can be applied after damage is done by other instruments. For example, when one advocate of bombing Iran was asked whether attacking Iran might cause the opposition there to coalesce around the regime, he said that wouldn’t be a problem because all that would be needed to avoid such an outcome was an accompanying public diplomacy campaign.69

在信息时代的新形势下，软性宣传比以往任何时候都更加有效，远胜于硬性宣传。如果缺乏基本的国家信誉，公共外交手段就无法将文化资源转化为吸引人的软实力。公共外交的成效取决于人们观念的转变（如访谈或民意调查所示），而非投入的资金或制作的精美宣传片。当美国国会询问国防部长盖茨2010年的战略沟通预算时，“没有人能给出确切答案，因为当时没有中央沟通部门。最初的答复是10亿美元，但后来改为6.26亿美元。” 许多此类行动“过去都由国务院公共外交部门负责”。70

Under the new conditions of the information age, more than ever the soft sell proves more effective than the hard sell. Without underlying national credibility, the instruments of public diplomacy cannot translate cultural resources into the soft power of attraction. The effectiveness of public diplomacy is measured by minds changed (as shown in interviews or polls), not dollars spent or slick production packages produced. When the U.S. Congress asked Secretary of Defense Gates about the 2010 budget for strategic communications, “no one could say because there was no central communication. The first answer came back at $1 billion, but that was later changed to $626 million.” Many of these operations “in the past had been in the purview of the State Department’s public diplomacy section.”70

批评人士担心，外交政策过度军事化会削弱其公信力。有人抱怨说，“让军方负责战略沟通……就好比让援助人员指挥空袭，或者让外交官管理野战医院。”另一些人则认为，真正需要的是一种“强化版”公共外交，其人员应接受过新媒体、跨文化沟通、细致入微的本地知识以及与弱势群体建立联系网络等方面的培训。71

Critics worry that the overmilitarization of foreign policy undercuts credibility. One complains that “tasking the military with strategic communications . . . is somewhat akin to asking an aid worker to direct an air strike, or a diplomat to run a field hospital.” Others argue that what is needed is a new public diplomacy “on steroids” staffed by diplomats trained in new media, cross-cultural communications, granular local knowledge, and networks of contacts with underrepresented groups.71

集中式的大众传媒公共外交方式仍然发挥着重要作用。各国政府需要纠正日常政策解读中的误解，同时也要努力传达更长远的战略信息。大众传媒方式的主要优势在于其受众覆盖面广，能够提升公众意识并设定议程。然而，其弱点在于无法影响信息在不同文化背景下的解读。信息发送者知道自己说了什么，但未必知道目标受众听到了什么。文化差异往往会扭曲信息的传递。

The centralized mass media approach to public diplomacy still plays an important role. Governments need to correct daily misrepresentations of their policies as well as try to convey a longer-term strategic message. The main strength of the mass media approach is its audience reach and ability to generate public awareness and set the agenda. But the inability to influence how the message is perceived in different cultural settings is its weak point. The sender knows what she says, but not always what the target(s) hears. Cultural barriers are apt to distort what is heard.

相比之下，网络化通信可以利用双向沟通和点对点关系来克服文化差异。它并非像传统方式那样，由中心统一设计并跨文化传播信息，“网络首先建立起有效沟通渠道的结构和动态，然后成员协作共同构建信息。由于信息或故事是跨文化共同创造的，因此它不受文化限制……文化不再是障碍或阻碍，而是融入到网络动态之中。”72鉴于政府的中央问责制结构，这种类型的权力下放和灵活性对于政府来说很难实现。

Networked communications, in contrast, can take advantage of two-way communications and peer-to-peer relations to overcome cultural differences. Rather than a central design and broadcast of a message across cultural boundaries, “networks first establish the structure and dynamics for effective communications channels, then members collaborate to craft the message. Because the message or story is co-created across cultures, it is not culture-bound. . . . Rather than being a barrier or impediment, culture is incorporated into network dynamics.”72 This type of decentralization and flexibility is difficult for governments to accomplish, given their central accountability structures.

非政府组织在运用网络方面更大的灵活性催生了所谓的“新公共外交”，这种外交“不再局限于信息传递、宣传活动，甚至不再局限于为外交政策目的而进行的政府与外国公众的直接接触。它还包括与他国的公民社会行动者建立关系，以及促进国内外非政府组织之间的网络建设。”73在这种公共外交模式下，政府政策旨在促进​​和参与跨境网络，而非控制这些网络。事实上，政府过度控制，甚至仅仅是控制的假象，都会削弱此类网络旨在建立的公信力。公共外交从单向沟通向双向对话模式的演变，将公众视为意义和沟通的共创者。74

The greater flexibility of NGOs in using networks has given rise to what some call “the new public diplomacy,” which is “no longer confined to messaging, promotion campaigns, or even direct governmental contacts with foreign publics serving foreign policy purposes. It is also about building relationships with civil society actors in other countries and about facilitating networks between non-governmental parties at home and abroad.”73 In this approach to public diplomacy, government policy is aimed at promoting and participating in, rather than controlling, such networks across borders. Indeed, too much government control or even the appearance thereof can undercut the credibility that such networks are designed to engender. The evolution of public diplomacy from one-way communications to a two-way dialogue model treats publics as peer-to-peer cocreators of meaning and communication.74

政府要想在新兴的公共外交网络化世界中取得成功，就必须学会放弃相当一部分控制权。但这会带来一个风险：非政府公民社会行为体的目标往往与政府政策甚至目标不一致。政府可以利用社交网络的新技术，例如授权员工使用Facebook和Twitter等社交媒体平台。75他们甚至可能采取较为宽松的管控方式，但当网络中的某个节点拥有官方标签时，他们很少愿意完全放任不管。例如，在民主国家，这种情况就太少见了。反对党议员很容易就外交部工作人员不忠诚或无能，未能维护国家形象和国家利益的问题进行抨击。同样的批评也针对国内非政府组织，特别是那些能够获得政府设施或支持的非政府组织。

For governments to succeed in the networked world of the new public diplomacy, they are going to have to learn to relinquish a good deal of their control, and this runs the risk that nongovernmental civil society actors are often not aligned in their goals with government policies or even objectives. Governments can take advantage of new technologies of social networking with employees licensed to use Facebook and Twitter.75 They may even use a loose rein, but they rarely are willing to allow free rein when one node of a network has an official label. In democracies, for example, it is too easy for opposition parliamentarians to score points about disloyal or ineffective foreign ministry employees failing to protect the national message and national interest. The same criticisms are leveled at home-domiciled nongovernmental actors, particularly if they have access to government facilities or support.

新公共外交在国内政治上的确存在问题，但其国际影响可能是有益的。异议和自我批评的存在很可能增强信息的公信力，并提升社会对包容异议者的吸引力。批评政府政策对政府而言可能颇为尴尬，但它也能使社会形象更具吸引力，从而有助于软实力的构建。在全球信息时代，利用公共外交来构建软实力的悖论在于，权力下放和控制权的削弱或许正是软实力构建的关键所在。

The domestic political problem of the new public diplomacy is real, but the international effects can be beneficial. The presence of dissent and self-criticism is likely to enhance the credibility of messages, as well as create a degree of attraction to the society that is willing to tolerate dissent. Criticism of government policies can be awkward for a government, but it can also cast a society in a more attractive light and thus help to create soft power. The paradox of using public diplomacy to generate soft power in a global information age is that decentralization and diminished control may be central to the creation of soft power.

随着公共外交更多地由公众主导，各国政府发现自己陷入了控制的困境。像2010年威胁焚烧《古兰经》的佛罗里达州牧师那样的不守规矩的公民，可能会破坏软实力。然而，尽管新的公共外交对民主国家来说可能充满挑战，但对中国等专制国家的国际关系而言，挑战可能更大。正如一位观察家所指出的，“如果真正的软实力来自社会而非政府，那么中国政府将继续压制其许多最具创造力和多样性的群体，而中国的人权记录、政治体制、经济实力以及日益增长的军事力量，都将继续对其国际形象产生负面影响。”76运用软实力很重要，但并不总是容易的，尤其是在网络时代。

As public diplomacy is done more by publics, governments find themselves caught in a dilemma about control. Unruly citizens like the Florida pastor who threatened to burn the Koran in 2010 can destroy soft power. But difficult though the new public diplomacy may be for democracies, it is likely to be even more difficult for the international relations of autocracies such as China. As one observer notes, if “real soft power comes from a society, not from government, China’s government continues to muzzle many of its most creative and diverse elements, while China’s human rights record, its political system, economic strength, and growing military power all continue to negatively afflict its image abroad.”76 Wielding soft power is important, but it is not always easy, particularly in a cyberage.

第二部分

PART II

权力转移：扩散与过渡

POWER SHIFTS: DIFFUSION AND TRANSITIONS

第五章

CHAPTER 5

扩散与网络力量

Diffusion and Cyberpower

本世纪正在发生两种类型的权力转移：权力转移和权力扩散。权力从一个主导国家转移到另一个主导国家是一个常见的历史事件，但权力扩散则是一个更为新颖的过程。在当今全球信息时代，所有国家都面临着一个共同的问题：越来越多的事情超出了即使是最强大的国家的控制范围。正如一位前国务院政策规划主任所言，“信息的扩散与武器的扩散一样，都是导致权力格局非极化的原因。”正如一位英国分析人士所说：“我们面临着越来越多的风险、威胁和挑战，这些风险、威胁和挑战影响着一个国家的人民，但主要或完全源于其他国家……金融危机、有组织犯罪、大规模移民、全球变暖、流行病和国际恐怖主义，仅举几例……造成这种困境的主要原因之一是权力在纵向和横向上都已分散。我们与其说是一个多极世界，不如说是一个无极世界。”2

Two types of power shifts are occurring in this century: power transition and power diffusion. Power transition from one dominant state to another is a familiar historical event, but power diffusion is a more novel process. The problem for all states in today’s global information age is that more things are happening outside the control of even the most powerful states. In the words of a former State Department director of policy planning, “The proliferation of information is as much a cause of nonpolarity as is the proliferation of weaponry.”1 Or as one British analyst puts it, “We face more and more risks, threats and challenges that affect people in one country but originate mainly or entirely in the other countries . . . financial crisis, organized crime, mass migration, global warming, pandemics and international terrorism, to name but a few. . . . One of the main reasons for the difficulty is that power has been diffused both vertically and horizontally. We have not so much a multi-polar world as a no-polar world.”2

一些观察人士对这一趋势表示欢迎，认为这标志着自那时以来一直主导全球机构的主权国家走向衰落。1648年的《威斯特伐利亚和约》预言，信息革命将扁平化官僚层级，代之以网络组织。更多政府职能将由私营市场和非营利组织承担。随着虚拟社区在互联网上的发展，它们将跨越地域管辖，并形成自身的治理模式。国家在人们生活中的重要性将大大降低。人们将遵循多重自愿契约生活，只需点击鼠标即可自由加入和退出不同的社区。这种跨领域的社区和治理新模式，将成为现代国家兴起之前封建世界的现代文明版本。3

Some observers welcome this trend as marking the decline of the sovereign state that has been the dominant global institutions since the Peace of Westphalia in 1648. They predict that the Information Revolution will flatten bureaucratic hierarchies and replace them with network organizations. More governmental functions will be handled by private markets as well as by nonprofit entities. As virtual communities develop on the Internet, they will cut across territorial jurisdictions and develop their own patterns of governance. States will become much less central to people’s lives. People will live by multiple voluntary contracts and drop in and out of communities at the click of a mouse. The new pattern of crosscutting communities and governance will become a modern and more civilized analog to the feudal world that existed before the rise of the modern state.3

信息革命

INFORMATION REVOLUTION

此类极端网络变革目前仍属设想，但一场新的信息革命正在改变权力的本质，并扩大其扩散范围。国家仍将是世界舞台上的主导力量，但它们会发现舞台更加拥挤，也更难掌控。无论是在国家内部还是在国家之间，更大比例的人口都能获取信息所带来的力量。各国政府历来都关注信息的流动和控制，而当前时期并非首次受到信息技术剧变的深刻影响。

Such extreme cybertransformations are still fanciful, but a new information revolution is changing the nature of power and increasing its diffusion. States will remain the dominant actor on the world stage, but they will find the stage far more crowded and difficult to control. A much larger part of the population both within and among countries has access to the power that comes from information. Governments have always worried about the flow and control of information, and the current period is not the first to be strongly affected by dramatic changes in information technology.

当前的信息革命，有时也被称为“第三次工业革命”，其基础是计算机、通信和软件领域的快速技术进步，这些进步反过来又导致信息创建、处理、传输和检索成本的大幅下降。计算能力在三十年间每十八个月翻一番，到二十一世纪初，其成本仅为二十世纪七十年代初的千分之一。如果汽车价格的下降速度与半导体价格的下降速度一样快，那么一辆汽车的价格将降至5美元。

The current Information Revolution, sometimes called “the Third Industrial Revolution,” is based on rapid technological advances in computers, communications, and software that in turn have led to dramatic decreases in the cost of creating, processing and transmitting, and searching for information. Computing power doubled every eighteen months for thirty years, and by the beginning of the twenty-first century it cost one-thousandth of what it had in the early 1970s. If the price of automobiles had fallen as quickly as the price of semiconductors, a car would cost $5.

1993年，全球约有50个网站；到2000年，这个数字已经超过500万。十年后，仅中国就拥有超过500万个网站。互联网用户超过4亿，社交网络Facebook的用户更是高达约5000万亿。通信带宽正在飞速扩展，通信成本的下降速度甚至超过了计算能力的下降速度。就在1980年，通过铜线传输的电话每秒只能传输1页信息；而如今，一根细光纤每秒就能传输9万卷信息。1980年，1GB的存储空间需要占用一个房间；而现在，200GB的存储空间就能装进你的衬衫口袋。数字信息量每五年增长十倍。4

In 1993, there were about 50 Websites in the world; by 2000, that number had surpassed 5 million. A decade later, China alone had over 400 million Internet users and the social network Facebook has some half a trillion users. Communications bandwidths are expanding rapidly, and communications costs continue to fall even more rapidly than computing power. As recently as 1980, phone calls over copper wire could carry only 1 page of information per second; today a thin strand of optical fiber can transmit 90,000 volumes in a second. In 1980, 1 gigabyte of storage occupied a room; now 200 gigabytes of storage fit in your shirt pocket. The amount of digital information increases tenfold every five years.4

这场信息革命的关键特征并非富人和权贵之间沟通的速度：130多年来，欧洲和北美之间一直可以通过电报进行即时通讯。关键的变化在于信息传输成本的大幅降低。实际上，实际传输成本几乎可以忽略不计；因此，全球可传输的信息量几乎是无限的。其结果是信息爆炸式增长，而纸质文档仅占其中极小一部分。据估计，仅在2006年，就创建和存储了1610亿GB的数字信息（这大约是所有已出版书籍信息量的300万倍）。预计到2010年，数字信息的年增长率将增长六倍以上，达到9880亿GB。21世纪初，计算机用户每年发送的电子邮件数量约为25万亿封。到2010年，全球每年产生的所有信息中，70%来自电子邮件、在线视频和万维网。计算机和通信相关技术的这种巨大变化正在改变政府的性质，并加速权力的扩散。

The key characteristic of this Information Revolution is not the speed of communications between the wealthy and powerful: For more than 130 years, instantaneous communication by telegraph has been possible between Europe and North America. The crucial change is the enormous reduction in the cost of transmitting information. For all practical purposes, the actual transmission costs have become negligible; hence, the amount of information that can be transmitted worldwide is virtually infinite. The result is an explosion of information, of which documents are a tiny fraction. By one estimate, 161 billion gigabytes of digital information were created and captured in the year 2006 alone (that is about 3 million times the information in all the books ever written). In 2010, the annual growth in digital information is expected to increase more than sixfold to 988 billion gigabytes. At the beginning of the twenty-first century, computer users sent roughly 25 trillion e-mail messages per year. By 2010, 70 percent of all information generated every year in the world came from e-mails, online videos, and the World Wide Web. This dramatic change in the linked technologies of computing and communications is changing the nature of government and accelerating a diffusion of power.

二十世纪中叶，人们担心当前信息革命带来的计算机和通信技术会像乔治·奥威尔的反乌托邦小说《1984》中描绘的那样，催生出中央政府的全面控制。大型计算机似乎注定会强化中央计划，并增强金字塔顶端那些掌控一切者的监视权力。电视将主导新闻报道。通过中央数据库，计算机可以使政府的身份识别和监控更加便捷。

In the middle of the twentieth century, people feared that the computers and communications of the current Information Revolution would create the central government control dramatized in George Orwell’s dystopian novel 1984. Mainframe computers seemed set to enhance central planning and increase the surveillance powers of those at the top of a pyramid of control. Government television would dominate the news. Through central databases, computers could make government identification and surveillance easier.

相反，随着计算成本的降低和计算机体积缩小到智能手机和其他便携式设备的大小，其分散化效应已经超过了集中化效应。如今，信息控制权的分布比几十年前要广泛得多。与受编辑和广播公司控制的广播、电视和报纸相比，互联网创造了无限的通信方式：一对一（通过电子邮件）、一对多（通过个人主页、博客或推特）、多对一（例如维基百科），以及或许最为重要的多对多（例如在线聊天室或Facebook、LinkedIn等社交网站）。将这些新方法与以往的通信方式进行比较，我们可以看到，区别在于“互联网信息能够传播得更远、更快，而且中间环节更少”。5信息往往可以成为关键的力量资源，而且越来越多的人比以往任何时候都更容易获得更多信息。

Instead, as computing power has decreased in cost and computers have shrunk to the size of smart phones and other portable devices, their decentralizing effects have outweighed their centralizing effects. Power over information is much more widely distributed today than even a few decades ago. Compared with radio, television, and newspapers controlled by editors and broadcasters, the Internet creates unlimited communication one to one (via e-mail), one to many (via a personal homepage, blog, or Twitter), many to one (such as Wikipedia), and, perhaps most importantly, many to many (as in online chat rooms or social networking sites such as Facebook or LinkedIn). Comparing these new methods to previous advances in communication, we can see the difference is that “internet messages have the capacity to flow farther, faster, and with fewer intermediaries.”5 Information can often provide a key power resource, and more people have access to more information than ever before.

这意味着世界政治将不再是各国政府的专属领域。随着计算和通信成本的降低，准入门槛也随之降低。从企业、非政府组织到恐怖组织，个人和私人组织都获得了在世界政治中扮演直接角色的能力。信息的传播意味着权力将更加分散，非正式网络将削弱传统官僚机构的垄断地位。互联网的快速发展意味着各国政府对其议程的控制力将有所下降。政治领导人在应对各种事件之前将拥有更少的自由度，并且一旦需要应对，他们将不得不与更多的参与者共同参与政治舞台。

What this means is that world politics will not be the sole province of governments. As the cost of computing and communication comes down, the barriers to entry decline. Both individuals and private organizations, ranging from corporations to NGOs to terrorists, are empowered to play direct roles in world politics. The spread of information means that power will be more widely distributed and informal networks will undercut the monopoly of traditional bureaucracy. The speed of Internet time means all governments have less control of their agendas. Political leaders will enjoy fewer degrees of freedom before they must respond to events, and then they will have to share the stage with more actors.

原则上，随着市场准入成本和壁垒的降低，信息革命应该削弱大国的权力，增强小国和非国家行为体的权力。但实际上，国际关系远比这种技术层面的复杂性要大得多。决定论意味着：信息革命的某些方面有利于小企业，而另一些方面则有利于已经强大而庞大的企业。规模仍然至关重要。经济学家所说的规模经济在与信息相关的某些权力领域依然存在。虽然黑客和政府都能创造信息并利用互联网，但对于许多目的而言，大型政府能够部署数万名训练有素的人员并拥有强大的计算能力来破解密码或入侵其他组织，这一点至关重要。就软实力而言，像好莱坞和宝莱坞这样的大型成熟娱乐产业在内容制作和发行方面享有显著的规模经济效益。此外，在信息经济中，存在着“网络效应”，即规模报酬递增。我们知道，一部电话毫无用处，但随着网络规模的扩大，下一部电话就会增加价值，以此类推。

In principle, as costs and barriers of entry into markets diminish, the Information Revolution should reduce the power of large states and enhance the power of small states and nonstate actors. But in practice, international relations are more complex than such technological determinism implies. Some aspects of the Information Revolution help the small; but some help the already large and powerful. Size still matters. What economists call economies of scale remain in some of the aspects of power that are related to information. Although a hacker and a government can both create information and exploit the Internet, it matters for many purposes that large governments can deploy tens of thousands of trained people and have vast computing power to crack codes or intrude into other organizations. In the case of soft power, large established entertainment industries like Hollywood and Bollywood enjoy considerable economies of scale in content production and distribution. Moreover, in the information economy, there are “network effects” with increasing returns to scale. As we know, one telephone is useless. The next adds value and so forth as the network grows.

此外，尽管传播现有信息成本不高，但收集和生产新信息往往需要大量投资。在许多竞争环境中，新信息至关重要。在某些情况下，信息是一种非竞争性公共产品：一个人的消费不会减少另一个人的消费。托马斯·杰斐逊曾用蜡烛作比喻：如果我给你一盏灯，我的灯并不会减少。但在竞争环境中，如果我先掌握了信息，比你更早看到情况，可能会产生巨大的影响。情报收集就是一个很好的例子。美国、俄罗斯、英国、中国和法国在情报收集和生产方面的能力远超大多数国家。

In addition, even though the dissemination of existing information doesn’t cost much, the collection and production of new information often require major investment. In many competitive situations, new information matters most. In some situations, information is a nonrival public good: One person’s consumption does not diminish that of another. Thomas Jefferson used the analogy of a candle: If I give you a light, it does not diminish my light. But in a competitive situation, it may make a big difference if I have the light first and see things before you do. Intelligence collection is a good example. America, Russia, Britain, China, and France have capabilities for collection and production of intelligence that dwarf those of most states.

正如我们在第二章中所看到的，军事力量在全球政治的关键领域仍然至关重要。信息技术对武力使用的影响既有有利于弱小国家的影响，也有有利于强国的影响。它是一把双刃剑。过去昂贵的军事技术如今可以现成地商业化，这有利于小国和非政府组织，但也增加了大国的脆弱性。例如，如今任何人都可以从商业公司订购卫星图像，或者直接使用谷歌搜索。地球监测软件可以以极低的成本甚至免费获取其他国家的动态。曾经只有军方才能使用的全球定位设备（GPS）如今已在商店里随处可见。此外，信息系统也为富裕国家带来了安全隐患，因为它们为恐怖组织提供了有利可图且易于攻击的目标。像维基解密这样的非政府组织收集并传播敏感信息，使军事行动更加复杂。可以想象，一个老练的对手（例如拥有网络战资源的小国）可能会认为它可以勒索大国。此外，还存在国家支持的“自由职业者”或“私人”网络攻击的可能性。

As we saw in Chapter 2, military power remains important in critical domains of global politics. Information technology has some effects on the use of force that benefit the small and some that favor the already powerful. It is a double-edged sword. Off-the-shelf commercial availability of formerly costly military technologies benefits small states and nongovernmental actors and increases the vulnerability of large states. For example, today anyone can order satellite images from commercial companies or simply use Google Earth software to see what goes on in other countries at little or no cost.
