网络恐怖主义和非国家行为体更难防范。正如我们所见，网络攻击目前并非恐怖分子最具吸引力的攻击手段，但随着未来几年恐怖组织不断提升其对基础设施造成巨大破坏的能力，这种诱惑将日益增长。由于溯源难度加大，诸如先发制人和人工情报等防御措施将变得至关重要。从更根本的层面来看，许多专家认为，长远的解决方案在于对互联网进行改造，使其更难遭受此类攻击。目前的互联网架构过于注重易用性而非安全性。一种方法是通过降低某些敏感国家基础设施与互联网的连接度来减少其脆弱性。一些专家建议，应为关键基础设施（例如金融和电力）的私有所有者提供特殊的“自愿加入”激励措施，鼓励他们加入安全系统，而不是依赖于互联网。开放的互联网（对于那些风险较低且愿意承受更大风险的人来说，它将继续存在）。

Cyberterrorism and nonstate actors are harder to deter. As we have seen, cyberattacks are not the most attractive route for terrorists today, but as groups develop their capacity to inflict great damage against infrastructure over the coming years, the temptation will grow. Because attribution will be difficult, improved defenses such as preemption and human intelligence become important. At a more fundamental level, many experts believe that the long-term solution is a program to reengineer the Internet to make such attacks more difficult than under today’s structure, which emphasizes ease of use rather than security. One approach is to reduce the vulnerability of some sensitive aspects of the national infrastructure by reducing their connectivity to the Internet. Some suggest special “opt-in” incentives for private owners of critical infrastructure (e.g., finance and electricity) to join secure systems rather than rely on the open Internet (which would continue to exist for those with lower stakes and a willingness to tolerate greater risks).

网络犯罪也可以通过类似的措施来减少，例如增加某些系统的访问难度。此外，或许可以发展一定程度的国际合作来限制网络犯罪，类似于过去打击海盗的努力。过去，许多政府都乐于容忍一些海盗，甚至包租私掠船（直到1856年《巴黎宣言》的签署），而如今一些政府对网络犯罪的态度也类似。例如，俄罗斯和中国拒绝签署已有30多个国家签署的《欧洲委员会网络犯罪公约》。但如果成本超过收益，他们的态度可能会随着时间推移而改变。例如，“俄罗斯网络犯罪分子在攻击本国目标时不再遵守放任自流的原则，而俄罗斯当局也开始放弃放任政策。”77虽然该公约的直接前景并不乐观，但可以设想，一些有意愿的人组成联盟，制定更高的标准，共同努力提高违反新兴规范者的成本，就像金融洗钱法规或防扩散安全倡议那样。

Cybercrime can also be reduced by similar approaches that make access to some systems more difficult than they are today. In addition, it may be possible to develop degrees of international cooperation to limit cybercrime that are analogous to efforts to discourage piracy in an earlier era. At one time, many governments found it convenient to tolerate some pirates and even charter privateers (until the Declaration of Paris in 1856), and today some governments have similar attitudes toward crime on the Internet. Russia and China, for example, have refused to sign the Council of Europe Convention on Cyber Crime, which has been signed by more than thirty countries. But their attitudes may change over time if costs exceed benefits. For example, “Russian cyber-criminals no longer follow hands-off rules when it comes to motherland targets, and Russian authorities are beginning to drop the laisser faire policy.”77 Although the immediate prospects for the convention are not promising, it is possible to imagine coalitions of the willing that set a higher standard and work together to raise the costs for those who violate an emergent norm, much as occurs with financial money-laundering regulations or the proliferation security initiative.

除非各国采取新的应对措施，否则网络间谍活动很可能持续不断。间谍活动与人类历史一样悠久，并不违反任何明确的国际法条款。尽管如此，各国政府有时会制定限制间谍活动的规则，并采取以牙还牙的报复措施，以激励合作。实验表明，在囚徒困境博弈和公共物品博弈中，参与者可以通过长期反复博弈来发展合作关系。78尽管很难设想各国政府达成协议，禁止从事间谍活动，从而形成具有法律效力的条约，但可以设想通过一系列的迭代（以牙还牙）来制定规则，从而在实践中限制损害。正如美国网络安全负责人霍华德·施密特所说：“关键在于……”回到疑似病毒来源国，告诉他们：如果不是你们造成的，你们就需要调查此事。”79.不予回应可能导致有针对性的报复。根据国际法原则，即使政府并非造成损害的幕后黑手，也可以针对源自该国的损害采取相称的反制措施。尽管并非完美无缺，但可以通过追究国家对其主权范围内行为的责任来应对非国家行为体。为避免局势升级或“背叛锁定”，提供援助并开展讨论有助于形成共同认知，即便无法达成完全一致的规范。这种“学习”在网络领域仍处于起步阶段，类似于20世纪50年代初核时代的情况。80

Internet espionage is likely to continue unabated unless there are new state approaches. Spying is as old as human history and does not violate any explicit provisions of international law. Nonetheless, at times governments have established rules of the road for limiting espionage and engaged in patterns of tit-for-tat retaliation to create an incentive for cooperation. Experiments have shown that partners in prisoner’s dilemma and public goods games can develop cooperation in repeated play over extended periods.78 Even though it is difficult to envisage enforceable treaties in which governments agree not to engage in espionage, it is plausible to imagine a process of iterations (tit for tat) that develops rules of the road that could limit damage in practical terms. In the words of Howard Schmidt, the American cybersecurity chief, “One of the key things has been going back to the countries that it appears it’s coming from and saying: if it’s not you, you need to investigate this.”79 Failure to respond can be followed by measured retaliation. Under international legal doctrine, proportionate countermeasures can be taken in response to harm originating from a state even if the government is not behind that harm. Although less than perfect, efforts can be made to deal with nonstate actors by holding states responsible for actions that originate within their sovereign boundaries. To avoid escalation or “defection lock-in,” it helps to offer assistance and to engage in discussions that can develop common perceptions, if not fully agreed norms. Such “learning” is still at an early stage in the cyberdomain, analogous to what took place in the nuclear era in the early 1950s.80

现阶段，如果没有核查能力，大规模军控条约似乎没有希望达成，尽管达成一些范围较小的协议是可能的。81在2000年代，联合国大会通过了一系列决议，谴责网络犯罪活动，并强调各国政府可以采取的防御措施。同期，俄罗斯寻求一项条约，以扩大国际社会对互联网的监管，禁止欺骗行为或嵌入恶意代码或电路，这些代码或电路可能在战争时期被激活。但美国方面认为，禁止攻击行为的措施可能会削弱对当前攻击的防御能力，而且难以核实或执行。此外，美国一直反对任何可能使专制政府审查互联网合法化的协议。尽管如此，美国已开始与俄罗斯进行非正式磋商。82即使是信息作战国际法的倡导者，也对类似于日内瓦公约的多边条约持怀疑态度，认为该条约可能包含精确而详细的规则，因为未来的技术不稳定。但他们认为，志同道合的国家可以宣布自治规则，这些规则可以形成未来的规范。83

At this stage, large-scale arms control treaties do not seem promising without a capacity for verification, though more limited agreements may be possible.81 During the 2000s, the UN General Assembly passed a series of resolutions condemning criminal activity and drawing attention to defensive measures that governments can take. During that same period, Russia sought a treaty for broader international oversight of the Internet, banning deception or the embedding of malicious code or circuitry that could be activated in the event of war. But Americans have argued that measures banning offense can damage defense against current attacks and would be impossible to verify or enforce. Moreover, the United States has resisted agreements that could legitimize authoritarian governments’ censorship of the Internet. Nonetheless, the United States has begun informal discussions with Russia.82 Even advocates for an international law for information operations are skeptical of a multilateral treaty akin to the Geneva Conventions that could contain precise and detailed rules given future technological volatility, but they argue that like-minded states could announce self-governing rules that could form norms for the future.83

规范上的差异使得就互联网内容监管达成任何广泛协议都变得困难。正如我们之前看到的，美国呼吁建立“行为规范”。各国都在“鼓励尊重全球网络公共领域”，但正如杰克·戈德史密斯所言，“即便我们能够阻止所有来自本国的网络攻击，我们也不想这样做。在私人领域，黑客行动主义可以成为一种解放的工具。在公共领域，对关键计算机系统最好的防御有时就是有效的进攻。”84从美国的角度来看，推特和YouTube关乎个人自由；而从北京或德黑兰的角度来看，它们却是攻击工具。即使在儿童色情问题上，尽管谴责的规范已基本达成共识，各国政府也更倾向于单方面实施国家过滤技术，而不是向服务提供商发出下架通知，并依赖托管国的法律诉讼。例如，澳大利亚针对犯罪内容实施的互联网过滤措施，是所有成熟民主国家中最严格的之一。85自助仍然是主流规范。

Normative differences present a difficulty in reaching any broad agreements on regulating content on the Internet. As we saw earlier, the United States has called for the creation of “norms of behavior among states” that “encourage respect for the global networked commons,” but as Jack Goldsmith argues, “even if we could stop all cyber attacks from our soil, we wouldn’t want to. On the private side, hacktivism can be a tool of liberation. On the public side, the best defense of critical computer systems is sometimes a good offense.”84 From the American point of view, Twitter and YouTube are matters of personal freedom; seen from Beijing or Tehran, they are instruments of attack. Even on the issue of child pornography, where norms of condemnation are broadly shared, governments are more likely to unilaterally institute national filtering technologies rather than issuing a take-down notice to the service provider and relying on legal prosecution by the hosting state. For example, Australia has imposed some of the toughest Internet filters regarding crime that have been proposed by any established democracy.85 Self-help remains the dominant norm.

网络空间既是一个全新的、又充满变数的人造环境。网络空间的特性缩小了不同行为体之间的一些权力差距，从而很好地体现了本世纪全球政治中典型的权力扩散现象。最大的强国不太可能像在其他领域（例如海洋或空中）那样主导网络空间。但网络空间也表明，权力扩散并不意味着权力平等，也不意味着政府取代政府成为世界政治中最有影响力的行为体。即使是像阿联酋这样的小国也能够迫使黑莓手机制造商做出妥协。“RIM公司正在吸取其他公司早已吸取的教训。正如我们在2000年雅虎试图在法国建立一个出售纳粹纪念品的论坛失败，以及近年来谷歌屡次试图在中国提供未经审查的搜索结果一样，任何信息服务提供商都无法免受国家权力的影响。对政府而言，将这一领域拱手让给私人利益集团的风险实在太高了。”86但是尽管公司有遵守法律的动机，而其他非国家行为体（如犯罪分子和恐怖分子）则没有类似的约束。

The cyberdomain is both a new and a volatile human-made environment. The characteristics of cyberspace reduce some of the power differentials among actors and thus provide a good example of the diffusion of power that typifies global politics in this century. The largest powers are unlikely to be able to dominate this domain as much as they have others, such as sea or air. But cyberspace also demonstrates that diffusion of power does not mean equality of power or the replacement of governments as the most powerful actors in world politics. Even the small United Arab Emirates was able to force the maker of the BlackBerry to compromise. “Research in Motion is learning a lesson that other companies have learned before. As we saw in 2000 with Yahoo’s failed attempt to maintain a forum to sell Nazi memorabilia in France, and with Google’s repeated attempts in recent years to deliver uncensored search results in China, no provider of information services is exempt from the power of the state. The stakes are simply too high for governments to cede the field to private interests alone.”86 But although companies have an incentive to obey laws, other nonstate actors such as criminals and terrorists are not similarly constrained.

尽管网络空间可能通过为小国提供利用非对称战争进行跨越式发展的机会，从而在国家间造成一些权力转移，但它不太可能成为我们在下一章将要讨论的权力转移格局的根本性改变。然而，尽管政府仍然是最强大的行为体，但网络空间很可能会出现权力向非国家行为体扩散的趋势，并且网络中心性将成为21世纪权力的一个关键维度。

Although cyberspace may create some power shifts among states by opening limited opportunities for leapfrogging by small states using asymmetrical warfare, it is unlikely to be a game changer in the power transitions that we will turn to in the next chapter. However, while leaving governments the strongest actors, the cyberdomain is likely to see an increase in the diffusion of power to nonstate actors and network centrality as a key dimension of power in the twenty-first century.

第六章

CHAPTER 6

权力交接

Power Transition

美国衰落的问题

The Question of American Decline

无论以何种方式衡量权力，国家间权力均等分配都相对罕见。更常见的情况是，发展不平衡意味着一些国家崛起，而另一些国家衰落。当一个国家在资源上占据绝对优势时，观察家们通常将这种情况称为“霸权”。早在古希腊时期，历史学家就用霸权更迭来解释重大战争的起源。修昔底德将公元前五世纪撕裂希腊城邦体系的伯罗奔尼撒战争归因于雅典的崛起及其在斯巴达引发的恐惧。同样，许多历史学家认为，摧毁欧洲世界中心地位的第一次世界大战的根本原因在于德国的崛起及其在英国引发的恐惧。正如一位政治学家所言：“霸权斗争的爆发往往是由对最终衰落的恐惧和对权力削弱的感知所引发的。”1

No matter how power is measured, an equal distribution of power among states is relatively rare. More often the processes of uneven growth mean that some states will be rising and others declining. When one state is preponderant in resources, observers often refer to the situation as “hegemony,” and as far back as ancient Greece, historians have explained the origin of major wars in terms of hegemonic transition. Thucydides ascribed the cause of the Peloponnesian War (which tore apart the Greek city-state system in the fifth century BCE) to the rise in the power of Athens and the fear it created in Sparta. Similarly, many historians attribute the underlying cause of World War I, which destroyed Europe’s centrality in the world, to the rise in the power of Germany and the fear it created in Britain. As one political scientist puts it, “The outbreaks of hegemonic struggles have most frequently been triggered by fears of ultimate decline and the perceived erosion of power.”1

一些人预计，中国的崛起将在21世纪对美国产生类似的影响。一位汉学家认为，“如果目前的趋势继续下去，亚洲迟早会爆发战争……如今，中国正积极寻求恐吓美国。”这与德国在一战前试图恐吓英国的做法类似，都与东亚脱节。”专栏作家罗伯特·卡根也声称：“中国领导人看待世界的方式与一个世纪前的德皇威廉二世非常相似……中国领导人对自身受到的约束感到不满，并担心他们必须在国际体系改变他们之前改变国际体系的规则。”2芝加哥大学政治学家约翰·米尔斯海默断言：“坦率地说，中国不可能和平崛起。”3两位较为谨慎的分析人士认为，“中国对美国利益构成威胁并非不可避免，但美国更有可能与中国开战，而不是与任何其他大国开战。”4

Some expect that the rise of China will have similar effects on the United States in the twenty-first century. One Sinologist argues that “sooner or later, if present trends continue, war is probable in Asia. . . . China today is actively seeking to scare the United States away from East Asia rather as Germany sought to frighten Britain before World War I.” Similarly, columnist Robert Kagan claims, “The Chinese leadership views the world in much the same way Kaiser Wilhelm II did a century ago. . . . Chinese leaders chafe at the constraints on them and worry that they must change the rules of the international system before the international system changes them.”2 University of Chicago political scientist John Mearsheimer asserts, “To put it bluntly, China cannot rise peacefully.”3 Two more cautious analysts argue, “It is hardly inevitable that China will be a threat to American interests, but the United States is much more likely to go to war with China than it is with any other major power.”4

霸权转型

HEGEMONIC TRANSITIONS

然而，拥有强大资源的国家与新兴强国之间发生战争并非不可避免。19世纪90年代，尽管面临战争的威胁，英国还是成功地应对了美国的崛起。5. 1500 年以来发生的九次世界大战或“世界大战”中，并非所有战争都是霸权战争。6此外，“霸权”一词的使用方式多种多样，令人困惑。对于构成霸权的不平等程度以及权力资源的类型，目前尚无统一的共识。一些学者将“霸权”与“帝国”混用，甚至将19世纪的英国称为霸权国家，尽管即使在1870年英国国力鼎盛时期，其国内生产总值也仅排名第三（落后于美国和俄罗斯），军费开支也仅排名第三（落后于俄罗斯和法国）。

There is nothing inevitable, however, about war between a state with preponderant resources and a rising power. In the 1890s, Britain successfully accommodated the rise of American power despite opportunities for war,5 and of the nine general or “world wars” since 1500, not all were hegemonic.6 Moreover, the word “hegemony” is used in diverse and confused ways. There is no general agreement on how much inequality and what types of power resources constitute hegemony. Some writers use the word interchangeably with “imperial” and refer to nineteenth-century Britain as hegemonic even though Britain ranked third (behind the United States and Russia) in GDP and third (behind Russia and France) in military expenditures even at the height of its power in 1870.

二战后，美国占据世界经济三分之一以上的份额，并在核武器方面拥有绝对优势，许多人将其视为全球霸主。然而，美国却未能阻止中国的“沦陷”，未能遏制东欧共产主义的扩张，未能打破朝鲜战争的僵局，未能阻止北越的“沦陷”，也未能推翻古巴的卡斯特罗政权。即使在所谓的“霸权主义时代”，美国也未能阻止中国的“沦陷”。美国凭借其霸权，试图通过军事威胁迫使其他国家做出改变，但只有五分之一的努力取得了成功；通过经济制裁，也只有一半的努力取得了成功。7正如我们在第一章中所看到的，以资源衡量的权力并不等同于以预期结果衡量的权力。背景、范围和领域必须明确界定，而且存在着让过去的辉煌光环蒙蔽历史评价的危险。模糊的定义和武断的历史观应该让我们对关于霸权和衰落的宏大理论保持警惕。

After World War II, when the United States represented more than one-third of world product and had an overwhelming preponderance in nuclear weapons, many considered it a global hegemon, but nonetheless the United States was unable to prevent the “loss” of China, roll back communism in Eastern Europe, prevent stalemate in the Korean War, stop the “loss” of North Vietnam, or dislodge the Castro regime in Cuba. Even in the era of alleged American hegemony, only one-fifth of its efforts to compel change in other countries through military threats and one-half through economic sanctions were successful.7 As we saw in Chapter 1, power measured in resources does not mean power measured in preferred outcomes. Context, scope, and domain must be specified, and there is the danger of allowing the golden glow of the past to color the appraisal of history. Vague definitions and arbitrary history should cause us to be wary of grand theories of hegemony and decline.

许多人认为，美国目前在权力资源方面的优势地位是霸权性的，最终会像之前的英国一样衰落。一些美国人对“衰落”这个概念反应强烈，因为它触及了政治上的敏感神经。然而，认为美国会永远拥有压倒性的权力资源，既有悖常理，也不符合历史事实。不过，“衰落”一词混淆了两个不同的维度：绝对衰落，指的是国家衰败或丧失有效利用自身资源的能力；相对衰落，指的是其他国家的权力资源增长或利用效率提高。例如，17世纪的荷兰国内经济繁荣，但随着其他国家的崛起，其相对实力却有所下降。相反，西罗马帝国的衰落并非源于其他国家的崛起，而是内部衰败和蛮族入侵。正如一位英国历史学家所警告的那样，“危言耸听者援引罗马和英国的类比来追溯美国霸权的衰落。他们这样做忽略了吉本关于比较相距遥远时代的危险性的警告。”罗马是一个饱受内战蹂躏的农业社会；而建立在一个小岛上的大英帝国，则如同“花盆里的橡树”。8

Many believe that America’s current preponderance in power resources is hegemonic and will decline like that of Britain before it. Some Americans react emotionally to the idea of decline because it touches a raw nerve in politics, but it would be counterintuitive and ahistorical to believe that the United States will have a preponderant share of power resources forever. However, the word “decline” mixes up two different dimensions: absolute decline in the sense of decay or the loss of ability to use one’s resources effectively and relative decline in which the power resources of other states grow greater or are used more effectively. For instance, seventeenth-century Netherlands flourished domestically but declined in relative power as other states grew in strength. Conversely, the Western Roman Empire did not succumb to the rise of another state but rather to internal decay and swarms of barbarians. As one British historian warns, “Doom-mongers conjure with Roman and British analogies in order to trace the decay of American hegemony. In so doing they ignore Gibbon’s warning about the danger of comparing epochs remote from one another.” Rome was an agrarian society torn by internecine strife; the British Empire, based on a tiny island, was “an oak tree in a plant pot.”8

将美国衰落与英国的历史类比虽然流行，但却具有误导性。英国曾拥有一个日不落帝国，统治着全球四分之一的人口，并享有海上霸权，但帝国时期的英国与当代美国在相对实力资源方面存在着巨大差异。到第一次世界大战时期，英国在列强中仅排名第四。军事人员占比，GDP 排名第四，军费开支排名第三。9国防开支占GDP的2.5%至3.4%，帝国的统治很大程度上依赖于地方军队。1914年，英国的资本净输出为其提供了一笔可观的财政储备（尽管一些历史学家认为，如果将这笔资金投资于国内工业会更好），第一次世界大战中860万英国军队中，近三分之一来自海外殖民地。10但随着民族主义的兴起，伦敦越来越难以代表帝国宣战，保卫帝国也从一种优势变成了一种负担。相比之下，美国自1865年以来就拥有一个大陆规模的经济体系，不受民族主义瓦解的影响。尽管美国帝国主义的论调不绝于耳，但与英国相比，美国的束缚更少，自由度也更高。而且，两国的地缘政治格局也截然不同。英国面临着德国和俄罗斯这两个新兴邻国的挑战，而美国则受益于两大洋的地理优势和相对弱小的邻国。

The historical analogy with British decline is popular but misleading. Britain had an empire on which the sun never set, ruled over one-quarter of humankind, and enjoyed naval supremacy, but there were major differences in the relative power resources of imperial Britain and contemporary America. By the time of World War I, Britain ranked only fourth among the great powers in its share of military personnel, fourth in GDP, and third in military spending.9 The costs of defense ranged from 2.5 to 3.4 percent of GDP, and the empire was ruled in large part through local troops. In 1914, Britain’s net export of capital gave it an important financial kitty to draw upon (though some historians consider that it would have been better to have invested in home industry), and of the 8.6 million British forces in World War I, nearly one-third were provided by the overseas empire.10 But with the rise of nationalism, it became increasingly difficult for London to declare war on behalf of the empire, and protecting the empire became more of a burden than an asset. In contrast, America has had a continental-scale economy immune from nationalist disintegration since 1865. For all the loose talk of American empire, the United States is less tethered and has more degrees of freedom than Britain had. And the geopolitics of the two states differs. Whereas Britain faced rising neighbors in Germany and Russia, America benefits from two oceans and weaker neighbors.

尽管存在这些差异，美国人却总是陷入对自身衰落的固有认知中。有些人认为美国的问题在于帝国扩张过度，有些人认为这是由于他国崛起而导致的相对衰落，还有些人则认为这是一个绝对衰落或腐朽的过程。这种预测并非新鲜事。开国元勋们就曾担忧人们会将美国与罗马共和国的衰落相提并论。这种文化上的悲观主义根植于美国社会，可以追溯到清教徒时期。查尔斯·狄更斯在一个半世纪前就曾指出：“如果所有公民都可信的话，那么（美国）总是处于沮丧、停滞不前、危机四伏的状态，从未有过其他的境况。”11

Despite these differences, Americans are prone to cycles of belief in their decline. Some see the American problem as imperial overstretch, some see it as relative decline caused by the rise of others, and some see it as a process of absolute decline or decay. Such projections are not new. The Founding Fathers worried about comparisons to the decline of the Roman republic. A strand of cultural pessimism is simply very American, extending back to Puritan roots. Charles Dickens observed a century and a half ago, “If its individual citizens, to a man, are to be believed, [America] always is depressed, and always is stagnated, and always is in an alarming crisis, and never was otherwise.”11

最近，民调显示，苏联于1957年发射人造卫星“斯普特尼克”号后，尼克松的经济调整和20世纪70年代的石油危机后，以及锈带工业关闭和里根政府20​​世纪80年代的预算赤字后，人们都认为美国正在衰落。在那个十年末，美国民众认为国家正在衰落；然而仅仅十年后，他们就改变了看法。美国曾是唯一的超级大国，但现在许多人认为它正在衰落。12.衰落周期更多地反映了心理因素，而不是权力资源的潜在变化。13与其依赖可疑的历史类比或短期周期的预测，接下来的两节将首先考察美国相对于其他国家的实力下降，然后考察基于国内变化的绝对实力下降，以此来审视美国实力问题。

More recently, polls showed a belief in decline after the Soviet Union launched Sputnik in 1957, after Nixon’s economic adjustments and the oil shocks in the 1970s, and after the closing of rust belt industries and the budget deficits of the Reagan administration in the 1980s. At the end of that decade, the American people believed the country was in decline; yet within a decade they believed that the United States was the sole superpower, and now many believe in decline again.12 Cycles of declinism tell us more about psychology than about underlying shifts in power resources.13 Rather than relying on questionable historical analogies, or projections from short-term cycles, the next two sections will examine the issue of American power by looking first at decline relative to the power of other countries and then at absolute decline based on domestic change.

电力资源分配

THE DISTRIBUTION OF POWER RESOURCES

二十一世纪初，权力资源分配极不均衡。美国人口仅占世界总人口的5%，却占据了世界约四分之一的产值、近一半的全球军费开支，以及世界上最丰富的文化和教育软实力资源。两位学者指出，“没有任何一个主权国家体系中出现过像美国这样拥有如此巨大物质优势的国家。”14然而，正如我们之前所见，权力资源并非总能转化为权力结果，即使在二战后的时期，实力强大的美国也常常难以实现其预期目标。然而，就相对权力资源而言，21世纪初的权力资源分配格局中，没有任何国家能够按照古典现实主义对权力的理解来与美国抗衡。尽管并非在所有方面，美国在权力资源分配中都占据主导地位。如表6.1所示，美国人口占世界人口的比例排名第四，而欧盟的经济规模略大于美国。

The twenty-first century began with a very unequal distribution of power resources. With 5 percent of the world’s population, the United States accounted for about a quarter of the world’s product, nearly half of global military expenditures, and the world’s most extensive cultural and educational soft power resources. According to two scholars, “No system of sovereign states has ever contained one state with comparable material preponderance.”14 As we saw earlier, however, power resources do not always translate into power outcomes, and even in the period after World War II, a preponderant United States was frequently thwarted in achieving its preferred outcomes. However, in relative power resources, the twenty-first century began with a distribution of power resources in which no country was in a position to balance the United States in terms of the classical realist understanding of the term. There was American primacy in the distribution of power resources, though not in all dimensions. As Table 6.1 shows, America ranked fourth in its share of world population, and the European Union had a slightly larger economy.

美国在全球资源份额中的主导地位的未来一直备受争议。尽管根据短期事件推断长期趋势是错误的，但在2010年达沃斯世界经济论坛等媒体活动中，普遍的观点却将全球金融危机解读为美国在全球资源平衡中占据主导地位的证据。权力格局已开始发生变化。15正如一位战略家所说，“华尔街的崩盘预示着全球格局的剧变：美国实力开始衰落。伟大的帝国和伟大的文明都有其自身的兴衰规律，这在历史上几乎是既定的。”16相反，另一些人则认为，美国的霸权地位如此之大，以至于“对其安全政策的系统性约束通常失效”。17从长远来看，国家情报委员会对 2025 年的预测是，“美国仍将是首屈一指的大国，但美国的统治地位将大大降低。”18 人们对所谓的金砖国家（巴西、俄罗斯、印度和中国）给予了极大的关注，一些人预计到2027年，它们的生产力将超过发达国家。但正如表6.1所示，以传统实力衡量，本世纪初欧洲和日本仍然遥遥领先于金砖国家。我们将首先考察美国的富裕盟友——欧洲和日本，然后再考察金砖国家，以评估它们的相对实力。

The future of this American primacy in the share of world resources is hotly debated. Although it is a mistake to project long-run trends from short-term events, the conventional wisdom at media events such as the Davos World Economic Forum in 2010 interpreted the global financial crisis as proof that the balance of power had already begun to shift.15 As one strategist puts it, “Wall Street’s crack-up presages a global tectonic shift: the beginning of the decline of American power. Great empires and great civilizations have a way of cresting that is pretty well set in historical stone.”16 Contrarily, others argue that American preeminence is so great that “systemic constraints on its security policy become generally inoperative.”17 Taking a longer-term view, the National Intelligence Council’s projection for 2025 was that “the U.S. will remain the preeminent power, but that American dominance will be much diminished.”18 Much attention has been lavished on the so-called BRIC states (Brazil, Russia, India, and China), which some expect to outproduce the rich world by 2027. But as Table 6.1 shows, as measured by traditional power resources, Europe and Japan remain well ahead of the BRICs at the beginning of the century. We shall look first at America’s rich allies, Europe and Japan, and then at the BRICs in assessing relative power resources.

欧洲

在21世纪初，美国面临的最接近于与其匹敌的对手是欧盟。尽管美国经济规模是德国的四倍，但欧盟的经济总量略大于美国，而欧洲近5亿的人口也远超美国的3亿。美国人均收入高于欧盟，这是因为一些新加入欧盟的成员国比原西欧核心成员国更为贫穷，但在人力资本、技术和出口方面，欧洲完全可以与美国相提并论。在2010年春季危机爆发之前，希腊和其他地区的财政问题引发了金融市场的担忧，经济学家们曾预测欧元可能很快会取代美元，成为世界主要储备货币。相反，欧洲各国政府（以及国际货币基金组织）不得不组织一项9.25亿美元的救助计划，试图恢复市场信心。德国总理安格拉·默克尔警告说，如果欧元失败，“那么不仅这种货币会失败……欧洲也会失败，欧洲一体化的理念也会随之破灭。”19

The closest thing to an equal that the United States faces at the beginning of the twenty-first century is the European Union. Although the American economy is four times larger than Germany’s, the total economy of the European Union is slightly larger than that of the United States and Europe’s population of nearly 500 million is considerably larger than America’s 300 million. American per capita income is higher than that of the EU, because a number of the new entrants into the European Union were poorer than the original Western European core countries, but in terms of human capital, technology, and exports, Europe is very much a peer competitor for the United States. Until the spring crisis of 2010, when fiscal problems in Greece and elsewhere created anxiety in financial markets, economists speculated that the Euro might soon replace the dollar as the world’s primary reserve currency. Instead, European governments (and the IMF) had to organize a $925 million rescue program to try to restore market confidence, and German chancellor Angela Merkel warned that if the Euro fails, “then not only the currency fails. . . . Europe will fail, and with it the idea of European unity.”19

表6.1二十一世纪初电力资源分布

TABLE 6.1 Distribution of Power Resources in the EarLy Twenty-First Century

资料来源：除非另有说明，均来自《中央情报局世界手册》 。

Source: CIA World Handbook unless otherwise cited.

1.“第 8 章：世界核力量”，SIPR1 年鉴 2009（斯德哥尔摩：斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所，2009 年），摘要见www.sipri.org/yearbook/2009/08。

1. “Chapter 8: World Nuclear Forces,” SIPR1 Yearbook 2009 (Stockholm: Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, 2009), summary at www.sipri.org/yearbook/2009/08.

2. “附录 5A：1999-2008 年军事支出数据”，SIPRI 年鉴 2009（斯德哥尔摩：斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所，2009 年），摘要见www.sipri.org/yearbook/2009/05/05A。

2. “Appendix 5A: Military Expenditure Data, 1999–2008,” SIPRI Yearbook 2009 (Stockholm: Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, 2009), summary at www.sipri.org/yearbook/2009/05/05A.

3. 根据CIA 世界概况中 GDP 支出百分比计算得出。

3. Calculated from % of GDP spending from CIA World Factbook.

4. 巴西国民议会，联邦预算，www.camara.gov.br/internet/comissao /index/mista/orca/orcamento/OR2009/Proposta/projeto/volume4/tomo2 /07_md.pdf。

4. National Congress of Brazil, Federal Budget, www.camara.gov.br/internet/comissao/index/mista/orca/orcamento/OR2009/Proposta/projeto/volume4/tomo2/07_md.pdf.

5. 同上。

5. Ibid.

6. 中国上海交通大学高等教育研究所，“2009年世界大学学术排名”，www.arwu.org/ARWU2009.jsp。

6. Institute of Higher Education of Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China, “Academic Ranking of World Universities—2009,” www.arwu.org/ARWU2009.jsp.

7. 联合国教育、科学及文化组织，“电影：故事片的制作”，http://stats.uis.unesco.org/unesco/TableViewer/tableView.aspx ?ReportId=1391 。

7. United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, “Cinema: Production of Feature Films,” http://stats.uis.unesco.org/unesco/TableViewer/tableView.aspx?ReportId=1391.

8. 国际教育协会，“学生流动地图集：国家概况”，www.atlas.iienetwork.org/? p=48027。俄罗斯联邦教育和科学部提供的俄罗斯统计数据，“外国人在俄罗斯接受教育”，http://en.russia.edu.ru。

8. Institute of International Education, “Atlas of Student Mobility: Country Profiles,” www.atlas.iienetwork.org/?p=48027. Statistics for Russia from Ministry of Education and Science of the Russian Federation, “Education in Russia for Foreigners,” http://en.russia.edu.ru.

从军事角度来看，欧洲的国防开支不到美国的一半，但其兵力却远超美国，并且拥有两个核武库国家。在软实力方面，欧洲文化长期以来在世界其他地区具有广泛的吸引力，而围绕布鲁塞尔团结一致的欧洲理念也对邻国有着强大的吸引力。欧洲人一直是重要的先驱，并在国际机构中发挥着核心作用。评估欧洲资源的关键问题在于，欧洲能否发展出足够的政治和社会文化凝聚力，从而在广泛的国际问题上采取统一行动，还是会继续保持一个由民族主义、政治文化和外交政策差异巨大的国家组成的有限集团？换言之，欧洲的权力转化能力究竟如何？

In military terms, Europe spends less than one-half of what the United States does on defense but has more men under arms and includes two countries that possess nuclear arsenals. In soft power, European cultures have long had a wide appeal in the rest of the world, and the sense of a Europe uniting around Brussels has had a strong attraction for its neighbors. Europeans have also been important pioneers and played central roles in international institutions. The key question in assessing Europe’s resources is whether Europe will develop enough political and social-cultural cohesion to act as one on a wide range of international issues, or whether it will remain a limited grouping of countries with strongly different nationalisms, political cultures, and foreign policies. In other words, what is Europe’s power-conversion capability?

答案因问题而异。在贸易和世界贸易组织影响力问题上，欧洲与美国势均力敌，足以制衡美国的实力。1999年初，欧洲货币联盟的成立和欧元的推出，使得欧洲在货币事务和国际货币基金组织中的作用几乎与美国相当（尽管2010年希腊债务危机削弱了人们对欧元的信心）。在反垄断问题上，欧洲市场的规模和吸引力意味着，寻求合并的美国公司必须同时获得欧盟委员会和美国司法部的批准。在网络领域，欧盟正在制定全球隐私保护标准。

The answer varies with different issues. On questions of trade and influence within the World Trade Organization, Europe is the equal of the United States and able to balance American power. The creation of the European Monetary Union and the launching of the Euro at the beginning of 1999 made Europe’s role in monetary affairs and the International Monetary Fund nearly equal to that of the United States (though the 2010 crisis over Greek debt dented confidence in the Euro). On antitrust issues, the size and attraction of the European market have meant that American firms seeking to merge have had to seek approval from the European Commission as well as the U.S. Justice Department. In the cyberworld, the EU is setting the global standards for privacy protection.

与此同时，欧洲的统一程度也面临着诸多限制。尽管经历了六十年的一体化进程，民族认同仍然强于共同的欧洲认同，而且，尽管与过去相比有所减弱，但民族利益依然重要。20.欧盟扩大至包括27个国家（未来还会有更多）这意味着欧洲机构很可能继续保持其独特性，不太可能形成一个强大的联邦制欧洲或单一国家。这并非贬低欧洲机构及其已取得的成就。法律一体化正在不断推进，欧洲法院的判决也迫使成员国改变政策。然而，立法和行政部门的一体化进程却相对滞后，尽管欧洲设立了主席和外交关系的核心人物，但外交和国防政策的一体化程度仍然有限​​。正如欧盟委员会前成员帕滕勋爵所言：“与美国不同，我们并非在所有地方都举足轻重。”21

At the same time, Europe faces significant limits on its degree of unity. National identities remain stronger than a common European identity, despite six decades of integration, and national interests, although subdued in comparison to the past, still matter.20 The enlargement of the European Union to include twenty-seven states (with more to come) means that European institutions are likely to remain sui generis and unlikely to produce a strong federal Europe or a single state. None of this is to belittle European institutions and what they have accomplished. Legal integration is increasing, and European Court verdicts have compelled member countries to change policies. However, legislative and executive branch integration has lagged, and even though Europe has created a president and a central figure for foreign relations, the integration of foreign and defense policy is still limited. In the words of Lord Patten, a former member of the European Commission, “Unlike the US we do not matter everywhere.”21

几十年来，欧洲经历了过度乐观与“欧洲悲观主义”（例如当前时期）之间的交替。正如一位记者在2010年报道的那样，“在以美国和中国为首的新兴大国为主导的新地缘政治秩序中，欧洲似乎成了输家……12月18日，美国总统奥巴马和中国总理温家宝举行了决定成败的关键会晤，促成了规模有限的哥本哈根协议，但没有邀请任何欧洲人。中国邀请了印度、巴西和南非的领导人。那次会晤以及欧洲的缺席，成为了2009年的‘标志性画面’。”22此外，2008 年金融危机后，几个欧盟成员国（特别是希腊）的财政问题暴露了欧元区财政一体化的局限性。

Over the decades Europe has seen alternations between excessive optimism and bouts of “Euro-pessimism” such as characterize the current period. As one journalist reported in 2010, “Europe is starting to look like the loser in a new geopolitical order dominated by the U.S. and emerging powers led by China. . . . No Europeans were invited when U.S. President Barack Obama and Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao held the make-or-break meeting on Dec. 18 that brokered the modest Copenhagen accord. The Chinese invited the leaders of India, Brazil and South Africa. That meeting and Europe’s absence was the ‘seminal image’ of 2009.”22 Moreover, after the 2008 financial crisis, the fiscal problems of several EU members, particularly Greece, exposed the limits of fiscal integration in the Eurozone.

正如《经济学人》所指出的，“现在到处都在谈论欧洲相对衰落……你可能会听到一些关于欧洲未来地位的悲观数据，这并非没有道理。1900年，欧洲人口占世界总人口的四分之一。到2060年，这一比例可能仅为6%——而且其中近三分之一的人口将超过65岁。” 欧洲确实面临着严峻的人口问题，但人口规模与实力并非高度相关，“关于欧洲衰落的预测历来都未能成为现实。”23 20世纪80年代，分析人士谈到欧洲的僵化和严重的萎靡不振，但在随后的几十年里，欧洲却展现出……令人瞩目的增长和制度发展。“欧盟的运作模式——分享权力、敲定协议、通过没完没了的委员会解决冲突——可能让人觉得枯燥乏味，甚至令人沮丧。但在一个日益网络化和相互依存的世界中，它已成为全球标准。”正如欧洲对外关系委员会主任所言，“人们普遍认为，欧洲的时代已经过去。欧洲缺乏远见、内部分裂、痴迷于法律框架、不愿投射军事力量以及经济停滞不前，这些都与比罗马更具主导地位的美国形成了鲜明对比……但问题不在于欧洲，而在于我们对权力的理解已经过时。”25

As The Economist noted, “Talk of Europe’s relative decline seems to be everywhere just now. . . . You may hear glum figures about Europe’s future weight and with some reason. In 1900, Europe accounted for a quarter of the world’s population. By 2060, it may account for just 6%—and almost a third of these will be more than 65 years old.” Europe does face severe demographic problems, but the size of a population is not highly correlated with power, and “predictions of Europe’s downfall have a long history of failing to materialize.”23 In the 1980s, analysts spoke of Euro-sclerosis and a crippling malaise, but in the ensuing decades Europe showed impressive growth and institutional development. “The EU’s modus operandi—sharing power, hammering out agreements, resolving conflict by endless committee—can be boring and even frustrating to watch. But in an increasingly networked and interdependent world, it has become the global standard.”24 As the director of the European Council on Foreign Relations puts it, “The conventional wisdom is that Europe’s hour has come and gone. Its lack of vision, divisions, obsession with legal frameworks, unwillingness to project military power, and sclerotic economy are contrasted with a United States more dominant even than Rome. . . . But the problem is not Europe—it is our outdated understanding of power.”25

政治学家安德鲁·莫拉夫奇克也提出了类似的观点，他认为，除了美国之外，欧洲各国无论单独还是集体，都是唯一能够“在全球范围内施加从‘硬实力’到‘软实力’全方位影响力”的国家。“如果‘两极世界’这个词还有任何意义的话，那么世界就是两极格局，而且在可预见的未来很可能仍将如此。”这种悲观的预测基于19世纪的现实主义观点，即“权力与全球资源总量的相对份额相关，各国之间进行着持续的零和博弈。”26此外，正如他所指出的，欧洲是世界第二大军事强国，其军费开支占全球的21%，而中国占5%，俄罗斯占3%，印度占2%，巴西占1.5%。数万名士兵被部署在塞拉利昂、刚果、科特迪瓦、乍得、黎巴嫩和阿富汗等国。在经济实力方面，欧洲拥有全球最大的市场，占全球贸易额的17%，而美国仅占12%；欧洲提供的对外援助占全球的50%，而美国仅占20%。

Political scientist Andrew Moravcsik makes a similar argument that European nations, singly and collectively, are the only states other than the United States able to “exert global influence across the full spectrum from ‘hard’ to ‘soft’ power. Insofar as the term retains any meaning, the world is bipolar, and is likely to remain so over the foreseeable future.” The pessimistic prognosis is based on a nineteenth-century realist view in which “power is linked to the relative share of aggregate global resources and countries are engaged in constant zero-sum rivalry.”26 Moreover, as he points out, Europe is the world’s second largest military power, with 21 percent of the world’s military spending compared to 5 percent for China, 3 percent for Russia, 2 percent for India, and 1.5 percent for Brazil. Tens of thousands of troops have been deployed outside of home countries in Sierra Leone, Congo, Ivory Coast, Chad, Lebanon, and Afghanistan. In terms of economic power, Europe has the world’s largest market and represents 17 percent of world trade compared to 12 percent for the United States, and Europe dispenses 50 percent of the world’s foreign assistance compared to 20 percent for the United States.

就相对实力而言，如果欧盟克服内部分歧，努力成为在传统现实主义权力平衡中挑战美国的全球力量，那么这些资产将带来巨大的优势。这或许能够制衡美国的实力。但如果欧洲和美国保持松散的联盟关系，甚至保持中立，这些资源可能会相互加强。正如《经济学人》十年前所推测的那样，就军事安全而言，“到2030年左右，欧洲和美国都可能在世界其他地区面临同样的问题”，例如俄罗斯、中国和穆斯林聚居的西南亚地区。27

In terms of relative power, if the EU overcame its internal differences and endeavored to become a global challenger to the United States in a traditional realist balance of power, these assets might counter American power. But if Europe and America remain loosely allied or even neutral, these resources could reinforce each other. As The Economist speculated a decade ago, in terms of military security, it is possible that “by about 2030, both Europe and America will be having the same trouble with some other part of the world,” such as Russia, China, and Muslim southwest Asia.27

经济脱钩的可能性也不大。新技术、灵活的劳动力市场、雄厚的风险投资以及创业文化，都使美国市场对欧洲投资者极具吸引力。美国在大学和研发方面的支出占GDP的2.7%，是欧洲的两倍。美欧之间的直接投资高于对亚洲的投资，这有助于加强两国经济的联系。超过三分之一的贸易发生在跨国公司之间。此外，尽管贸易不可避免地会在民主国家的国内政治中造成一定程度的摩擦，但如果双方有合作意愿，贸易就是一个双赢的局面，而且美国与欧洲的贸易比美国与亚洲的贸易更加平衡。

Nor is economic divorce likely. New technology, flexibility in labor markets, strong venture capital, and an entrepreneurial culture make the American market attractive to European investors. The United States spends 2.7 percent—twice as much as Europe—on universities and R&D. Direct investment in both directions is higher than with Asia and helps knit the economies together. More than one-third of trade occurs within transnational corporations. Moreover, even though trade inevitably produces some degree of friction in the domestic politics of democracies, it is a game from which both sides can profit if there is a will to cooperate, and U.S. trade with Europe is more balanced than U.S. trade with Asia.

在文化层面，美国人和欧洲人两百多年来既互相揶揄，又互相欣赏。尽管人们对好莱坞电影或麦当劳颇有微词，但没人强迫欧洲人去那里吃饭，尽管每年仍有数百万人光顾。尽管欧洲部分地区与乔治·W·布什政府之间存在摩擦，但巴拉克·奥巴马在欧洲大部分地区的人气几乎达到了偶像级。从某种程度上说，这两个大陆之间不可避免的摩擦反而体现了一种亲近而非疏离。更广义地说，美国人和欧洲人在民主和人权价值观上的共识，比与其他地区更为紧密。即使按照传统的现实主义视角来评估权力平衡，美国和欧洲都不太可能威胁到对方的根本利益或重要利益。28.围绕利益冲突的权力斗争很可能仍停留在较为平凡的层面。而在那些需要与他人合作而非凌驾于他人之上的问题上，欧洲人展现出了令人印象深刻的能力。

At the cultural level, Americans and Europeans have sniped at and admired each other for more than two centuries. For all the complaints about Hollywood films or McDonald’s, no one forces Europeans to eat there, though millions do each year. And despite the frictions between parts of Europe and the George W. Bush administration, Barack Obama became almost a cult figure in his popularity in much of Europe. In some ways, the inevitable frictions between the two continents show a closeness rather than a distance. And in a larger sense, Americans and Europeans share the values of democracy and human rights more with each other than with other regions of the world. Even in a traditional realist assessment of balance of power resources, neither the United States nor Europe is likely to threaten the vital or important interests of the other side.28 Power struggles over conflicting interests are likely to remain at a more mundane level. And on issues that require power with rather than over others, the Europeans have impressive capacity.

日本

由于上世纪90年代初投机泡沫破裂后一系列糟糕的政策决策，日本经济经历了二十年的缓慢增长。2010年，中国经济总量（以美元计）超过了日本，但按购买力平价计算，中国经济人均规模仅为日本的六分之一。29 1988 年，全球市值排名前十的公司中有八家是日本公司；如今，一家日本公司也没有了。30尽管日本近期的表现不尽如人意，但它仍然拥有令人瞩目的实力。日本拥有世界第三大经济体、高度发达的工业体系以及亚洲最现代化的军队。虽然中国拥有核武器且兵力更多，但日本的军队装备更精良。而且，如果日本愿意，它也具备迅速研发核武器的技术能力。

Japan’s economy has suffered two decades of slow growth because of poor policy decisions that followed the bursting of a speculative bubble in the early 1990s. In 2010, China’s economy passed Japan’s in total size as measured in dollars, though it is only one-sixth of Japan’s in per capita terms (measured in purchasing power parity).29 In 1988, eight of the top ten companies in the world by market capitalization were Japanese; today none are Japanese.30 Despite its recent performance, Japan retains impressive power resources. It possesses the world’s third largest national economy, highly sophisticated industry, and the most modern military in Asia. Although China has nuclear weapons and more men under arms, Japan’s military is better equipped. It also has the technological capacity to develop nuclear weapons quite quickly if it chooses to do so.

仅仅二十年前，在日本人均收入超过美国之后，许多美国人担心会被日本超越。1989年《新闻周刊》的一篇文章简洁地指出：“在世界各地的董事会和政府部门，人们都在担忧一个令人不安的问题：日本是否即将成为一个超级大国，取代美国成为太平洋地区的霸主，甚至成为世界第一大国。”31 Books 预测日本将领导太平洋集团，将美国排除在外，甚至预测日本和美国最终会开战。32未来学家赫尔曼·卡恩预测，日本将成为核超级大国，日本角色的转变将类似于“19 世纪 70 年代普鲁士崛起给欧洲和世界事务带来的变化”。33这些观点推断出日本令人印象深刻的记录，但今天它们却提醒我们，基于快速增长的电力资源进行线性预测是危险的。34

Only two decades ago, many Americans feared being overtaken by Japan after Japanese per capita income surpassed that of the United States. A 1989 Newsweek article put it succinctly: “In boardrooms and government bureaus around the world, the uneasy question is whether Japan is about to become a superpower, supplanting America as the colossus of the Pacific and perhaps even the world’s No. 1 nation.”31 Books predicted a Japanese-led Pacific bloc that would exclude the United States and even an eventual war between Japan and the United States.32 Futurologist Herman Kahn forecast that Japan would become a nuclear superpower and that the transition in Japan’s role would be like “the change brought about in European and world affairs in the 1870s by the rise of Prussia.”33 These views extrapolated an impressive Japanese record, but today they serve as a useful reminder about the danger of linear projections based on rapidly rising power resources.34

二战前夕，日本工业产值占世界总产值的5%。战争摧毁了日本，直到1964年才恢复到这一水平。从1950年到1974年，日本经济年均增长率高达10%，到20世纪80年代，日本已成为世界第二大经济体，拥有1500万人口。占世界产量的百分比。35日本成为世界最大的债权国和最大的对外援助国。其科技水平与美国大致相当，在某些制造业领域甚至略胜一筹。日本的军备规模较小（军费开支限制在国民生产总值的1%左右），并将经济增长作为一项非常成功的战略。尽管如此，正如前文所述，日本仍然打造了东亚最现代化、装备最精良的常规军事力量。

On the eve of World War II, Japan had accounted for 5 percent of world industrial production. Devastated by the war, it did not regain that level until 1964. From 1950 to 1974, Japan averaged a remarkable 10 percent annual growth, and by the 1980s Japan had become the world’s second largest national economy, with 15 percent of world product.35 It became the world’s largest creditor and largest donor of foreign aid. Its technology was roughly equal with that of the United States and even slightly ahead in some areas of manufacturing. Japan armed only lightly (restricting military expenditures to about 1 percent of gross national product) and focused on economic growth as a highly successful strategy. Nonetheless, as mentioned, it created the most modern and best-equipped conventional military force in East Asia.

日本拥有两次令人瞩目的“自我重塑”历史。一个半世纪前，日本成为第一个成功适应现代全球化的非西方国家。在经历了几个世纪的闭关锁国之后，日本明治维新时期有选择地融入世界，并在半个世纪内发展壮大，最终在日俄战争中击败了欧洲列强。1945年后，日本从二战的废墟中崛起。2000年，首相委员会就日本21世纪的发展目标提出新的重塑计划。36鉴于政治进程的薄弱、进一步放松管制的必要性、人口老龄化以及对移民的抵制，这种变革并非易事。37日本面临严重的人口问题，预计到 2050 年人口将减少到 1 亿，而且其文化对接受移民持抵触态度。38但日本仍然保持着较高的生活水平、高技能的劳动力、稳定的社会，以及在技术和制造业领域的领先地位。此外，其文化（包括传统文化和流行文化）、海外发展援助以及对国际机构的支持，也为其软实力提供了一定的资源。

Japan has an impressive historical record of “reinventing itself” twice. A century and a half ago, Japan became the first non-Western country to successfully adapt to modern globalization. After centuries of isolation, Japan’s Meiji Restoration chose selectively from the rest of the world, and within a half-century the country became strong enough to defeat a European great power in the Russo-Japanese War. After 1945, it rose from the ashes of World War II. In 2000, a prime minister’s commission on Japan’s goals in the twenty-first century called for a new reinvention.36 Given the weakness of the political process, the need for further deregulation, the aging of the population, and the resistance to immigration, such change will not be easy.37 Japan faces severe demographic problems, with its population projected to shrink to 100 million by 2050, and its culture is resistant to accepting immigrants.38 But Japan retains a high standard of living, a highly skilled labor force, a stable society, and areas of technological leadership and manufacturing skills. Moreover, its culture (both traditional and popular), its overseas development assistance, and its support of international institutions provide some resources for soft power.

十年或二十年后，复兴的日本能否像十年前预测的那样，在经济或军事上成为美国的全球挑战者？这似乎不太可能。日本的面积与加利福尼亚州大致相当，其地理规模和人口规模永远无法与美国相提并论。日本在现代化、民主化和大众文化方面的成功为其提供了一定的软实力，但其民族中心主义的态度和政策却削弱了这种软实力。一些政客他们发起了一场运动，旨在修改限制日本军队只能用于自卫的宪法第九条，甚至有人谈到了核武器。如果美国脱离与日本的同盟，这可能会引发日本的不安全感，促使其决定发展自己的核能力，但即便如此，日本也远未达到与美国匹敌的水平。

Could a revived Japan, a decade or two hence, become a global challenger to the United States, economically or militarily, as was predicted a decade ago? It seems unlikely. Roughly the size of California, Japan will never have the geographical or population scale of the United States. Its success in modernization and democracy and its popular culture provide Japan with some soft power, but ethnocentric attitudes and policies undercut it. Some politicians have started a movement to revise Article 9 of the Constitution, which restricts Japan’s forces to self-defense, and a few have spoken of nuclear armament. If the United States were to drop its alliance with Japan, this could produce a sense of insecurity that might lead Japan to decide it had to develop its own nuclear capacity, but even so Japan would be far from a peer competitor.

或者，如果日本与中国结盟，两国资源的结合将形成强大的联盟。2006年，中国成为日本最大的贸易伙伴，而2009年由日本民主党组建的新政府也寻求改善与中国的关系。然而，建立紧密的联盟似乎不太可能。不仅20世纪30年代的创伤尚未完全愈合，而且中日两国对日本在亚洲乃至世界上的定位也存在分歧。中国希望约束日本，而日本可能会对这种约束感到不满。如果美国真的从东亚地区撤军（尽管这种可能性极小），日本或许会加入中国的阵营。但考虑到日本对中国崛起的担忧，继续与美国结盟的可能性更大。就传统的权力平衡而言，日本更有可能寻求美国的支持以维护其独立于中国的局面，这反而会增强美国的地位。一个与美国结盟的东亚不太可能成为取代美国的挑战者。39

Alternatively, if Japan were to ally with China, the combined resources of the two countries would make a potent coalition. In 2006, China became Japan’s largest trade partner, and the new government formed by the Democratic Party of Japan in 2009 sought improved relations with China. However, a close alliance seems unlikely. Not only have the wounds of the 1930s failed to heal completely, but also China and Japan have conflicting visions of Japan’s proper place in Asia and in the world. China would want to constrain Japan, but Japan might chafe at the restraints. In the highly unlikely prospect that the United States were to withdraw from the East Asian region, Japan might join a Chinese bandwagon. But given Japanese concerns about the rise of Chinese power, continued alliance with the United States is the more likely outcome. In terms of traditional balance of power resources, Japan is more likely to seek American support to preserve its independence from China, and this enhances the American position. An allied East Asia is not a plausible candidate to be the challenger that displaces the United States.39

简而言之，世界上另外两个拥有与美国相近的人均收入和发达经济体系的国家都与美国结盟。按照传统的现实主义权力平衡理论，这会对美国的净实力产生重大影响。此外，如果从与他国合作而非凌驾于他国之上的角度来看待权力，欧洲和日本则提供了应对共同跨国问题的最大资源库。尽管它们的利益与美国并不完全相同，但二者之间存在着大量的重叠之处。这些社会之间的社会和政府网络为合作共赢提供了机会。

In short, the two other entities in the world with per capita income and sophisticated economies similar to the American economy are both allied to the United States. In traditional realist terms of balances of power resources, that makes a large difference for the net position of American power. In addition, in a more positive-sum view of power with rather than over other countries, Europe and Japan provide the largest pools of resources for dealing with common transnational problems. Even though their interests are not identical to those of the United States, the large amount of overlap of social and governmental networks among these societies provides opportunities for cooperation on joint gains.

金砖国家

所谓的金砖国家情况有所不同。高盛在2001年创造了“金砖国家”一词，旨在引起人们对该公司所称的“新兴市场”中盈利机会的关注。2000年至2008年间，金砖国家在全球经济产出的份额迅速从16%上升至22%，并且在始于2008年的全球经济衰退中，它们的整体表现优于平均水平。在本世纪的第一个十年里，金砖国家的人口占世界总人口的42%，经济增长占世界总增长的33%。40除了美国（排名第三）之外，世界上人口最多的四个国家——中国、印度、印度尼西亚和巴西——在本世纪的第一个十年里都实现了超过 5% 的稳健经济增长率。41与之相比，美国第一个十年的增长率为1.9%，低于其长期平均水平。中国的表现遥遥领先，而俄罗斯在经济衰退开始后表现不佳。

The so-called BRICs are a different situation. Goldman Sachs coined the term in 2001 to call attention to profitable opportunities in what the investment firm considered “emerging markets.” The BRICs’ share of world product rose rapidly from 16 to 22 percent between 2000 and 2008, and collectively they did better than average in the global recession that began in 2008. Together, they accounted for 42 percent of world population and 33 percent of world growth in the first decade of the century.40 Apart from the United States (which ranks third), of the four most populous countries of the world, China, India, Indonesia, and Brazil all had solid economic growth rates above 5 percent in the first decade of the century.41 In contrast, the U.S. growth rate of 1.9 percent in the first decade was below its long-term average. China showed by far the best performance, and Russia performed poorly after the recession began.

具有讽刺意味的是，尽管俄罗斯与“金砖国家”的概念并不完全契合，但这个经济术语却意外地获得了政治意义。正如《北京周报》所评论的那样，“2001年高盛创造‘金砖国家’（BRIC）这一缩写时，无论是经济学家还是世界其他国家，都没有想到巴西、俄罗斯、印度和中国最终会坐在一起，共同构建一个重要的平台。”42 2009 年 6 月，这四个国家的外交部长在俄罗斯叶卡捷琳堡举行会议，旨在将“一个朗朗上口的缩写词变成一股不可忽视的国际力量”。43金砖国家拥有2.8万亿美元外汇储备，占全球外汇储备的42%（尽管其中大部分来自中国）。俄罗斯总统梅德韦杰夫曾表示，“如果金融工具只以一种货币计价，就不可能建立成功的全球货币体系”。在中国超越美国成为巴西最大的贸易伙伴后，北京和圣保罗宣布计划以各自货币结算贸易。而不是美元。尽管俄罗斯仅占中国贸易总额的5%，但两国宣布了一项类似的协议。44

Ironically, an economic term took on a political life of its own despite the fact that Russia fit poorly in the category. As the Beijing Review commented, “When Goldman Sachs created the acronym BRIC in 2001, neither the economists nor the rest of the world imagined that Brazil, Russia, India and China would finally sit together to build up a substantial platform one day.”42 In June 2009, the foreign ministers of the four countries met in Yekaterinburg, Russia, to transform “a catchy acronym into an international force to be reckoned with.”43 The BRICS held $2.8 trillion, or 42 percent, of global foreign reserves (though most of that was Chinese). Russian president Medvedev stated that “there can be no successful global currency system if the financial instruments that are used are denominated in only one currency,” and after China eclipsed the United States as Brazil’s largest trading partner, Beijing and Sao Paolo announced plans to settle trade in their national currencies rather than dollars. Although Russia accounts for only 5 percent of China’s trade, the two countries announced a similar agreement.44

在最近的金融危机之后，高盛提高了预测标准，称“到 2027 年，金砖国家的 GDP 总和可能会超过七国集团，比我们最初预想的提前了大约 10 年。”45无论这种线性经济预测的合理性如何，就长期评估实力资源而言，这个术语在政治上意义不大。虽然金砖国家会议可能有利于短期外交策略，但它将内部存在严重分歧的国家混为一谈，而将俄罗斯这个前超级大国与三个发展中经济体并列更是毫无意义。在这四个国家中，俄罗斯人口最少，识字率最高，人均收入也远高于其他三国，但更重要的是，许多观察家认为，俄罗斯的实力正在衰落，而其他三国的实力却在增强。仅仅二十年前，“俄罗斯还是一个科学超级大国，其科研成果超过了中国、印度和巴西的总和。但自那以后，它不仅被中国世界领先的科学发展速度远远甩在了后面，也被印度和巴西远远甩在了后面。”46正如我们将看到的，金砖国家（BRIC）这个缩写词的核心是中国资源的崛起。

After the recent financial crisis, Goldman Sachs upped the ante and projected that “the combined GDP of the BRICs might exceed that of the G7 countries by 2027, about 10 years earlier than we initially believed.“45 Whatever the merits of this linear economic projection, the term makes little political sense for long-range assessments of power resources. Although a meeting of BRICs may be convenient for short-term diplomatic tactics, it lumps together countries that have deep divisions, and including Russia, a former superpower, with the three developing economies makes little sense. Of the four, Russia has the smallest and most literate population and a much higher per capita income, but, more importantly, many observers believe that Russia is declining while the other three are rising in power resources. Just two decades ago, “Russia was a scientific superpower, carrying out more research than China, India and Brazil combined. Since then it has been left behind not only by the world-beating growth of Chinese science but also by India and Brazil.”46 As we shall see, the heart of the BRIC acronym is the rise in the resources of China.

俄罗斯

20世纪50年代，许多美国人担心苏联会超越美国，成为世界头号强国。苏联拥有世界最大的领土、第三大人口和第二大经济体，其石油和天然气产量甚至超过沙特阿拉伯。它拥有近一半的世界核武器，兵力超过美国，研发人员数量也位居世界第一。1952年，苏联仅比美国晚一年就成功引爆了氢弹，并在1957年率先将人造卫星送入太空。就软实力而言，二战后，共产主义意识形态因其对法西斯主义的抵抗而在欧洲具有吸引力，在第三世界则因其认同感而备受推崇。随着非殖民化运动的兴起，苏联宣传机构积极鼓吹共产主义胜利不可避免的神话。

In the 1950s, many Americans feared that the Soviet Union would surpass the United States as the world’s leading power. The Soviet Union had the world’s largest territory, third largest population, and second largest economy, and it produced more oil and gas than Saudi Arabia. It possessed nearly one-half the world’s nuclear weapons, had more men under arms than the United States, and had the highest number of people employed in research and development. It exploded a hydrogen bomb only one year after the United States did in 1952, and it was the first to launch a satellite into space in 1957. In terms of soft power, following World War II communist ideology was attractive in Europe because of its resistance to fascism and in the Third World because of its identification with the popular movement toward decolonization. Soviet propaganda actively fostered a myth of the inevitability of the triumph of communism.

尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫曾在1959年夸口说，苏联最迟将在1980年或1970年超越美国。直到1976年，列昂尼德·勃列日涅夫还告诉法国总统，共产主义将在1995年主导世界。这些预测得到了当时公布的5%到6%的年均经济增长率以及1950年至1970年间苏联在全球生产总值中所占份额从11%增长到12.3%的佐证。然而，此后苏联的经济增长率和在全球生产总值中所占份额开始长期下滑。1986年，戈尔巴乔夫形容苏联经济“非常混乱，所有指标都落后”。47一年后，外交部长爱德华·谢瓦尔德纳泽告诉他的官员们：“你我代表着一个伟大的国家，但在过去的15年里，这个国家作为领先的工业发达国家之一的地位却越来越低。”48事后看来，令人惊讶的是，美国对苏联实力的评估竟然如此失准。20世纪70年代末，一个名为“当前危险委员会”的机构声称，苏联的实力正在超越美国，而1980年的选举也反映了这种担忧。

Nikita Khrushchev famously boasted in 1959 that the Soviet Union would overtake the United States by 1970 or by 1980 at the latest. As late as 1976, Leonid Brezhnev told the French president that communism would dominate the world by 1995. Such predictions were bolstered by reported annual economic growth rates ranging between 5 and 6 percent and an increase in the Soviet share of world product from 11 to 12.3 percent between 1950 and 1970. After that, however, the Soviet growth rate and share of world product began a long decline. In 1986, Gorbachev described the Soviet economy as “very disordered. We lag in all indices.”47 A year later, Foreign Minister Eduard Shevardnadze told his officials, “You and I represent a great country that in the last 15 years has been more and more losing its position as one of the leading industrially developed nations.”48 What is surprising in retrospect is how wildly inaccurate were the American assessments of Soviet power. In the late 1970s, a “Committee on the Present Danger” argued that Soviet power was surpassing that of the United States, and the 1980 election reflected such fears.

1991年苏联解体后，俄罗斯的领土（原苏联的76%）、人口（原苏联的50%）、经济规模（原苏联的45%）和军事人员数量（原苏联的33%）都大幅缩减。此外，共产主义意识形态的软实力也几乎消失殆尽。尽管如此，俄罗斯仍然拥有近5000枚已部署的核武器和超过100万的武装人员，但其军费开支仅占世界总额的4%（仅为美国的10%），其全球力量投射能力也大幅下降。在经济资源方面，俄罗斯的国内生产总值（GDP）为2.3万亿美元，约为美国的14%；其人均收入（按购买力平价计算）为1.6万美元，约为美国的33%。其经济……俄罗斯严重依赖石油和天然气出口，高科技产品出口仅占其制成品出口的7%（相比之下，美国这一比例为28%）。在软实力方面，尽管俄罗斯传统文化具有吸引力，但其全球影响力却很弱。正如一位俄罗斯分析人士所言，俄罗斯不得不动用“硬实力，包括军事力量，因为它生活在一个更加危险的世界，而且没有任何可以依靠的后盾，也因为它缺乏软实力——即社会、文化、政治和经济吸引力。”49

The collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991 left a Russia significantly shrunken in territory (76 percent of the USSR), population (50 percent of the USSR), economy (45 percent of the USSR), and military personnel (33 percent of the USSR). Moreover, the soft power of communist ideology had virtually disappeared. Nonetheless, Russia had nearly 5,000 deployed nuclear weapons, and more than 1 million persons under arms, though its total military expenditure was only 4 percent of the world total (10 percent of the U.S. share), and its global power projection capabilities had greatly diminished. In economic resources, Russia’s $2.3 trillion gross domestic product was 14 percent that of the United States, and its per capita income (in purchasing power parity) of $16,000 was roughly 33 percent that of the United States. Its economy was heavily dependent on export of oil and gas, with high-tech exports representing only 7 percent of its manufactured exports (compared to 28 percent for the United States). In terms of soft power, despite the attractiveness of traditional Russian culture, Russia has little global presence. In the words of one Russian analyst, Russia has to use “hard power, including military force, because it lives in a much more dangerous world and has no one to hide behind from it, and because it has little soft power—that is, social, cultural, political and economic attractiveness.”49

俄罗斯不再受共产主义意识形态和繁琐的中央计划体制的束缚，民族分裂的可能性虽然仍然存在，但已远低于以往。俄罗斯族人口在原苏联仅占50%，而如今已占俄罗斯联邦人口的81%。然而，俄罗斯缺乏有效市场经济所需的政治制度，腐败盛行。俄罗斯的“强盗资本主义”缺乏建立市场信任的有效监管。公共卫生体系混乱不堪，死亡率上升，出生率下降。俄罗斯男性平均寿命为59岁，这对于一个发达经济体而言是一个极低的数字。50正如梅德韦杰夫总统所说，“俄罗斯人每年都在减少。”51联合国人口统计学家的中等估计表明，到本世纪中叶，俄罗斯人口可能会从目前的 1.45 亿减少到 1.21 亿。52一位专家认为，到 2020 年，俄罗斯必须引进 1200 万移民才能在人口方面保持稳定，这似乎不太可能。53

Russia is no longer hampered by communist ideology and a cumbersome central planning system, and the likelihood of ethnic fragmentation, though still a threat, is less than in the past. Whereas ethnic Russians were only 50 percent of the former Soviet Union, they are now 81 percent of the Russian Federation. The political institutions for an effective market economy are largely missing, and corruption is rampant. Russia’s robber baron capitalism lacks the kind of effective regulation that creates trust in market relationships. The public health system is in disarray, mortality rates have increased, and birthrates are declining. The average Russian male dies at fifty-nine, an extraordinarily low number for an advanced economy.50 As President Medvedev puts it, “Every year there are fewer and fewer Russians.”51 Midrange estimates by UN demographers suggest that Russia’s population may decline from 145 million today to 121 million by midcentury.52 In the view of one expert, Russia will have to import 12 million immigrants by 2020 just to stand still demographically, and this seems unlikely.53

俄罗斯的未来充满多种可能性。一种极端观点认为，俄罗斯将走向衰落，沦为“单一作物经济”，机构腐败，人口和健康问题难以克服。另一种观点则认为，通过改革和现代化，俄罗斯能够克服这些问题，而且领导层正朝着这个方向努力。2009年底，梅德韦杰夫总统发表了一项意义深远的呼吁，要求俄罗斯“实现经济现代化，摆脱屈辱的局面”。他表示，依赖自然资源和摒弃苏联式的态度“阻碍了其保持世界强国地位的努力”。54但一些批评人士认为，俄罗斯领导人的现代化理念过于国家主导，而且问题重重，因为公共机构运作不善。“创新型经济需要开放的市场、风险投资、自由思考的企业家、快速的破产法庭和强有力的知识产权保护。” 然而，现实却是“垄断盛行、腐败横行、国家干预令人窒息、法律薄弱且自相矛盾”。55

Many Russian futures are possible. At one extreme are those who project decline and see Russia as a “one-crop economy” with corrupt institutions and insurmountable demographic and health problems. Others argue that with reform and modernization, Russia will be able to surmount these problems and that the leadership is headed in this direction. Late in 2009, President Medvedev issued a sweeping call “for Russia to modernize its economy, wean itself from a humiliating dependence on natural resources and do away with Soviet-style attitudes” that he said were “hindering its effort to remain a world power.”54 But some critics argue that Russian leaders’ concept of modernization is too state led and problematic because public institutions function so badly. “An innovative economy needs open markets, venture capital, free thinking entrepreneurs, fast bankruptcy courts and solid protection of intellectual property.” Instead there are “wide-spread monopolies, ubiquitous corruption, stifling state-interferences, weak and contradictory laws.”55

政府运转失灵和腐败盛行，使得现代化进程举步维艰。阿尔法银行行长彼得·阿文指出：“从经济上看，它越来越像苏联。它严重依赖石油，急需资金，亟需进行重大改革，同时社会负担也十分沉重。经济停滞是主要威胁。”56一位俄罗斯经济学家直言不讳地说：“对于现代化，并没有达成共识。”57无论结果如何，由于俄罗斯仍然拥有核力量、庞大的人力资本、网络技术能力、靠近欧洲以及与中国结盟的潜力，俄罗斯将有能力给美国制造麻烦，即使它不再像冷战时期那样有能力制衡美国的力量。

Dysfunctional government and pervasive corruption make modernization difficult. Peter Aven, president of Alfa Bank, argues that “economically, it looks like the Soviet Union more and more. There is a huge dependency on oil, a need for capital, a need for serious reforms, while the social burden is very strong. Stagnation is the main threat.”56 A Russian economist says flatly that “there is no consensus in favor of modernization.”57 Whatever the outcome, because of its residual nuclear strength, its great human capital, its skills in cybertechnology, its proximity to Europe, and the potential of alliance with China, Russia will have the resources to cause problems for the United States, even if it no longer has the capacity to balance American power that it had in the Cold War.

俄中轴心的前景如何？传统的权力平衡政治或许会预测，美国在权力资源上的主导地位会导致这种联盟的出现。历史上也并非没有先例：上世纪50年代，中国和苏联曾结盟对抗美国。1972年尼克松对华开放后，这一三角关系发生了逆转，美中两国合作遏制双方都视为威胁的苏联势力。随着苏联解体，这一联盟也随之结束。1992年，俄中宣布两国关系为“建设性伙伴关系”；1996年，两国称之为“战略伙伴关系”；2001年7月，两国签署了“友好合作条约”。这一伙伴关系的一个共同主题是对当前局势的共同反对。（美国主导的）“单极世界”。58一些俄罗斯人认为，“俄罗斯正在迅速转向优先与中国合作——即使是作为‘弟弟’。”59

What are the prospects for a Russia-China axis? Traditional balance of power politics might predict such a response to American primacy in power resources. And there is historical precedent for such a union: In the 1950s, China and the Soviet Union were allied against the United States. After Nixon’s opening to China in 1972, the triangle worked the other way, with the United States and China cooperating to limit what both saw as a threatening Soviet power. That alliance ended with the collapse of the Soviet Union. In 1992, Russia and China declared their relations a “constructive partnership”; in 1996, they called it a “strategic partnership”; and in July 2001, they signed a treaty of “friendship and cooperation.” One theme of this partnership is common opposition to the present (U.S.-dominated) “unipolar world.”58 Some Russians believe that “Russia is drifting fast towards prioritizing cooperation with China—even if as a ‘younger brother.’”59

尽管言辞激烈，但中俄结盟仍面临诸多严峻挑战，远不止于战术层面的外交协调。正如一位法国分析人士总结道：“尽管取得了一些显著成就，但两国的双边接触仍然是片面的、暧昧的……俄罗斯和中国有着截然不同的世界观、不同的外交政策方针，有时甚至存在利益冲突。”60远东地区的人口状况令莫斯科感到担忧，该地区俄罗斯一侧的人口为600万，而中国一侧的人口则高达1.2亿。俄罗斯经济和军事的衰退加剧了其对中国崛起的担忧。正如梅德韦杰夫总统所说，“如果俄罗斯不能确保其在远东的存在，最终可能会‘失去一切’。”2009年，俄罗斯宣布了一项新的军事理论，明确保留了首先使用核武器的权利，并继续拥有大量短程战术核武器。冷战期间，美国曾利用类似的核态势来对抗俄罗斯在欧洲的常规军事优势。许多军事观察家认为，俄罗斯的新理论是对中国在东亚常规军事优势的一种类似回应。传统的现实主义者甚至可能预期，随着中国实力的增长，俄印、俄日乃至俄美关系都会有所改善。

Despite the rhetoric, there are serious obstacles to an alliance between China and Russia that goes much beyond tactical diplomatic coordination. As a French analyst summarizes, “Despite some significant successes, their bilateral engagement continues to be partial and ambivalent. . . . Russia and China have contrasting world-views, different approaches to foreign policy and sometimes conflicting priorities.”60 The demographic situation in the Far East, where the population on the Russian side of the border is 6 million and on the China side is up to 120 million, creates a degree of anxiety in Moscow. Russia’s economic and military decline have increased its concern about the rise of Chinese power. As President Medvedev says, “If Russia does not secure its presence in the Far East, it could eventually ‘lose everything’ to the Chinese.”61 In 2009, Russia announced a new military doctrine that explicitly reserved the right to first use of nuclear weapons, and it continued to hold a large number of short-range tactical nuclear weapons. During the Cold War, the United States used a similar nuclear posture to counter Russian conventional military superiority in Europe. Many military observers believe the new Russian doctrine is a similar response to Chinese conventional superiority in East Asia. A traditional realist might even expect an improvement in Russian-Indian, Russian-Japanese, and even Russian-American relations as Chinese power grows.

俄罗斯仍然对美国构成潜在威胁，这主要是因为它是唯一一个拥有足够导弹和核弹头摧毁美国的国家，而且俄罗斯相对衰落也使其更不愿放弃核武器地位。俄罗斯还拥有庞大的国土面积、受过良好教育的人口、技术精湛的科学家和工程师以及丰富的自然资源。但俄罗斯似乎不太可能再次拥有像二战后四十年间苏联那样，对美国的力量构成制衡的资源。

Russia still poses a potential threat to the United States, largely because it is the one country with enough missiles and nuclear warheads to destroy the United States, and Russia’s relative decline has made the country more reluctant to renounce its nuclear status. Russia also possesses enormous scale, an educated population, skilled scientists and engineers, and vast natural resources. But it seems unlikely that Russia would again possess the resources to present the same sort of balance to American power that the Soviet Union presented during the four decades after World War II.

印度

印度经常被提及为未来的世界强国，其12亿人口是美国的四倍，并可能在2025年超过中国。一些印度人预测，到本世纪中叶，世界将形成三极格局：美国、中国和印度。62一位经济学家认为，“如果我们按照目前的趋势推断，25 年内，印度的国民收入将位居世界第三（仅次于美国和中国）。”63

India is often mentioned as a future great power, and its population of 1.2 billion is four times that of the United States and is likely to surpass that of China by 2025. Some Indians predict a tripolar world by midcentury: the United States, China, and India.62 One economist argues that “if we extrapolate present trends, India will have the world’s third largest national income (after the U.S. and China) within 25 years from now.”63

几十年来，印度一直饱受所谓“印度教式经济增长率”的困扰，人均增长率仅略高于1%。1947年独立后，印度奉行内向型政策，专注于重工业。但事实证明，经济增长率低迷与其说是源于印度教文化，不如说是受到英国费边社（以及其他）社会主义经济计划的影响。20世纪90年代初，随着市场导向型改革的推行，印度的经济格局发生了转变，整体增长率上升至7%，并预计未来将达到两位数。英国专栏作家马丁·沃尔夫称印度为“过早的超级大国”，意指其国民生活水平较低，但经济规模庞大。他认为，印度经济规模将在十年内超过英国，并在二十年内超过日本。64印度拥有数亿人口的新兴中产阶级，英语是官方语言之一，约有5000万至1亿人使用。以此为基础，印度信息产业能够在国际市场中发挥重要作用，并且印度拥有活跃的太空计划。

For decades, India suffered from what some called the “Hindu rate of economic growth” of a little more than 1 percent per capita. After independence in 1947, India followed an inward-looking policy focused on heavy industry. But the rate of economic growth turned out to owe less to Hindu culture than to imported British Fabian (and other) socialist economic planning. After market-oriented reforms in the early 1990s, the pattern changed, and growth rates rose to 7 percent overall growth, with projections of double-digit rates in the future. British columnist Martin Wolf calls India a “premature superpower,” meaning a country with low living standards but a huge economy. He thinks that the Indian economy will be bigger than Britain’s in a decade and bigger than Japan’s in two.64 India has an emerging middle class of several hundred million, and English is an official language spoken by some 50–100 million people. Building on that base, Indian information industries are able to play a major role in global markets, and India has an active space program.

印度拥有雄厚的军事实力，据估计拥有60至70枚核武器、中程导弹、太空计划、130万军事人员，以及近300亿美元的年度军费开支，约占世界军费总额的2%。在软实力方面，印度拥有成熟的民主制度和充满活力的、具有跨国影响力的流行文化。印度拥有庞大的海外侨民群体，其电影产业——宝莱坞——是全球最大的电影产业，年产量位居世界第一，在亚洲和中东部分地区甚至超过好莱坞。65

India has significant military power resources, with an estimated 60–70 nuclear weapons, intermediate-range missiles, a space program, 1.3 million military personnel, and annual military expenditure of nearly $30 billion, or 2 percent of the world total. In terms of soft power, India has an established democracy and a vibrant popular culture with transnational influence. India has an influential diaspora, and its motion picture industry, Bollywood, is the largest in the world in terms of the number of films produced yearly, out-competing Hollywood in parts of Asia and the Middle East.65

与此同时，印度仍然是一个欠发达国家，数亿文盲生活在贫困之中。“印度11亿人口中约有三分之一生活在极端贫困之中，而世界上约有三分之一的贫困人口生活在印度。”印度的GDP为3.3万亿美元，仅略高于中国的80亿美元，美国的20%。印度的人均收入为2900美元（按购买力平价计算），仅为中国的50%，美国的不到7%。更令人震惊的是，中国的识字率高达91%，城市人口比例为43%，而印度的这两个数字分别为61%和29%。印度每年培养的“工程和计算机技术人才”数量约为美国的两倍……但其中只有4.2%的人适合在软件产品公司工作，即使经过六个月的培训，也只有17.8%的人能够被IT服务公司录用。67一个症状是印度在国际大学排名中表现不佳：“高等教育咨询机构 QS 编制的 2009 年亚洲大学排名显示，印度排名最高的院校是排名第 30 的印度理工学院孟买分校；中国和香港有 10 所大学排名更高。”68印度的高科技产品出口仅占其出口总额的 5%，而中国则占 30%。

At the same time, India remains very much an underdeveloped country, with hundreds of millions of illiterate citizens living in poverty. “Around a third of India’s 1.1 billion people live in conditions of acute poverty, and around a third of the world’s poor live in India.”66 India’s GDP of $3.3 trillion is little more than 33 percent of China’s $8 billion and 20 percent that of the United States. India’s per capita income of $2,900 (in purchasing power parity) is 50 percent of China’s and less than 7 percent of the United States’. Even more striking, whereas 91 percent of the Chinese population is literate and 43 percent urban, the numbers for India are only 61 percent and 29 percent, respectively. Each year, India produces about twice as many “engineering and computing geeks as America . . . but only 4.2 percent are fit to work in a software product firm, and just 17.8 percent are employable by an IT [information technology] services company, even with six months training.”67 A symptom of this is India’s poor performance in international comparisons of universities: “The 2009 Asian University Rankings, prepared by the higher education consultancy QS, shows the top Indian institution to be the IIT Bombay at number 30; 10 universities in China and Hong Kong are higher.”68 India’s high-tech exports are only 5 percent of its total exports compared to 30 percent for China.

印度不太可能在本世纪上半叶发展出足以挑战美国的全球实力，但它拥有可观的资源，可以增强中印联盟的规模。由于两国经济的快速增长和贸易的日益密切，一些观察人士开始使用“中印”一词来指代两国的结合，但两国之间仍然存在巨大的差异。69这样的联盟发展成为真正的反美联盟的可能性很小。正如中俄关系中仍然存在挥之不去的猜疑一样，印度和中国之间也存在类似的竞争。尽管两国分别在1993年和1996年签署了协议，承诺和平解决导致1962年战争的边界争端，但值得注意的是，印度国防部长曾将中国称为“中国”。在1998年3月印度进行核试验之前，中国曾被视为印度的“头号潜在敌人”，而边界争端在2009年再次引发争议。尽管印度官员在公开场合对中印关系的态度有所缓和，但私下里他们仍然十分担忧。70印度与其说是成为盟友，不如说是成为亚洲国家集团的一员，以制衡中国。

India is unlikely to develop the power resources to become a global challenger to the United States in the first half of this century, but it has considerable assets that could be added to the scales of a Sino-Indian coalition. Because of the rapid growth and increased trade of these two countries, some observers began to use the term “Chindia” to refer to the combination of them, but enormous differences remain.69 The likelihood that such a coalition would become a serious anti-American alliance is small. Just as there is lingering suspicion in the Sino-Russian relationship, so there is a similar rivalry between India and China. Even though the two countries signed agreements in 1993 and 1996 that promised peaceful settlement of the border dispute that had led them to war in 1962, it is also worth noting that India’s defense minister labeled China as India’s “potential enemy number one” just prior to India’s nuclear tests in March 1998, and the border dispute became controversial again in 2009. Even though Indian officials have become more discrete in public about relations with China, their concerns remain intense in private.70 Rather than becoming an ally, India is more likely to become part of the group of Asian nations that will tend to balance China.

巴西

巴西人有时会开玩笑说：“我们是一个拥有美好未来的国家——而且永远都会如此！”71前总统伊格纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦说：“巴西一直表现得像个二等国家。我们总是告诉自己我们是未来的国家，但我们从未将这些特质转化为具体的成就。”72巴西于1825年脱离葡萄牙独立后，整个世纪实际收入都停滞不前。20世纪中期，巴西经济出现快速增长，但这种增长主要依靠半封闭经济体系下的外债融资，并在20世纪70年代的石油危机中崩溃。随后二十年，巴西经历了动荡不安的恶性通货膨胀，到20世纪90年代初，年通货膨胀率超过700%。1994年，巴西引入了新的浮动汇率制度，指示中央银行将通货膨胀作为目标，并稳定了政府财政。

Brazilians sometimes joked that “we are a country with a great future—and always will be!”71 Former president Ignacio Lula da Silva said, “Brazil always behaved like a second-class country. We always told ourselves we were the country of the future, but we never transformed these qualities into something concrete.”72 After Brazil gained independence from Portugal in 1825, real income remained stagnant throughout the century. A growth spurt in the mid-twentieth century was financed with foreign debt within a semiclosed economy, which collapsed among the oil shocks of the 1970s. Two volatile decades of rampant inflation followed, reaching more than 700 percent a year by the early 1990s. In 1994, Brazil introduced a new floating exchange rate, instructed the Central Bank to target inflation, and stabilized government finances.

巴西的未来不再是个笑话。金砖国家（BRIC）这个缩写词最初出现时，一些观察人士反对说：“一个经济增长率如同其泳装般单薄，容易受到任何金融危机冲击，​​政治长期动荡，挥霍自身巨大潜力的能力如同其足球天赋和狂欢节一样闻名遐迩的国家，似乎不配与这些新兴强国为伍。”正如《经济学人》进一步评论的那样，如今“在某些方面，巴西已经超越了其他金砖国家。与中国不同，它是一个民主国家。与印度不同，它没有叛乱分子，没有种族和宗教冲突，也没有敌对的邻国。与俄罗斯不同，它的出口产品不仅限于石油和武器，而且它尊重外国投资者。”巴西正在吸引外国投资，并且“已经建立了一些强大的……”政治制度。自由而充满活力的媒体能够揭露腐败——尽管腐败现象普遍存在，而且大多逍遥法外。73

Brazil’s future is a joke no longer. When the BRIC acronym was first invented, some observers objected that “a country with a growth rate as skimpy as its swimsuits, prey to any financial crisis that was around, a place of chronic political instability, whose infinite capacity to squander its obvious potential was as legendary as its talent for football and carnivals, did not seem to belong with those emerging titans.” As The Economist further commented, now “in some ways, Brazil outclasses the other BRICs. Unlike China, it is a democracy. Unlike India, it has no insurgents, no ethnic and religious conflicts nor hostile neighbors. Unlike Russia, it exports more than oil and arms and treats foreign investors with respect.” Brazil is attracting foreign investment, and “has established some strong political institutions. A free and vigorous press uncovers corruption—though there is plenty of it, and it mostly goes unpunished.”73

自上世纪 90 年代遏制通货膨胀并推行市场改革以来，巴西在 21 世纪初展现出令人瞩目的经济增长率，增速达到 5% 左右，一些分析人士认为未来这一增速可能会进一步提高。巴西国土面积几乎是印度的三倍，2亿人口中90%识字，GDP高达2万亿美元，与俄罗斯相当，人均收入达1万美元（是印度的三倍，几乎是中国的两倍），拥有令人瞩目的能源资源。2007年，巴西近海发现的大量石油储量有望使其成为能源领域的重要力量。巴西的军事规模远小于其他金砖国家，而且与金砖四国不同，巴西没有核武器。但它是南美洲面积最大的国家，在邻国中没有真正的竞争对手。在软实力方面，巴西的狂欢节和足球等流行文化具有跨国吸引力，其外交政策也旨在向拉丁美洲及其他地区展现积极的形象。

Since curbing inflation and instituting market reforms in the 1990s, Brazil has shown an impressive rate of economic growth in the range of 5 percent in the 2000s, which some analysts believe might increase in the future.74 With a territory nearly three times the size of India’s, 90 percent of its 200 million people literate, a $2 trillion GDP equivalent to Russia’s, and per capita income of $10,000 (three times India’s and nearly twice China’s), Brazil has impressive power resources. In 2007, the discovery of massive offshore oil reserves promised to make Brazil a significant power in the energy arena as well. Brazil’s military is much smaller, and unlike the other BRICs, the country has no nuclear weapons. But it is the largest state on its continent and has no real peer competitors among its neighbors. In soft power terms, Brazil’s popular culture of carnival and football has transnational appeal, and it has adopted a foreign policy designed to project a positive image in Latin America and beyond.

巴西也面临着严峻的问题。其基础设施不足，司法系统不堪重负，谋杀率居高不下，腐败现象猖獗。在透明国际发布的全球清廉指数中，巴西在180个国家中排名第75位（相比之下，中国排名第79位，印度排名第84位，俄罗斯排名第146位）。在经济竞争力方面，世界经济论坛将巴西在133个国家中排名第56位（相比之下，中国排名第27位，印度排名第49位，俄罗斯排名第63位）。巴西在研发方面的投入低于经合组织平均水平；而人口仅为巴西25%的韩国，其专利申请量却是巴西的30倍左右。生产率增长缓慢，尽管巴西拥有一些成功的跨国公司，但正如一位巴西经理人所说，“我们这里不会出现哈佛或谷歌。”75一些巴西人认为，除非他们增加储蓄并加大对教育的投资，否则他们将无法提高生产率。76

Brazil also faces serious problems. Its infrastructure is inadequate, its legal system is overburdened, it has a very high murder rate, and corruption abounds. It ranks 75th out of 180 countries on Transparency International’s corruption perceptions index (compared to 79th for China, 84th for India, and 146th for Russia). In economic competitiveness, the World Economic Forum ranks Brazil as 56th among 133 countries (compared to 27th for China, 49th for India, and 63rd for Russia). Brazil spends less than the OECD average on research and development; and South Korea, with a population 25 percent of Brazil’s, registers about thirty times more patents. Productivity growth is sluggish, and although Brazil is the home of some successful transnational corporations, as one Brazilian manager puts it, “we are not going to have a Harvard or a Google here.”75 Some Brazilians believe that they will not be able to raise their productivity rate unless they increase their savings and invest more in education.76

贫困和不平等一直是巴西面临的严峻问题。巴西的基尼系数为0.55（1.0代表完全不平等，所有收入都集中在一个人手中），而美国的基尼系数为0.45，中国的为0.42，印度的为0.37，俄罗斯的为0.42。近年来，巴西采取了一系列措施来减少贫困和不平等。2003年至2008年间，巴西的极端贫困人口减少了50%，不平等程度下降了5.5%。77生活在贫困中的人口数量从 2003 年占总人口的 28% 下降到 2008 年的 16%。78

Poverty and inequality have been a serious problem for Brazil. The nation has a Gini coefficient index of 0.55 (1.0 is perfect inequality, with one person receiving all income) compared to 0.45 for the United States, 0.42 for China, 0.37 for India, and 0.42 for Russia. Brazil has recently taken a number of steps to reduce poverty and inequality. It reduced extreme poverty by 50 percent between 2003 and 2008, and inequality dropped by 5.5 percent.77 The number of people living in poverty fell from 28 percent of the total population in 2003 to 16 percent in 2008.78

就外交政策目标而言，“巴西才刚刚开始意识到自己所拥有的影响力”，并且拒绝了美国多次要求其改变对伊朗和委内瑞拉等国政策的请求。79但巴西在 2003 年为自己设定的三个外交政策目标上并没有取得显著进展：在联合国安理会获得常任理事国席位，在世贸组织多哈回合谈判中达成世界贸易协议，以及建立一个强大的南美集团。80当中国人为设定的固定汇率在2010年开始给巴西带来问题时，“不幸的是，巴西没有与中国争论的余地。巴西外交官珍视新兴金砖国家之间的团结……即使这种团结可能会威胁到巴西作为金砖国家所依赖的增长。”81巴西直到后来才表示更倾向于中国对巴西进行货币重估。此外，尽管新巴西的出现会使美国的外交政策比以往更加复杂，但巴西在本世纪不太可能成为美国的平等竞争对手。这一角色将留给中国。

In terms of foreign policy objectives, “Brazil is just starting to realize the weight it has,” and it has resisted a number of entreaties from the United States to alter its policy toward countries such as Iran and Venezuela.79 But Brazil has not made notable progress on the three foreign policy objectives it set for itself in 2003: a permanent seat on the UN Security Council, a world trade deal in the Doha Round of WTO talks, and creation of a powerful South American block.80 And when China’s artificially pegged exchange rates began to create problems for Brazil in 2010, “unfortunately, Brazil has no stomach for arguments with China. Its diplomats prize solidarity among the emerging BRIC nations . . . even when that solidarity could threaten the growth on which Brazil’s BRIC status is premised.”81 Only belatedly did Brazil say that it would prefer a Chinese revaluation. It is also the case that, although the new Brazil will complicate American diplomacy compared to the past, Brazil is not likely to try becoming a peer competitor to the United States in this century. That role will be left to China.

中国

在金砖国家中，中国无疑是最大的经济体，其人口和经济规模相当于其他三个国家的总和。此外，中国拥有规模最大的军队、最高的军费预算、最高的经济增长率以及最多的互联网用户。中国的人均收入以及人均互联网和移动电话用户数量落后于俄罗斯和巴西，但这种情况可能会改变。如果中国保持近期的高速增长，年增长率若超过7%，十年内中国经济规模将翻一番。中国已迅速从2008年经济危机中复苏，正如前文所述，高盛预计中国经济总量将在2027年超过美国。一位诺贝尔经济学奖得主甚至展望未来，预测到2040年，中国GDP将占全球GDP的40%。82

Among the BRICs, China is by far the giant, with a population and an economy equal to those of the other three countries combined. Moreover, it has the largest army, the largest military budget, the highest rate of economic growth, and the most Internet users of the four. China lags behind Russia and Brazil in income per capita and in Internet and mobile phone users per capita, but this may change if China maintains its recent high growth rates. At any figure above 7 percent per year, the Chinese economy will double in a decade. China recovered quickly from the 2008 economic crisis, and as mentioned previously, Goldman Sachs expects the total size of the Chinese economy to surpass that of the United States in 2027. One Nobel Laureate economist looks even further into the future and estimates that by 2040, China will produce 40 percent of global GDP.82

中国是沃尔夫预言的另一个过早崛起的超级大国。中国目前的实力声誉得益于人们对未来的预测。在一项民意调查中，44%的受访者错误地认为中国已经是世界最大的经济体，而只有27%的受访者正确地选择了美国（美国的经济体量是中国的三倍）。83十多年来，许多人认为中国是最有可能制衡美国实力或超越美国实力的竞争者。84最近有一本书甚至名为《当中国统治世界时：西方世界的终结和新全球秩序的诞生》。85早在 20 世纪 90 年代，民意调查显示，50% 的美国公众认为中国将在 21 世纪对美国的世界强国地位构成最大的挑战（相比之下，认为日本构成最大挑战的仅占 8%，认为俄罗斯和欧洲构成最大挑战的仅占 6%）。86

China is another of Wolf’s premature superpowers. China’s current reputation for power benefits from projections about the future. In one poll, 44 percent of respondents mistakenly thought that China already had the world’s largest economy, compared to 27 percent who accurately picked the United States (which is three times larger).83 For more than a decade, many have viewed China as the most likely contender to balance American power or surpass it.84 One recent book is even entitled When China Rules the World: The End of the Western World and the Birth of a New Global Order.85 Already in the 1990s, polls showed that 50 percent of the American public thought China would pose the biggest challenge to U.S. world power status in the twenty-first century (compared with 8 percent for Japan and 6 percent for Russia and Europe).86
