尽管大多数对中国实力的预测都基于其国内生产总值（GDP）的快速增长，但中国还拥有其他重要的实力资源。就基本资源而言，中国的领土面积与美国相当，人口是美国的四倍。中国拥有世界上规模最大的军队、约200枚核武器，以及在太空和网络空间（包括世界上最多的互联网用户）方面的现代化能力。在软实力资源方面，正如我们在第四章中所看到的，中国仍然缺乏能够与好莱坞或宝莱坞相媲美的文化产业，其大学水平尚未与美国匹敌，也缺乏像美国那样众多的非政府组织来创造大量的软实力。然而，中国正在大力提升其软实力。中国一直拥有极具吸引力的传统文化，并且孕育了数百位孔子。中国在世界各地设立了教授其语言和文化的机构。此外，中国还调整了外交策略，更多地采用多边机制，以缓解其他国家的担忧，并降低它们结盟制衡一个新兴大国的可能性。

Although most projections of Chinese power are based on the rapid growth rate of the nation’s GDP, China has other significant power resources. In terms of basic resources, its territory is equal to that of the United States and its population is four times greater. It has the world’s largest army, about 200 nuclear weapons, and modern capabilities in space and cyberspace (including the world’s largest number of Internet users). In soft power resources, as we saw in Chapter 4, China still lacks cultural industries able to compete with Hollywood or Bollywood, its universities are not yet the equal of America’s, and it lacks the many NGOs that generate much of America’s soft power. However, China is making major efforts to increase it soft power. China has always had an attractive traditional culture, and it has created several hundred Confucius Institutes around the world to teach its language and culture. China has also adjusted its diplomacy to use more multilateral arrangements to alleviate fears and reduce the likelihood of other countries allying to balance a rising power.

中国的确拥有令人瞩目的能源资源，但我们应该对主要基于当前增长率和政治言论的预测持怀疑态度。在中国和美国，对对方的看法都深受国内政治斗争的影响，两国都有人将对方视为敌人。即便没有这些扭曲的认知，如果两国军队没有做好应对各种突发情况的准备，都会被本国人民视为失职。至于前文提到的历史类比，请记住，到1900年，德国的工业实力已经超越英国，德皇推行的是一项冒险的、全球导向的外交政策，这必然会导致与其他大国的冲突。相比之下，中国在经济上仍然远远落后于美国，其政策主要集中于本地区及其经济发展。尽管中国的“市场列宁主义”经济模式（即所谓的“北京共识”）在威权国家能够带来软实力，但在许多民主国家却会产生相反的效果。87然而，中国的崛起让人想起修昔底德的警告，即认为冲突不可避免的信念可能成为冲突的主要原因之一。88双方都认为最终会与对方开战，因此都做出了合理的军事准备，而对方则将这些准备解读为自己最坏的担忧得到了证实。

China does have impressive power resources, but we should be skeptical about projections based primarily on current growth rates and political rhetoric. In both China and the United States, perceptions of the other country are heavily colored by domestic political struggles, and there are people in both countries who want to see the other as an enemy. Even without such distortions, the military on both sides would be seen by its countrymen and -women as derelict in its duties if it did not plan for all contingencies. As for the historical analogies mentioned earlier, remember that by 1900 Germany had surpassed Britain in industrial power and the kaiser was pursuing an adventurous, globally oriented foreign policy that was bound to bring about a clash with other great powers. In contrast, China still lags far behind the United States economically and has focused its policies primarily on its region and on its economic development. Even though China’s “market Leninist” economic model (the so-called Beijing Consensus) provides soft power in authoritarian countries, it has the opposite effect in many democracies.87 Nonetheless, the rise of China recalls Thucydides’s warning that belief in the inevitability of conflict can become one of its main causes.88 Each side, believing it will end up at war with the other, makes reasonable military preparations, which then are read by the other side as confirmation of its worst fears.

事实上，“中国崛起”这个说法并不准确。“中国复兴”或许更为贴切，因为无论从国土面积还是历史来看，中国长期以来都是东亚的重要力量。从公元500年到1500年，中国在技术和经济上都处于世界领先地位（尽管当时其影响力尚未遍及全球）。直到近五百年，中国才被率先受益于工业革命的欧美超越。20世纪80年代初邓小平推行市场改革后，中国经济保持了8%至9%的年均增长率，并最终走向辉煌。在二十世纪最后二十年里，中国的国民生产总值实现了惊人的三倍增长，这种务实的经济表现，以及其儒家文化，增强了中国在该地区的软实力。

In fact, the rise of China is a misnomer. Reemergence would be more accurate, because by size and history the Middle Kingdom has long been a major power in East Asia. Technically and economically, China was the world’s leader (though without global reach) from 500 to 1500. Only in the last half-millennium was it overtaken by Europe and America, which were first to benefit from the Industrial Revolution. After Deng Xiaoping’s market reforms in the early 1980s, China’s high annual growth rates of 8–9 percent led to a remarkable tripling of its GNP in the last two decades of the twentieth century, and this pragmatic economic performance, along with its Confucian culture, enhanced China’s soft power in the region.

中国在经济实力上与美国相比还有很长的路要走，发展道路上仍然面临诸多障碍。21世纪初，美国经济按购买力平价计算约为中国的两倍，按官方汇率计算则超过中国的三倍。然而，所有这些比较和预测都带有一定的主观性。例如，购买力平价是经济学家用来衡量不同社会福利水平的估算值。几年前，世界银行经济学家修改了他们的计算方法，结果中国按购买力平价计算的GDP一下子就下降了40%——或者更确切地说，可能只是点击了一下鼠标。89与此同时，以当前汇率进行比较（美国在这方面遥遥领先）会受到货币价值波动的影响，而中国曾利用人为压低的汇率来补贴其出口。尽管如此，在评估能源实力时，汇率比较往往更为准确。一顿饭、一次理发或一套房子的价格最好用购买力平价来比较，但进口石油或一架先进战斗机的成本则最好用支付这些成本所需的汇率来衡量。

China has a long way to go to equal the power resources of the United States and still faces many obstacles to development. At the beginning of the twenty-first century, the American economy was about twice the size of China’s in purchasing power parity and more than three times as large at official exchange rates. All such comparisons and projections are somewhat arbitrary, however. For example, purchasing power parity is an estimate that economists make to judge the equivalence in welfare in different societies. A few years ago, when World Bank economists revised their methodology, China’s GDP at purchasing power parity dropped 40 percent at the stroke of a pen or, more likely, the click of a mouse.89 Meanwhile, comparisons in terms of current exchange rates (by which the United States is much further ahead) depend on fluctuations in currency values, and China has used an artificially low exchange rate as a means to subsidize its exports. Nonetheless, exchange rate comparisons are often more accurate in estimating power resources. The price of a meal or a haircut or a house is best compared by using purchasing power parity, but the cost of imported oil or an advanced fighter aircraft is better judged at the exchange rates that must be used to pay for it.

即使中国整体GDP在2030年左右超过美国，两国经济规模虽将相当，但构成却不尽相同。中国仍将拥有广袤的欠发达农村地区，并将开始面临人口问题，这些问题源于其在20世纪实施的独生子女政策的滞后影响。中国新增劳动力人数将于2011年开始下降，劳动力规模将于2016年达到峰值。此外，随着国家的发展，经济增长速度往往会放缓。假设2030年后中国经济增长率为6%，而美国仅为2%，那么中国的人均收入要到本世纪下半叶才能与美国持平（具体时间取决于比较指标）。91

Even if overall Chinese GDP passes that of the United States around 2030, the two economies would be equivalent in size but not equal in composition. China would still have a vast underdeveloped countryside, and it will begin to face demographic problems from the delayed effects of the one child per couple policy it enforced in the twentieth century.90 Newcomers to China’s labor force will start declining in 2011, and China’s labor force will peak in 2016. Moreover, as countries develop, there is a tendency for growth rates to slow. If we assume a 6 percent Chinese growth and only 2 percent American growth after 2030, China would not equal the United States in per capita income until sometime in the second half of the century (depending on the measures of comparison).91

人均收入可以衡量一个经济体的成熟度。换句话说，中国令人瞩目的经济增长速度，加上其庞大的人口规模，很可能在未来某个时候使其经济总量超过美国。这已经为中国带来了可观的实力，但这并不意味着中国与美国平起平坐。而且，由于美国不太可能在此期间停滞不前，中国距离对美国霸权构成像上世纪初德意志帝国超越英国时那样的挑战还很遥远。即便模糊的霸权转移理论能够得到更清晰的阐述，就目前而言，事实也并不足以支持对即将到来的战争做出危言耸听的预测。92

Per capita income provides a measure of the sophistication of an economy. In other words, China’s impressive growth rate combined with the size of its population will likely lead it to pass the American economy in total size at some point. This has already provided China with impressive power resources, but that is not the same as equality. And because the United States is unlikely to be standing still during that period, China is a long way from posing the kind of challenge to American preponderance that the kaiser’s Germany posed when it passed Britain at the beginning of the last century. Even if fuzzy hegemonic transition theory were more clearly specified than it is, the facts do not at this point justify alarmist predictions of a coming war.92

此外，对经济增长趋势的线性预测可能会产生误导。各国在经济起飞初期往往会优先发展那些容易实现的领域，因为它们受益于进口技术，而随着经济发展水平的提高，经济增长速度通常会放缓。当人均收入超过1万美元时，经济增长速度就会放缓。此外，中国经济还面临着诸多严峻挑战，例如从效率低下的国有企业转型、日益加剧的不平等、大规模的内部移民、社会保障体系不完善、腐败以及可能导致政治不稳定的制度不健全。中国北部和东部的发展速度已经超过了南部和西部。31个省份中只有10个省的人均收入高于全国平均水平，而欠发达省份包括少数民族比例较高的地区，例如西藏和新疆。在发展中国家中，中国几乎是唯一一个老龄化速度异常快的国家。到20​​30年，中国的“老年人口将超过儿童人口”，一些中国人口学家担忧“未富先老”。93

Moreover, linear projections of economic growth trends can be misleading. Countries tend to pick the low-hanging fruit as they benefit from imported technologies in the early stages of economic takeoff, and growth rates generally slow as economies reach higher levels of development. At per capita incomes above $10,000, rates of growth slow down. In addition, the Chinese economy faces serious obstacles of transition from inefficient state-owned enterprises, growing inequality, massive internal migration, an inadequate social safety net, corruption, and inadequate institutions that could foster political instability. The north and east of the country have outpaced the south and west. Only ten of thirty-one provinces have per capita income above the national average, and underdeveloped provinces include those with higher proportions of minorities, such as Tibet and Xinjiang. Almost alone among developing countries, China is aging extraordinarily fast. By 2030, China will have “more elderly dependents than children,” and some Chinese demographers worry about “getting old before getting rich.”93

在2000年代，中国从世界第九大出口国跃升至世界第一大出口国，但随着2008年金融危机后全球贸易和金融平衡日益紧张，中国以出口为主导的发展模式可能需要调整。世界银行行长罗伯特·佐利克认为，中国以出口为主导的增长模式长期来看是不可持续的。因为要维持8%的增长，到2020年中国出口份额需要翻一番。减少储蓄、增加消费是显而易见的答案，但并非易事，因为人口老龄化可能导致家庭储蓄居高不下，而企业储蓄高企则反映了某些行业的特殊利益和有限的竞争。94

During the 2000s, China moved from being the ninth largest exporter to the largest in the world, but China’s export-led development model will probably need to be adjusted as global trade and financial balances become more contentious in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. World Bank president Robert Zoellick argues that China’s export-led growth model is unsustainable over time, because to maintain 8 percent growth would require a doubling of China’s share of exports by 2020. Reducing saving and increasing consumption are the obvious but not easy answers, because an aging population may keep household savings high, and high corporate savings reflect special interests and limited competition in some sectors.94

2010 年，中国拥有全球最大的两家银行和十大银行中的四家，但按规模排名可能会产生误导，直到中国清理掉仍然由政府控制的众多金融机构，并强制执行商业纪律和透明度。95一些经济学家认为，中国可能会经历痛苦的​​金融萎缩，但不太可能崩溃：“中国经济增长几乎肯定会大幅放缓，但中国仍将继续比世界其他地区增长得更快。”96尽管中国拥有巨额外汇储备（正如我们在第三章中看到的），但中国很难通过以本币向海外放贷来提高其金融杠杆。“除非中国拥有一个深度且开放的债券市场，利率由市场而非政府决定，否则此类人民币资产的需求将十分有限。”97

In 2010, China was home to the two largest and four of the ten largest banks in the world, though rankings by size can be misleading until China cleans up the many financial institutions that remain in government hands and enforces commercial discipline and transparency.95 Some economists think China could experience a painful financial contraction but a collapse is unlikely: “Chinese growth will almost certainly slow dramatically, but the country will nonetheless continue to grow faster than the rest of the world.”96 And although China holds huge foreign currency reserves (as we saw in Chapter 3), China will have difficulty increasing its financial leverage by lending overseas in its own currency. “Until China has a deep and open bond market where interest rates are set by the market and not the government, there will be only limited takers for such renminbi assets.”97

迄今为止，中国的威权政治体制在实现特定目标方面展现出了令人瞩目的权力转化能力——例如，成功举办奥运会、建设高速铁路项目，甚至刺激经济从全球金融危机中复苏。然而，中国能否长期保持这种能力，对外界和中国领导人而言都是一个谜。与生来就拥有民主宪法的印度不同，中国尚未找到解决伴随人均收入增长而来的政治参与（而非民主）诉求的途径。共产主义意识形态早已消逝，执政党的合法性依赖于经济增长和汉族民族主义。一位专家认为，中国政治体制缺乏合法性，腐败盛行，且缺乏清晰的自我完善愿景。如果经济衰退，中国很容易陷入政治动荡。“尽管中国取得了经济成就，国防能力也在不断增强，但只要它无法建立起一个有吸引力的政治体制，其国际影响力就将依然有限。”98另一位专家认为，经济变革将带来政治变革，到 2020 年，当人均 GDP 达到 7500 美元（按购买力平价 [ppp] 计算）时，中国将加入新加坡等被自由之家评为“部分自由”的国家行列。新加坡资深领导人李光耀认为，政治变革可能会在十年或十五年后到来，届时受过海外教育的年轻一代将掌握政权。“他们了解现行体制的问题，虽然会努力维护中国利益，但也会拥有更广阔的变革视野。”100中国能否找到一种能够有效应对不断壮大的城市中产阶级、区域发展不平衡以及少数民族不满情绪的方案，仍有待观察。关键在于，包括中国人自己在内，没有人能够预知中国的政治未来将如何演变，以及这将如何影响其经济增长。101

China’s authoritarian political system has thus far shown an impressive power-conversion capability in relation to specific targets—for example, the ability to stage a successful Olympic Games, build high-speed rail projects, or even stimulate the economy to recover from the global financial crisis. Whether China can maintain this capability over the longer term is a mystery both to outsiders and to Chinese leaders. Unlike India, which was born with a democratic constitution, China has not yet found a way to solve the problem of demands for political participation (if not democracy) that tend to accompany rising per capita income. The ideology of communism is long gone, and the legitimacy of the ruling party depends upon economic growth and ethnic Han nationalism. One expert argues that the Chinese political system lacks legitimacy, suffers from a high level of corruption, has no clear vision for self-improvement, and is vulnerable to political unrest should the economy falter. “Despite its economic successes and growing defense capabilities, China’s international influence will remain limited as long as it fails to evolve an attractive political system.”98 Another expert believes that economic change will bring political change, and by 2020, when per capita GDP will reach $7,500 (in purchasing power parity [ppp]), China will join countries such as Singapore that are rated by Freedom House as “partly free.”99 Singapore’s senior leader, Lee Kwan Yew, believes that political change may come in ten or fifteen years when a younger overseas-educated generation rises to power. “They understand the problems of the system, and while bargaining hard for Chinese interests, will have a broader view of change.”100 Whether China can develop a formula that can manage an expanding urban middle class, regional inequality, and resentment among ethnic minorities remains to be seen. The basic point is that no one, including the Chinese, knows how China’s political future will evolve and how that will affect its economic growth.101

网络政治带来了另一个复杂因素。正如我们在前一章所看到的，中国拥有超过4亿的互联网用户，是全球最大的互联网用户群体，同时也拥有高度发达的政府管控和过滤系统。不仅许多网民抱有强烈的民族主义情绪，少数派的自由主义观点也会被过滤掉，异议人士则会受到惩罚。尽管如此，信息泄露仍然不可避免。在信息流量急剧增长，而限制措施又可能阻碍经济增长的当下，如何应对信息流的激增，给中国领导人带来了一个棘手的难题。事实上，一些观察人士担心，中国崩溃而非崛起会带来不稳定。正如中国问题专家苏珊·谢克所言：“中国最大的危险并非其日益增长的实力，而是其内部的脆弱性。共产党的合法性薄弱，以及领导人的脆弱感，都可能导致中国在危机中做出鲁莽的举动。”102或者正如比尔·克林顿总统在1999年所说，虽然大多数人担心一个强大的中国带来的挑战，“但我们不要忘记一个虚弱的中国所带来的风险，它将饱受内部冲突、社会动荡和……的困扰。”犯罪活动猖獗；亚洲正成为一片巨大的不稳定区域。103一个无法控制移民流动、环境影响（包括对全球气候的影响）以及内部冲突的中国，将面临严峻的问题。政治有时会干扰经济预测。

Cyberpolitics presents another complication. As we saw in the previous chapter, with over 400 million users, China has the largest Internet population, as well as a highly developed system of governmental controls and filters. Not only are many Internet users intensely nationalistic, but also minority liberal views are filtered out and dissent is punished. Nonetheless, some leakage of information is inevitable. Coping with greatly increasing flows of information at a time when restrictions can hinder economic growth presents a sharp dilemma for Chinese leaders. Indeed, some observers fear instability caused by a collapsing, rather than a rising, China. In the words of China expert Susan Shirk, “It is China’s internal fragility, not its growing strength, that presents the greatest danger. The weak legitimacy of the Communist Party and its leaders’ sense of vulnerability could cause China to behave rashly in a crisis.”102 Or as President Bill Clinton put it in 1999, while most people worry about the challenge of a strong China, “let us not forget the risk of a weak China, beset by internal conflict, social dislocation and criminal activity; becoming a vast zone of instability in Asia.”103 A China that cannot control flows of migration, environmental effects on the global climate, and internal conflict poses serious problems. Politics sometimes has a way of confounding economic projections.

只要中国经济持续增长，其军事实力就可能增强，从而使中国在邻国眼中显得更具威胁性。中国官方公布的军费开支报告并未包含美国国防预算中的许多项目，但无论构成如何，从1989年到2008年，中国的官方军费预算每年都以两位数的速度增长。1991年的海湾战争、1995-1996年的台湾冲突以及1999年的科索沃战争，都让中国领导人意识到中国在现代化军事能力方面远远落后于其他国家，因此，他们在整个90年代几乎将军费开支翻了一番。中国从俄罗斯进口军事技术，其本国工业也在生产一些性能接近美国现役武器系统的武器系统。2010年五角大楼的一份报告估计，中国的军费开支总额为1500亿美元（相比之下，美国为7190亿美元），约占GDP的2%（相比之下，美国为4%）。104兰德公司的一项研究预测，到 2025 年，中国的军费开支将超过 1850 亿美元（以 2001 年美元计），约占美国当前军费开支的 25%。105

As long as China’s economy does grow, its military power will likely increase, thus making China appear more dangerous to its neighbors. Official Chinese reports of military expenditure do not include many items listed in the American defense budget, but regardless of composition, from 1989 to 2008 China’s official military budget increased by double digits every year. The Gulf War in 1991, the tensions over Taiwan in 1995–1996, and the Kosovo campaign of 1999 showed Chinese leaders how far China lagged behind in modern military capabilities, and as a result they nearly doubled military expenditures over the course of the 1990s. China has imported military technology from Russia, and its own industries are producing some weapons systems that are approaching the capability of those in the American inventory. A 2010 Pentagon report estimated China’s total military spending to be $150 billion (compared to $719 billion for the United States), or about 2 percent of GDP (compared to 4 percent for the United States).104 A RAND study projects that by 2025, China’s military expenditure will be more than $185 billion (in 2001 dollars), or about 25 percent of current American military expenditure.105

尽管中国尚未发展出令人瞩目的全球力量投射能力，但它能够凭借远程导弹和日益壮大的潜艇舰队，给美国在其近海的军事行动带来复杂性，这引发了人们对中国声称其对南海控制权拥有“核心利益”的质疑。正如中国问题专家肯尼斯·利伯塔尔所言：“中国普遍认为中美实力差距正在缩小，但这与现实不符。然而，中国确实存在某种程度的民族主义夸大其词。”106与此同时，中国在发展蓝水这一复杂进程中仍处于起步阶段。拥有航母战斗群的海军。107然而，中国军事能力的不断增强意味着，美国若要发挥军事作用以安抚亚洲盟友，就需要投入更多资源。此外，正如我们在第二章和第五章中所看到的，中国一直在大力发展网络空间非对称作战能力。

Although China has not developed impressive capabilities for global force projection, it is able to complicate American naval operations off its coast with long-range missiles and a growing submarine fleet, and this has raised questions about China’s new assertions of a “core interest” in control of the South China Sea. In the words of China expert Kenneth Lieberthal, “There is an overall feeling in China that there is a narrowing of the gap in power with the United States that is belied by reality. Nevertheless, there is a sort of national hyperbole in China.”106 At the same time, China is only at the beginning of the complex process of developing a blue water navy with carrier battle groups.107 Nonetheless, growing Chinese military capacity would mean that any American military role to reassure allies in Asia would require more resources. In addition, as we saw in Chapters 2 and 5, China has been making impressive efforts to develop asymmetrical conflict capabilities in cyberspace.

邓小平在1974年联合国大会上表示，“中国不是超级大国，也永远不会寻求成为超级大国。”108当代中国领导人认识到经济快速增长是国内政治稳定的关键，因此将重点放在经济发展以及他们所谓的“和谐”国际环境上，力求避免阻碍中国的发展。然而，时代更迭，权力往往会滋生傲慢，贪婪也会随着时间推移而膨胀。马丁·雅克认为，“崛起中的大国最终必然会利用其新获得的经济实力来实现更广泛的政治、文化和军事目标。这就是成为霸权国家所必然包含的，而中国也必将成为其中之一。”109传统上，中国将自己视为东亚朝贡国家体系的中心，或称“中央王国”，并将寻求重建这一秩序。110约翰·伊肯伯里等人则认为，当前的国际秩序具有开放性、经济一体化和吸收中国的能力，而不是被中国主导的秩序所取代。111迄今为止，中国领导人在扮演重要的全球角色方面，无论是作为霸权国家还是作为“负责任的利益攸关方”，都只采取了微小的举措。他们仍然扮演着搭便车者的角色，但“他们第一次开始依赖于一个他们无法控制的世界，而不是一个他们可以控制的帝国。”112

Deng told the UN General Assembly in 1974 that “China is not a superpower, nor will it ever seek to be one.”108 The current generation of Chinese leaders, realizing that rapid economic growth is the key to domestic political stability, has focused on economic development and on what it calls a “harmonious” international environment that will not disrupt China’s growth. But generations change, power often creates hubris, and appetites sometimes grow with eating. Martin Jacques argues that “rising powers in time invariably use their newfound economic strength for wider political, cultural and military ends. That is what being a hegemonic power involves, and China will surely become one.”109 Traditionally, China saw itself as the center, or “middle kingdom,” of a tributary system of states in East Asia and will seek to re-create this order.110 Others such as John Ikenberry argue that the current international order has the openness, economic integration, and capacity to absorb China rather than be replaced by a Chinese-led order.111 Thus far, Chinese leaders have taken only minor steps toward a major global role, whether as a hegemon or as a “responsible stakeholder.” They still act as free-riders, but “for the first time are becoming dependent on a world which they cannot control rather than an empire which they can control.”112

正如我们之前看到的，一些怀疑论者认为，中国的目标是“在短期内取代美国成为东亚的主导力量，在长期内挑战美国作为世界主导力量的地位”。113即使这是对中国意图的准确评估（即便中国人也无法预知后代的想法），中国是否具备实现这一目标的军事能力也令人怀疑。此外，中国领导人不仅要应对其他国家的反应，还要应对自身经济增长目标以及对外部市场和资源的需求所带来的制约。中国过于强硬的军事姿态可能会在其地区邻国中引发反制联盟，从而削弱其硬实力和软实力。例如，2010年，随着中国对位于越南东海岸250英里外的西沙群岛的主权声索日益强硬，越南方面谴责了这一举动，并开始“在幕后大力推动更多外国势力参与谈判，迫使中国在多边环境下进行谈判”，这与中国倾向于与各国进行一对一谈判的策略背道而驰。114此外，皮尤研究中心对全球16个国家进行的一项民意调查发现，人们对中国的经济崛起持积极态度，但对其军事崛起则不然。“如果人们主要将中国视为一个经济力量，那么他们很可能既赞成中国的崛起，又亲美。相反，如果一个人主要将中国视为一个日益强大的军事力量，那么他或她的亲美情绪往往意味着对中国崛起的反对。”115

As we saw earlier, some skeptics have argued that China aims “in the near term to replace the United States as the dominant power in East Asia and in the long term to challenge America’s position as the dominant power in the world.”113 Even if this were an accurate assessment of China’s intentions (and even the Chinese cannot know the views of future generations), it is doubtful that China will have the military capability to make this possible. Moreover, Chinese leaders will have to contend with the reactions of other countries as well as the constraints created by their own objectives of economic growth and the need for external markets and resources. Too aggressive a Chinese military posture could produce a countervailing coalition among its regional neighbors that would weaken both its hard and soft power. In 2010, for example, as China became more assertive in its claims to the Paracel Islands that lie 250 miles off the east coast of Vietnam, the Vietnamese denounced the move and began “pushing hard behind the scenes to bring more foreign players into negotiations so that China will have to bargain in a multilateral setting,” which goes against China’s preference to negotiate one on one with each country.114 Moreover, a Pew poll of sixteen countries around the world found a positive attitude toward China’s economic rise but not toward its military rise. “If China is perceived as mainly an economic actor, that person is likely to both approve China’s rise and being pro-U.S. By contrast, if an individual mainly sees China as an increasing military power, then his or her pro-American sentiments will often mean disapproval of China’s rise.”115

中国不太可能在全球范围内成为美国的同等竞争对手，但这并不意味着它不能在亚洲挑战美国，但正如前面提到的，中国在亚洲的崛起受到了印度和日本（以及其他国家）的挑战，这为美国提供了巨大的力量优势。116美日同盟——1996年克林顿-桥本宣言重申其为后冷战时代东亚稳定的基础——以及布什政府时期美印关系的改善，都是制约中国野心的重要因素。这意味着在该地区的大国政治格局中，中国难以轻易将美国排挤出局。凭借这一优势地位，美国、日本、印度、澳大利亚等国可以携手与中国接触，激励其发挥负责任的作用，同时防范中国实力增长可能带来的侵略行为。

That China is not likely to become a peer competitor to the United States on a global basis does not mean that it could not challenge the United States in Asia, but as mentioned earlier, the rise of Chinese power in Asia is contested by both India and Japan (as well as other states), and that provides a major power advantage to the United States.116 The U.S.-Japan alliance, which the Clinton-Hashimoto declaration of 1996 reaffirmed as the basis for stability in post–Cold War East Asia, is an important impediment to Chinese ambitions, as is the improvement in U.S.-Indian relations that advanced under the Bush administration. This means that in the great power politics of the region, China cannot easily expel the Americans. From that position of strength, the United States, Japan, India, Australia, and others can work to engage China and provide incentives for it to play a responsible role, while hedging against the possibility of aggressive behavior as China’s power grows.

美国实力：国内衰败？

AMERICAN POWER: DOMESTIC DECAY?

有人认为，行使权力的成本最终会压垮所有帝国，而由于美国的帝国扩张过度，将会出现权力转移。117迄今为止，事实与这一理论并不十分吻合，因为外部负担并未随时间推移而增加。相反，过去几十年里，国防和外交支出占国民生产总值的比例有所下降。尽管如此，美国相对实力的下降并非源于帝国扩张过度，而是源于国内发展不足。正如历史学家所言，罗马帝国的衰落始于内部。民众对自身的文化和制度失去了信心，精英阶层争夺权力，腐败盛行，经济增长乏力。118

Some argue that the costs of exercising power eventually overburden all empires and that a power transition will occur because of America’s imperial overstretch.117 Thus far, the facts do not fit this theory very well because external burdens have not increased over time. Instead, defense and foreign affairs expenditures have declined as a share of GNP over the past several decades. Nonetheless, the United States could decline in terms of relative power not because of imperial overstretch, but because of domestic underreach. As historians remind us, Rome rotted from within. People lost confidence in their culture and institutions, elites battled for control, corruption increased, and the economy failed to grow adequately.118

美国是否会因为国内文化冲突、制度崩溃和经济停滞而丧失其对世界局势的影响力？如果美国社会和制度看似正在崩溃，美国对其他国家的吸引力将会下降。如果经济衰退，美国将失去硬实力和软实力。即便美国继续拥有令人瞩目的军事、经济和软实力资源，它也可能缺乏将这些资源转化为有效影响力的能力。毕竟，有些人即使拿到好牌，最终也会输掉比赛。

Could the United States lose its ability to influence world events because of domestic battles over culture, collapse of institutions, and economic stagnation? If American society and institutions appear to be collapsing, the United States will be less attractive to others. If the economy fails, the United States will lose hard as well as soft power. And even if the United States continues to hold impressive military, economic, and soft power resources, it could lack the capacity to transform those resources into effective influence. After all, some card players lose despite being dealt high hands.

社会与文化

尽管美国存在诸多社会问题——而且一直如此——但这些问题似乎并非呈线性恶化趋势。有些问题甚至有所改善，例如犯罪率、离婚率和青少年怀孕率。围绕同性婚姻和堕胎等议题，文化冲突依然存在，但民调显示，总体而言，社会的包容度有所提高。公民社会充满活力，教堂出席率高达42%。119然而，民意调查显示，人们的感知与现实之间存在“乐观差距”。部分原因在于，媒体倾向于强调与负面新闻主题相符的故事。对国家层面趋势的反应是一种媒介效应，很少有人拥有直接经验。即便有人有相关经验，大多数人也会告诉民调机构，他们自己的生活、社区、学校和国会议员都很好，尽管他们对国家层面感到担忧。如果每个人都从媒体上“得知”国家层面一团糟，而他们又没有直接经验，那么他们就会把关于国家状况的普遍看法告诉民调机构。由此产生的乐观程度差异并不能令人信服地证明国家正在衰落。过去围绕移民、奴隶制、进化论、禁酒运动、麦卡锡主义和民权运动的文化斗争，可以说比当今任何争议问题都更加激烈。民调显示，人们常常对过去抱有美好的幻想。通过将过去的美好与现在的糟糕进行比较，总是很容易证明衰落（或者反过来，通过比较现在的糟糕来证明进步）。

Although the United States has many social problems—and always has—they do not seem to be getting worse in any linear manner. Some are even improving, such as crime, divorce rates, and teenage pregnancy. There are culture wars over issues such as same-sex marriage and abortion, but polls nevertheless show an overall increase in tolerance. Civil society is robust, and church attendance is high at 42 percent.119 Nonetheless, polls show an “optimism gap” between perceptions and reality. In part, this reflects the media’s tendency to emphasize stories consistent with a bad news theme. Reaction to national-level trends is a mediated phenomenon, with few people having direct experience. To the extent they do, the majority tell pollsters that their own lives, communities, schools, and congressmen are fine, though they worry about the national level. If everyone “knows” from the media that things are a mess at the national level and they have no direct experience at the national level, they tell pollsters the conventional wisdom about the national condition. The resulting optimism gap is not convincing evidence of decline. Past culture battles over immigration, slavery, evolution, temperance, McCarthyism, and civil rights were arguably more serious than any of today’s issues of contention. Polls show that people often attribute a golden glow to the past. It is always easy to show decay by comparing the good in the past with the bad in the present (or progress by doing the converse).

此类文化判断可能从两个方面对美国国家实力产生不利影响。首先，如果美国民众因社会和文化问题而分心或分裂，以致美国丧失了在外交政策上采取集体行动的能力，那么其硬实力就会削弱。20世纪70年代，越战后美国社会出现严重分歧，这似乎就是一个问题。相比之下，尽管对伊拉克战争的支持率从2003年的72%下降到2008年的36%，但美国公众舆论仍然支持积极的外交政策。120

There are two ways in which such cultural judgments could adversely affect American national power. First, if Americans were so distracted or divided by internal battles over social and cultural issues that the United States lost the capacity to act collectively in foreign policy, hard power would diminish. That appeared to be a problem in the 1970s in the aftermath of deep divisions over Vietnam. In contrast, even though support for the Iraq War fell from 72 percent in 2003 to 36 percent by 2008, American public opinion continued to support an active foreign policy.120

其次，美国社会状况的恶化可能会削弱其软实力。尽管美国在一些社会问题上取得了进步，但在婴儿死亡率、预期寿命、儿童贫困率和凶杀率等方面，美国仍落后于其他发达国家。此类比较可能会损害美国的软实力，但美国并非唯一面临诸多争议性文化变革的国家。当这些问题普遍存在时，比较的负面影响就会降低，对软实力的损害也会减小。例如，自1960年以来，整个西方世界对权威的尊重和某些行为准则有所下降。但几乎没有迹象表明美国人的个人责任感低于其他国家。与其他发达的西方社会相比，慈善捐赠和社区服务水平普遍较高。121

Second, a decline in the quality of American social conditions could reduce soft power. Although America has made progress on some social issues, the United States lags behind other rich countries on infant mortality, life expectancy, children in poverty, and homicides. Such comparisons can be costly for American soft power, but the United States is not alone in many of the cultural changes that cause controversy. When such problems are shared, comparisons are less invidious and less damaging to soft power. For example, respect for authority and some standards of behavior have declined since 1960 throughout the Western world. But there is little indication that American levels of personal responsibility are lower than those of other advanced Western societies, and levels of charitable giving and community service are generally higher.121

移民

更令人担忧的是，如果美国转向内向型政策并大幅削减移民。以目前的移民水平来看，美国是少数几个能够避免人口下降并维持其世界人口份额的发达国家之一，但如果对恐怖袭击或公众仇外情绪的反应导致边境关闭，这种情况可能会发生改变。自建国初期以来，人们就一直担忧移民会对国家价值观和美国民族认同感产生怎样的影响。19世纪的“一无所知党”（Know Nothing Party）正是建立在反对移民，特别是爱尔兰移民的基础上的。从1882年起，亚洲人就被特别排斥在外，而随着1924年《移民限制法》的颁布，移民流入在接下来的四十年里放缓。20世纪，美国外来人口比例在1910年达到最高，占总人口的14.7%。如今，这一比例为11.7%。122

A more serious concern would be if the United States turned inward and seriously curtailed immigration. With its current levels of immigration, America is one of the few developed countries that may avoid demographic decline and keep its share of world population, but this might change if reactions to terrorist events or public xenophobia closed the borders. Fears over the effect of immigration on national values and on a coherent sense of American identity have existed since the early years of the nation. The nineteenth-century Know Nothing Party was built upon opposition to immigrants, particularly the Irish. Asians were singled out for exclusion from 1882 onward, and with the Immigration Restriction Act of 1924 the influx of immigrants slowed for the next four decades. During the twentieth century, the nation recorded its highest percentage of foreign-born residents in 1910—14.7 percent of the population. Today, 11.7 percent are foreign born.122

尽管美国是一个移民国家，但对移民持怀疑态度的美国人多于支持移民的人。多项民意调查显示，多数人甚至大多数美国人希望减少移民进入美国。123经济衰退加剧了这种观点，2009 年，50% 的美国人赞成减少移民，高于 2008 年的 39%。124新移民的数量和来源都引发了人们对移民对美国文化影响的担忧。2000 年人口普查数据显示，受合法和非法新移民潮的推动，西班牙裔人口激增，西班牙裔即将取代黑人成为美国最大的少数族裔。125 位人口统计学家描绘了 2050 年美国的一个景象：非西班牙裔白人仅占微弱多数；西班牙裔占 25%；黑人占 14%；亚裔占 8%。126

Despite being a nation of immigrants, more Americans are skeptical about immigration than are sympathetic to it. Various polls show that a plurality or majority wants fewer immigrants coming into the country.123 The recession exacerbated such views, and in 2009, 50 percent of Americans favored decreasing immigration, up from 39 percent in 2008.124 Both the numbers and origins of the new immigrants have caused concerns about immigration’s effects on American culture. Data from the 2000 census showed a soaring Hispanic population driven largely by waves of new immigrants, legal and illegal, with Hispanics about to replace blacks as the nation’s largest minority.125 Demographers have portrayed a country in 2050 in which non-Hispanic whites will be only a slim majority. Hispanics will be 25 percent; blacks, 14 percent; and Asians, 8 percent.126

通讯和市场力量为移民掌握英语并接受新环境提供了强大的动力。同化程度。大多数证据表明，最新一批移民的同化速度至少与他们的前辈一样快。现代媒体帮助新移民比一个世纪前的移民更早地了解他们的新国家。尽管快速的非法移民会引发社会问题，但支持者认为，从长远来看，合法移民会增强美国的实力。随着本世纪的推进，大多数发达国家都将面临人口短缺。目前约有83个国家和地区的生育率低于维持人口稳定所需的水平。为了维持目前的人口规模，日本需要在未来50年内每年接收35万新移民，这对于一个历史上对移民持敌对态度的文化来说，无疑是一个难题。127尽管美国民众态度矛盾，但它仍然是一个移民国家。人口普查局预测，未来四十年美国人口将增长49%。

Communications and market forces produce a powerful incentive for immigrants to master the English language and accept a degree of assimilation. Most of the evidence suggests that the latest immigrants are assimilating at least as quickly as their predecessors. Modern media help new immigrants to know more about their new country beforehand than immigrants did a century ago. Although rapid illegal immigration can cause social problems, proponents argue that over the long term legal immigration strengthens the power of the United States. Most developed countries will experience a shortage of people as the century progresses. Some eighty-three countries and territories currently have fertility rates that are below the level necessary for a constant population level. To maintain its current population size, Japan would have to accept 350,000 newcomers a year for the next fifty years, which is difficult for a culture that has historically been hostile to immigration.127 Despite American ambivalence, it remains a country of immigration. The Census Bureau projects that the American population will grow 49 percent over the next four decades.

如今，美国是世界第三人口大国；五十年后，它很可能仍将保持第三的位置（仅次于印度和中国）。这不仅关乎经济实力，而且鉴于几乎所有发达国家都面临人口老龄化和赡养老年人的重担，移民或许有助于缓解这一政策难题的严峻性。此外，技术移民带来的经济效益对特定行业至关重要，尽管研究表明，短期内直接可衡量的国家层面经济效益相对较小，而且非技术工人可能会面临竞争。H-1B签证数量与美国专利申请数量之间存在很强的相关性。移民大学毕业生人数每增加1%，人均专利申请量就会增加6%。128 1998 年，中国和印度出生的工程师经营着硅谷四分之一的高科技企业，这些企业的销售额达 178 亿美元；2005 年，在过去十年中，每四家美国科技创业公司中就有一家是由外国移民参与创办的。129

Today, the United States is the world’s third most populous country; fifty years from now it is still likely to be third (after only India and China). Not only is this relevant to economic power, but also with nearly all developed countries aging and facing a burden of providing for the older generation, immigration could help reduce the sharpness of the policy problem. In addition, the economic benefits of skilled immigrants can be important to particular sectors, even though studies suggest that the short-term directly measurable economic benefits at the national level are relatively small and unskilled workers may suffer from competition. There is a strong correlation between the number of H-1B visas and the number of patents filed in the United States. A 1 percent increase in the number of immigrant college graduates leads to a 6 percent increase in patents per capita.128 In 1998, Chinese- and Indian-born engineers were running one-quarter of Silicon Valley’s high-technology businesses, which accounted for $17.8 billion in sales, and in 2005, foreign-born immigrants had participated in one of every four American technology start-ups during the previous decade.129

移民对美国软实力的益处同样重要。人们渴望来到美国，这增强了美国的吸引力，而移民的向上流动性对其他国家的人们也极具吸引力。美国就像一块磁铁，许多人都能想象自己成为美国人。许多成功的美国人看起来与其他国家的人“很像”。此外，移民与家乡的亲朋好友之间的联系有助于传递关于美国的真实而积极的信息。而且，多元文化的存在也为与其他国家建立联系创造了途径，并有助于在全球化时代拓宽美国人的视野。移民非但没有削弱硬实力和软实力，反而增强了二者。长期敏锐地观察美国和中国的李光耀认为，中国不会超越美国成为21世纪的领先大国，他认为美国能够吸引来自世界各地的最优秀、最聪明的人才，并将他们融合到一个充满创造力的多元文化中，是造成这一结论的主要原因。中国拥有更庞大的国内人口可供招募，但在他看来，中国以中国为中心的文化将使其创造力不如美国。130

Equally important are immigration’s benefits for America’s soft power. That people want to come to the United States enhances America’s appeal, and the upward mobility of immigrants is attractive to people in other countries. America is a magnet, and many people can envisage themselves as Americans. Many successful Americans “look like” people in other countries. Moreover, connections between immigrants and their families and friends back home help to convey accurate and positive information about the United States. In addition, the presence of multiple cultures creates avenues of connection with other countries and helps create an important broadening of American attitudes in an era of globalization. Rather than diluting hard and soft power, immigration enhances both. When Lee Kwan Yew, an acute longtime observer of both the United States and China, concludes that China will not surpass the United States as the leading power of the twenty-first century, he cites as a major reason the ability of the United States to attract the best and brightest from the rest of the world and meld them into a diverse culture of creativity. China has a larger population to recruit from domestically, but in his view, its Sino-centric culture will make it less creative than the United States.130

经济

尽管迄今为止讨论的文化和社会问题似乎不太可能削弱美国的实力，但美国经济一旦出现问题，将会造成真正的致命打击。经济衰退并非指所有资本主义经济体都会经历的正常衰退，而是指生产率水平和持续增长能力的长期下滑。尽管宏观经济预测（如同天气预报一样）向来不可靠，但美国在2008年金融危机后的十年里经济增长速度似乎将会放缓。国际货币基金组织预计，在当前经济衰退之后，2014年美国经济增长率平均约为2%。哈佛大学经济学家马丁·费尔德斯坦预测，未来十年经济增长率也将与之相近。十年。这低于过去几十年的平均水平，但“与过去十年的平均水平大致相同”。131

Although the cultural and social problems discussed thus far do not seem likely to weaken American power, a failure in the performance of the American economy would be a real showstopper. Economic failure does not mean recessions that are normal in all capitalist economies, but a long-term slump in the level of productivity and the capacity for sustained growth. Even though macroeconomic forecasts (like weather forecasts) are notoriously unreliable, it appears that the United States will experience slower growth in the decade after the 2008 financial crisis. The International Monetary Fund expects economic growth in the aftermath of the current recession to average about 2 percent in 2014. Harvard economist Martin Feldstein projects a similar rate for the next decade. This is lower than the average over the past several decades but “roughly the same as the average rate over the past ten years.”131

20世纪80年代，许多观察家认为美国经济已经后劲不足。包括汽车和消费电子产品在内的多个制造业领域的技术优势已经丧失。二战后二十年间，美国劳动生产率的年均增长率为2.7%，而到了80年代，这一数字已下滑至1.4%。尽管美国的生活水平在七大市场经济体中仍然最高，但自1972年以来，其增长速度仅为其他国家的四分之一。据一家主流商业杂志1987年报道，“美国正处于增长危机之中……曾经毋庸置疑的个人和国家议程，如今看来都过于昂贵。”132当时人们认为日本和德国正在超越美国，这削弱了美国的硬实力和软实力。美国似乎失去了竞争优势。然而，如今，即使在经历了金融危机和随之而来的经济衰退之后，世界经济论坛在全球经济竞争力排名中仍将美国列为第四（排在瑞士、瑞典和新加坡之后）。相比之下，中国排名第二十七。133美国经济在许多新兴领域处于领先地位，例如信息技术、生物技术和纳米技术。美国的研发投入超过了排名其后的七个国家的总和。134一些经济学家认为，美国的“冒险消费是该国创业商业文化的重要补充”。135

In the 1980s, many observers believed that the U.S. economy had run out of steam. Technological dominance had been lost in several manufacturing sectors, including automobiles and consumer electronics. The annual rate of increase of labor productivity, which averaged 2.7 percent in the two decades after World War II, had slipped to 1.4 percent in the 1980s. Although the American standard of living was still the highest among the seven largest market economies, it had grown only one-quarter as fast as the others since 1972. According to a leading business magazine in 1987, “The nation is in a growth crisis. . . . Both personal and national agendas that were once unquestioned suddenly seem too expensive.”132 Japan and Germany were believed to be overtaking America, and this undercut American hard and soft power. The United States seemed to have lost its competitive edge. Today, however, even after the financial crisis and ensuing recession, the World Economic Forum ranked the United States fourth (after Switzerland, Sweden, and Singapore) in global economic competitiveness. In comparison, China ranked twenty-seventh.133 And the American economy leads in many new sectors, such as information technology, biotechnology, and nanotechnology. The United States spends more on research and development than the next seven countries combined.134 Some economists argue that America’s “venturesome consumption is a vital counterpart to the country’s entrepreneurial business culture.”135

生产力增长能否在本世纪继续支撑美国的实力？乐观者认为，美国在信息技术的生产和应用方面处于领先地位。1995年以后，计算能力成本下降速度的显著提升提高了美国的生产力。生产力至关重要，因为工人每小时的产出越多，经济就能在不出现短缺和通货膨胀的情况下实现更大幅度的增长。而持续的非通胀增长能够提供可用于投资硬实力的资源，从而增强美国的实力。增强软实力。对工具或新型组织形式的新投资可以提高生产力。

Will productivity growth support American power well into this century? Optimists cite the U.S. lead in the production and use of information technologies. After 1995, a noticeable change in the rate of decline in the cost of computing power enhanced American productivity. Productivity is crucial because the more that workers can produce per hour, the more the economy can grow without shortages and inflation. And sustained noninflationary growth provides the resources that can be invested in hard power and that can enhance soft power. Productivity can increase because of new investment in tools or new forms of organization.

信息技术并非美国生产力的唯一来源。美国农业创新显著，全球化开放也发挥了重要作用，但计算机和电子产业在1960年至2006年间贡献了44%的生产力增长，其在GDP中的占比也高于其他主要工业化国家。正如一位权威专家所言：“令人惊讶的是，自2000年互联网泡沫破灭以来，美国经济的生产力增长持续快速攀升，表明其创新能力强劲。”而且，这种增长势头如今正向用户行业蔓延。欧盟主要经济体并未达到美国生产力增长的如此迅猛程度。136一些经济学家预测，未来十年美国生产率增长将放缓至 2.25%，而另一些经济学家则预测，未来十年生产率增长将接近 1.5%。137

Information technology is not the only source of American productivity. The United States has seen significant agricultural innovation, and openness to globalization also plays a role, but the computer and electronics industry generated 44 percent of productivity growth from 1960 to 2006, and the IT sector accounts for a larger share of GDP than in the other major industrial countries. As a leading expert concludes, “Surprisingly, productivity growth in the U.S. economy has continued to rise at a rapid pace since the dot-com crash in 2000, indicating a high rate of innovation,” and this growth is now spreading to user industries. The acceleration of American productivity growth was not equaled in the major economies of the EU.136 Some economists project that American productivity growth will slow to 2.25 percent, whereas others forecast a rate closer to 1.5 percent in the next decade.137

在研发投入方面，美国以2007年的3690亿美元位居世界第一，其次是亚洲（3380亿美元）和欧盟（2630亿美元）。不过，北美在全球研发投入总额中所占的份额从1996年的40%下降到2007年的35%，而亚洲的份额则上升到31%。美国研发支出占其GDP的2.7%，几乎是中国的两倍，但略低于日本和韩国的3%。138 2007 年，美国发明家在美国注册了约 80,000 项专利，比世界其他地区加起来还要多。139一些报告对企业税率、人力资本和海外专利增长等问题表示担忧。另一些人则认为，美国人之所以在技术应用和商业化方面更具创新性，是因为美国的创业文化。美国的风险投资公司将其70%的资金投资于国内初创企业，而不是海外企业。一项全球创业调查显示，美国在创业方面领先于其他国家，原因在于……它拥有良好的文化氛围、最成熟的风险投资行业、大学与产业界密切合作的传统以及开放的移民政策。140

In terms of investment in research and development, the United States was the world leader with $369 billion in 2007, followed by Asia ($338 billon) and the European Union ($263 billion), though the North American share of the global total dropped from 40 percent in 1996 to 35 percent in 2007, while Asia’s rose to 31 percent. The United States spent 2.7 percent of its GDP on research and development, nearly double that of China, but slightly less than the 3 percent for Japan and Korea.138 In 2007, American inventors registered about 80,000 patents in the United States, or more than the rest of the world combined.139 A number of reports have expressed concern about matters such as corporate tax rates, human capital, and the growth of overseas patents. Others argue that Americans are more innovative at using and commercializing technologies because of the country’s entrepreneurial culture. Venture capital firms in the United States invest 70 percent of their money in start-ups in this country rather than overseas. A survey of global entrepreneurship ranked the United States ahead of other countries because it had a favorable culture, the most mature venture capital industry, a tradition of close relations between universities and industry, and an open immigration policy.140

除了新的生产率是否可持续这一问题之外，美国经济的未来还面临其他一些担忧，例如个人储蓄率低、经常账户赤字（这意味着美国人对外国的债务越来越多）以及政府债务上升。个人储蓄难以计算，且容易出现严重的测量误差，但其趋势明显下降：从20世纪70年代占个人收入的9.7%下降到2001年的接近于零，并在2008-2009年金融危机后回升至约4%。141部分原因是消费主义文化的盛行和信贷获取的便利。这种下降究竟有多大影响，难以确定。国民储蓄率包含了政府和企业的储蓄，但其衡量标准已过时。142日本保持了较高的个人储蓄率，但其经济却停滞不前。如果考虑到美国资本品价格更低这一因素，美国的实际投资与其他经合组织国家相比则更具优势。143危险在于，在严重的经济衰退中，外国投资者可能会迅速撤回投资，加剧经济不稳定。尽管与一些预测相反，美元仍然是避险货币，美国财政部在2008年危机后也维持了AAA评级。然而，如果美国通过提高储蓄率来为其投资提供更多资金，美国人的收入将会更高，经济不稳定的风险也会降低。

In addition to the question of whether the new rates of productivity are sustainable, other concerns about the future of American economy include the low rate of personal savings, the current account deficit (which means that Americans are becoming more indebted to foreigners), and the rise in government debt. Personal savings are difficult to calculate and subject to serious measurement errors, but the trend was clearly down from 9.7 percent of personal incomes in the 1970s to near zero in 2001, recovering to about 4 percent after the financial crisis of 2008–2009.141 In part this decline was attributed to an increased culture of consumerism and easier access to credit. How much this decline matters is difficult to determine. The national savings rate includes government and corporate saving and is based on outdated measures.142 Japan kept up a high personal savings rate, but its economy stagnated. When corrected for the fact that capital goods are cheaper in the United States, American real investment compares favorably with other OECD countries.143 The danger is that in a severe recession foreigners might withdraw their investments rapidly and add to instability in the economy, though contrary to some predictions, the dollar remained a safe haven and the Treasury retained its AAA rating in the immediate aftermath of the 2008 crisis. Nonetheless, American income would be higher and dangers of instability lessened if the United States financed more of its investment through higher savings.

金融危机之后，政府债务水平成为人们关注的焦点。正如英国历史学家尼尔·弗格森所言：“帝国衰落的根源就在于此，始于债务爆炸。”银行救助和凯恩斯主义刺激计划不仅加剧了债务，而且社会保障和医疗保健等福利项目的支出以及偿还债务也将占据未来财政收入的很大一部分。“除非削减福利支出或增加税收，否则这种情况将难以避免。”如果债务问题得不到解决，就再也不会有平衡预算了。”弗格森接着说，“认为美国是‘避风港’的想法是无稽之谈。美国的政府债务就像1941年的珍珠港一样，才是真正的避风港。”144但美国不是希腊。

After the financial crisis, a major source of concern became the level of government debt. In the words of British historian Niall Ferguson, “This is how empires decline. It begins with a debt explosion.” Not only did the bank bailout and Keynesian stimulus package add to debt, but also the costs of entitlement programs for social security and health care and servicing of the debt will claim large shares of future revenue. “Unless entitlements are cut or taxes are raised, there will never be another balanced budget.” Ferguson goes on to say that “the idea that the US is a ‘safe haven’ is nonsense. Its government debt is a safe haven the way Pearl Harbor was in 1941.”144 But America is not Greece.

美国国会预算办公室预测，到2023年，政府债务总额将达到GDP的100%。许多经济学家对富裕国家的债务水平超过90%感到担忧，“但美国相对于其他国家拥有两大优势，使其能够相对平静地应对债务问题：一是拥有世界储备货币，二是拥有流动性最强的资产市场——国债。”145在金融危机期间，美元走强，债券收益率下降，这使得美国更容易为其赤字融资。突如其来的信心危机本身并非问题所在，真正的问题在于偿债成本的逐步上升，这会影响经济的长期健康发展。研究表明，债务占GDP比重每增加1%，利率就会上升0.03%，而更高的利率意味着私营部门投资减少，长期来看经济增长放缓。“所有这些影响都可以通过良好的政策来缓解，或者通过糟糕的政策来加剧。”146债务增加不一定会导致衰退，尽管它肯定会增加风险。

The Congressional Budget Office calculates that total government debt will reach 100 percent of GDP by 2023. Many economists worry when debt levels in rich countries exceed 90 percent, “but America has two huge advantages over other countries that have allowed it to face its debt with relative equanimity: possessing both the world’s reserve currency and its most liquid asset market, in Treasury bonds.”145 During the financial crisis, the dollar rose and bond yields fell, making it easier for America to finance its deficit. A sudden crisis of confidence is less the problem than is a gradual increase in the cost of servicing the debt, affecting the long-term health of the economy. Studies suggest that interest rates rise 0.03 percent for every 1 percent increase in the debt-to-GDP ratio, and higher interest rates mean lower private-sector investment and slower growth over the long term. “All of these effects can be mitigated by good policies, or exacerbated by bad ones.”146 Increased debt need not lead to decline, though it certainly increases the risks.

在信息时代，受过良好教育的劳动力是经济成功的另一关键。乍一看，美国在这方面表现出色。2006年，84%的成年人拥有高中学历，27%拥有大学学历。147美国高等教育支出占 GDP 的比例是法国、德国、英国或日本的两倍。148美国高等教育体系被评为世界最佳，过去几十年里，美国大学在学术声誉方面对英国、欧洲大陆和日本的竞争对手的领先优势不断扩大。《泰晤士高等教育增刊》将排名前十的大学列为六所美国大学；上海交通大学的一项中国研究显示，排名前二十的大学中有十七所位于美国（中国没有上榜）。149名美国人获得的诺贝尔奖数量超过其他任何国家的公民，发表的科学论文数量也更多。在同行评审期刊上发表的论文数量（是中国人的三倍）。150这些成就增强了经济实力和软实力。

A well-educated labor force is another key to economic success in an information age. At first glance, the United States does well. In 2006, 84 percent of adults had graduated from high school and 27 percent had graduated from college.147 The United States spends twice as much on higher education as a percentage of GDP than does France, Germany, Britain, or Japan.148 The American higher education system is rated the best in the world, and American universities have widened their lead in academic reputation over competitors in Britain, Continental Europe, and Japan over the past few decades. The Times Higher Education Supplement lists six of the top ten universities as American; and a Chinese study by Shanghai Jiao Tong University places seventeen of the top twenty in the United States (and none in China).149 Americans win more Nobel prizes than do citizens of any other country and publish more scientific papers in peer-reviewed journals (including three times as many as Chinese do).150 These accomplishments enhance both economic power and soft power.

然而，尽管美国教育在顶尖水平上表现出色，但在基层教育方面却不尽如人意。美国教育的精华部分——大部分大学和顶尖中学——达到甚至树立了全球标准。但美国教育的糟粕部分——太多的小学和中学，尤其是在经济欠发达地区——则严重落后。这可能意味着劳动力素质无法跟上信息经济时代不断提高的标准。2007年的一项全国教育进步评估发现，只有39%的四年级学生数学成绩达到或超过熟练水平，阅读成绩达到或超过熟练水平的学生比例为33%，尽管在过去十年中略有改善。151虽然没有可靠证据表明学生的成绩比过去更差，但美国的教育优势正在削弱，因为越来越多的国家在教育方面做得比过去更好。在最富裕的30个国家中，只有新西兰、西班牙、土耳其和墨西哥的高中毕业率低于美国。152高等教育领域的情况也是如此。美国40%的年轻人获得至少副学士学位的比例没有改变，但美国曾经领先世界，现在在36个发达国家中排名第12位。153名美国学生的知识和技能似乎没有得到足够的提升，以跟上经济发展的步伐。如果美国想要达到信息驱动型经济所需的标准，就必须改进其教育体系。

However, even though American education is strong at the top, it is less impressive at lower levels. American education at its best— much of the university and the top slice of the secondary system— meets or sets the global standard. But American education at its worst—too many primary and secondary schools, especially in lessaffluent districts—lags badly. This may mean that the quality of the labor force will not keep up to the rising standards needed in an information-based economy. A National Assessment of Educational Progress in 2007 found only 39 percent of fourth graders were at or above the proficient level in math and 33 percent scored at that level in reading, though there had been a slight improvement during the previous decade.151 There is no reliable evidence that students are performing worse than in the past, but America’s educational advantage is eroding because more countries are doing better than in the past. Among the thirty richest countries, only New Zealand, Spain, Turkey, and Mexico now have lower high school completion rates.152 The situation is also true in higher education. America’s 40 percent rate of young adults earning at least an associate degree has not changed, but it used to lead the world and now earns twelfth place among thirty-six developed countries.153 American students do not seem to be improving their knowledge and skills enough to keep pace with an advancing economy. Improvement in the American educational system will be necessary if the country is to meet the standards needed in an information-driven economy.

美国收入分配格局的变化也给美国经济带来了问题。据美国人口普查局统计，1947年至1968年间，家庭收入不平等现象有所下降。1968年以后，不平等现象加剧。美国的基尼系数为0.45，按国际标准衡量属于较高水平，并且“在过去几十年中稳步上升……过去十年中，最高收入者与中等收入者之间的收入差距进一步扩大”。154 劳动力需求从受教育程度较低的工人转向其他行业，这或许是工资下降的最重要原因。155这个问题不仅是一个公正的问题，而且还是一个不平等是否会导致政治反应，从而抑制经济生产力并减缓作为硬实力和软实力基础的高速经济增长的问题。

The changing shape of the nation’s income distribution also poses a problem for the American economy. According to the Census Bureau, from 1947 to 1968 family income inequality decreased. After 1968, inequality increased. The American Gini coefficient of 0.45 is high by international standards and “has risen steadily over the past several decades . . . and the gap between the highest earners and the mid-level earners has increased over the past decade.”154 Shifts in labor demand away from less-educated workers are perhaps the most important explanation of eroding wages.155 The problem is not only a question of justice, but also of whether inequality may lead to political reactions that could curb the productivity of the economy and slow the high rates of economic growth that are the foundation of hard and soft power.

美国经济所产生的软实力是一个悬而未决的问题。许多人钦佩美国经济长期以来取得的成功，但即便在金融危机损害其声誉之前，他们也并未将其视为典范。美国政府在经济中扮演的角色较轻，支出仅占GDP的三分之一，而欧洲则接近一半。美国的市场竞争力量更强，社会保障体系更薄弱。工会力量较弱，劳动力市场监管也较少。美国的医疗保健成本高昂，且不平等现象尤为突出。文化态度、破产法和金融结构更有利于创业。监管更加透明，股东对公司管理层的影响力也更大。尽管外国人对其中一些优点赞不绝口，但也有人反对这种对市场力量的过度依赖所带来的不平等、不安全感和宏观经济不稳定等问题。

Soft power generated by the American economy is an open question. Many people admire the success the American economy has had over the long term but have not seen it as a model, even before the financial crisis tarnished its reputation. Government plays a lighter role in the U.S. economy, spending one-third of GDP, whereas Europe is nearer one-half. Competitive market forces are stronger, social safety nets weaker. Unions are weaker and labor markets less regulated. American health care has been both costly and exceptional in its inequality. Cultural attitudes, bankruptcy laws, and financial structures more strongly favor entrepreneurship. Regulations are more transparent, and shareholders have more influence on company managers. Although foreigners extol some of these virtues, others object to the price of inequality, insecurity, and macroeconomic instability that accompanies this greater reliance on market forces.

政治制度

尽管存在这些问题和不确定性，尽管增速有所放缓，但只要政策得当，美国经济似乎仍有望继续为国家创造硬实力。更大的不确定性则围绕着美国体制的问题。许多观察家认为，美国政治体制的僵局将阻碍其将自身权力资源转化为实际权力。曾在华生活多年的资深记者詹姆斯·法洛斯认为，“美国仍然有能力解决几乎所有结构性缺陷……能源消耗、医疗成本、重建强大的中产阶级所需的合理教育和职业组合……这就是21世纪初美国的悲剧：一种充满活力、自我更新的文化，吸引着世界各地的人才；而一种治理体系却越来越像个笑话。”156虽然经济衰退时期的政治僵局看起来往往很糟糕，但难点在于确定这种情况是否比过去糟糕得多。

Despite these problems and uncertainties, and despite some slowing, with the right policies the American economy seems likely to continue producing hard power for the country. Greater uncertainty surrounds the question of American institutions. Many observers argue that the gridlock of the American political system will prevent it from translating its power resources into power outcomes. In the view of James Fallows, an experienced journalist who lived in China for years, “America still has the means to address nearly any of its structural weaknesses . . . energy use, medical costs, the right educational and occupational mix to rebuild a robust middle class. . . . That is the American tragedy of the early 21st century: a vital and self-renewing culture that attracts the world’s talent and a governing system that increasingly looks like a joke.”156 Although political gridlock in a period of recession often looks bad, the difficulty is ascertaining whether the situation is much worse than it was in the past.

权力转化——即将权力资源转化为有效影响力——一直是美国面临的一个长期难题。宪法基于十八世纪的自由主义观点，认为权力的最佳控制方式是分散权力，并辅以制衡机制。在外交政策方面，宪法始终鼓励总统和国会争夺控制权。强大的经济和族裔压力集团为了自身利益而对国家利益进行定义，而美国例外论的政治文化则使外交政策带有独特的道德色彩，从而加剧了问题的复杂性。国会总是对那些“会哭的孩子有奶吃”，特殊利益集团施压要求其立法规定外交政策策略和行为准则，并对其他国家实施制裁。正如基辛格曾经指出的那样，“外国批评者所认为的美国寻求霸权的行为，往往是对国内压力集团的回应。”这种累积效应“将美国的外交政策推向单边主义和霸凌行为。因为与通常旨在邀请对话的外交沟通不同，立法最终会变成一种‘要么接受，要么放弃’的指令，相当于最后通牒。”157

Power conversion—translating power resources into effective influence—is a long-standing problem for the United States. The Constitution is based on an eighteenth-century liberal view that power is best controlled by fragmentation and countervailing checks and balances. In foreign policy, the Constitution has always invited the president and Congress to struggle for control. Strong economic and ethnic pressure groups struggle for their self-interested definitions of the national interest, and a political culture of American exceptionalism complicates matters by making foreign policy uniquely moralistic. Congress always pays attention to squeaky wheels, and special interests press it to legislate the tactics of foreign policy and codes of conduct with sanctions for other countries. As Kissinger once pointed out, “What is presented by foreign critics as America’s quest for domination is very frequently a response to domestic pressure groups.” The cumulative effect “drives American foreign policy toward unilateral and bullying conduct. For unlike diplomatic communications, which are generally an invitation to dialogue, legislation translates into a take-it-or-leave-it prescription, the operational equivalent of an ultimatum.”157

人们还担忧公众对机构的信任度下降。2010年的一项民意调查发现，61%的受访者认为国家正在衰落，只有19%的人相信政府总是或大多数时候会做正确的事。另一项民意调查发现，只有22%的人几乎总是或大多数时候信任华盛顿的政府。158正如威廉·加尔斯顿所说，“当公民被要求为更美好的未来做出牺牲时，信任就显得尤为重要。对提出这一要求的政府的不信任可能是国家衰落的先兆，甚至是原因。”159

There is also a concern about the decline of public confidence in institutions. In 2010, one poll found that 61 percent of poll respondents thought the country was in decline and only 19 percent trusted the government to do what is right all or most of the time. Another poll found 22 percent trusting the government in Washington almost always or most of the time.158 As William Galston puts it, “Trust is never more important than when citizens are asked to make sacrifices for a brighter future. Mistrust of the government making this request could be the harbinger—even the cause—of national decline.159

1964年，四分之三的美国公众表示，他们相信联邦政府在大多数情况下都能做出正确的决定。如今，只有五分之一的公众承认对联邦政府抱有如此高的信任度。随着时间的推移，这一数字略有波动，在2001年9月11日事件后有所上升，之后逐渐下降。过去，公众对州和地方政府的信任度略高一些，达到32%至38%，但在2009年跌至新低。160政府并非孤例。过去几十年间，公众对许多主要机构的信任度下降了一半：大学从61%降至30%，大型企业从55%降至21%，医疗行业从73%降至29%，新闻业从29%降至14%。过去十年间，公众对教育机构和军队的信任度有所上升，但对华尔街和大型企业的信任度却有所下降。161

In 1964, three-quarters of the American public said they trusted the federal government to do the right thing most of the time. Today, only one-fifth of the public admits to trust at this high standard. The numbers have varied somewhat over time, rising after September 11, 2001, before gradually declining, and the numbers for state and local government have been slightly better in the past—32 to 38 percent—but they sunk to a new low in 2009.160 Government is not alone. Over the past few decades, public confidence has dropped in half for many major institutions: 61 to 30 percent for universities, 55 to 21 percent for major companies, 73 to 29 percent for medicine, and 29 to 14 percent for journalism. Over the past decade, confidence rose in educational institutions and the military but fell for Wall Street and major companies.161

美国建国的部分原因在于对政府的不信任，而美国宪法的制定也旨在抵制中央集权。杰斐逊主义的悠久传统认为，美国人不必过分担忧对政府的信任度。此外，当被问及的并非政府的日常运作，而是其根本的宪政框架时，公众的评价往往非常积极。如果你问美国人哪里最适合居住，80%的人会选择美国。如果你问他们是否喜欢美国的民主政体，90%的人会给出肯定的回答。很少有人认为这个体制已经腐朽，必须被推翻。162

The United States was founded in part on a mistrust of government, and the American Constitution was deliberately set up to resist centralized power. A long Jeffersonian tradition says Americans should not worry too much about the level of confidence in government. Moreover, when asked not about day-to-day government but about the underlying constitutional framework, the public is very positive. If you ask Americans what is the best place to live, 80 percent say the United States. If asked whether they like their democratic system of government, 90 percent say yes. Few people feel the system is rotten and must be overthrown.162

当前情绪的某些方面可能是周期性的，而另一些方面则反映了人们对当前政治进程中争吵和僵局的不满。与不久前相比，党派政治的极化程度有所加剧，但丑陋的政治并非新鲜事。评估问题的一部分在于，经历过大萧条并赢得二战的那一代人对政府的信任度异常高。就此而言，从美国历史的长河来看，异常之处在于20世纪50年代和60年代初对政府的过度自信，而非此后的低迷。此外，关于政府信任度下降的大部分证据都来自民意调查数据，而民意调查的结果会受到提问方式的影响。不可否认的是，随着时间的推移，对相同问题的回答呈下降趋势，但这种下降的意义尚不明确。毕竟，下降幅度最大的时期发生在四十多年前的约翰逊和尼克松执政时期，即上世纪六十年代末和七十年代初。

Some aspects of the current mood are probably cyclical, whereas others represent discontent with current bickering and deadlock in the political process. Compared with the recent past, party politics has become more polarized, but nasty politics is nothing new. Part of the problem of assessment is that faith in government became abnormally high among the generation that survived the Depression and won World War II. In that case, over the long view of American history, the anomaly was overconfidence in government in the 1950s and early 1960s, not low levels thereafter. Moreover, much of the evidence for loss of trust in government comes from polling data, and responses are sensitive to the way questions are asked. What cannot be dismissed is that there has been a downward trend to answers to the same questions over time, but the significance of this decline is still uncertain. After all, the sharpest decline occurred over four decades ago in the Johnson and Nixon administrations of the late 1960s and early 1970s.

这并不意味着民众对政府信任度下降就不存在问题。无论信任度下降的原因是什么，如果公众不愿提供税款等关键资源，不愿自愿遵守法律，或者如果优秀的年轻人拒绝进入政府部门工作，政府能力就会受到削弱，民众对政府的不满也会加剧。此外，不信任的氛围可能会引发部分民众的极端行为，例如1995年俄克拉荷马城联邦办公大楼爆炸案。此类后果可能会损害美国的硬实力和软实力。

This does not imply that there are no problems with expressions of declining confidence in government. Whatever the reasons for the decline, if the public becomes unwilling to provide such crucial resources as tax dollars or to voluntarily comply with laws, or if bright young people refuse to go into government service, governmental capacity would be impaired and people would become more dissatisfied with government. Moreover, a climate of distrust can trigger extreme actions by deviant members of the population, such as the bombing of a federal office building in Oklahoma City in 1995. Such results could impair both American hard and soft power.

然而，迄今为止，这些行为结果似乎尚未显现。美国国税局并未发现偷税漏税现象增加。163许多报道指出，政府官员的腐败程度比几十年前有所降低，世界银行在“控制腐败”方面给予美国很高的分数（高于百分之九十）。2000年，人口普查表格的自愿邮寄回复率上升至 67%，2010 年略有上升，扭转了自 1970 年以来 30 年的下降趋势。165投票率在1960年后的四十年间从62%下降到50%，但这一下降趋势在2000年停止，并在2008年回升至58%。选民行为似乎没有像民意调查问卷的回答那样发生剧烈变化。尽管在竞争激烈的2000年总统大选后有人预测会出现制度危机，但新上任的布什政府仍然能够有效执政并成功连任。

As yet, however, these behavioral results do not seem to have materialized. The Internal Revenue Service sees no increase in cheating on taxes.163 By many accounts, government officials have become less corrupt than in earlier decades, and the World Bank gives the United States a high score (above the ninetieth percentile) on “control of corruption.”164 Voluntary mail return of census forms increased to 67 percent in 2000, and rose slightly in 2010, reversing a thirty-year decline since 1970.165 Voting rates declined from 62 percent to 50 percent in the forty years after 1960, but the decline stopped in 2000 and returned to 58 percent in 2008. Behavior does not seem to have changed as dramatically as have responses to poll questions. Despite predictions of institutional crisis expressed in the aftermath of the tightly contested 2000 presidential election, the incoming Bush administration was able to govern and achieve reelection.

政府机构信任度的下降似乎并未大幅削弱美国的软实力，原因之一是大多数其他发达国家似乎也正在经历类似的情况。类似的现象也出现在加拿大、英国、法国、瑞典、日本等国家——仅举几例——都出现了类似的趋势。人们对机构失去信心的原因可能根植于更深层次的观念趋势，即后现代社会普遍存在的个人主义盛行和对权威的尊重度下降。正如我们在社会变革方面所看到的，当这种观念在大多数发达社会中普遍存在时，就很难做出贬低美国相对于其他国家吸引力的歧视性比较。166

Nor does the decline in confidence in government institutions seem to have greatly diminished American soft power, if only because most other developed countries seem to be experiencing a similar phenomenon. Canada, Britain, France, Sweden, Japan—just to name a few—have seen a similar trend. The causes of the expressed loss of confidence in institutions may be rooted in deeper trends in attitudes toward greater individualism and less deference to authority that are characteristic of all postmodern societies. As we saw with regard to social change, when such attitudes are typical of most advanced societies, it is difficult to make invidious comparisons that undercut American attractiveness compared to the others.166

社会资本的这些变化对美国制度的有效性究竟有多大影响？罗伯特·帕特南指出，过去一个世纪以来，社区纽带并非持续削弱。相反，仔细审视美国历史，就会发现这是一部公民参与起伏跌宕的历史，而不仅仅是低谷——一部衰落与复兴的历史。167他提出了一系列政策建议，这些政策或许有助于在二十一世纪初实现类似于上世纪初进步运动所带来的复兴。四分之三的美国人感到与自己的社区联系紧密，并认为社区的生活质量优良或良好。根据皮尤研究中心的一项民意调查，1.11亿美国人表示，他们在过去十二个月中曾抽出时间参与社区志愿服务，帮助解决社区问题，其中6000万人定期参与志愿服务。40%的人表示，与社区中的其他人合作是他们所能做的最重要的事情。168

How serious are these changes in social capital for the effectiveness of American institutions? Robert Putnam notes that community bonds have not weakened steadily over the last century. On the contrary, American history carefully examined is a story of ups and downs in civic engagement, not just downs—a story of collapse and renewal.167 He suggests a number of policies that might contribute to a renewal early in the twenty-first century analogous to that created by the progressive movement at the beginning of the last century. Three-quarters of Americans feel connected to their communities and say the quality of life there is excellent or good. According to a Pew poll, 111 million Americans say they volunteered their time to help solve problems in their communities in the previous twelve months, and 60 million volunteered on a regular basis. Forty percent said working together with others in their community was the most important thing they could do.168

近年来，美国政治和政治体制的极化程度远超美国公众舆论所呈现的水平。2008年后的经济衰退加剧了这一局面。正如一位英国观察家所言，“美国的政治体制旨在使联邦层面的立法变得困难，而非容易……因此，这套体制的基本运作良好；但这绝非忽视其改革空间的借口”，例如众议院中人为操纵的“安全席位”以及参议院的阻挠议事规则和冗长辩论。169美国政治体制能否进行自我改革并应对此处描述的问题，还有待观察，但并非如此。批评者们将美国的国内衰败比作罗马或其他帝国的衰落，并暗示美国国内的衰败程度并不像他们所暗示的那样严重。但美国国内的衰败不太可能在本世纪头几十年内导致权力的快速更迭。

In recent years, American politics and political institutions have become more polarized than the distribution of opinions in the American public would suggest. The situation was exacerbated by the economic downturn after 2008. As a British observer suggests, “America’s political system was designed to make legislation at the federal level difficult, not easy. . . . So the basic system works; but that is no excuse for ignoring areas where it could be reformed,” such as the gerrymandered safe seats in the House of Representatives and the blocking procedures of Senate rules and filibusters.169 Whether the American political system can reform itself and cope with the problems described here remains to be seen, but it is not as broken as implied by critics who draw analogies to the domestic decay of Rome or other empires. American domestic decay is unlikely to lead to a rapid power transition in the first decades of this century.

净评估

NET ASSESSMENT

对未来几十年美国实力的任何全面评估都会遇到诸多困难。正如我们所见，许多早期的评估都与实际情况大相径庭。回顾上世纪70年代美国对苏联实力以及80年代对日本实力的估计，不禁令人警醒。如今，有人自信地预测，21世纪中国将取代美国成为世界头号强国，而另一些人则同样自信地认为，“美国才刚刚开始崛起。21世纪将是美国的世纪。”170但不可预见的事件往往会使这种预测落空。未来有多种可能性，而非只有一种。

Any net assessment of American power in the coming decades encounters a number of difficulties. As we have seen, many earlier efforts have been wide of the mark. It is chastening to remember how wildly exaggerated were American estimates of Soviet power in the 1970s and of Japanese power in the 1980s. Today, some confidently predict the twenty-first century will see China replace the United States as the world’s leading state, whereas others equally confidently argue that “the United States is only at the beginning of its power. The twenty-first century will be the American century.”170 But unforeseen events often confound such projections. There are a range of possible futures, not one.

关于美国相对于中国的实力，很大程度上取决于中国未来政治变革的不确定性。如果没有这些政治不确定性，中国的体量和高速经济增长几乎肯定会提升其相对于美国的相对实力。这将使其在实力资源上更接近美国，但并不一定意味着中国会超越美国成为最强大的国家。即使中国国内政治没有遭遇重大挫折，目前许多仅基于GDP增长的预测也过于片面，忽略了美国的军事和软实力优势，以及中国在亚洲内部力量平衡中相对于美国与欧洲、日本、印度等国可能存在的良好关系而言的地缘政治劣势。我个人的估计是，在各种可能的未来情景中，更有可能出现的情况是，中国在本世纪上半叶能够与美国展开激烈的竞争，但不会超越美国的整体实力。回顾历史，英国战略家劳伦斯·弗里德曼指出，美国与“过去的主导大国”有两个显著区别：美国的实力是建立在联盟而非殖民地之上的，并且与一种灵活的意识形态相关……即使在过度扩张之后，美国也可以回归这种意识形态。171展望未来，安妮-玛丽·斯劳特认为，美国的开放和创新文化将使其在一个网络补充（即使不能完全取代）等级权力的世界中保持中心地位。172美国更有可能从这样的网络和联盟中受益。

On American power relative to China, much will depend on the uncertainties of future political change in China. Barring such political uncertainties, China’s size and high rate of economic growth will almost certainly increase its relative strength vis-à-vis the United States. This will bring it closer to the United States in power resources but will not necessarily mean that China will surpass the United States as the most powerful country. Even if China suffers no major domestic political setback, many current projections based on GDP growth alone are too one-dimensional and ignore U.S. military and soft power advantages, as well as China’s geopolitical disadvantages in the internal Asian balance of power compared to America’s likely favorable relations with Europe, Japan, India, and others. My own estimate is that among the range of possible futures, the more likely are ones in which China gives the United States a run for its money but does not surpass it in overall power in the first half of this century. Looking back at history, British strategist Lawrence Freedman notes two features that distinguish the United States from “the dominant great powers of the past: American power is based on alliances rather than colonies and is associated with an ideology that is flexible . . . to which America can return even after it has overextended itself.”171 And looking to the future, Anne-Marie Slaughter argues that America’s culture of openness and innovation will keep it central in a world where networks supplement, if not fully replace, hierarchical power.172 The United States is more likely to benefit from such networks and alliances.

就美国衰落的绝对程度而非相对程度而言，美国在债务、中等教育和政治僵局等领域面临着严峻的问题，但这仅仅是冰山一角。重要的是要超越当前的传统观念，不要让个人偏好左右分析。在诸多负面的未来情景中，有一种是美国对恐怖袭击反应过度，采取封闭政策，从而切断了自身与开放带来的实力之间的联系。但撇开此类错误不谈，原则上，从长远来看，解决我们今天关注的美国重大问题并非没有办法，例如长期债务（例如，通过征收消费税和削减开支，在经济复苏后用于支付福利支出）和政治僵局（例如，通过改革选区重划程序以减少不公正选区划分、改革参议院规则等等）。当然，这些解决方案或许永远无法实现。但值得区分的是，哪些情况根本无解，哪些情况原则上可以解决（即使不修改宪法）。

On question of absolute, rather than relative, American decline, the United States faces serious problems in areas such as debt, secondary education, and political gridlock, but they are only part of the picture. It is important to look beyond current conventional wisdom and not to let preferences determine analysis. Among the negative futures are ones in which the United States overreacts to terrorist attacks by closing inward and thus cuts itself off from the strength it obtains from openness. But barring such mistakes, in principle and over a longer term, there are solutions to major American problems that preoccupy us today, such as long-term debt (for example, consumption taxes and expenditure cuts that pay for entitlements when the economy recovers) and political gridlock (for example, changes in redistricting procedures to reduce gerrymandering, changes in Senate rules, and so forth). Of course, such solutions may forever remain out of reach. But it is worth distinguishing situations where there are no solutions from those that could in principle be solved (even without a constitutional amendment).

将21世纪的权力转移描述为美国衰落的问题既不准确也具有误导性。这种分析如果鼓励中国采取冒险政策或促使美国出于恐惧而反应过度，可能会导致危险的政策后果。美国并未处于绝对衰落状态，而且在未来几十年里，它很可能仍将比任何一个国家都强大，尽管美国的经济和文化主导地位将会减弱。与本世纪初相比，美国如今的实力更加强大。与此同时，美国必然会面临其他国家——包括国家和非国家行为体——实力的提升。此外，美国还将面临越来越多的问题，这些问题的解决既需要依靠与他国的合作，也需要依靠对其他国家的支配力。美国维持联盟和构建网络的能力将是其硬实力和软实力的重要组成部分。在这种情况下，正如我们将在下一章中看到的，将国内改革与将美国资源转化为外部实力的明智战略相结合，将比以往任何时候都更加重要。

Describing power transition in the twenty-first century as an issue of American decline is inaccurate and misleading. Such analysis can lead to dangerous policy implications if it encourages China to engage in adventurous policies or the United States to overreact out of fear. America is not in absolute decline, and it is likely to remain more powerful than any single state in the coming decades, although American economic and cultural preponderance will become less dominant than at the beginning of the century. At the same time, the United States will certainly be faced with a rise in the power resources of many others—both states and nonstate actors. The United States will also face an increasing number of issues in which solutions will require power with others as much as power over others. American capacity to maintain alliances and create networks will be an important dimension of the nation’s hard and soft power. In such circumstances, it will be more important than ever to combine domestic reforms with smart strategies for the conversion of American resources into external power, as we shall see in the next chapter.

第三部分

PART III

政策

POLICY

第七章

CHAPTER 7

智能电源

Smart Power

权力本身并无好坏之分。它就像饮食中的卡路里，并非越多越好。权力资源匮乏意味着获得理想结果的概率较低，但权力（就资源而言）过多则可能弊大于利，因为它会导致过度自信和不恰当的权力转换策略。大量证据支持阿克顿勋爵的名言：“权力使人腐败，绝对权力使人绝对腐败”，研究表明，权力尤其会腐蚀那些自认为理应拥有权力的人。一位心理学家将“权力悖论”定义为：权力被赋予那些以社会智慧的方式促进更大利益的个人、团体或国家，但“人们希望领导者具备的社会智慧，恰恰是权力所损害的”。2正如我们有时说一个人或一个女人可能太英俊或太聪明而对自己不利一样，个人和国家也可能遭受“权力诅咒”。3在圣经中大卫和歌利亚的故事里，非利士人拥有强大的力量和资源，却因此采取了劣势的策略，最终导致失败和死亡。4

Power is not good or bad per se. It is like calories in a diet; more is not always better. Having too few power resources means a lower probability of obtaining preferred outcomes, but too much power (in terms of resources) can be a curse, rather than a benefit, if it leads to overconfidence and inappropriate strategies for power conversion. Good evidence exists to support Lord Acton’s famous dictum that “power corrupts and absolute power corrupts absolutely,” and studies show that it particularly corrupts those who think they deserve it.1 One psychologist defines “the power paradox” as the fact that power is given to those individuals, groups, or states that advance the interests of the greater good in socially intelligent fashion, but “what people want from leaders—social intelligence—is what is damaged by the possession of power.”2 Just as we sometimes say that a man or a woman may be too handsome or too smart for his or her own good, so people and states may suffer from a “power curse.”3 In the biblical story of David and Goliath, the Philistine’s superior power resources misled him into an inferior strategy, which in turn led to defeat and death.4

二十一世纪的“巧实力”叙事并非关乎权力最大化或霸权维护，而是关乎如何找到……在权力分散和“其他国家崛起”的新背景下，如何将资源整合为成功的战略至关重要。作为最大的强国，美国在全球事务中的领导地位依然重要，但关于美国世纪和美国霸权的旧叙事，或者关于美国衰落的叙事，都对未来所需的战略类型产生了误导。

A smart power narrative for the twenty-first century is not about maximizing power or preserving hegemony. It is about finding ways to combine resources into successful strategies in the new context of power diffusion and the “rise of the rest.” As the largest power, American leadership remains important in global affairs, but the old twentieth-century narrative about an American century and primacy or, alternatively, narratives of American decline are both misleading about the type of strategy that will be necessary.

战略将手段与目的联系起来，这需要明确目标（预期结果）、资源以及运用这些资源的策略。一个明智的战略能够回答五个问题。首先，我们期望实现哪些目标或结果？由于人生中我们通常无法拥有想要的一切，因此，仅仅列出一份无限的愿望清单并不能回答这个问题。它意味着设定优先事项，从而权衡取舍。它还需要理解有形的占有目标与总体结构性目标之间的关系，以及哪些目标涉及对他人零和博弈式的权力，哪些目标涉及需要与他人合作才能获得的共同收益。一位历史学家曾评价国防部长迪克·切尼的“20世纪90年代国防战略”，称其“旨在确保美国的霸权地位，但除此之外没有任何明确的目标”。5

A strategy relates means to ends, and that requires clarity about goals (preferred outcomes), resources, and tactics for their use. A smart strategy provides the answers to five questions. First, what goals or outcomes are preferred? Because we can’t usually have everything we want in life, this answer requires more than the mere construction of an infinite wish list. It means setting priorities that will structure trade-offs. It also requires understanding the relationship between tangible possession goals and general structural goals, as well as which goals involve zero-sum power over others and which involve joint gains that require power with others. One historian said of Secretary of Defense Dick Cheney’s “Defense Strategy for the 1990s,” that it “sought to assure U.S. dominance without any clear purpose beyond just that.”5

一项明智的战略还必须回答第二个问题：有哪些资源可用，以及在哪些情况下可用？这不仅需要对资源进行准确完整的清点，还需要了解这些资源何时可用（或不可用），以及在不同情况下其可用性可能发生的变化。接下来，一项巧妙的权力转换战略会提出第三个问题：影响目标的立场和偏好是什么？正如一项对经典战略的综述所强调的那样，准确了解潜在对手的能力和倾向至关重要。6他们拥有什么？更重要的是，他们怎么想？在哪些领域、哪些时期，他们的偏好和策略的强度、可塑性和变化可能性如何？有时，例如在极端暴力破坏行为中，目标的偏好对成功与否并不重要——例如，如果我只想刺杀你，你的想法可能无关紧要——但是在大多数情况下，掌握目标的可靠情报对于调整整合力量资源的战术至关重要。

A smart strategy must also answer a second question: What resources are available and in which contexts? Not only an accurate and complete inventory of resources is needed, but also an understanding of when they will (or will not) be available and how their availability is likely to change in different situations. Then a smart power–conversion strategy asks a third question: What are the positions and preferences of the targets of influence attempts? As a survey of classical strategies emphasized, it is essential to have “an accurate view of the capabilities and proclivities of potential opponents.”6 What do they have, and, more importantly, what do they think? What are the intensity, malleability, and likelihood of changes in their preferences and strategies over what periods in which domains? Sometimes, as in extreme acts of violent destruction, the preferences of the target do not matter much to success—for example, it may not matter what you think if all I want to do is to assassinate you—but in most instances good intelligence about the target is essential for adjusting the tactics used to combine power resources.

这就引出了第四个问题：哪些权力行为形式最有可能成功？在特定情况下，你更有可能在合理的时间和成本内，运用硬实力的命令行为、运用议程设置、说服和吸引等合作行为，还是两者结合的方式取得成功？运用这些行为的策略会如何导致它们之间的竞争或强化？例如，硬实力和软实力的使用何时会相互强化或相互削弱？这种情况会如何随时间变化？

That leads to the fourth question: Which forms of power behavior are most likely to succeed? In a given situation, are you more likely to succeed at reasonable time and cost with the command behavior of hard power or with the co-optive behavior of agenda-setting, persuasion, and attraction or a combination of the two. How will the tactics for using these behaviors lead to competition or reinforcement among them? For example, when will the use of hard and soft power reinforce or undercut each other? How will that change over time?

第五，成功的概率是多少？崇高的事业如果伴随着过度乐观或对成功概率的故意忽视，可能会造成可怕的后果。例如，无论美国入侵伊拉克的目标多么崇高，它都伴随着一种傲慢自大的盲目，即对最终所需的时间和成本的忽视。值得注意的是，正义战争理论的古老传统不仅关注手段的比例性和区别性，还关注成功概率将如何影响后果。这正是现实主义者在巧实力战略中推崇的审慎原则的体现。最后，如果成功概率经不起审慎判断的检验，就应该回到第一个问题，并重新评估目标、优先事项和权衡取舍。在调整目标之后，巧实力战略将再次逐一审视这些因素。

Fifth, what is the probability of success? Noble causes can have terrible consequences if they are accompanied by excessive optimism or willful blindness about the probabilities of success. For example, no matter what the quality of the objectives for the American invasion of Iraq, it was accompanied by what proved to be hubristic blindness about the eventual time and costs involved. It is worth remembering that the ancient tradition of just-war theory asks not only about proportionality and discrimination in means, but also about how the probability of success will affect consequences. That is the case for prudence that realists properly extol in a smart power strategy. And, finally, if the probabilities of success fail the test of prudent judgment, a return to the first question is in order, along with a reassessment of goals, priorities, and trade-offs. After adjusting goals, a smart power strategy then runs down the list again.

国家智慧电力战略

STATE SMART POWER STRATEGIES

据一位国务院高级官员称，“‘巧实力’的概念——即外交、国防、发展以及其他所谓的‘硬实力和软实力’工具的智能整合与网络化——正是奥巴马总统和希拉里国务卿政策愿景的核心。”7由于该术语已被奥巴马政府采用，一些分析人士认为它仅指……美国，以及批评者抱怨说，这不过是像“严厉的爱”一样的口号，粉饰了丑陋的一面。但即便“巧实力”一词容易被用来做口号（没人想显得“愚蠢”，尽管适得其反的策略确实符合这个描述），巧实力也可以用于分析，而且绝不仅限于美国。

According to a high State Department official, “The concept of ‘smart power’—the intelligent integration and networking of diplomacy, defense, development, and other tools of so-called ‘hard and soft’ power—is at the very heart of President Obama and Secretary Clinton’s policy vision.”7 Because the term has been adopted by the Obama administration, some analysts think it refers only to the United States, and critics complain that it is merely a slogan like “tough love” that sugarcoats nasty stuff. But even though the term “smart power” lends itself to slogans (no one wants to be “dumb,” though counterproductive strategies fit that description), smart power can also be used for analysis and is by no means limited to the United States.
